00057 {
00058     if (!(
00059           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
00060           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX) && ((offset <= 1)))))
00061         cvmx_warn("CVMX_LMCX_BANK_CONFLICT1(%lu) is invalid on this chip\n", offset);
00062     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000360ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull;
00063 }

00345 {
00346     if (!(
00347           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN61XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
00348           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN63XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
00349           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN66XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
00350           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN68XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
00351           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN70XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
00352           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
00353           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
00354           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
00355           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF71XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
00356           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX) && ((offset <= 1)))))
00357         cvmx_warn("CVMX_LMCX_CONTROL(%lu) is invalid on this chip\n", offset);
00358     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000190ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull;
00359 }
00360 #else
00361 #define CVMX_LMCX_CONTROL(offset) (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000190ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull)
00362 #endif
00363 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
00364 static inline uint64_t CVMX_LMCX_CTL(unsigned long offset)
00365 {
00366     if (!(
00367           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN30XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
00368           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN31XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
00369           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN38XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
00370           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN50XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
00371           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN52XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
00372           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN56XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
00373           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN58XX) && ((offset == 0)))))
00374         cvmx_warn("CVMX_LMCX_CTL(%lu) is invalid on this chip\n", offset);
00375     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000010ull) + ((offset) & 1) * 0x60000000ull;
00376 }

00416           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN70XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
00417           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||

00419           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X) && ((offset <= 3))) ||

00547           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX) && (((offset <= 1)) && ((block_id <= 3)))) ||
00548           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X) && (((offset <= 1)) && ((block_id <= 3)))) ||

00551     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880000D0ull) + (((offset) & 1) + ((block_id) & 3) * 0x200000ull) * 8;
00552 }

00555 #endif

00643 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
00644 static inline uint64_t CVMX_LMCX_DLL_CTL3(unsigned long offset)
00645 {
00646     if (!(
00647           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN61XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
00648           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN63XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
00649           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN66XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
00650           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN68XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
00651           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN70XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
00652           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
00653           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
00654           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X) && ((offset <= 3))) ||

00659 }
00660 #else

00662 #endif
00663 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
00664 static inline uint64_t CVMX_LMCX_DUAL_MEMCFG(unsigned long offset)
00665 {
00666     switch(cvmx_get_octeon_family()) {
00667         case OCTEON_CNF71XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00668         case OCTEON_CN50XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00669         case OCTEON_CN61XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00670         case OCTEON_CN70XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00671         case OCTEON_CN66XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00672         case OCTEON_CN52XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00673         case OCTEON_CN58XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00674         case OCTEON_CN63XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00675             if ((offset == 0))
00676                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000098ull) + ((offset) & 0) * 0x60000000ull;
00677             break;
00678         case OCTEON_CNF75XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00679         case OCTEON_CN73XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00680             if ((offset <= 1))
00681                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000098ull) + ((offset) & 1) * 0x1000000ull;
00682             break;
00683         case OCTEON_CN78XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00684             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX))
00685                 if ((offset <= 3))
00686                     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000098ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull;
00687             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X))
00688                 if ((offset <= 3))
00689                     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000098ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull;
00690         case OCTEON_CN68XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00691             if ((offset <= 3))
00692                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000098ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull;
00693             break;
00694         case OCTEON_CN56XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00695             if ((offset <= 1))
00696                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000098ull) + ((offset) & 1) * 0x60000000ull;
00697             break;
00698     }
00699     cvmx_warn("CVMX_LMCX_DUAL_MEMCFG (offset = %lu) not supported on this chip\n", offset);
00700     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000098ull) + ((offset) & 1) * 0x1000000ull;
00701 }
00702 #else
00703 static inline uint64_t CVMX_LMCX_DUAL_MEMCFG(unsigned long offset)
00704 {
00705     switch(cvmx_get_octeon_family()) {
00706         case OCTEON_CNF71XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00707         case OCTEON_CN50XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00708         case OCTEON_CN61XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00709         case OCTEON_CN70XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00710         case OCTEON_CN66XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00711         case OCTEON_CN52XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00712         case OCTEON_CN58XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00713         case OCTEON_CN63XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00714             return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000098ull) + (offset) * 0x60000000ull;
00715         case OCTEON_CNF75XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00716         case OCTEON_CN73XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00717             return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000098ull) + (offset) * 0x1000000ull;
00718         case OCTEON_CN78XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00719             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX))
00720                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000098ull) + (offset) * 0x1000000ull;
00721             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X))
00722                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000098ull) + (offset) * 0x1000000ull;
00723         case OCTEON_CN68XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00724             return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000098ull) + (offset) * 0x1000000ull;
00725         case OCTEON_CN56XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00726             return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000098ull) + (offset) * 0x60000000ull;
00727     }
00728     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000098ull) + (offset) * 0x1000000ull;
00729 }
00730 #endif
00731 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
00732 static inline uint64_t CVMX_LMCX_ECC_PARITY_TEST(unsigned long offset)
00733 {
00734     if (!(
00735           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
00736           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
00737           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
00738           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX) && ((offset <= 1)))))
00739         cvmx_warn("CVMX_LMCX_ECC_PARITY_TEST(%lu) is invalid on this chip\n", offset);
00740     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000108ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull;
00741 }
00742 #else
00743 #define CVMX_LMCX_ECC_PARITY_TEST(offset) (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000108ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull)
00744 #endif
00745 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
00746 static inline uint64_t CVMX_LMCX_ECC_SYND(unsigned long offset)
00747 {
00748     switch(cvmx_get_octeon_family()) {
00749         case OCTEON_CN30XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00750         case OCTEON_CN50XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00751         case OCTEON_CN38XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00752         case OCTEON_CN31XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00753         case OCTEON_CN61XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00754         case OCTEON_CN70XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00755         case OCTEON_CN66XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00756         case OCTEON_CN52XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00757         case OCTEON_CN58XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00758         case OCTEON_CNF71XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00759         case OCTEON_CN63XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00760             if ((offset == 0))
00761                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000038ull) + ((offset) & 0) * 0x60000000ull;
00762             break;
00763         case OCTEON_CN78XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00764             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX))
00765                 if ((offset <= 3))
00766                     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000038ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull;
00767             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X))
00768                 if ((offset <= 3))
00769                     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000038ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull;
00770         case OCTEON_CN68XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00771             if ((offset <= 3))
00772                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000038ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull;
00773             break;
00774         case OCTEON_CNF75XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00775         case OCTEON_CN73XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00776             if ((offset <= 1))
00777                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000038ull) + ((offset) & 1) * 0x1000000ull;
00778             break;
00779         case OCTEON_CN56XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00780             if ((offset <= 1))
00781                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000038ull) + ((offset) & 1) * 0x60000000ull;
00782             break;
00783     }
00784     cvmx_warn("CVMX_LMCX_ECC_SYND (offset = %lu) not supported on this chip\n", offset);
00785     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000038ull) + ((offset) & 1) * 0x1000000ull;
00786 }
00787 #else

00789 {
00790     switch(cvmx_get_octeon_family()) {
00791         case OCTEON_CN30XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00792         case OCTEON_CN50XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00793         case OCTEON_CN38XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00794         case OCTEON_CN31XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00795         case OCTEON_CN61XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00796         case OCTEON_CN70XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00797         case OCTEON_CN66XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00798         case OCTEON_CN52XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00799         case OCTEON_CN58XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00800         case OCTEON_CNF71XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00801         case OCTEON_CN63XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00802             return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000038ull) + (offset) * 0x60000000ull;
00803         case OCTEON_CN78XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00804             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX))
00805                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000038ull) + (offset) * 0x1000000ull;
00806             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X))
00807                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000038ull) + (offset) * 0x1000000ull;
00808         case OCTEON_CN68XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00809             return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000038ull) + (offset) * 0x1000000ull;
00810         case OCTEON_CNF75XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00811         case OCTEON_CN73XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00812             return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000038ull) + (offset) * 0x1000000ull;

00815     }

00817 }

00821 {
00822     if (!(
00823           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN70XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
00824           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
00825           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
00826           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
00827           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX) && ((offset <= 1)))))
00828         cvmx_warn("CVMX_LMCX_EXT_CONFIG(%lu) is invalid on this chip\n", offset);
00829     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000030ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull;
00830 }

00847 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
00848 static inline uint64_t CVMX_LMCX_FADR(unsigned long offset)
00849 {
00850     switch(cvmx_get_octeon_family()) {
00851         case OCTEON_CN30XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00852         case OCTEON_CN50XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00853         case OCTEON_CN38XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00854         case OCTEON_CN31XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00855         case OCTEON_CN61XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00856         case OCTEON_CN70XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00857         case OCTEON_CN66XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00858         case OCTEON_CN52XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00859         case OCTEON_CN58XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00860         case OCTEON_CNF71XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00861         case OCTEON_CN63XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00862             if ((offset == 0))
00863                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000020ull) + ((offset) & 0) * 0x60000000ull;
00864             break;
00865         case OCTEON_CN78XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00866             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX))
00867                 if ((offset <= 3))
00868                     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000020ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull;
00869             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X))
00870                 if ((offset <= 3))
00871                     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000020ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull;
00872         case OCTEON_CN68XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00873             if ((offset <= 3))
00874                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000020ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull;
00875             break;
00876         case OCTEON_CNF75XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00877         case OCTEON_CN73XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00878             if ((offset <= 1))
00879                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000020ull) + ((offset) & 1) * 0x1000000ull;
00880             break;
00881         case OCTEON_CN56XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
00882             if ((offset <= 1))
00883                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000020ull) + ((offset) & 1) * 0x60000000ull;
00884             break;
00885     }
00886     cvmx_warn("CVMX_LMCX_FADR (offset = %lu) not supported on this chip\n", offset);
00887     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000020ull) + ((offset) & 1) * 0x1000000ull;
00888 }
00889 #else

00891 {

00906             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX))
00907                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000020ull) + (offset) * 0x1000000ull;
00908             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X))
00909                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000020ull) + (offset) * 0x1000000ull;
00910         case OCTEON_CN68XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:

00968           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN70XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
00969           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
00970           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
00971           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
00972           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF71XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||

01015 static inline uint64_t CVMX_LMCX_INT(unsigned long offset)
01016 {
01017     if (!(
01018           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN61XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01019           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN63XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01020           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN66XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01021           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN68XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
01022           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN70XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01023           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
01024           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
01025           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
01026           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF71XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01027           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX) && ((offset <= 1)))))
01028         cvmx_warn("CVMX_LMCX_INT(%lu) is invalid on this chip\n", offset);
01029     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880001F0ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull;
01030 }
01031 #else
01032 #define CVMX_LMCX_INT(offset) (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880001F0ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull)
01033 #endif
01034 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
01035 static inline uint64_t CVMX_LMCX_INT_EN(unsigned long offset)
01036 {
01037     if (!(
01038           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN61XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01039           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN63XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01040           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN66XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01041           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN68XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
01042           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN70XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01043           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
01044           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
01045           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
01046           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF71XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01047           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX) && ((offset <= 1)))))
01048         cvmx_warn("CVMX_LMCX_INT_EN(%lu) is invalid on this chip\n", offset);
01049     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880001E8ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull;
01050 }
01051 #else
01052 #define CVMX_LMCX_INT_EN(offset) (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880001E8ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull)
01053 #endif
01054 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
01055 static inline uint64_t CVMX_LMCX_LANEX_CRC_SWIZ(unsigned long offset, unsigned long block_id)
01056 {
01057     if (!(
01058           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) && (((offset <= 8)) && ((block_id <= 1)))) ||
01059           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX) && (((offset <= 8)) && ((block_id <= 3)))) ||
01060           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X) && (((offset <= 8)) && ((block_id <= 3)))) ||
01061           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX) && (((offset <= 8)) && ((block_id <= 1))))))
01062         cvmx_warn("CVMX_LMCX_LANEX_CRC_SWIZ(%lu,%lu) is invalid on this chip\n", offset, block_id);
01063     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000380ull) + (((offset) & 15) + ((block_id) & 3) * 0x200000ull) * 8;
01064 }
01065 #else
01066 #define CVMX_LMCX_LANEX_CRC_SWIZ(offset, block_id) (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000380ull) + (((offset) & 15) + ((block_id) & 3) * 0x200000ull) * 8)
01067 #endif
01068 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
01069 static inline uint64_t CVMX_LMCX_MEM_CFG0(unsigned long offset)
01070 {
01071     if (!(
01072           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN30XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01073           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN31XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01074           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN38XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01075           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN50XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01076           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN52XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01077           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN56XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
01078           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN58XX) && ((offset == 0)))))
01079         cvmx_warn("CVMX_LMCX_MEM_CFG0(%lu) is invalid on this chip\n", offset);
01080     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000000ull) + ((offset) & 1) * 0x60000000ull;
01081 }
01082 #else
01083 #define CVMX_LMCX_MEM_CFG0(offset) (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000000ull) + ((offset) & 1) * 0x60000000ull)
01084 #endif

01093           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN52XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01094           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN56XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||

01217 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
01218 static inline uint64_t CVMX_LMCX_MR_MPR_CTL(unsigned long offset)
01219 {

01222           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
01223           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
01224           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
01225           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX) && ((offset <= 1)))))

01232 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
01233 static inline uint64_t CVMX_LMCX_NS_CTL(unsigned long offset)
01234 {
01235     if (!(
01236           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
01237           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
01238           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX) && ((offset <= 1)))))
01239         cvmx_warn("CVMX_LMCX_NS_CTL(%lu) is invalid on this chip\n", offset);
01240     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000178ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull;
01241 }
01242 #else
01243 #define CVMX_LMCX_NS_CTL(offset) (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000178ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull)
01244 #endif
01245 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
01246 static inline uint64_t CVMX_LMCX_NXM(unsigned long offset)
01247 {
01248     switch(cvmx_get_octeon_family()) {
01249         case OCTEON_CNF71XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01250         case OCTEON_CN61XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01251         case OCTEON_CN70XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01252         case OCTEON_CN66XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01253         case OCTEON_CN52XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01254         case OCTEON_CN58XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01255         case OCTEON_CN63XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01256             if ((offset == 0))
01257                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880000C8ull) + ((offset) & 0) * 0x60000000ull;
01258             break;
01259         case OCTEON_CNF75XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01260         case OCTEON_CN73XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01261             if ((offset <= 1))
01262                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880000C8ull) + ((offset) & 1) * 0x1000000ull;
01263             break;
01264         case OCTEON_CN78XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01265             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX))
01266                 if ((offset <= 3))
01267                     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880000C8ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull;
01268             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X))
01269                 if ((offset <= 3))
01270                     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880000C8ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull;
01271         case OCTEON_CN68XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01272             if ((offset <= 3))
01273                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880000C8ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull;
01274             break;
01275         case OCTEON_CN56XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01276             if ((offset <= 1))
01277                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880000C8ull) + ((offset) & 1) * 0x60000000ull;
01278             break;
01279     }
01280     cvmx_warn("CVMX_LMCX_NXM (offset = %lu) not supported on this chip\n", offset);
01281     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880000C8ull) + ((offset) & 1) * 0x1000000ull;
01282 }
01283 #else
01284 static inline uint64_t CVMX_LMCX_NXM(unsigned long offset)
01285 {
01286     switch(cvmx_get_octeon_family()) {
01287         case OCTEON_CNF71XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01288         case OCTEON_CN61XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01289         case OCTEON_CN70XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01290         case OCTEON_CN66XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01291         case OCTEON_CN52XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01292         case OCTEON_CN58XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01293         case OCTEON_CN63XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01294             return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880000C8ull) + (offset) * 0x60000000ull;
01295         case OCTEON_CNF75XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01296         case OCTEON_CN73XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01297             return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880000C8ull) + (offset) * 0x1000000ull;
01298         case OCTEON_CN78XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01299             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX))
01300                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880000C8ull) + (offset) * 0x1000000ull;
01301             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X))
01302                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880000C8ull) + (offset) * 0x1000000ull;
01303         case OCTEON_CN68XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01304             return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880000C8ull) + (offset) * 0x1000000ull;
01305         case OCTEON_CN56XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01306             return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880000C8ull) + (offset) * 0x60000000ull;
01307     }
01308     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880000C8ull) + (offset) * 0x1000000ull;
01309 }
01310 #endif
01311 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
01312 static inline uint64_t CVMX_LMCX_NXM_FADR(unsigned long offset)
01313 {
01314     if (!(
01315           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN70XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01316           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
01317           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
01318           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
01319           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX) && ((offset <= 1)))))
01320         cvmx_warn("CVMX_LMCX_NXM_FADR(%lu) is invalid on this chip\n", offset);
01321     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000028ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull;
01322 }
01323 #else
01324 #define CVMX_LMCX_NXM_FADR(offset) (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000028ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull)
01325 #endif
01326 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
01327 static inline uint64_t CVMX_LMCX_OPS_CNT(unsigned long offset)
01328 {
01329     if (!(
01330           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN61XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01331           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN63XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01332           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN66XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01333           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN68XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
01334           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN70XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01335           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
01336           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
01337           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
01338           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF71XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01339           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX) && ((offset <= 1)))))
01340         cvmx_warn("CVMX_LMCX_OPS_CNT(%lu) is invalid on this chip\n", offset);
01341     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880001D8ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull;
01342 }
01343 #else
01344 #define CVMX_LMCX_OPS_CNT(offset) (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880001D8ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull)
01345 #endif
01346 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
01347 static inline uint64_t CVMX_LMCX_OPS_CNT_HI(unsigned long offset)
01348 {
01349     if (!(
01350           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN30XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01351           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN31XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01352           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN38XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01353           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN50XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01354           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN52XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01355           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN56XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
01356           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN58XX) && ((offset == 0)))))
01357         cvmx_warn("CVMX_LMCX_OPS_CNT_HI(%lu) is invalid on this chip\n", offset);
01358     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000060ull) + ((offset) & 1) * 0x60000000ull;
01359 }
01360 #else
01361 #define CVMX_LMCX_OPS_CNT_HI(offset) (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000060ull) + ((offset) & 1) * 0x60000000ull)
01362 #endif

01672 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
01673 static inline uint64_t CVMX_LMCX_SCRAMBLED_FADR(unsigned long offset)
01674 {
01675     if (!(
01676           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN61XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01677           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN66XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01678           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN70XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01679           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
01680           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
01681           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
01682           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF71XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01683           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX) && ((offset <= 1)))))
01684         cvmx_warn("CVMX_LMCX_SCRAMBLED_FADR(%lu) is invalid on this chip\n", offset);
01685     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000330ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull;
01686 }
01687 #else
01688 #define CVMX_LMCX_SCRAMBLED_FADR(offset) (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000330ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull)
01689 #endif
01690 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
01691 static inline uint64_t CVMX_LMCX_SCRAMBLE_CFG0(unsigned long offset)
01692 {
01693     if (!(
01694           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN61XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01695           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN66XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01696           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN70XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01697           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
01698           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
01699           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
01700           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF71XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01701           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX) && ((offset <= 1)))))
01702         cvmx_warn("CVMX_LMCX_SCRAMBLE_CFG0(%lu) is invalid on this chip\n", offset);
01703     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000320ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull;
01704 }

01763           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
01764           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||

01914 {

01919           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN68XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
01920           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN70XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01921           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
01922           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
01923           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X) && ((offset <= 3))) ||

01932 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
01933 static inline uint64_t CVMX_LMCX_WLEVEL_DBG(unsigned long offset)
01934 {
01935     if (!(
01936           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN61XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01937           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN63XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01938           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN66XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01939           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN68XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
01940           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN70XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01941           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
01942           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
01943           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
01944           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF71XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
01945           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX) && ((offset <= 1)))))
01946         cvmx_warn("CVMX_LMCX_WLEVEL_DBG(%lu) is invalid on this chip\n", offset);
01947     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000308ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull;
01948 }
01949 #else
01950 #define CVMX_LMCX_WLEVEL_DBG(offset) (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000308ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull)
01951 #endif
01952 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
01953 static inline uint64_t CVMX_LMCX_WLEVEL_RANKX(unsigned long offset, unsigned long block_id)
01954 {
01955     switch(cvmx_get_octeon_family()) {
01956         case OCTEON_CN70XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01957             if (((offset <= 3)) && ((block_id == 0)))
01958                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880002C0ull) + (((offset) & 3) + ((block_id) & 0) * 0x200000ull) * 8;
01959             break;
01960         case OCTEON_CNF75XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01961         case OCTEON_CN73XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01962             if (((offset <= 3)) && ((block_id <= 1)))
01963                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880002C0ull) + (((offset) & 3) + ((block_id) & 1) * 0x200000ull) * 8;
01964             break;
01965         case OCTEON_CN78XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01966             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX))
01967                 if (((offset <= 3)) && ((block_id <= 3)))
01968                     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880002C0ull) + (((offset) & 3) + ((block_id) & 3) * 0x200000ull) * 8;
01969             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X))
01970                 if (((offset <= 3)) && ((block_id <= 3)))
01971                     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880002C0ull) + (((offset) & 3) + ((block_id) & 3) * 0x200000ull) * 8;
01972 
01973             break;
01974         case OCTEON_CN66XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01975         case OCTEON_CN63XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01976             if (((offset <= 3)) && ((block_id == 0)))
01977                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880002B0ull) + (((offset) & 3) + ((block_id) & 0) * 0x0ull) * 8;
01978             break;
01979         case OCTEON_CNF71XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01980         case OCTEON_CN61XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01981             if (((offset <= 3)) && ((block_id == 0)))
01982                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880002B0ull) + (((offset) & 3) + ((block_id) & 0) * 0x200000ull) * 8;
01983             break;
01984         case OCTEON_CN68XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01985             if (((offset <= 3)) && ((block_id <= 3)))
01986                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880002B0ull) + (((offset) & 3) + ((block_id) & 3) * 0x200000ull) * 8;
01987             break;
01988     }
01989     cvmx_warn("CVMX_LMCX_WLEVEL_RANKX (%lu, %lu) not supported on this chip\n", offset, block_id);
01990     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880002C0ull) + (((offset) & 3) + ((block_id) & 1) * 0x200000ull) * 8;
01991 }
01992 #else
01993 static inline uint64_t CVMX_LMCX_WLEVEL_RANKX(unsigned long offset, unsigned long block_id)
01994 {
01995     switch(cvmx_get_octeon_family()) {
01996         case OCTEON_CN70XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01997             return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880002C0ull) + ((offset) + (block_id) * 0x200000ull) * 8;
01998         case OCTEON_CNF75XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
01999         case OCTEON_CN73XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
02000             return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880002C0ull) + ((offset) + (block_id) * 0x200000ull) * 8;
02001         case OCTEON_CN78XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
02002             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX))
02003                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880002C0ull) + ((offset) + (block_id) * 0x200000ull) * 8;
02004             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X))
02005                 return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880002C0ull) + ((offset) + (block_id) * 0x200000ull) * 8;
02006 
02007         case OCTEON_CN66XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
02008         case OCTEON_CN63XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
02009             return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880002B0ull) + ((offset) + (block_id) * 0x0ull) * 8;
02010         case OCTEON_CNF71XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
02011         case OCTEON_CN61XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
02012             return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880002B0ull) + ((offset) + (block_id) * 0x200000ull) * 8;
02013         case OCTEON_CN68XX & OCTEON_FAMILY_MASK:
02014             return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880002B0ull) + ((offset) + (block_id) * 0x200000ull) * 8;
02015     }
02016     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880002C0ull) + ((offset) + (block_id) * 0x200000ull) * 8;
02017 }
02018 #endif
02019 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
02020 static inline uint64_t CVMX_LMCX_WODT_CTL0(unsigned long offset)
02021 {
02022     if (!(
02023           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN30XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
02024           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN31XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
02025           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN38XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
02026           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN50XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
02027           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN52XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
02028           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN56XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
02029           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN58XX) && ((offset == 0)))))
02030         cvmx_warn("CVMX_LMCX_WODT_CTL0(%lu) is invalid on this chip\n", offset);
02031     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000030ull) + ((offset) & 1) * 0x60000000ull;
02032 }
02033 #else
02034 #define CVMX_LMCX_WODT_CTL0(offset) (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000030ull) + ((offset) & 1) * 0x60000000ull)
02035 #endif
02036 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
02037 static inline uint64_t CVMX_LMCX_WODT_CTL1(unsigned long offset)
02038 {
02039     if (!(
02040           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN30XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
02041           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN31XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
02042           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN52XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
02043           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN56XX) && ((offset <= 1)))))
02044         cvmx_warn("CVMX_LMCX_WODT_CTL1(%lu) is invalid on this chip\n", offset);
02045     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000080ull) + ((offset) & 1) * 0x60000000ull;
02046 }
02047 #else
02048 #define CVMX_LMCX_WODT_CTL1(offset) (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180088000080ull) + ((offset) & 1) * 0x60000000ull)
02049 #endif
02050 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
02051 static inline uint64_t CVMX_LMCX_WODT_MASK(unsigned long offset)
02052 {
02053     if (!(
02054           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN61XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
02055           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN63XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
02056           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN66XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
02057           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN68XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
02058           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN70XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
02059           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
02060           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
02061           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X) && ((offset <= 3))) ||
02062           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF71XX) && ((offset == 0))) ||
02063           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX) && ((offset <= 1)))))
02064         cvmx_warn("CVMX_LMCX_WODT_MASK(%lu) is invalid on this chip\n", offset);
02065     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880001B0ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull;
02066 }
02067 #else
02068 #define CVMX_LMCX_WODT_MASK(offset) (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800880001B0ull) + ((offset) & 3) * 0x1000000ull)
02069 #endif
02070 
02071 /**
02072  * cvmx_lmc#_bank_conflict1
02073  */
02074 union cvmx_lmcx_bank_conflict1 {
02075     uint64_t u64;
02076     struct cvmx_lmcx_bank_conflict1_s {
02077 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02078     uint64_t cnt                          : 64; /**< Bank conflict counter. A 64-bit counter that increments at every dclk
02079                                                          cycles when LMC could not issue R/W operations to the DRAM due to
02080                                                          bank conflict. This increments when all 8 In-Flight buffers are not
02081                                                          utilized. */
02082 #else
02083     uint64_t cnt                          : 64;
02084 #endif
02085     } s;
02086     struct cvmx_lmcx_bank_conflict1_s     cn78xx;
02087     struct cvmx_lmcx_bank_conflict1_s     cnf75xx;
02088 };
02089 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_bank_conflict1 cvmx_lmcx_bank_conflict1_t;
02090 
02091 /**
02092  * cvmx_lmc#_bank_conflict2
02093  */
02094 union cvmx_lmcx_bank_conflict2 {
02095     uint64_t u64;
02096     struct cvmx_lmcx_bank_conflict2_s {
02097 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02098     uint64_t cnt                          : 64; /**< Bank conflict counter. A 64-bit counter that increments at every dclk
02099                                                          cycles when LMC could not issue R/W operations to the DRAM due to
02100                                                          bank conflict. This increments only when there are less than 4 In-Flight
02101                                                          buffers occupied. */
02102 #else
02103     uint64_t cnt                          : 64;
02104 #endif
02105     } s;
02106     struct cvmx_lmcx_bank_conflict2_s     cn78xx;
02107     struct cvmx_lmcx_bank_conflict2_s     cnf75xx;
02108 };
02109 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_bank_conflict2 cvmx_lmcx_bank_conflict2_t;

02111 /**
02112  * cvmx_lmc#_bist_ctl
02113  *
02114  * This register has fields to control BIST operation.
02115  *
02116  */
02117 union cvmx_lmcx_bist_ctl {
02118     uint64_t u64;
02119     struct cvmx_lmcx_bist_ctl_s {
02120 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02121     uint64_t reserved_5_63                : 59;
02122     uint64_t macram_bist_status           : 1;  /**< Maximum Activate Counts RAM BIST status.
02123                                                          1 means fail. */
02124     uint64_t dlcram_bist_status           : 1;  /**< DLC RAM BIST status; 1 means fail. */
02125     uint64_t dlcram_bist_done             : 1;  /**< DLC and MAC RAM BIST complete indication;
02126                                                          1 means both RAMs have completed. */
02127     uint64_t start_bist                   : 1;  /**< Start BIST on DLC and MAC memory. */
02128     uint64_t reserved_0_0                 : 1;
02129 #else
02130     uint64_t reserved_0_0                 : 1;
02131     uint64_t start_bist                   : 1;
02132     uint64_t dlcram_bist_done             : 1;
02133     uint64_t dlcram_bist_status           : 1;
02134     uint64_t macram_bist_status           : 1;
02135     uint64_t reserved_5_63                : 59;
02136 #endif
02137     } s;
02138     struct cvmx_lmcx_bist_ctl_cn50xx {
02139 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02140     uint64_t reserved_1_63                : 63;
02141     uint64_t start                        : 1;  /**< A 0->1 transition causes BiST to run. */
02142 #else
02143     uint64_t start                        : 1;
02144     uint64_t reserved_1_63                : 63;
02145 #endif
02146     } cn50xx;
02147     struct cvmx_lmcx_bist_ctl_cn50xx      cn52xx;
02148     struct cvmx_lmcx_bist_ctl_cn50xx      cn52xxp1;
02149     struct cvmx_lmcx_bist_ctl_cn50xx      cn56xx;
02150     struct cvmx_lmcx_bist_ctl_cn50xx      cn56xxp1;
02151     struct cvmx_lmcx_bist_ctl_cn70xx {
02152 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02153     uint64_t reserved_4_63                : 60;
02154     uint64_t dlcram_bist_status           : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
02155     uint64_t dlcram_bist_done             : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
02156     uint64_t start_bist                   : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
02157     uint64_t clear_bist                   : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
02158 #else
02159     uint64_t clear_bist                   : 1;
02160     uint64_t start_bist                   : 1;
02161     uint64_t dlcram_bist_done             : 1;
02162     uint64_t dlcram_bist_status           : 1;
02163     uint64_t reserved_4_63                : 60;
02164 #endif
02165     } cn70xx;
02166     struct cvmx_lmcx_bist_ctl_cn70xx      cn70xxp1;
02167     struct cvmx_lmcx_bist_ctl_cn73xx {
02168 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02169     uint64_t reserved_5_63                : 59;
02170     uint64_t macram_bist_status           : 1;  /**< Maximum Activate Counts RAM BIST status.
02171                                                          1 means fail. */
02172     uint64_t dlcram_bist_status           : 1;  /**< DLC RAM BIST status; one means fail. */
02173     uint64_t dlcram_bist_done             : 1;  /**< DLC and MAC RAM BIST complete indication;
02174                                                          One means both RAMs have completed. */
02175     uint64_t start_bist                   : 1;  /**< Start BIST on DLC and MAC memory. */
02176     uint64_t clear_bist                   : 1;  /**< Start clear BIST on DLC and MAC memory. */
02177 #else
02178     uint64_t clear_bist                   : 1;
02179     uint64_t start_bist                   : 1;
02180     uint64_t dlcram_bist_done             : 1;
02181     uint64_t dlcram_bist_status           : 1;
02182     uint64_t macram_bist_status           : 1;
02183     uint64_t reserved_5_63                : 59;
02184 #endif
02185     } cn73xx;
02186     struct cvmx_lmcx_bist_ctl_cn73xx      cn78xx;
02187     struct cvmx_lmcx_bist_ctl_cn73xx      cn78xxp1;
02188     struct cvmx_lmcx_bist_ctl_cn73xx      cnf75xx;
02189 };
02190 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_bist_ctl cvmx_lmcx_bist_ctl_t;
02191 
02192 /**
02193  * cvmx_lmc#_bist_result
02194  *
02195  * Notes:
02196  * Access to the internal BiST results
02197  * Each bit is the BiST result of an individual memory (per bit, 0=pass and 1=fail).
02198  */
02199 union cvmx_lmcx_bist_result {
02200     uint64_t u64;
02201     struct cvmx_lmcx_bist_result_s {
02202 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02203     uint64_t reserved_11_63               : 53;
02204     uint64_t csrd2e                       : 1;  /**< BiST result of CSRD2E memory (0=pass, !0=fail) */
02205     uint64_t csre2d                       : 1;  /**< BiST result of CSRE2D memory (0=pass, !0=fail) */
02206     uint64_t mwf                          : 1;  /**< BiST result of MWF memories (0=pass, !0=fail) */
02207     uint64_t mwd                          : 3;  /**< BiST result of MWD memories (0=pass, !0=fail) */
02208     uint64_t mwc                          : 1;  /**< BiST result of MWC memories (0=pass, !0=fail) */
02209     uint64_t mrf                          : 1;  /**< BiST result of MRF memories (0=pass, !0=fail) */
02210     uint64_t mrd                          : 3;  /**< BiST result of MRD memories (0=pass, !0=fail) */
02211 #else
02212     uint64_t mrd                          : 3;
02213     uint64_t mrf                          : 1;
02214     uint64_t mwc                          : 1;
02215     uint64_t mwd                          : 3;
02216     uint64_t mwf                          : 1;
02217     uint64_t csre2d                       : 1;
02218     uint64_t csrd2e                       : 1;
02219     uint64_t reserved_11_63               : 53;
02220 #endif
02221     } s;
02222     struct cvmx_lmcx_bist_result_cn50xx {
02223 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02224     uint64_t reserved_9_63                : 55;
02225     uint64_t mwf                          : 1;  /**< BiST result of MWF memories (0=pass, !0=fail) */
02226     uint64_t mwd                          : 3;  /**< BiST result of MWD memories (0=pass, !0=fail) */
02227     uint64_t mwc                          : 1;  /**< BiST result of MWC memories (0=pass, !0=fail) */
02228     uint64_t mrf                          : 1;  /**< BiST result of MRF memories (0=pass, !0=fail) */
02229     uint64_t mrd                          : 3;  /**< BiST result of MRD memories (0=pass, !0=fail) */
02230 #else
02231     uint64_t mrd                          : 3;
02232     uint64_t mrf                          : 1;
02233     uint64_t mwc                          : 1;
02234     uint64_t mwd                          : 3;
02235     uint64_t mwf                          : 1;
02236     uint64_t reserved_9_63                : 55;
02237 #endif
02238     } cn50xx;
02239     struct cvmx_lmcx_bist_result_s        cn52xx;
02240     struct cvmx_lmcx_bist_result_s        cn52xxp1;
02241     struct cvmx_lmcx_bist_result_s        cn56xx;
02242     struct cvmx_lmcx_bist_result_s        cn56xxp1;
02243 };
02244 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_bist_result cvmx_lmcx_bist_result_t;
02245 
02246 /**
02247  * cvmx_lmc#_char_ctl
02248  *
02249  * This register provides an assortment of various control fields needed to characterize the DDR3
02250  * interface.
02251  */
02252 union cvmx_lmcx_char_ctl {
02253     uint64_t u64;
02254     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_ctl_s {
02255 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02256     uint64_t reserved_54_63               : 10;
02257     uint64_t dq_char_byte_check           : 1;  /**< When set, LMC performs loopback pattern check on a byte. The selection of the byte is
02258                                                          controlled by the LMC()_CHAR_CTL[CSR DQ_CHAR_BYTE_SEL]. */
02259     uint64_t dq_char_check_lock           : 1;  /**< Indicates if a lock has been achieved. Is set to 1 only if a lock is achieved during the
02260                                                          LFSR priming period after DQ_CHAR_CHECK_ENABLE is set to 1, and is forced back to 0 when
02261                                                          DQ_CHAR_CHECK_ENABLE is set to 0. */
02262     uint64_t dq_char_check_enable         : 1;  /**< Enable DQ pattern check. The transition from disabled to enabled clears
02263                                                          LMC()_CHAR_DQ_ERR_COUNT. */
02264     uint64_t dq_char_bit_sel              : 3;  /**< Select a bit within the byte for DQ characterization pattern check. */
02265     uint64_t dq_char_byte_sel             : 4;  /**< Select a byte of data for DQ characterization pattern check. */
02266     uint64_t dr                           : 1;  /**< Pattern at data rate (not clock rate). */
02267     uint64_t skew_on                      : 1;  /**< Skew adjacent bits. */
02268     uint64_t en                           : 1;  /**< Enable characterization. */
02269     uint64_t sel                          : 1;  /**< Pattern select: 0 = PRBS, 1 = programmable pattern. */
02270     uint64_t prog                         : 8;  /**< Programmable pattern. */
02271     uint64_t prbs                         : 32; /**< PRBS polynomial. */
02272 #else
02273     uint64_t prbs                         : 32;
02274     uint64_t prog                         : 8;
02275     uint64_t sel                          : 1;
02276     uint64_t en                           : 1;
02277     uint64_t skew_on                      : 1;
02278     uint64_t dr                           : 1;
02279     uint64_t dq_char_byte_sel             : 4;
02280     uint64_t dq_char_bit_sel              : 3;
02281     uint64_t dq_char_check_enable         : 1;
02282     uint64_t dq_char_check_lock           : 1;
02283     uint64_t dq_char_byte_check           : 1;
02284     uint64_t reserved_54_63               : 10;
02285 #endif
02286     } s;
02287     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_ctl_cn61xx {
02288 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02289     uint64_t reserved_44_63               : 20;
02290     uint64_t dr                           : 1;  /**< Pattern at Data Rate (not Clock Rate) */
02291     uint64_t skew_on                      : 1;  /**< Skew adjacent bits */
02292     uint64_t en                           : 1;  /**< Enable characterization */
02293     uint64_t sel                          : 1;  /**< Pattern select
02294                                                          0 = PRBS
02295                                                          1 = Programmable pattern */
02296     uint64_t prog                         : 8;  /**< Programmable pattern */
02297     uint64_t prbs                         : 32; /**< PRBS Polynomial */
02298 #else
02299     uint64_t prbs                         : 32;
02300     uint64_t prog                         : 8;
02301     uint64_t sel                          : 1;
02302     uint64_t en                           : 1;
02303     uint64_t skew_on                      : 1;
02304     uint64_t dr                           : 1;
02305     uint64_t reserved_44_63               : 20;
02306 #endif
02307     } cn61xx;
02308     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_ctl_cn63xx {
02309 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02310     uint64_t reserved_42_63               : 22;
02311     uint64_t en                           : 1;  /**< Enable characterization */
02312     uint64_t sel                          : 1;  /**< Pattern select
02313                                                          0 = PRBS
02314                                                          1 = Programmable pattern */
02315     uint64_t prog                         : 8;  /**< Programmable pattern */
02316     uint64_t prbs                         : 32; /**< PRBS Polynomial */
02317 #else
02318     uint64_t prbs                         : 32;
02319     uint64_t prog                         : 8;
02320     uint64_t sel                          : 1;
02321     uint64_t en                           : 1;
02322     uint64_t reserved_42_63               : 22;
02323 #endif
02324     } cn63xx;
02325     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_ctl_cn63xx      cn63xxp1;
02326     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_ctl_cn61xx      cn66xx;
02327     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_ctl_cn61xx      cn68xx;
02328     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_ctl_cn63xx      cn68xxp1;
02329     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_ctl_cn70xx {
02330 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02331     uint64_t reserved_53_63               : 11;
02332     uint64_t dq_char_check_lock           : 1;  /**< Indicates if a lock has been achieved. Is set to 1 only if a lock is achieved during the
02333                                                          LFSR priming period after DQ_CHAR_CHECK_ENABLE is set to 1, and is forced back to 0 when
02334                                                          DQ_CHAR_CHECK_ENABLE is set to 0. */
02335     uint64_t dq_char_check_enable         : 1;  /**< Enable DQ pattern check. The transition from disabled to enabled clears
02336                                                          LMC(0..0)_CHAR_DQ_ERR_COUNT. */
02337     uint64_t dq_char_bit_sel              : 3;  /**< Select a bit within the byte for DQ characterization pattern check. */
02338     uint64_t dq_char_byte_sel             : 4;  /**< Select a byte of data for DQ characterization pattern check. */
02339     uint64_t dr                           : 1;  /**< Pattern at data rate (not clock rate). */
02340     uint64_t skew_on                      : 1;  /**< Skew adjacent bits. */
02341     uint64_t en                           : 1;  /**< Enable characterization. */
02342     uint64_t sel                          : 1;  /**< Pattern select: 0 = PRBS, 1 = programmable pattern. */
02343     uint64_t prog                         : 8;  /**< Programmable pattern. */
02344     uint64_t prbs                         : 32; /**< PRBS polynomial. */
02345 #else
02346     uint64_t prbs                         : 32;
02347     uint64_t prog                         : 8;
02348     uint64_t sel                          : 1;
02349     uint64_t en                           : 1;
02350     uint64_t skew_on                      : 1;
02351     uint64_t dr                           : 1;
02352     uint64_t dq_char_byte_sel             : 4;
02353     uint64_t dq_char_bit_sel              : 3;
02354     uint64_t dq_char_check_enable         : 1;
02355     uint64_t dq_char_check_lock           : 1;
02356     uint64_t reserved_53_63               : 11;
02357 #endif
02358     } cn70xx;
02359     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_ctl_cn70xx      cn70xxp1;
02360     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_ctl_s           cn73xx;
02361     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_ctl_s           cn78xx;
02362     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_ctl_s           cn78xxp1;
02363     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_ctl_cn61xx      cnf71xx;
02364     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_ctl_s           cnf75xx;
02365 };
02366 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_char_ctl cvmx_lmcx_char_ctl_t;
02367 
02368 /**
02369  * cvmx_lmc#_char_dq_err_count
02370  *
02371  * This register is used to initiate the various control sequences in the LMC.
02372  *
02373  */
02374 union cvmx_lmcx_char_dq_err_count {
02375     uint64_t u64;
02376     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_dq_err_count_s {
02377 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02378     uint64_t reserved_40_63               : 24;
02379     uint64_t dq_err_count                 : 40; /**< DQ error count. */
02380 #else
02381     uint64_t dq_err_count                 : 40;
02382     uint64_t reserved_40_63               : 24;
02383 #endif
02384     } s;
02385     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_dq_err_count_s  cn70xx;
02386     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_dq_err_count_s  cn70xxp1;
02387     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_dq_err_count_s  cn73xx;
02388     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_dq_err_count_s  cn78xx;
02389     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_dq_err_count_s  cn78xxp1;
02390     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_dq_err_count_s  cnf75xx;
02391 };
02392 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_char_dq_err_count cvmx_lmcx_char_dq_err_count_t;
02393 
02394 /**
02395  * cvmx_lmc#_char_mask0
02396  *
02397  * This register provides an assortment of various control fields needed to characterize the
02398  * DDR3/DDR4 interface.
02399  * It is also used to corrupt the write data bits when ECC Corrupt logic generator is enabled.
02400  */
02401 union cvmx_lmcx_char_mask0 {
02402     uint64_t u64;
02403     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask0_s {
02404 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02405     uint64_t mask                         : 64; /**< Mask for DQ0<63:0>.
02406                                                          Before enabling ECC Corrupt generation logic by setting
02407                                                          LMC()_ECC_PARITY_TEST[ECC_CORRUPT_ENA], set any the MASK bits to 1 to flip the
02408                                                          corresponding bits of the lower 64-bit dataword during a write data transfer. */
02409 #else
02410     uint64_t mask                         : 64;
02411 #endif
02412     } s;
02413     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask0_s         cn61xx;
02414     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask0_s         cn63xx;
02415     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask0_s         cn63xxp1;
02416     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask0_s         cn66xx;
02417     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask0_s         cn68xx;
02418     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask0_s         cn68xxp1;
02419     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask0_s         cn70xx;
02420     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask0_s         cn70xxp1;
02421     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask0_s         cn73xx;
02422     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask0_s         cn78xx;
02423     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask0_s         cn78xxp1;
02424     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask0_s         cnf71xx;
02425     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask0_s         cnf75xx;
02426 };
02427 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_char_mask0 cvmx_lmcx_char_mask0_t;
02428 
02429 /**
02430  * cvmx_lmc#_char_mask1
02431  *
02432  * This register provides an assortment of various control fields needed to characterize the DDR3
02433  * interface.
02434  */
02435 union cvmx_lmcx_char_mask1 {
02436     uint64_t u64;
02437     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask1_s {
02438 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02439     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
02440     uint64_t mask                         : 8;  /**< Mask for DQ0<71:64>. */
02441 #else
02442     uint64_t mask                         : 8;
02443     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
02444 #endif
02445     } s;
02446     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask1_s         cn61xx;
02447     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask1_s         cn63xx;
02448     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask1_s         cn63xxp1;
02449     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask1_s         cn66xx;
02450     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask1_s         cn68xx;
02451     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask1_s         cn68xxp1;
02452     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask1_s         cn70xx;
02453     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask1_s         cn70xxp1;
02454     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask1_s         cn73xx;
02455     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask1_s         cn78xx;
02456     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask1_s         cn78xxp1;
02457     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask1_s         cnf71xx;
02458     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask1_s         cnf75xx;
02459 };
02460 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_char_mask1 cvmx_lmcx_char_mask1_t;
02461 
02462 /**
02463  * cvmx_lmc#_char_mask2
02464  *
02465  * This register provides an assortment of various control fields needed to characterize the
02466  * DDR3/DDR4 interface.
02467  * It is also used to corrupt the write data bits when ECC Corrupt logic generator is enabled.
02468  */
02469 union cvmx_lmcx_char_mask2 {
02470     uint64_t u64;
02471     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask2_s {
02472 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02473     uint64_t mask                         : 64; /**< Mask for DQ1<63:0>.
02474                                                          Before enabling ECC Corrupt generation logic by setting
02475                                                          LMC()_ECC_PARITY_TEST[ECC_CORRUPT_ENA], set any the MASK bits to 1 to flip the
02476                                                          corresponding bits of the upper 64-bit dataword during a write data transfer. */
02477 #else
02478     uint64_t mask                         : 64;
02479 #endif
02480     } s;
02481     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask2_s         cn61xx;
02482     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask2_s         cn63xx;
02483     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask2_s         cn63xxp1;
02484     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask2_s         cn66xx;
02485     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask2_s         cn68xx;
02486     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask2_s         cn68xxp1;
02487     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask2_s         cn70xx;
02488     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask2_s         cn70xxp1;
02489     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask2_s         cn73xx;
02490     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask2_s         cn78xx;
02491     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask2_s         cn78xxp1;
02492     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask2_s         cnf71xx;
02493     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask2_s         cnf75xx;
02494 };
02495 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_char_mask2 cvmx_lmcx_char_mask2_t;
02496 
02497 /**
02498  * cvmx_lmc#_char_mask3
02499  *
02500  * This register provides an assortment of various control fields needed to characterize the DDR3
02501  * interface.
02502  */
02503 union cvmx_lmcx_char_mask3 {
02504     uint64_t u64;
02505     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask3_s {
02506 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02507     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
02508     uint64_t mask                         : 8;  /**< Mask for DQ1<71:64>. */
02509 #else
02510     uint64_t mask                         : 8;
02511     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
02512 #endif
02513     } s;
02514     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask3_s         cn61xx;
02515     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask3_s         cn63xx;
02516     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask3_s         cn63xxp1;
02517     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask3_s         cn66xx;
02518     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask3_s         cn68xx;
02519     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask3_s         cn68xxp1;
02520     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask3_s         cn70xx;
02521     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask3_s         cn70xxp1;
02522     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask3_s         cn73xx;
02523     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask3_s         cn78xx;
02524     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask3_s         cn78xxp1;
02525     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask3_s         cnf71xx;
02526     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask3_s         cnf75xx;
02527 };
02528 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_char_mask3 cvmx_lmcx_char_mask3_t;
02529 
02530 /**
02531  * cvmx_lmc#_char_mask4
02532  *
02533  * This register is an assortment of various control fields needed to characterize the DDR3 interface.
02534  *
02535  */
02536 union cvmx_lmcx_char_mask4 {
02537     uint64_t u64;
02538     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask4_s {
02539 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02540     uint64_t ref_pin_on_mask              : 9;  /**< This mask is applied to the REF_PIN_ON signals that go to the PHY, so that each byte lane
02541                                                          can selectively turn off or on the signals once the master signals are enabled. Using the
02542                                                          symbol R, the mask looks like this:
02543                                                          RRRRRRRRR
02544                                                          876543210 */
02545     uint64_t dac_on_mask                  : 9;  /**< This mask is applied to the DAC_ON signals that go to the PHY, so that each byte lane can
02546                                                          selectively turn off or on the signals once the master signals are enabled. Using the
02547                                                          symbol D for DAC_ON, the mask looks like this:
02548                                                          DDDDDDDDD
02549                                                          876543210 */
02550     uint64_t reserved_45_45               : 1;
02551     uint64_t dbi_mask                     : 9;  /**< Mask for DBI/DQS<1>. */
02552     uint64_t par_mask                     : 1;  /**< Mask for PAR. */
02553     uint64_t act_n_mask                   : 1;  /**< Mask for ACT_N. */
02554     uint64_t a17_mask                     : 1;  /**< Mask for A17. */
02555     uint64_t reset_n_mask                 : 1;  /**< Mask for RESET_L. */
02556     uint64_t a_mask                       : 16; /**< Mask for A<15:0>. */
02557     uint64_t ba_mask                      : 3;  /**< Mask for BA<2:0>. */
02558     uint64_t we_n_mask                    : 1;  /**< Mask for WE_N. */
02559     uint64_t cas_n_mask                   : 1;  /**< Mask for CAS_N. */
02560     uint64_t ras_n_mask                   : 1;  /**< Mask for RAS_N. */
02561     uint64_t odt1_mask                    : 2;  /**< Mask for ODT1. */
02562     uint64_t odt0_mask                    : 2;  /**< Mask for ODT0. */
02563     uint64_t cs1_n_mask                   : 2;  /**< Mask for CS1_N. */
02564     uint64_t cs0_n_mask                   : 2;  /**< Mask for CS0_N. */
02565     uint64_t cke_mask                     : 2;  /**< Mask for CKE*. */
02566 #else
02567     uint64_t cke_mask                     : 2;
02568     uint64_t cs0_n_mask                   : 2;
02569     uint64_t cs1_n_mask                   : 2;
02570     uint64_t odt0_mask                    : 2;
02571     uint64_t odt1_mask                    : 2;
02572     uint64_t ras_n_mask                   : 1;
02573     uint64_t cas_n_mask                   : 1;
02574     uint64_t we_n_mask                    : 1;
02575     uint64_t ba_mask                      : 3;
02576     uint64_t a_mask                       : 16;
02577     uint64_t reset_n_mask                 : 1;
02578     uint64_t a17_mask                     : 1;
02579     uint64_t act_n_mask                   : 1;
02580     uint64_t par_mask                     : 1;
02581     uint64_t dbi_mask                     : 9;
02582     uint64_t reserved_45_45               : 1;
02583     uint64_t dac_on_mask                  : 9;
02584     uint64_t ref_pin_on_mask              : 9;
02585 #endif
02586     } s;
02587     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask4_cn61xx {
02588 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02589     uint64_t reserved_33_63               : 31;
02590     uint64_t reset_n_mask                 : 1;  /**< Mask for RESET_L */
02591     uint64_t a_mask                       : 16; /**< Mask for A[15:0] */
02592     uint64_t ba_mask                      : 3;  /**< Mask for BA[2:0] */
02593     uint64_t we_n_mask                    : 1;  /**< Mask for WE_N */
02594     uint64_t cas_n_mask                   : 1;  /**< Mask for CAS_N */
02595     uint64_t ras_n_mask                   : 1;  /**< Mask for RAS_N */
02596     uint64_t odt1_mask                    : 2;  /**< Mask for ODT1 */
02597     uint64_t odt0_mask                    : 2;  /**< Mask for ODT0 */
02598     uint64_t cs1_n_mask                   : 2;  /**< Mask for CS1_N */
02599     uint64_t cs0_n_mask                   : 2;  /**< Mask for CS0_N */
02600     uint64_t cke_mask                     : 2;  /**< Mask for CKE* */
02601 #else
02602     uint64_t cke_mask                     : 2;
02603     uint64_t cs0_n_mask                   : 2;
02604     uint64_t cs1_n_mask                   : 2;
02605     uint64_t odt0_mask                    : 2;
02606     uint64_t odt1_mask                    : 2;
02607     uint64_t ras_n_mask                   : 1;
02608     uint64_t cas_n_mask                   : 1;
02609     uint64_t we_n_mask                    : 1;
02610     uint64_t ba_mask                      : 3;
02611     uint64_t a_mask                       : 16;
02612     uint64_t reset_n_mask                 : 1;
02613     uint64_t reserved_33_63               : 31;
02614 #endif
02615     } cn61xx;
02616     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask4_cn61xx    cn63xx;
02617     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask4_cn61xx    cn63xxp1;
02618     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask4_cn61xx    cn66xx;
02619     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask4_cn61xx    cn68xx;
02620     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask4_cn61xx    cn68xxp1;
02621     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask4_cn70xx {
02622 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02623     uint64_t reserved_45_63               : 19;
02624     uint64_t dbi_mask                     : 9;  /**< Mask for DBI/DQS<1>. */
02625     uint64_t par_mask                     : 1;  /**< Mask for PAR. */
02626     uint64_t act_n_mask                   : 1;  /**< Mask for ACT_N. */
02627     uint64_t a17_mask                     : 1;  /**< Mask for A17. */
02628     uint64_t reset_n_mask                 : 1;  /**< Mask for RESET_L. */
02629     uint64_t a_mask                       : 16; /**< Mask for A<15:0>. */
02630     uint64_t ba_mask                      : 3;  /**< Mask for BA<2:0>. */
02631     uint64_t we_n_mask                    : 1;  /**< Mask for WE_N. */
02632     uint64_t cas_n_mask                   : 1;  /**< Mask for CAS_N. */
02633     uint64_t ras_n_mask                   : 1;  /**< Mask for RAS_N. */
02634     uint64_t odt1_mask                    : 2;  /**< Mask for ODT1. */
02635     uint64_t odt0_mask                    : 2;  /**< Mask for ODT0. */
02636     uint64_t cs1_n_mask                   : 2;  /**< Mask for CS1_N. */
02637     uint64_t cs0_n_mask                   : 2;  /**< Mask for CS0_N. */
02638     uint64_t cke_mask                     : 2;  /**< Mask for CKE*. */
02639 #else
02640     uint64_t cke_mask                     : 2;
02641     uint64_t cs0_n_mask                   : 2;
02642     uint64_t cs1_n_mask                   : 2;
02643     uint64_t odt0_mask                    : 2;
02644     uint64_t odt1_mask                    : 2;
02645     uint64_t ras_n_mask                   : 1;
02646     uint64_t cas_n_mask                   : 1;
02647     uint64_t we_n_mask                    : 1;
02648     uint64_t ba_mask                      : 3;
02649     uint64_t a_mask                       : 16;
02650     uint64_t reset_n_mask                 : 1;
02651     uint64_t a17_mask                     : 1;
02652     uint64_t act_n_mask                   : 1;
02653     uint64_t par_mask                     : 1;
02654     uint64_t dbi_mask                     : 9;
02655     uint64_t reserved_45_63               : 19;
02656 #endif
02657     } cn70xx;
02658     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask4_cn70xx    cn70xxp1;
02659     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask4_s         cn73xx;
02660     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask4_s         cn78xx;
02661     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask4_s         cn78xxp1;
02662     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask4_cn61xx    cnf71xx;
02663     struct cvmx_lmcx_char_mask4_s         cnf75xx;
02664 };
02665 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_char_mask4 cvmx_lmcx_char_mask4_t;
02666 
02667 /**
02668  * cvmx_lmc#_comp_ctl
02669  *
02670  * LMC_COMP_CTL = LMC Compensation control
02671  *
02672  */
02673 union cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl {
02674     uint64_t u64;
02675     struct cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl_s {
02676 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02677     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
02678     uint64_t nctl_csr                     : 4;  /**< Compensation control bits */
02679     uint64_t nctl_clk                     : 4;  /**< Compensation control bits */
02680     uint64_t nctl_cmd                     : 4;  /**< Compensation control bits */
02681     uint64_t nctl_dat                     : 4;  /**< Compensation control bits */
02682     uint64_t pctl_csr                     : 4;  /**< Compensation control bits */
02683     uint64_t pctl_clk                     : 4;  /**< Compensation control bits */
02684     uint64_t reserved_0_7                 : 8;
02685 #else
02686     uint64_t reserved_0_7                 : 8;
02687     uint64_t pctl_clk                     : 4;
02688     uint64_t pctl_csr                     : 4;
02689     uint64_t nctl_dat                     : 4;
02690     uint64_t nctl_cmd                     : 4;
02691     uint64_t nctl_clk                     : 4;
02692     uint64_t nctl_csr                     : 4;
02693     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
02694 #endif
02695     } s;
02696     struct cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl_cn30xx {
02697 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02698     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
02699     uint64_t nctl_csr                     : 4;  /**< Compensation control bits */
02700     uint64_t nctl_clk                     : 4;  /**< Compensation control bits */
02701     uint64_t nctl_cmd                     : 4;  /**< Compensation control bits */
02702     uint64_t nctl_dat                     : 4;  /**< Compensation control bits */
02703     uint64_t pctl_csr                     : 4;  /**< Compensation control bits */
02704     uint64_t pctl_clk                     : 4;  /**< Compensation control bits */
02705     uint64_t pctl_cmd                     : 4;  /**< Compensation control bits */
02706     uint64_t pctl_dat                     : 4;  /**< Compensation control bits */
02707 #else
02708     uint64_t pctl_dat                     : 4;
02709     uint64_t pctl_cmd                     : 4;
02710     uint64_t pctl_clk                     : 4;
02711     uint64_t pctl_csr                     : 4;
02712     uint64_t nctl_dat                     : 4;
02713     uint64_t nctl_cmd                     : 4;
02714     uint64_t nctl_clk                     : 4;
02715     uint64_t nctl_csr                     : 4;
02716     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
02717 #endif
02718     } cn30xx;
02719     struct cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl_cn30xx      cn31xx;
02720     struct cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl_cn30xx      cn38xx;
02721     struct cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl_cn30xx      cn38xxp2;
02722     struct cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl_cn50xx {
02723 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02724     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
02725     uint64_t nctl_csr                     : 4;  /**< Compensation control bits */
02726     uint64_t reserved_20_27               : 8;
02727     uint64_t nctl_dat                     : 4;  /**< Compensation control bits */
02728     uint64_t pctl_csr                     : 4;  /**< Compensation control bits */
02729     uint64_t reserved_5_11                : 7;
02730     uint64_t pctl_dat                     : 5;  /**< Compensation control bits */
02731 #else
02732     uint64_t pctl_dat                     : 5;
02733     uint64_t reserved_5_11                : 7;
02734     uint64_t pctl_csr                     : 4;
02735     uint64_t nctl_dat                     : 4;
02736     uint64_t reserved_20_27               : 8;
02737     uint64_t nctl_csr                     : 4;
02738     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
02739 #endif
02740     } cn50xx;
02741     struct cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl_cn50xx      cn52xx;
02742     struct cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl_cn50xx      cn52xxp1;
02743     struct cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl_cn50xx      cn56xx;
02744     struct cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl_cn50xx      cn56xxp1;
02745     struct cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl_cn50xx      cn58xx;
02746     struct cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl_cn58xxp1 {
02747 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02748     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
02749     uint64_t nctl_csr                     : 4;  /**< Compensation control bits */
02750     uint64_t reserved_20_27               : 8;
02751     uint64_t nctl_dat                     : 4;  /**< Compensation control bits */
02752     uint64_t pctl_csr                     : 4;  /**< Compensation control bits */
02753     uint64_t reserved_4_11                : 8;
02754     uint64_t pctl_dat                     : 4;  /**< Compensation control bits */
02755 #else
02756     uint64_t pctl_dat                     : 4;
02757     uint64_t reserved_4_11                : 8;
02758     uint64_t pctl_csr                     : 4;
02759     uint64_t nctl_dat                     : 4;
02760     uint64_t reserved_20_27               : 8;
02761     uint64_t nctl_csr                     : 4;
02762     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
02763 #endif
02764     } cn58xxp1;
02765 };
02766 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl_t;
02767 
02768 /**
02769  * cvmx_lmc#_comp_ctl2
02770  *
02771  * LMC_COMP_CTL2 = LMC Compensation control
02772  *
02773  */
02774 union cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl2 {
02775     uint64_t u64;
02776     struct cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl2_s {
02777 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02778     uint64_t reserved_51_63               : 13;
02779     uint64_t rclk_char_mode               : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
02780     uint64_t reserved_40_49               : 10;
02781     uint64_t ptune_offset                 : 4;  /**< Ptune offset value. This is a signed value where the MSB is a sign bit, with zero
02782                                                          indicating addition and one indicating subtraction. */
02783     uint64_t reserved_12_35               : 24;
02784     uint64_t cmd_ctl                      : 4;  /**< Drive strength control for DDR_RAS_L_A<16>/DDR_CAS_L_A<15>/DDR_WE_L_A<14>/DDR_A<13:0>/
02785                                                          DDR_A<15>_BG1/DDR_A<14>_BG0/DDR_BA* /DDR_BA2_TEN/DDR_PAR/DDR_RESET_L drivers.
02786                                                          In DDR3 mode:
02787                                                            0x1 = 24 ohm.
02788                                                            0x2 = 26.67 ohm.
02789                                                            0x3 = 30 ohm.
02790                                                            0x4 = 34.3 ohm.
02791                                                            0x5 = 40 ohm.
02792                                                            0x6 = 48 ohm.
02793                                                            0x7 = 60 ohm.
02794                                                            _ else = Reserved.
02795                                                          In DDR4 mode:
02796                                                            0x0 = Reserved.
02797                                                            0x1 = Reserved.
02798                                                            0x2 = 26 ohm.
02799                                                            0x3 = 30 ohm.
02800                                                            0x4 = 34 ohm.
02801                                                            0x5 = 40 ohm.
02802                                                            0x6 = 48 ohm.
02803                                                            _ else = Reserved. */
02804     uint64_t ck_ctl                       : 4;  /**< Drive strength control for DDR_CK_*_P/N drivers.
02805                                                          In DDR3 mode:
02806                                                            0x1 = 24 ohm.
02807                                                            0x2 = 26.67 ohm.
02808                                                            0x3 = 30 ohm.
02809                                                            0x4 = 34.3 ohm.
02810                                                            0x5 = 40 ohm.
02811                                                            0x6 = 48 ohm.
02812                                                            0x7 = 60 ohm.
02813                                                            _ else = Reserved.
02814                                                          In DDR4 mode:
02815                                                            0x0 = Reserved.
02816                                                            0x1 = Reserved.
02817                                                            0x2 = 26 ohm.
02818                                                            0x3 = 30 ohm.
02819                                                            0x4 = 34 ohm.
02820                                                            0x5 = 40 ohm.
