02821                                                            0x6 = 48 ohm.
02822                                                            _ else = Reserved." */
02823     uint64_t dqx_ctl                      : 4;  /**< Drive strength control for DDR_DQ* /DDR_CB* /DDR_DQS_*_P/N drivers.
02824                                                          0x1 = 24 ohm.
02825                                                          0x2 = 26.67 ohm.
02826                                                          0x3 = 30 ohm.
02827                                                          0x4 = 34.3 ohm.
02828                                                          0x5 = 40 ohm.
02829                                                          0x6 = 48 ohm.
02830                                                          0x7 = 60 ohm.
02831                                                          _ else = Reserved. */
02832 #else
02833     uint64_t dqx_ctl                      : 4;
02834     uint64_t ck_ctl                       : 4;
02835     uint64_t cmd_ctl                      : 4;
02836     uint64_t reserved_12_35               : 24;
02837     uint64_t ptune_offset                 : 4;
02838     uint64_t reserved_40_49               : 10;
02839     uint64_t rclk_char_mode               : 1;
02840     uint64_t reserved_51_63               : 13;
02841 #endif
02842     } s;
02843     struct cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl2_cn61xx {
02844 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02845     uint64_t reserved_34_63               : 30;
02846     uint64_t ddr__ptune                   : 4;  /**< DDR PCTL from compensation circuit
02847                                                          The encoded value provides debug information for the
02848                                                          compensation impedance on P-pullup */
02849     uint64_t ddr__ntune                   : 4;  /**< DDR NCTL from compensation circuit
02850                                                          The encoded value provides debug information for the
02851                                                          compensation impedance on N-pulldown */
02852     uint64_t m180                         : 1;  /**< Cap impedance at 180 Ohm (instead of 240 Ohm) */
02853     uint64_t byp                          : 1;  /**< Bypass mode
02854                                                          When set, PTUNE,NTUNE are the compensation setting.
02855                                                          When clear, DDR_PTUNE,DDR_NTUNE are the compensation setting. */
02856     uint64_t ptune                        : 4;  /**< PCTL impedance control in bypass mode */
02857     uint64_t ntune                        : 4;  /**< NCTL impedance control in bypass mode */
02858     uint64_t rodt_ctl                     : 4;  /**< NCTL RODT impedance control bits
02859                                                          This field controls ODT values during a memory read
02860                                                          on the Octeon side
02861                                                          0000 = No ODT
02862                                                          0001 = 20 ohm
02863                                                          0010 = 30 ohm
02864                                                          0011 = 40 ohm
02865                                                          0100 = 60 ohm
02866                                                          0101 = 120 ohm
02867                                                          0110-1111 = Reserved */
02868     uint64_t cmd_ctl                      : 4;  /**< Drive strength control for CMD/A/RESET_L drivers
02869                                                          0001 = 24 ohm
02870                                                          0010 = 26.67 ohm
02871                                                          0011 = 30 ohm
02872                                                          0100 = 34.3 ohm
02873                                                          0101 = 40 ohm
02874                                                          0110 = 48 ohm
02875                                                          0111 = 60 ohm
02876                                                          0000,1000-1111 = Reserved */
02877     uint64_t ck_ctl                       : 4;  /**< Drive strength control for CK/CS*_L/ODT/CKE* drivers
02878                                                          0001 = 24 ohm
02879                                                          0010 = 26.67 ohm
02880                                                          0011 = 30 ohm
02881                                                          0100 = 34.3 ohm
02882                                                          0101 = 40 ohm
02883                                                          0110 = 48 ohm
02884                                                          0111 = 60 ohm
02885                                                          0000,1000-1111 = Reserved */
02886     uint64_t dqx_ctl                      : 4;  /**< Drive strength control for DQ/DQS drivers
02887                                                          0001 = 24 ohm
02888                                                          0010 = 26.67 ohm
02889                                                          0011 = 30 ohm
02890                                                          0100 = 34.3 ohm
02891                                                          0101 = 40 ohm
02892                                                          0110 = 48 ohm
02893                                                          0111 = 60 ohm
02894                                                          0000,1000-1111 = Reserved */
02895 #else
02896     uint64_t dqx_ctl                      : 4;
02897     uint64_t ck_ctl                       : 4;
02898     uint64_t cmd_ctl                      : 4;
02899     uint64_t rodt_ctl                     : 4;
02900     uint64_t ntune                        : 4;
02901     uint64_t ptune                        : 4;
02902     uint64_t byp                          : 1;
02903     uint64_t m180                         : 1;
02904     uint64_t ddr__ntune                   : 4;
02905     uint64_t ddr__ptune                   : 4;
02906     uint64_t reserved_34_63               : 30;
02907 #endif
02908     } cn61xx;
02909     struct cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl2_cn61xx     cn63xx;
02910     struct cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl2_cn61xx     cn63xxp1;
02911     struct cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl2_cn61xx     cn66xx;
02912     struct cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl2_cn61xx     cn68xx;
02913     struct cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl2_cn61xx     cn68xxp1;
02914     struct cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl2_cn70xx {
02915 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02916     uint64_t reserved_51_63               : 13;
02917     uint64_t rclk_char_mode               : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
02918     uint64_t ddr__ptune                   : 5;  /**< DDR PCTL from compensation circuit. The encoded value provides debug information for the
02919                                                          compensation impedance on P-pullup. */
02920     uint64_t ddr__ntune                   : 5;  /**< DDR NCTL from compensation circuit. The encoded value provides debug information for the
02921                                                          compensation impedance on N-pulldown. */
02922     uint64_t ptune_offset                 : 4;  /**< Ptune offset value. This is a signed value where the MSB is a sign bit, with zero
02923                                                          indicating addition and one indicating subtraction. */
02924     uint64_t ntune_offset                 : 4;  /**< Ntune offset value. This is a signed value where the MSB is a sign bit, with zero
02925                                                          indicating addition and one indicating subtraction. */
02926     uint64_t m180                         : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
02927     uint64_t byp                          : 1;  /**< Bypass mode. When set, [PTUNE],[NTUNE] are the compensation setting. When clear,
02928                                                          [DDR__PTUNE],[DDR__NTUNE] are the compensation setting. */
02929     uint64_t ptune                        : 5;  /**< PCTL impedance control in bypass mode. */
02930     uint64_t ntune                        : 5;  /**< NCTL impedance control in bypass mode. */
02931     uint64_t rodt_ctl                     : 4;  /**< RODT NCTL impedance control bits. This field controls ODT values during a memory read.
02932                                                            0x0 = No ODT.
02933                                                            0x1 = 20 ohm.
02934                                                            0x2 = 30 ohm.
02935                                                            0x3 = 40 ohm.
02936                                                            0x4 = 60 ohm.
02937                                                            0x5 = 120 ohm.
02938                                                            _ else = Reserved.
02939                                                          In DDR4 mode:
02940                                                            0x0 = No ODT.
02941                                                            0x1 = 40 ohm.
02942                                                            0x2 = 60 ohm.
02943                                                            0x3 = 80 ohm.
02944                                                            0x4 = 120 ohm.
02945                                                            0x5 = 240 ohm.
02946                                                            0x6 = 34 ohm.
02947                                                            0x7 = 48 ohm.
02948                                                            _ else = Reserved. */
02949     uint64_t control_ctl                  : 4;  /**< Drive strength control for DDR_DIMMx_CS*_L/DDR_DIMMx_ODT_* /DDR_DIMMx_CKE* drivers.
02950                                                          In DDR3 mode:
02951                                                            0x1 = 24 ohm.
02952                                                            0x2 = 26.67 ohm.
02953                                                            0x3 = 30 ohm.
02954                                                            0x4 = 34.3 ohm.
02955                                                            0x5 = 40 ohm.
02956                                                            0x6 = 48 ohm.
02957                                                            0x7 = 60 ohm.
02958                                                            _ else = Reserved.
02959                                                          In DDR4 mode:
02960                                                            0x0 = Reserved.
02961                                                            0x1 = Reserved.
02962                                                            0x2 = 26 ohm.
02963                                                            0x3 = 30 ohm.
02964                                                            0x4 = 34 ohm.
02965                                                            0x5 = 40 ohm.
02966                                                            0x6 = 48 ohm.
02967                                                            _ else = Reserved. */
02968     uint64_t cmd_ctl                      : 4;  /**< Drive strength control for DDR_RAS_L_A<16>/DDR_CAS_L_A<15>/DDR_WE_L_A<14>/DDR_A<13:0>/DDR_
02969                                                          A<15>_BG1/DDR_A<14>_BG0/DDR_BA* /DDR_BA2_TEN/DDR_PAR/DDR_RESET_L drivers.
02970                                                          In DDR3 mode:
02971                                                            0x1 = 24 ohm.
02972                                                            0x2 = 26.67 ohm.
02973                                                            0x3 = 30 ohm.
02974                                                            0x4 = 34.3 ohm.
02975                                                            0x5 = 40 ohm.
02976                                                            0x6 = 48 ohm.
02977                                                            0x7 = 60 ohm.
02978                                                            _ else = Reserved.
02979                                                          In DDR4 mode:
02980                                                            0x0 = Reserved.
02981                                                            0x1 = Reserved.
02982                                                            0x2 = 26 ohm.
02983                                                            0x3 = 30 ohm.
02984                                                            0x4 = 34 ohm.
02985                                                            0x5 = 40 ohm.
02986                                                            0x6 = 48 ohm.
02987                                                            _ else = Reserved. */
02988     uint64_t ck_ctl                       : 4;  /**< "Drive strength control for DDR_CK_*_P/N drivers.
02989                                                          In DDR3 mode:
02990                                                            0x1 = 24 ohm.
02991                                                            0x2 = 26.67 ohm.
02992                                                            0x3 = 30 ohm.
02993                                                            0x4 = 34.3 ohm.
02994                                                            0x5 = 40 ohm.
02995                                                            0x6 = 48 ohm.
02996                                                            0x7 = 60 ohm.
02997                                                            _ else = Reserved.
02998                                                          In DDR4 mode:
02999                                                            0x0 = Reserved.
03000                                                            0x1 = Reserved.
03001                                                            0x2 = 26 ohm.
03002                                                            0x3 = 30 ohm.
03003                                                            0x4 = 34 ohm.
03004                                                            0x5 = 40 ohm.
03005                                                            0x6 = 48 ohm.
03006                                                            _ else = Reserved." */
03007     uint64_t dqx_ctl                      : 4;  /**< Drive strength control for DDR_DQ* /DDR_CB* /DDR_DQS_*_P/N drivers.
03008                                                          0x1 = 24 ohm.
03009                                                          0x2 = 26.67 ohm.
03010                                                          0x3 = 30 ohm.
03011                                                          0x4 = 34.3 ohm.
03012                                                          0x5 = 40 ohm.
03013                                                          0x6 = 48 ohm.
03014                                                          0x7 = 60 ohm.
03015                                                          _ else = Reserved. */
03016 #else
03017     uint64_t dqx_ctl                      : 4;
03018     uint64_t ck_ctl                       : 4;
03019     uint64_t cmd_ctl                      : 4;
03020     uint64_t control_ctl                  : 4;
03021     uint64_t rodt_ctl                     : 4;
03022     uint64_t ntune                        : 5;
03023     uint64_t ptune                        : 5;
03024     uint64_t byp                          : 1;
03025     uint64_t m180                         : 1;
03026     uint64_t ntune_offset                 : 4;
03027     uint64_t ptune_offset                 : 4;
03028     uint64_t ddr__ntune                   : 5;
03029     uint64_t ddr__ptune                   : 5;
03030     uint64_t rclk_char_mode               : 1;
03031     uint64_t reserved_51_63               : 13;
03032 #endif
03033     } cn70xx;
03034     struct cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl2_cn70xx     cn70xxp1;
03035     struct cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl2_cn70xx     cn73xx;
03036     struct cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl2_cn70xx     cn78xx;
03037     struct cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl2_cn70xx     cn78xxp1;
03038     struct cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl2_cn61xx     cnf71xx;
03039     struct cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl2_cn70xx     cnf75xx;
03040 };
03041 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl2 cvmx_lmcx_comp_ctl2_t;
03042 
03043 /**
03044  * cvmx_lmc#_config
03045  *
03046  * This register controls certain parameters required for memory configuration. Note the
03047  * following:
03048  * * Priority order for hardware write operations to
03049  * LMC()_CONFIG/LMC()_FADR/LMC()_ECC_SYND: DED error > SEC error.
03050  * * The self-refresh entry sequence(s) power the DLL up/down (depending on
03051  * LMC()_MODEREG_PARAMS0[DLL]) when LMC()_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set.
03052  * * Prior to the self-refresh exit sequence, LMC()_MODEREG_PARAMS0 should be reprogrammed
03053  * (if needed) to the appropriate values.
03054  *
03055  * See LMC Initialization Sequence for the LMC bring-up sequence.
03056  */
03057 union cvmx_lmcx_config {
03058     uint64_t u64;
03059     struct cvmx_lmcx_config_s {
03060 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
03061     uint64_t lrdimm_ena                   : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
03062     uint64_t bg2_enable                   : 1;  /**< BG1 enable bit. Only has an effect when LMC()_CONFIG[MODEDDR4] = 1.
03063                                                          Set to 1 when using DDR4 x4 or x8 parts.
03064                                                          Clear to 0 when using DDR4 x16 parts. */
03065     uint64_t mode_x4dev                   : 1;  /**< DDR *4 device mode. */
03066     uint64_t mode32b                      : 1;  /**< 32-bit datapath mode. When set, only 32 DQ pins are used. */
03067     uint64_t scrz                         : 1;  /**< Hide LMC()_SCRAMBLE_CFG0 and LMC()_SCRAMBLE_CFG1 when set. */
03068     uint64_t early_unload_d1_r1           : 1;  /**< Reserved, MBZ. */
03069     uint64_t early_unload_d1_r0           : 1;  /**< Reserved, MBZ. */
03070     uint64_t early_unload_d0_r1           : 1;  /**< Reserved, MBZ. */
03071     uint64_t early_unload_d0_r0           : 1;  /**< Reserved, MBZ. */
03072     uint64_t init_status                  : 4;  /**< Indicates status of initialization. [INIT_STATUS][n] = 1 implies rank n has been
03073                                                          initialized.
03074                                                          Software must set necessary [RANKMASK] bits before executing the initialization sequence
03075                                                          using LMC()_SEQ_CTL. If the rank has been selected for init with the [RANKMASK] bits,
03076                                                          the [INIT_STATUS] bits will be set after successful initialization and after self-refresh
03077                                                          exit. [INIT_STATUS] determines the chip-selects that assert during refresh, ZQCS,
03078                                                          precharge
03079                                                          power-down entry/exit, and self-refresh entry SEQ_SELs. */
03080     uint64_t mirrmask                     : 4;  /**< "Mask determining which ranks are address-mirrored.
03081                                                          [MIRRMASK]<n> = 1 means rank n addresses are mirrored for
03082                                                          0 <= n <= 3.
03083                                                          In DDR3, a mirrored read/write operation has the following differences:
03084                                                          * DDR#_BA<1> is swapped with DDR#_BA<0>.
03085                                                          * DDR#_A<8> is swapped with DDR#_A<7>.
03086                                                          * DDR#_A<6> is swapped with DDR#_A<5>.
03087                                                          * DDR#_A<4> is swapped with DDR#_A<3>.
03088                                                          When RANK_ENA = 0, MIRRMASK<1> MBZ.
03089                                                          In DDR4, a mirrored read/write operation has the following differences:
03090                                                          * DDR#_BG<1> is swapped with DDR#_BG<0>.
03091                                                          * DDR#_BA<1> is swapped with DDR#_BA<0>.
03092                                                          * DDR#_A<13> is swapped with DDR#_A<11>.
03093                                                          * DDR#_A<8> is swapped with DDR#_A<7>.
03094                                                          * DDR#_A<6> is swapped with DDR#_A<5>.
03095                                                          * DDR#_A<4> is swapped with DDR#_A<3>.
03096                                                          For CN70XX, MIRRMASK<3:2> MBZ.
03097                                                          * When RANK_ENA = 0, MIRRMASK<1> MBZ." */
03098     uint64_t rankmask                     : 4;  /**< Mask to select rank to be leveled/initialized. To write-level/read-level/initialize rank
03099                                                          i, set [RANKMASK]<i>:
03100                                                          <pre>
03101                                                                        RANK_ENA = 1   RANK_ENA = 0
03102                                                          RANKMASK<0> = DIMM0_CS0      DIMM0_CS0
03103                                                          RANKMASK<1> = DIMM0_CS1      MBZ
03104                                                          RANKMASK<2> = DIMM1_CS0      DIMM1_CS0
03105                                                          RANKMASK<3> = DIMM1_CS1      MBZ
03106                                                          </pre>
03107                                                          For read/write leveling, each rank has to be leveled separately, so [RANKMASK] should only
03108                                                          have one bit set. [RANKMASK] is not used during self-refresh entry/exit and precharge
03109                                                          power-
03110                                                          down entry/exit instruction sequences. When [RANK_ENA] = 0, [RANKMASK]<1> and
03111                                                          [RANKMASK]<3> MBZ. */
03112     uint64_t rank_ena                     : 1;  /**< "RANK enable (for use with dual-rank DIMMs).
03113                                                          * For dual-rank DIMMs, the [RANK_ENA] bit will enable the drive of the DDR#_DIMM*_CS*_L
03114                                                          and
03115                                                          ODT_<1:0> pins differently based on the ([PBANK_LSB] - 1) address bit.
03116                                                          * Write 0 for SINGLE ranked DIMMs." */
03117     uint64_t sref_with_dll                : 1;  /**< Self-refresh entry/exit write mode registers. When set, self-refresh entry sequence writes
03118                                                          MR2 and MR1 (in this order, in all ranks), and self-refresh exit sequence writes MR1, MR0,
03119                                                          MR2, and MR3 (in this order, for all ranks). The write operations occur before self-
03120                                                          refresh entry, and after self-refresh exit. When clear, self-refresh entry and exit
03121                                                          instruction sequences do not write any mode registers in the DDR3/4 parts. */
03122     uint64_t early_dqx                    : 1;  /**< Set this bit to send DQx signals one CK cycle earlier for the case when the shortest DQx
03123                                                          lines have a larger delay than the CK line. */
03124     uint64_t reserved_18_39               : 22;
03125     uint64_t reset                        : 1;  /**< Reset one-shot pulse for LMC()_OPS_CNT, LMC()_IFB_CNT, and LMC()_DCLK_CNT.
03126                                                          To cause the reset, software writes this to a 1, then rewrites it to a 0. */
03127     uint64_t ecc_adr                      : 1;  /**< Include memory reference address in the ECC calculation.
03128                                                          0 = disabled, 1 = enabled. */
03129     uint64_t forcewrite                   : 4;  /**< Force the oldest outstanding write to complete after having waited for 2^[FORCEWRITE] CK
03130                                                          cycles. 0 = disabled. */
03131     uint64_t idlepower                    : 3;  /**< Enter precharge power-down mode after the memory controller has been idle for
03132                                                          2^(2+[IDLEPOWER]) CK cycles. 0 = disabled.
03133                                                          This field should only be programmed after initialization.
03134                                                          LMC()_MODEREG_PARAMS0[PPD] determines whether the DRAM DLL is disabled during the
03135                                                          precharge power-down. */
03136     uint64_t pbank_lsb                    : 4;  /**< DIMM address bit select. Reverting to the explanation for [ROW_LSB], [PBANK_LSB] would be:
03137                                                          [ROW_LSB] bit + num_rowbits + num_rankbits
03138                                                          Decoding for PBANK_LSB:
03139                                                          0x0: DIMM = mem_adr<28>; if [RANK_ENA]=1, rank = mem_adr<27>.
03140                                                          0x1: DIMM = mem_adr<29>; if [RANK_ENA]=1, rank = mem_adr<28>.
03141                                                          0x2: DIMM = mem_adr<30>; if [RANK_ENA]=1, rank = mem_adr<29>.
03142                                                          0x3: DIMM = mem_adr<31>; if [RANK_ENA]=1, rank = mem_adr<30>.
03143                                                          0x4: DIMM = mem_adr<32>; if [RANK_ENA]=1, rank = mem_adr<31>.
03144                                                          0x5: DIMM = mem_adr<33>; if [RANK_ENA]=1, rank = mem_adr<32>.
03145                                                          0x6: DIMM = mem_adr<34>; if [RANK_ENA]=1, rank = mem_adr<33>.
03146                                                          0x7: DIMM = mem_adr<35>; if [RANK_ENA]=1, rank = mem_adr<34>.
03147                                                          0x8: DIMM = mem_adr<36>; if [RANK_ENA]=1, rank = mem_adr<35>.
03148                                                          0x9: DIMM = mem_adr<37>; if [RANK_ENA]=1, rank = mem_adr<36>.
03149                                                          0xA: DIMM = 0;           if [RANK_ENA]=1, rank = mem_adr<37>.
03150                                                          0xB-0xF: Reserved.
03151                                                          For example, for a DIMM made of Samsung's K4B1G0846C-F7 1Gb (16M * 8 bit * 8 bank)
03152                                                          parts, the column address width = 10, so with 10b of col, 3b of bus, 3b of bank, ROW_LSB =
03153                                                          16. So, row = mem_adr<29:16>.
03154                                                          With [RANK_ENA] = 0, [PBANK_LSB] = 2.
03155                                                          With [RANK_ENA] = 1, [PBANK_LSB] = 3. */
03156     uint64_t row_lsb                      : 3;  /**< Row address bit select.
03157                                                          0x0 = Address bit 14 is LSB.
03158                                                          0x1 = Address bit 15 is LSB.
03159                                                          0x2 = Address bit 16 is LSB.
03160                                                          0x3 = Address bit 17 is LSB.
03161                                                          0x4 = Address bit 18 is LSB.
03162                                                          0x5 = Address bit 19 is LSB.
03163                                                          0x6 = Address bit 20 is LSB.
03164                                                          0x6 = Reserved.
03165                                                          Encoding used to determine which memory address bit position represents the low order DDR
03166                                                          ROW address. The processor's memory address<34:7> needs to be translated to DRAM addresses
03167                                                          (bnk,row,col,rank and DIMM) and that is a function of the following:
03168                                                          * Datapath width (64).
03169                                                          * Number of banks (8).
03170                                                          * Number of column bits of the memory part--specified indirectly by this register.
03171                                                          * Number of row bits of the memory part--specified indirectly by [PBANK_LSB].
03172                                                          * Number of ranks in a DIMM--specified by [RANK_ENA].
03173                                                          * Number of DIMMs in the system by the register below ([PBANK_LSB]).
03174                                                          Column address starts from mem_addr[3] for 64b (8Bytes) DQ width. [ROW_LSB] is
03175                                                          mem_adr[15] for 64b mode. Therefore, the [ROW_LSB] parameter should be set to
03176                                                          0x1 (64b).
03177                                                          For example, for a DIMM made of Samsung's K4B1G0846C-F7 1GB (16M * 8 bit * 8 bank)
03178                                                          parts, the column address width = 10, so with 10b of col, 3b of bus, 3b of bank, ROW_LSB =
03179                                                          16. So, row = mem_adr<29:16>.
03180                                                          Refer to Cache-block Read Transaction Example, Cache-block Read Transaction Example. */
03181     uint64_t ecc_ena                      : 1;  /**< ECC enable. When set, enables the 8b ECC check/correct logic. Should be 1 when used with
03182                                                          DIMMs with ECC; 0, otherwise.
03183                                                          * When this mode is turned on, DQ<71:64> on write operations contains the ECC code
03184                                                          generated for the 64 bits of data which will be written in the memory. Later on read
03185                                                          operations, will be used to check for single-bit error (which will be auto-corrected) and
03186                                                          double-bit error (which will be reported).
03187                                                          * When not turned on, DQ<71:64> are driven to 0. Please refer to SEC_ERR, DED_ERR,
03188                                                          LMC()_FADR, and LMC()_ECC_SYND registers for diagnostics information when there is
03189                                                          an error. */
03190     uint64_t init_start                   : 1;  /**< A 0->1 transition starts the DDR memory sequence that is
03191                                                          selected by LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE].  This register is a
03192                                                          oneshot and clears itself each time it is set. */
03193 #else
03194     uint64_t init_start                   : 1;
03195     uint64_t ecc_ena                      : 1;
03196     uint64_t row_lsb                      : 3;
03197     uint64_t pbank_lsb                    : 4;
03198     uint64_t idlepower                    : 3;
03199     uint64_t forcewrite                   : 4;
03200     uint64_t ecc_adr                      : 1;
03201     uint64_t reset                        : 1;
03202     uint64_t reserved_18_39               : 22;
03203     uint64_t early_dqx                    : 1;
03204     uint64_t sref_with_dll                : 1;
03205     uint64_t rank_ena                     : 1;
03206     uint64_t rankmask                     : 4;
03207     uint64_t mirrmask                     : 4;
03208     uint64_t init_status                  : 4;
03209     uint64_t early_unload_d0_r0           : 1;
03210     uint64_t early_unload_d0_r1           : 1;
03211     uint64_t early_unload_d1_r0           : 1;
03212     uint64_t early_unload_d1_r1           : 1;
03213     uint64_t scrz                         : 1;
03214     uint64_t mode32b                      : 1;
03215     uint64_t mode_x4dev                   : 1;
03216     uint64_t bg2_enable                   : 1;
03217     uint64_t lrdimm_ena                   : 1;
03218 #endif
03219     } s;
03220     struct cvmx_lmcx_config_cn61xx {
03221 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
03222     uint64_t reserved_61_63               : 3;
03223     uint64_t mode32b                      : 1;  /**< 32b Datapath Mode                                          NS
03224                                                          Set to 1 if we use only 32 DQ pins
03225                                                          0 for 64b DQ mode. */
03226     uint64_t scrz                         : 1;  /**< Hide LMC*_SCRAMBLE_CFG0 and LMC*_SCRAMBLE_CFG1 when set */
03227     uint64_t early_unload_d1_r1           : 1;  /**< When set, unload the PHY silo one cycle early for Rank 3
03228                                                          reads
03229                                                          The recommended EARLY_UNLOAD_D1_R1 value can be calculated
03230                                                          after the final LMC*_RLEVEL_RANK3[BYTE*] values are
03231                                                          selected (as part of read-leveling initialization).
03232                                                          Then, determine the largest read-leveling setting
03233                                                          for rank 3 (i.e. calculate maxset=MAX(LMC*_RLEVEL_RANK3[BYTEi])
03234                                                          across all i), then set EARLY_UNLOAD_D1_R1
03235                                                          when the low two bits of this largest setting is not
03236                                                          3 (i.e. EARLY_UNLOAD_D1_R1 = (maxset<1:0>!=3)). */
03237     uint64_t early_unload_d1_r0           : 1;  /**< When set, unload the PHY silo one cycle early for Rank 2
03238                                                          reads
03239                                                          The recommended EARLY_UNLOAD_D1_RO value can be calculated
03240                                                          after the final LMC*_RLEVEL_RANK2[BYTE*] values are
03241                                                          selected (as part of read-leveling initialization).
03242                                                          Then, determine the largest read-leveling setting
03243                                                          for rank 2 (i.e. calculate maxset=MAX(LMC*_RLEVEL_RANK2[BYTEi])
03244                                                          across all i), then set EARLY_UNLOAD_D1_RO
03245                                                          when the low two bits of this largest setting is not
03246                                                          3 (i.e. EARLY_UNLOAD_D1_RO = (maxset<1:0>!=3)). */
03247     uint64_t early_unload_d0_r1           : 1;  /**< When set, unload the PHY silo one cycle early for Rank 1
03248                                                          reads
03249                                                          The recommended EARLY_UNLOAD_D0_R1 value can be calculated
03250                                                          after the final LMC*_RLEVEL_RANK1[BYTE*] values are
03251                                                          selected (as part of read-leveling initialization).
03252                                                          Then, determine the largest read-leveling setting
03253                                                          for rank 1 (i.e. calculate maxset=MAX(LMC*_RLEVEL_RANK1[BYTEi])
03254                                                          across all i), then set EARLY_UNLOAD_D0_R1
03255                                                          when the low two bits of this largest setting is not
03256                                                          3 (i.e. EARLY_UNLOAD_D0_R1 = (maxset<1:0>!=3)). */
03257     uint64_t early_unload_d0_r0           : 1;  /**< When set, unload the PHY silo one cycle early for Rank 0
03258                                                          reads.
03259                                                          The recommended EARLY_UNLOAD_D0_R0 value can be calculated
03260                                                          after the final LMC*_RLEVEL_RANK0[BYTE*] values are
03261                                                          selected (as part of read-leveling initialization).
03262                                                          Then, determine the largest read-leveling setting
03263                                                          for rank 0 (i.e. calculate maxset=MAX(LMC*_RLEVEL_RANK0[BYTEi])
03264                                                          across all i), then set EARLY_UNLOAD_D0_R0
03265                                                          when the low two bits of this largest setting is not
03266                                                          3 (i.e. EARLY_UNLOAD_D0_R0 = (maxset<1:0>!=3)). */
03267     uint64_t init_status                  : 4;  /**< Indicates status of initialization
03268                                                          INIT_STATUS[n] = 1 implies rank n has been initialized
03269                                                          SW must set necessary INIT_STATUS bits with the
03270                                                          same LMC*_CONFIG write that initiates
03271                                                          power-up/init and self-refresh exit sequences
03272                                                          (if the required INIT_STATUS bits are not already
03273                                                          set before LMC initiates the sequence).
03274                                                          INIT_STATUS determines the chip-selects that assert
03275                                                          during refresh, ZQCS, and precharge power-down and
03276                                                          self-refresh entry/exit SEQUENCE's. */
03277     uint64_t mirrmask                     : 4;  /**< Mask determining which ranks are address-mirrored.
03278                                                          MIRRMASK<n> = 1 means Rank n addresses are mirrored
03279                                                          for 0 <= n <= 3
03280                                                          A mirrored read/write has these differences:
03281                                                           - DDR_BA<1> is swapped with DDR_BA<0>
03282                                                           - DDR_A<8> is swapped with DDR_A<7>
03283                                                           - DDR_A<6> is swapped with DDR_A<5>
03284                                                           - DDR_A<4> is swapped with DDR_A<3>
03285                                                          When RANK_ENA=0, MIRRMASK<1> and MIRRMASK<3> MBZ */
03286     uint64_t rankmask                     : 4;  /**< Mask to select rank to be leveled/initialized.
03287                                                          To write-level/read-level/initialize rank i, set RANKMASK<i>
03288                                                                          RANK_ENA=1               RANK_ENA=0
03289                                                            RANKMASK<0> = DIMM0_CS0                DIMM0_CS0
03290                                                            RANKMASK<1> = DIMM0_CS1                  MBZ
03291                                                            RANKMASK<2> = DIMM1_CS0                DIMM1_CS0
03292                                                            RANKMASK<3> = DIMM1_CS1                  MBZ
03293                                                          For read/write leveling, each rank has to be leveled separately,
03294                                                          so RANKMASK should only have one bit set.
03295                                                          RANKMASK is not used during self-refresh entry/exit and
03296                                                          precharge power-down entry/exit instruction sequences.
03297                                                          When RANK_ENA=0, RANKMASK<1> and RANKMASK<3> MBZ */
03298     uint64_t rank_ena                     : 1;  /**< RANK ena (for use with dual-rank DIMMs)
03299                                                          For dual-rank DIMMs, the rank_ena bit will enable
03300                                                          the drive of the CS*_L[1:0] and ODT_<1:0> pins differently based on the
03301                                                          (pbank_lsb-1) address bit.
03302                                                          Write 0 for SINGLE ranked DIMM's. */
03303     uint64_t sref_with_dll                : 1;  /**< Self-refresh entry/exit write MR1 and MR2
03304                                                          When set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences
03305                                                          write MR1 and MR2 (in all ranks). (The writes occur before
03306                                                          self-refresh entry, and after self-refresh exit.)
03307                                                          When clear, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences
03308                                                          do not write any registers in the DDR3 parts. */
03309     uint64_t early_dqx                    : 1;  /**< Send DQx signals one CK cycle earlier for the case when
03310                                                          the shortest DQx lines have a larger delay than the CK line */
03311     uint64_t sequence                     : 3;  /**< Selects the sequence that LMC runs after a 0->1
03312                                                          transition on LMC*_CONFIG[INIT_START].
03313                                                          SEQUENCE=0=power-up/init:
03314                                                            - RANKMASK selects participating ranks (should be all ranks with attached DRAM)
03315                                                            - INIT_STATUS must equal RANKMASK
03316                                                            - DDR_DIMM*_CKE signals activated (if they weren't already active)
03317                                                            - RDIMM register control words 0-15 will be written to RANKMASK-selected
03318                                                                RDIMM's when LMC(0)_CONTROL[RDIMM_ENA]=1 and corresponding
03319                                                                LMC*_DIMM_CTL[DIMM*_WMASK] bits are set. (Refer to LMC*_DIMM*_PARAMS and
03320                                                                LMC*_DIMM_CTL descriptions below for more details.)
03321                                                            - MR0, MR1, MR2, and MR3 will be written to selected ranks
03322                                                          SEQUENCE=1=read-leveling:
03323                                                            - RANKMASK selects the rank to be read-leveled
03324                                                            - MR3 written to selected rank
03325                                                          SEQUENCE=2=self-refresh entry:
03326                                                            - INIT_STATUS selects participating ranks (should be all ranks with attached DRAM)
03327                                                            - MR1 and MR2 will be written to selected ranks if SREF_WITH_DLL=1
03328                                                            - DDR_DIMM*_CKE signals de-activated
03329                                                          SEQUENCE=3=self-refresh exit:
03330                                                            - INIT_STATUS must be set to indicate participating ranks (should be all ranks with attached DRAM)
03331                                                            - DDR_DIMM*_CKE signals activated
03332                                                            - MR0, MR1, MR2, and MR3 will be written to participating ranks if SREF_WITH_DLL=1
03333                                                          SEQUENCE=4=precharge power-down entry:
03334                                                            - INIT_STATUS selects participating ranks (should be all ranks with attached DRAM)
03335                                                            - DDR_DIMM*_CKE signals de-activated
03336                                                          SEQUENCE=5=precharge power-down exit:
03337                                                            - INIT_STATUS selects participating ranks (should be all ranks with attached DRAM)
03338                                                            - DDR_DIMM*_CKE signals activated
03339                                                          SEQUENCE=6=write-leveling:
03340                                                            - RANKMASK selects the rank to be write-leveled
03341                                                            - INIT_STATUS must indicate all ranks with attached DRAM
03342                                                            - MR1 and MR2 written to INIT_STATUS-selected ranks
03343                                                          SEQUENCE=7=illegal
03344                                                          Precharge power-down entry and exit SEQUENCE's may also
03345                                                          be automatically generated by the HW when IDLEPOWER!=0.
03346                                                          Self-refresh entry SEQUENCE's may also be automatically
03347                                                          generated by hardware upon a chip warm or soft reset
03348                                                          sequence when LMC*_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT] are set.
03349                                                          LMC writes the LMC*_MODEREG_PARAMS0 and LMC*_MODEREG_PARAMS1 CSR field values
03350                                                          to the Mode registers in the DRAM parts (i.e. MR0, MR1, MR2, and MR3) as part of some of these sequences.
03351                                                          Refer to the LMC*_MODEREG_PARAMS0 and LMC*_MODEREG_PARAMS1 descriptions for more details.
03352                                                          If there are two consecutive power-up/init's without
03353                                                          a DRESET assertion between them, LMC asserts DDR_DIMM*_CKE as part of
03354                                                          the first power-up/init, and continues to assert DDR_DIMM*_CKE
03355                                                          through the remainder of the first and the second power-up/init.
03356                                                          If DDR_DIMM*_CKE deactivation and reactivation is needed for
03357                                                          a second power-up/init, a DRESET assertion is required
03358                                                          between the first and the second. */
03359     uint64_t ref_zqcs_int                 : 19; /**< Refresh & ZQCS interval represented in \#of 512 CK cycle
03360                                                          increments. A Refresh sequence is triggered when bits
03361                                                          [24:18] are equal to 0, and a ZQCS sequence is triggered
03362                                                          when [36:18] are equal to 0.
03363                                                          Program [24:18] to RND-DN(tREFI/clkPeriod/512)
03364                                                          Program [36:25] to RND-DN(ZQCS_Interval/clkPeriod/(512*128)). Note
03365                                                          that this value should always be greater than 32, to account for
03366                                                          resistor calibration delays.
03367                                                          000_00000000_00000000: RESERVED
03368                                                          Max Refresh interval = 127 * 512           = 65024 CKs
03369                                                          Max ZQCS interval    = (8*256*256-1) * 512 = 268434944 CKs ~ 335ms for a 800 MHz CK
03370                                                          LMC*_CONFIG[INIT_STATUS] determines which ranks receive
03371                                                          the REF / ZQCS. LMC does not send any refreshes / ZQCS's
03372                                                          when LMC*_CONFIG[INIT_STATUS]=0. */
03373     uint64_t reset                        : 1;  /**< Reset oneshot pulse for refresh counter,
03374                                                          and LMC*_OPS_CNT, LMC*_IFB_CNT, and LMC*_DCLK_CNT
03375                                                          CSR's. SW should write this to a one, then re-write
03376                                                          it to a zero to cause the reset. */
03377     uint64_t ecc_adr                      : 1;  /**< Include memory reference address in the ECC calculation
03378                                                          0=disabled, 1=enabled */
03379     uint64_t forcewrite                   : 4;  /**< Force the oldest outstanding write to complete after
03380                                                          having waited for 2^FORCEWRITE CK cycles.  0=disabled. */
03381     uint64_t idlepower                    : 3;  /**< Enter precharge power-down mode after the memory
03382                                                          controller has been idle for 2^(2+IDLEPOWER) CK cycles.
03383                                                          0=disabled.
03384                                                          This field should only be programmed after initialization.
03385                                                          LMC*_MODEREG_PARAMS0[PPD] determines whether the DRAM DLL
03386                                                          is disabled during the precharge power-down. */
03387     uint64_t pbank_lsb                    : 4;  /**< DIMM address bit select
03388                                                          Reverting to the explanation for ROW_LSB,
03389                                                          PBank_LSB would be Row_LSB bit + \#rowbits + \#rankbits
03390                                                          In the 512MB DIMM Example, assuming no rank bits:
03391                                                          pbank_lsb=mem_addr[15+13] for 64b mode
03392                                                                   =mem_addr[14+13] for 32b mode
03393                                                          Decoding for pbank_lsb
03394                                                               - 0000:DIMM = mem_adr[28]    / rank = mem_adr[27] (if RANK_ENA)
03395                                                               - 0001:DIMM = mem_adr[29]    / rank = mem_adr[28]      "
03396                                                               - 0010:DIMM = mem_adr[30]    / rank = mem_adr[29]      "
03397                                                               - 0011:DIMM = mem_adr[31]    / rank = mem_adr[30]      "
03398                                                               - 0100:DIMM = mem_adr[32]    / rank = mem_adr[31]      "
03399                                                               - 0101:DIMM = mem_adr[33]    / rank = mem_adr[32]      "
03400                                                               - 0110:DIMM = mem_adr[34]    / rank = mem_adr[33]      "
03401                                                               - 0111:DIMM = 0              / rank = mem_adr[34]      "
03402                                                               - 1000-1111: RESERVED
03403                                                          For example, for a DIMM made of Samsung's k4b1g0846c-f7 1Gb (16M x 8 bit x 8 bank)
03404                                                          DDR3 parts, the column address width = 10, so with
03405                                                          10b of col, 3b of bus, 3b of bank, row_lsb = 16. So, row = mem_adr[29:16]
03406                                                          With rank_ena = 0, pbank_lsb = 2
03407                                                          With rank_ena = 1, pbank_lsb = 3 */
03408     uint64_t row_lsb                      : 3;  /**< Row Address bit select
03409                                                          Encoding used to determine which memory address
03410                                                          bit position represents the low order DDR ROW address.
03411                                                          The processor's memory address[34:7] needs to be
03412                                                          translated to DRAM addresses (bnk,row,col,rank and DIMM)
03413                                                          and that is a function of the following:
03414                                                          1. Datapath Width (64 or 32)
03415                                                          2. \# Banks (8)
03416                                                          3. \# Column Bits of the memory part - spec'd indirectly
03417                                                          by this register.
03418                                                          4. \# Row Bits of the memory part - spec'd indirectly
03419                                                          5. \# Ranks in a DIMM - spec'd by RANK_ENA
03420                                                          6. \# DIMM's in the system by the register below (PBANK_LSB).
03421                                                          Col Address starts from mem_addr[2] for 32b (4Bytes)
03422                                                          dq width or from mem_addr[3] for 64b (8Bytes) dq width
03423                                                          \# col + \# bank = 12. Hence row_lsb is mem_adr[15] for
03424                                                          64bmode or mem_adr[14] for 32b mode. Hence row_lsb
03425                                                          parameter should be set to 001 (64b) or 000 (32b).
03426                                                          Decoding for row_lsb
03427                                                               - 000: row_lsb = mem_adr[14]
03428                                                               - 001: row_lsb = mem_adr[15]
03429                                                               - 010: row_lsb = mem_adr[16]
03430                                                               - 011: row_lsb = mem_adr[17]
03431                                                               - 100: row_lsb = mem_adr[18]
03432                                                               - 101: row_lsb = mem_adr[19]
03433                                                               - 110: row_lsb = mem_adr[20]
03434                                                               - 111: RESERVED
03435                                                          For example, for a DIMM made of Samsung's k4b1g0846c-f7 1Gb (16M x 8 bit x 8 bank)
03436                                                          DDR3 parts, the column address width = 10, so with
03437                                                          10b of col, 3b of bus, 3b of bank, row_lsb = 16. So, row = mem_adr[29:16] */
03438     uint64_t ecc_ena                      : 1;  /**< ECC Enable: When set will enable the 8b ECC
03439                                                          check/correct logic. Should be 1 when used with DIMMs
03440                                                          with ECC. 0, otherwise.
03441                                                          When this mode is turned on, DQ[71:64]
03442                                                          on writes, will contain the ECC code generated for
03443                                                          the 64 bits of data which will
03444                                                          written in the memory and then later on reads, used
03445                                                          to check for Single bit error (which will be auto-
03446                                                          corrected) and Double Bit error (which will be
03447                                                          reported). When not turned on, DQ[71:64]
03448                                                          are driven to 0.  Please refer to SEC_ERR, DED_ERR,
03449                                                          LMC*_FADR, LMC*_SCRAMBLED_FADR and LMC*_ECC_SYND registers
03450                                                          for diagnostics information when there is an error. */
03451     uint64_t init_start                   : 1;  /**< A 0->1 transition starts the DDR memory sequence that is
03452                                                          selected by LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE].  This register is a
03453                                                          oneshot and clears itself each time it is set. */
03454 #else
03455     uint64_t init_start                   : 1;
03456     uint64_t ecc_ena                      : 1;
03457     uint64_t row_lsb                      : 3;
03458     uint64_t pbank_lsb                    : 4;
03459     uint64_t idlepower                    : 3;
03460     uint64_t forcewrite                   : 4;
03461     uint64_t ecc_adr                      : 1;
03462     uint64_t reset                        : 1;
03463     uint64_t ref_zqcs_int                 : 19;
03464     uint64_t sequence                     : 3;
03465     uint64_t early_dqx                    : 1;
03466     uint64_t sref_with_dll                : 1;
03467     uint64_t rank_ena                     : 1;
03468     uint64_t rankmask                     : 4;
03469     uint64_t mirrmask                     : 4;
03470     uint64_t init_status                  : 4;
03471     uint64_t early_unload_d0_r0           : 1;
03472     uint64_t early_unload_d0_r1           : 1;
03473     uint64_t early_unload_d1_r0           : 1;
03474     uint64_t early_unload_d1_r1           : 1;
03475     uint64_t scrz                         : 1;
03476     uint64_t mode32b                      : 1;
03477     uint64_t reserved_61_63               : 3;
03478 #endif
03479     } cn61xx;
03480     struct cvmx_lmcx_config_cn63xx {
03481 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
03482     uint64_t reserved_59_63               : 5;
03483     uint64_t early_unload_d1_r1           : 1;  /**< When set, unload the PHY silo one cycle early for Rank 3
03484                                                          reads
03485                                                          The recommended EARLY_UNLOAD_D1_R1 value can be calculated
03486                                                          after the final LMC*_RLEVEL_RANK3[BYTE*] values are
03487                                                          selected (as part of read-leveling initialization).
03488                                                          Then, determine the largest read-leveling setting
03489                                                          for rank 3 (i.e. calculate maxset=MAX(LMC*_RLEVEL_RANK3[BYTEi])
03490                                                          across all i), then set EARLY_UNLOAD_D1_R1
03491                                                          when the low two bits of this largest setting is not
03492                                                          3 (i.e. EARLY_UNLOAD_D1_R1 = (maxset<1:0>!=3)). */
03493     uint64_t early_unload_d1_r0           : 1;  /**< When set, unload the PHY silo one cycle early for Rank 2
03494                                                          reads
03495                                                          The recommended EARLY_UNLOAD_D1_RO value can be calculated
03496                                                          after the final LMC*_RLEVEL_RANK2[BYTE*] values are
03497                                                          selected (as part of read-leveling initialization).
03498                                                          Then, determine the largest read-leveling setting
03499                                                          for rank 2 (i.e. calculate maxset=MAX(LMC*_RLEVEL_RANK2[BYTEi])
03500                                                          across all i), then set EARLY_UNLOAD_D1_RO
03501                                                          when the low two bits of this largest setting is not
03502                                                          3 (i.e. EARLY_UNLOAD_D1_RO = (maxset<1:0>!=3)). */
03503     uint64_t early_unload_d0_r1           : 1;  /**< When set, unload the PHY silo one cycle early for Rank 1
03504                                                          reads
03505                                                          The recommended EARLY_UNLOAD_D0_R1 value can be calculated
03506                                                          after the final LMC*_RLEVEL_RANK1[BYTE*] values are
03507                                                          selected (as part of read-leveling initialization).
03508                                                          Then, determine the largest read-leveling setting
03509                                                          for rank 1 (i.e. calculate maxset=MAX(LMC*_RLEVEL_RANK1[BYTEi])
03510                                                          across all i), then set EARLY_UNLOAD_D0_R1
03511                                                          when the low two bits of this largest setting is not
03512                                                          3 (i.e. EARLY_UNLOAD_D0_R1 = (maxset<1:0>!=3)). */
03513     uint64_t early_unload_d0_r0           : 1;  /**< When set, unload the PHY silo one cycle early for Rank 0
03514                                                          reads.
03515                                                          The recommended EARLY_UNLOAD_D0_R0 value can be calculated
03516                                                          after the final LMC*_RLEVEL_RANK0[BYTE*] values are
03517                                                          selected (as part of read-leveling initialization).
03518                                                          Then, determine the largest read-leveling setting
03519                                                          for rank 0 (i.e. calculate maxset=MAX(LMC*_RLEVEL_RANK0[BYTEi])
03520                                                          across all i), then set EARLY_UNLOAD_D0_R0
03521                                                          when the low two bits of this largest setting is not
03522                                                          3 (i.e. EARLY_UNLOAD_D0_R0 = (maxset<1:0>!=3)). */
03523     uint64_t init_status                  : 4;  /**< Indicates status of initialization
03524                                                          INIT_STATUS[n] = 1 implies rank n has been initialized
03525                                                          SW must set necessary INIT_STATUS bits with the
03526                                                          same LMC*_CONFIG write that initiates
03527                                                          power-up/init and self-refresh exit sequences
03528                                                          (if the required INIT_STATUS bits are not already
03529                                                          set before LMC initiates the sequence).
03530                                                          INIT_STATUS determines the chip-selects that assert
03531                                                          during refresh, ZQCS, and precharge power-down and
03532                                                          self-refresh entry/exit SEQUENCE's. */
03533     uint64_t mirrmask                     : 4;  /**< Mask determining which ranks are address-mirrored.
03534                                                          MIRRMASK<n> = 1 means Rank n addresses are mirrored
03535                                                          for 0 <= n <= 3
03536                                                          A mirrored read/write has these differences:
03537                                                           - DDR_BA<1> is swapped with DDR_BA<0>
03538                                                           - DDR_A<8> is swapped with DDR_A<7>
03539                                                           - DDR_A<6> is swapped with DDR_A<5>
03540                                                           - DDR_A<4> is swapped with DDR_A<3>
03541                                                          When RANK_ENA=0, MIRRMASK<1> and MIRRMASK<3> MBZ */
03542     uint64_t rankmask                     : 4;  /**< Mask to select rank to be leveled/initialized.
03543                                                          To write-level/read-level/initialize rank i, set RANKMASK<i>
03544                                                                          RANK_ENA=1               RANK_ENA=0
03545                                                            RANKMASK<0> = DIMM0_CS0                DIMM0_CS0
03546                                                            RANKMASK<1> = DIMM0_CS1                  MBZ
03547                                                            RANKMASK<2> = DIMM1_CS0                DIMM1_CS0
03548                                                            RANKMASK<3> = DIMM1_CS1                  MBZ
03549                                                          For read/write leveling, each rank has to be leveled separately,
03550                                                          so RANKMASK should only have one bit set.
03551                                                          RANKMASK is not used during self-refresh entry/exit and
03552                                                          precharge power-down entry/exit instruction sequences.
03553                                                          When RANK_ENA=0, RANKMASK<1> and RANKMASK<3> MBZ */
03554     uint64_t rank_ena                     : 1;  /**< RANK ena (for use with dual-rank DIMMs)
03555                                                          For dual-rank DIMMs, the rank_ena bit will enable
03556                                                          the drive of the CS*_L[1:0] and ODT_<1:0> pins differently based on the
03557                                                          (pbank_lsb-1) address bit.
03558                                                          Write 0 for SINGLE ranked DIMM's. */
03559     uint64_t sref_with_dll                : 1;  /**< Self-refresh entry/exit write MR1 and MR2
03560                                                          When set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences
03561                                                          write MR1 and MR2 (in all ranks). (The writes occur before
03562                                                          self-refresh entry, and after self-refresh exit.)
03563                                                          When clear, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences
03564                                                          do not write any registers in the DDR3 parts. */
03565     uint64_t early_dqx                    : 1;  /**< Send DQx signals one CK cycle earlier for the case when
03566                                                          the shortest DQx lines have a larger delay than the CK line */
03567     uint64_t sequence                     : 3;  /**< Selects the sequence that LMC runs after a 0->1
03568                                                          transition on LMC*_CONFIG[INIT_START].
03569                                                          SEQUENCE=0=power-up/init:
03570                                                            - RANKMASK selects participating ranks (should be all ranks with attached DRAM)
03571                                                            - INIT_STATUS must equal RANKMASK
03572                                                            - DDR_CKE* signals activated (if they weren't already active)
03573                                                            - RDIMM register control words 0-15 will be written to RANKMASK-selected
03574                                                                RDIMM's when LMC(0)_CONTROL[RDIMM_ENA]=1 and corresponding
03575                                                                LMC*_DIMM_CTL[DIMM*_WMASK] bits are set. (Refer to LMC*_DIMM*_PARAMS and
03576                                                                LMC*_DIMM_CTL descriptions below for more details.)
03577                                                            - MR0, MR1, MR2, and MR3 will be written to selected ranks
03578                                                          SEQUENCE=1=read-leveling:
03579                                                            - RANKMASK selects the rank to be read-leveled
03580                                                            - MR3 written to selected rank
03581                                                          SEQUENCE=2=self-refresh entry:
03582                                                            - INIT_STATUS selects participating ranks (should be all ranks with attached DRAM)
03583                                                            - MR1 and MR2 will be written to selected ranks if SREF_WITH_DLL=1
03584                                                            - DDR_CKE* signals de-activated
03585                                                          SEQUENCE=3=self-refresh exit:
03586                                                            - INIT_STATUS must be set to indicate participating ranks (should be all ranks with attached DRAM)
03587                                                            - DDR_CKE* signals activated
03588                                                            - MR0, MR1, MR2, and MR3 will be written to participating ranks if SREF_WITH_DLL=1
03589                                                          SEQUENCE=4=precharge power-down entry:
03590                                                            - INIT_STATUS selects participating ranks (should be all ranks with attached DRAM)
03591                                                            - DDR_CKE* signals de-activated
03592                                                          SEQUENCE=5=precharge power-down exit:
03593                                                            - INIT_STATUS selects participating ranks (should be all ranks with attached DRAM)
03594                                                            - DDR_CKE* signals activated
03595                                                          SEQUENCE=6=write-leveling:
03596                                                            - RANKMASK selects the rank to be write-leveled
03597                                                            - INIT_STATUS must indicate all ranks with attached DRAM
03598                                                            - MR1 and MR2 written to INIT_STATUS-selected ranks
03599                                                          SEQUENCE=7=illegal
03600                                                          Precharge power-down entry and exit SEQUENCE's may also
03601                                                          be automatically generated by the HW when IDLEPOWER!=0.
03602                                                          Self-refresh entry SEQUENCE's may also be automatically
03603                                                          generated by hardware upon a chip warm or soft reset
03604                                                          sequence when LMC*_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT] are set.
03605                                                          LMC writes the LMC*_MODEREG_PARAMS0 and LMC*_MODEREG_PARAMS1 CSR field values
03606                                                          to the Mode registers in the DRAM parts (i.e. MR0, MR1, MR2, and MR3) as part of some of these sequences.
03607                                                          Refer to the LMC*_MODEREG_PARAMS0 and LMC*_MODEREG_PARAMS1 descriptions for more details.
03608                                                          If there are two consecutive power-up/init's without
03609                                                          a DRESET assertion between them, LMC asserts DDR_CKE* as part of
03610                                                          the first power-up/init, and continues to assert DDR_CKE*
03611                                                          through the remainder of the first and the second power-up/init.
03612                                                          If DDR_CKE* deactivation and reactivation is needed for
03613                                                          a second power-up/init, a DRESET assertion is required
03614                                                          between the first and the second. */
03615     uint64_t ref_zqcs_int                 : 19; /**< Refresh & ZQCS interval represented in \#of 512 CK cycle
03616                                                          increments. A Refresh sequence is triggered when bits
03617                                                          [24:18] are equal to 0, and a ZQCS sequence is triggered
03618                                                          when [36:18] are equal to 0.
03619                                                          Program [24:18] to RND-DN(tREFI/clkPeriod/512)
03620                                                          Program [36:25] to RND-DN(ZQCS_Interval/clkPeriod/(512*128)). Note
03621                                                          that this value should always be greater than 32, to account for
03622                                                          resistor calibration delays.
03623                                                          000_00000000_00000000: RESERVED
03624                                                          Max Refresh interval = 127 * 512           = 65024 CKs
03625                                                          Max ZQCS interval    = (8*256*256-1) * 512 = 268434944 CKs ~ 335ms for a 800 MHz CK
03626                                                          LMC*_CONFIG[INIT_STATUS] determines which ranks receive
03627                                                          the REF / ZQCS. LMC does not send any refreshes / ZQCS's
03628                                                          when LMC*_CONFIG[INIT_STATUS]=0. */
03629     uint64_t reset                        : 1;  /**< Reset oneshot pulse for refresh counter,
03630                                                          and LMC*_OPS_CNT, LMC*_IFB_CNT, and LMC*_DCLK_CNT
03631                                                          CSR's. SW should write this to a one, then re-write
03632                                                          it to a zero to cause the reset. */
03633     uint64_t ecc_adr                      : 1;  /**< Include memory reference address in the ECC calculation
03634                                                          0=disabled, 1=enabled */
03635     uint64_t forcewrite                   : 4;  /**< Force the oldest outstanding write to complete after
03636                                                          having waited for 2^FORCEWRITE CK cycles.  0=disabled. */
03637     uint64_t idlepower                    : 3;  /**< Enter precharge power-down mode after the memory
03638                                                          controller has been idle for 2^(2+IDLEPOWER) CK cycles.
03639                                                          0=disabled.
03640                                                          This field should only be programmed after initialization.
03641                                                          LMC*_MODEREG_PARAMS0[PPD] determines whether the DRAM DLL
03642                                                          is disabled during the precharge power-down. */
03643     uint64_t pbank_lsb                    : 4;  /**< DIMM address bit select
03644                                                          Reverting to the explanation for ROW_LSB,
