03645                                                          PBank_LSB would be Row_LSB bit + \#rowbits + \#rankbits
03646                                                          Decoding for pbank_lsb
03647                                                               - 0000:DIMM = mem_adr[28]    / rank = mem_adr[27] (if RANK_ENA)
03648                                                               - 0001:DIMM = mem_adr[29]    / rank = mem_adr[28]      "
03649                                                               - 0010:DIMM = mem_adr[30]    / rank = mem_adr[29]      "
03650                                                               - 0011:DIMM = mem_adr[31]    / rank = mem_adr[30]      "
03651                                                               - 0100:DIMM = mem_adr[32]    / rank = mem_adr[31]      "
03652                                                               - 0101:DIMM = mem_adr[33]    / rank = mem_adr[32]      "
03653                                                               - 0110:DIMM = mem_adr[34]    / rank = mem_adr[33]      "
03654                                                               - 0111:DIMM = 0              / rank = mem_adr[34]      "
03655                                                               - 1000-1111: RESERVED
03656                                                          For example, for a DIMM made of Samsung's k4b1g0846c-f7 1Gb (16M x 8 bit x 8 bank)
03657                                                          DDR3 parts, the column address width = 10, so with
03658                                                          10b of col, 3b of bus, 3b of bank, row_lsb = 16. So, row = mem_adr[29:16]
03659                                                          With rank_ena = 0, pbank_lsb = 2
03660                                                          With rank_ena = 1, pbank_lsb = 3 */
03661     uint64_t row_lsb                      : 3;  /**< Row Address bit select
03662                                                          Encoding used to determine which memory address
03663                                                          bit position represents the low order DDR ROW address.
03664                                                          The processor's memory address[34:7] needs to be
03665                                                          translated to DRAM addresses (bnk,row,col,rank and DIMM)
03666                                                          and that is a function of the following:
03667                                                          1. Datapath Width (64)
03668                                                          2. \# Banks (8)
03669                                                          3. \# Column Bits of the memory part - spec'd indirectly
03670                                                          by this register.
03671                                                          4. \# Row Bits of the memory part - spec'd indirectly
03672                                                          5. \# Ranks in a DIMM - spec'd by RANK_ENA
03673                                                          6. \# DIMM's in the system by the register below (PBANK_LSB).
03674                                                          Decoding for row_lsb
03675                                                               - 000: row_lsb = mem_adr[14]
03676                                                               - 001: row_lsb = mem_adr[15]
03677                                                               - 010: row_lsb = mem_adr[16]
03678                                                               - 011: row_lsb = mem_adr[17]
03679                                                               - 100: row_lsb = mem_adr[18]
03680                                                               - 101: row_lsb = mem_adr[19]
03681                                                               - 110: row_lsb = mem_adr[20]
03682                                                               - 111: RESERVED
03683                                                          For example, for a DIMM made of Samsung's k4b1g0846c-f7 1Gb (16M x 8 bit x 8 bank)
03684                                                          DDR3 parts, the column address width = 10, so with
03685                                                          10b of col, 3b of bus, 3b of bank, row_lsb = 16. So, row = mem_adr[29:16] */
03686     uint64_t ecc_ena                      : 1;  /**< ECC Enable: When set will enable the 8b ECC
03687                                                          check/correct logic. Should be 1 when used with DIMMs
03688                                                          with ECC. 0, otherwise.
03689                                                          When this mode is turned on, DQ[71:64]
03690                                                          on writes, will contain the ECC code generated for
03691                                                          the 64 bits of data which will
03692                                                          written in the memory and then later on reads, used
03693                                                          to check for Single bit error (which will be auto-
03694                                                          corrected) and Double Bit error (which will be
03695                                                          reported). When not turned on, DQ[71:64]
03696                                                          are driven to 0.  Please refer to SEC_ERR, DED_ERR,
03697                                                          LMC*_FADR, and LMC*_ECC_SYND registers
03698                                                          for diagnostics information when there is an error. */
03699     uint64_t init_start                   : 1;  /**< A 0->1 transition starts the DDR memory sequence that is
03700                                                          selected by LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE].  This register is a
03701                                                          oneshot and clears itself each time it is set. */
03702 #else
03703     uint64_t init_start                   : 1;
03704     uint64_t ecc_ena                      : 1;
03705     uint64_t row_lsb                      : 3;
03706     uint64_t pbank_lsb                    : 4;
03707     uint64_t idlepower                    : 3;
03708     uint64_t forcewrite                   : 4;
03709     uint64_t ecc_adr                      : 1;
03710     uint64_t reset                        : 1;
03711     uint64_t ref_zqcs_int                 : 19;
03712     uint64_t sequence                     : 3;
03713     uint64_t early_dqx                    : 1;
03714     uint64_t sref_with_dll                : 1;
03715     uint64_t rank_ena                     : 1;
03716     uint64_t rankmask                     : 4;
03717     uint64_t mirrmask                     : 4;
03718     uint64_t init_status                  : 4;
03719     uint64_t early_unload_d0_r0           : 1;
03720     uint64_t early_unload_d0_r1           : 1;
03721     uint64_t early_unload_d1_r0           : 1;
03722     uint64_t early_unload_d1_r1           : 1;
03723     uint64_t reserved_59_63               : 5;
03724 #endif
03725     } cn63xx;
03726     struct cvmx_lmcx_config_cn63xxp1 {
03727 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
03728     uint64_t reserved_55_63               : 9;
03729     uint64_t init_status                  : 4;  /**< Indicates status of initialization
03730                                                          INIT_STATUS[n] = 1 implies rank n has been initialized
03731                                                          SW must set necessary INIT_STATUS bits with the
03732                                                          same LMC*_CONFIG write that initiates
03733                                                          power-up/init and self-refresh exit sequences
03734                                                          (if the required INIT_STATUS bits are not already
03735                                                          set before LMC initiates the sequence).
03736                                                          INIT_STATUS determines the chip-selects that assert
03737                                                          during refresh, ZQCS, and precharge power-down and
03738                                                          self-refresh entry/exit SEQUENCE's. */
03739     uint64_t mirrmask                     : 4;  /**< Mask determining which ranks are address-mirrored.
03740                                                          MIRRMASK<n> = 1 means Rank n addresses are mirrored
03741                                                          for 0 <= n <= 3
03742                                                          A mirrored read/write has these differences:
03743                                                           - DDR_BA<1> is swapped with DDR_BA<0>
03744                                                           - DDR_A<8> is swapped with DDR_A<7>
03745                                                           - DDR_A<6> is swapped with DDR_A<5>
03746                                                           - DDR_A<4> is swapped with DDR_A<3>
03747                                                          When RANK_ENA=0, MIRRMASK<1> and MIRRMASK<3> MBZ */
03748     uint64_t rankmask                     : 4;  /**< Mask to select rank to be leveled/initialized.
03749                                                          To write-level/read-level/initialize rank i, set RANKMASK<i>
03750                                                                          RANK_ENA=1               RANK_ENA=0
03751                                                            RANKMASK<0> = DIMM0_CS0                DIMM0_CS0
03752                                                            RANKMASK<1> = DIMM0_CS1                  MBZ
03753                                                            RANKMASK<2> = DIMM1_CS0                DIMM1_CS0
03754                                                            RANKMASK<3> = DIMM1_CS1                  MBZ
03755                                                          For read/write leveling, each rank has to be leveled separately,
03756                                                          so RANKMASK should only have one bit set.
03757                                                          RANKMASK is not used during self-refresh entry/exit and
03758                                                          precharge power-down entry/exit instruction sequences.
03759                                                          When RANK_ENA=0, RANKMASK<1> and RANKMASK<3> MBZ */
03760     uint64_t rank_ena                     : 1;  /**< RANK ena (for use with dual-rank DIMMs)
03761                                                          For dual-rank DIMMs, the rank_ena bit will enable
03762                                                          the drive of the CS*_L[1:0] and ODT_<1:0> pins differently based on the
03763                                                          (pbank_lsb-1) address bit.
03764                                                          Write 0 for SINGLE ranked DIMM's. */
03765     uint64_t sref_with_dll                : 1;  /**< Self-refresh entry/exit write MR1 and MR2
03766                                                          When set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences
03767                                                          write MR1 and MR2 (in all ranks). (The writes occur before
03768                                                          self-refresh entry, and after self-refresh exit.)
03769                                                          When clear, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences
03770                                                          do not write any registers in the DDR3 parts. */
03771     uint64_t early_dqx                    : 1;  /**< Send DQx signals one CK cycle earlier for the case when
03772                                                          the shortest DQx lines have a larger delay than the CK line */
03773     uint64_t sequence                     : 3;  /**< Selects the sequence that LMC runs after a 0->1
03774                                                          transition on LMC*_CONFIG[INIT_START].
03775                                                          SEQUENCE=0=power-up/init:
03776                                                            - RANKMASK selects participating ranks (should be all ranks with attached DRAM)
03777                                                            - INIT_STATUS must equal RANKMASK
03778                                                            - DDR_CKE* signals activated (if they weren't already active)
03779                                                            - RDIMM register control words 0-15 will be written to RANKMASK-selected
03780                                                                RDIMM's when LMC(0)_CONTROL[RDIMM_ENA]=1 and corresponding
03781                                                                LMC*_DIMM_CTL[DIMM*_WMASK] bits are set. (Refer to LMC*_DIMM*_PARAMS and
03782                                                                LMC*_DIMM_CTL descriptions below for more details.)
03783                                                            - MR0, MR1, MR2, and MR3 will be written to selected ranks
03784                                                          SEQUENCE=1=read-leveling:
03785                                                            - RANKMASK selects the rank to be read-leveled
03786                                                            - MR3 written to selected rank
03787                                                          SEQUENCE=2=self-refresh entry:
03788                                                            - INIT_STATUS selects participating ranks (should be all ranks with attached DRAM)
03789                                                            - MR1 and MR2 will be written to selected ranks if SREF_WITH_DLL=1
03790                                                            - DDR_CKE* signals de-activated
03791                                                          SEQUENCE=3=self-refresh exit:
03792                                                            - INIT_STATUS must be set to indicate participating ranks (should be all ranks with attached DRAM)
03793                                                            - DDR_CKE* signals activated
03794                                                            - MR0, MR1, MR2, and MR3 will be written to participating ranks if SREF_WITH_DLL=1
03795                                                          SEQUENCE=4=precharge power-down entry:
03796                                                            - INIT_STATUS selects participating ranks (should be all ranks with attached DRAM)
03797                                                            - DDR_CKE* signals de-activated
03798                                                          SEQUENCE=5=precharge power-down exit:
03799                                                            - INIT_STATUS selects participating ranks (should be all ranks with attached DRAM)
03800                                                            - DDR_CKE* signals activated
03801                                                          SEQUENCE=6=write-leveling:
03802                                                            - RANKMASK selects the rank to be write-leveled
03803                                                            - INIT_STATUS must indicate all ranks with attached DRAM
03804                                                            - MR1 and MR2 written to INIT_STATUS-selected ranks
03805                                                          SEQUENCE=7=illegal
03806                                                          Precharge power-down entry and exit SEQUENCE's may also
03807                                                          be automatically generated by the HW when IDLEPOWER!=0.
03808                                                          Self-refresh entry SEQUENCE's may also be automatically
03809                                                          generated by hardware upon a chip warm or soft reset
03810                                                          sequence when LMC*_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT] are set.
03811                                                          LMC writes the LMC*_MODEREG_PARAMS0 and LMC*_MODEREG_PARAMS1 CSR field values
03812                                                          to the Mode registers in the DRAM parts (i.e. MR0, MR1, MR2, and MR3) as part of some of these sequences.
03813                                                          Refer to the LMC*_MODEREG_PARAMS0 and LMC*_MODEREG_PARAMS1 descriptions for more details.
03814                                                          If there are two consecutive power-up/init's without
03815                                                          a DRESET assertion between them, LMC asserts DDR_CKE* as part of
03816                                                          the first power-up/init, and continues to assert DDR_CKE*
03817                                                          through the remainder of the first and the second power-up/init.
03818                                                          If DDR_CKE* deactivation and reactivation is needed for
03819                                                          a second power-up/init, a DRESET assertion is required
03820                                                          between the first and the second. */
03821     uint64_t ref_zqcs_int                 : 19; /**< Refresh & ZQCS interval represented in \#of 512 CK cycle
03822                                                          increments. A Refresh sequence is triggered when bits
03823                                                          [24:18] are equal to 0, and a ZQCS sequence is triggered
03824                                                          when [36:18] are equal to 0.
03825                                                          Program [24:18] to RND-DN(tREFI/clkPeriod/512)
03826                                                          Program [36:25] to RND-DN(ZQCS_Interval/clkPeriod/(512*128)). Note
03827                                                          that this value should always be greater than 32, to account for
03828                                                          resistor calibration delays.
03829                                                          000_00000000_00000000: RESERVED
03830                                                          Max Refresh interval = 127 * 512           = 65024 CKs
03831                                                          Max ZQCS interval    = (8*256*256-1) * 512 = 268434944 CKs ~ 335ms for a 800 MHz CK
03832                                                          LMC*_CONFIG[INIT_STATUS] determines which ranks receive
03833                                                          the REF / ZQCS. LMC does not send any refreshes / ZQCS's
03834                                                          when LMC*_CONFIG[INIT_STATUS]=0. */
03835     uint64_t reset                        : 1;  /**< Reset oneshot pulse for refresh counter,
03836                                                          and LMC*_OPS_CNT, LMC*_IFB_CNT, and LMC*_DCLK_CNT
03837                                                          CSR's. SW should write this to a one, then re-write
03838                                                          it to a zero to cause the reset. */
03839     uint64_t ecc_adr                      : 1;  /**< Include memory reference address in the ECC calculation
03840                                                          0=disabled, 1=enabled */
03841     uint64_t forcewrite                   : 4;  /**< Force the oldest outstanding write to complete after
03842                                                          having waited for 2^FORCEWRITE CK cycles.  0=disabled. */
03843     uint64_t idlepower                    : 3;  /**< Enter precharge power-down mode after the memory
03844                                                          controller has been idle for 2^(2+IDLEPOWER) CK cycles.
03845                                                          0=disabled.
03846                                                          This field should only be programmed after initialization.
03847                                                          LMC*_MODEREG_PARAMS0[PPD] determines whether the DRAM DLL
03848                                                          is disabled during the precharge power-down. */
03849     uint64_t pbank_lsb                    : 4;  /**< DIMM address bit select
03850                                                          Reverting to the explanation for ROW_LSB,
03851                                                          PBank_LSB would be Row_LSB bit + \#rowbits + \#rankbits
03852                                                          Decoding for pbank_lsb
03853                                                               - 0000:DIMM = mem_adr[28]    / rank = mem_adr[27] (if RANK_ENA)
03854                                                               - 0001:DIMM = mem_adr[29]    / rank = mem_adr[28]      "
03855                                                               - 0010:DIMM = mem_adr[30]    / rank = mem_adr[29]      "
03856                                                               - 0011:DIMM = mem_adr[31]    / rank = mem_adr[30]      "
03857                                                               - 0100:DIMM = mem_adr[32]    / rank = mem_adr[31]      "
03858                                                               - 0101:DIMM = mem_adr[33]    / rank = mem_adr[32]      "
03859                                                               - 0110:DIMM = mem_adr[34]    / rank = mem_adr[33]      "
03860                                                               - 0111:DIMM = 0              / rank = mem_adr[34]      "
03861                                                               - 1000-1111: RESERVED
03862                                                          For example, for a DIMM made of Samsung's k4b1g0846c-f7 1Gb (16M x 8 bit x 8 bank)
03863                                                          DDR3 parts, the column address width = 10, so with
03864                                                          10b of col, 3b of bus, 3b of bank, row_lsb = 16. So, row = mem_adr[29:16]
03865                                                          With rank_ena = 0, pbank_lsb = 2
03866                                                          With rank_ena = 1, pbank_lsb = 3 */
03867     uint64_t row_lsb                      : 3;  /**< Row Address bit select
03868                                                          Encoding used to determine which memory address
03869                                                          bit position represents the low order DDR ROW address.
03870                                                          The processor's memory address[34:7] needs to be
03871                                                          translated to DRAM addresses (bnk,row,col,rank and DIMM)
03872                                                          and that is a function of the following:
03873                                                          1. Datapath Width (64)
03874                                                          2. \# Banks (8)
03875                                                          3. \# Column Bits of the memory part - spec'd indirectly
03876                                                          by this register.
03877                                                          4. \# Row Bits of the memory part - spec'd indirectly
03878                                                          5. \# Ranks in a DIMM - spec'd by RANK_ENA
03879                                                          6. \# DIMM's in the system by the register below (PBANK_LSB).
03880                                                          Decoding for row_lsb
03881                                                               - 000: row_lsb = mem_adr[14]
03882                                                               - 001: row_lsb = mem_adr[15]
03883                                                               - 010: row_lsb = mem_adr[16]
03884                                                               - 011: row_lsb = mem_adr[17]
03885                                                               - 100: row_lsb = mem_adr[18]
03886                                                               - 101: row_lsb = mem_adr[19]
03887                                                               - 110: row_lsb = mem_adr[20]
03888                                                               - 111: RESERVED
03889                                                          For example, for a DIMM made of Samsung's k4b1g0846c-f7 1Gb (16M x 8 bit x 8 bank)
03890                                                          DDR3 parts, the column address width = 10, so with
03891                                                          10b of col, 3b of bus, 3b of bank, row_lsb = 16. So, row = mem_adr[29:16] */
03892     uint64_t ecc_ena                      : 1;  /**< ECC Enable: When set will enable the 8b ECC
03893                                                          check/correct logic. Should be 1 when used with DIMMs
03894                                                          with ECC. 0, otherwise.
03895                                                          When this mode is turned on, DQ[71:64]
03896                                                          on writes, will contain the ECC code generated for
03897                                                          the 64 bits of data which will
03898                                                          written in the memory and then later on reads, used
03899                                                          to check for Single bit error (which will be auto-
03900                                                          corrected) and Double Bit error (which will be
03901                                                          reported). When not turned on, DQ[71:64]
03902                                                          are driven to 0.  Please refer to SEC_ERR, DED_ERR,
03903                                                          LMC*_FADR, and LMC*_ECC_SYND registers
03904                                                          for diagnostics information when there is an error. */
03905     uint64_t init_start                   : 1;  /**< A 0->1 transition starts the DDR memory sequence that is
03906                                                          selected by LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE].  This register is a
03907                                                          oneshot and clears itself each time it is set. */
03908 #else
03909     uint64_t init_start                   : 1;
03910     uint64_t ecc_ena                      : 1;
03911     uint64_t row_lsb                      : 3;
03912     uint64_t pbank_lsb                    : 4;
03913     uint64_t idlepower                    : 3;
03914     uint64_t forcewrite                   : 4;
03915     uint64_t ecc_adr                      : 1;
03916     uint64_t reset                        : 1;
03917     uint64_t ref_zqcs_int                 : 19;
03918     uint64_t sequence                     : 3;
03919     uint64_t early_dqx                    : 1;
03920     uint64_t sref_with_dll                : 1;
03921     uint64_t rank_ena                     : 1;
03922     uint64_t rankmask                     : 4;
03923     uint64_t mirrmask                     : 4;
03924     uint64_t init_status                  : 4;
03925     uint64_t reserved_55_63               : 9;
03926 #endif
03927     } cn63xxp1;
03928     struct cvmx_lmcx_config_cn66xx {
03929 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
03930     uint64_t reserved_60_63               : 4;
03931     uint64_t scrz                         : 1;  /**< Hide LMC*_SCRAMBLE_CFG0 and LMC*_SCRAMBLE_CFG1 when set */
03932     uint64_t early_unload_d1_r1           : 1;  /**< When set, unload the PHY silo one cycle early for Rank 3
03933                                                          reads
03934                                                          The recommended EARLY_UNLOAD_D1_R1 value can be calculated
03935                                                          after the final LMC*_RLEVEL_RANK3[BYTE*] values are
03936                                                          selected (as part of read-leveling initialization).
03937                                                          Then, determine the largest read-leveling setting
03938                                                          for rank 3 (i.e. calculate maxset=MAX(LMC*_RLEVEL_RANK3[BYTEi])
03939                                                          across all i), then set EARLY_UNLOAD_D1_R1
03940                                                          when the low two bits of this largest setting is not
03941                                                          3 (i.e. EARLY_UNLOAD_D1_R1 = (maxset<1:0>!=3)). */
03942     uint64_t early_unload_d1_r0           : 1;  /**< When set, unload the PHY silo one cycle early for Rank 2
03943                                                          reads
03944                                                          The recommended EARLY_UNLOAD_D1_RO value can be calculated
03945                                                          after the final LMC*_RLEVEL_RANK2[BYTE*] values are
03946                                                          selected (as part of read-leveling initialization).
03947                                                          Then, determine the largest read-leveling setting
03948                                                          for rank 2 (i.e. calculate maxset=MAX(LMC*_RLEVEL_RANK2[BYTEi])
03949                                                          across all i), then set EARLY_UNLOAD_D1_RO
03950                                                          when the low two bits of this largest setting is not
03951                                                          3 (i.e. EARLY_UNLOAD_D1_RO = (maxset<1:0>!=3)). */
03952     uint64_t early_unload_d0_r1           : 1;  /**< When set, unload the PHY silo one cycle early for Rank 1
03953                                                          reads
03954                                                          The recommended EARLY_UNLOAD_D0_R1 value can be calculated
03955                                                          after the final LMC*_RLEVEL_RANK1[BYTE*] values are
03956                                                          selected (as part of read-leveling initialization).
03957                                                          Then, determine the largest read-leveling setting
03958                                                          for rank 1 (i.e. calculate maxset=MAX(LMC*_RLEVEL_RANK1[BYTEi])
03959                                                          across all i), then set EARLY_UNLOAD_D0_R1
03960                                                          when the low two bits of this largest setting is not
03961                                                          3 (i.e. EARLY_UNLOAD_D0_R1 = (maxset<1:0>!=3)). */
03962     uint64_t early_unload_d0_r0           : 1;  /**< When set, unload the PHY silo one cycle early for Rank 0
03963                                                          reads.
03964                                                          The recommended EARLY_UNLOAD_D0_R0 value can be calculated
03965                                                          after the final LMC*_RLEVEL_RANK0[BYTE*] values are
03966                                                          selected (as part of read-leveling initialization).
03967                                                          Then, determine the largest read-leveling setting
03968                                                          for rank 0 (i.e. calculate maxset=MAX(LMC*_RLEVEL_RANK0[BYTEi])
03969                                                          across all i), then set EARLY_UNLOAD_D0_R0
03970                                                          when the low two bits of this largest setting is not
03971                                                          3 (i.e. EARLY_UNLOAD_D0_R0 = (maxset<1:0>!=3)). */
03972     uint64_t init_status                  : 4;  /**< Indicates status of initialization
03973                                                          INIT_STATUS[n] = 1 implies rank n has been initialized
03974                                                          SW must set necessary INIT_STATUS bits with the
03975                                                          same LMC*_CONFIG write that initiates
03976                                                          power-up/init and self-refresh exit sequences
03977                                                          (if the required INIT_STATUS bits are not already
03978                                                          set before LMC initiates the sequence).
03979                                                          INIT_STATUS determines the chip-selects that assert
03980                                                          during refresh, ZQCS, and precharge power-down and
03981                                                          self-refresh entry/exit SEQUENCE's. */
03982     uint64_t mirrmask                     : 4;  /**< Mask determining which ranks are address-mirrored.
03983                                                          MIRRMASK<n> = 1 means Rank n addresses are mirrored
03984                                                          for 0 <= n <= 3
03985                                                          A mirrored read/write has these differences:
03986                                                           - DDR_BA<1> is swapped with DDR_BA<0>
03987                                                           - DDR_A<8> is swapped with DDR_A<7>
03988                                                           - DDR_A<6> is swapped with DDR_A<5>
03989                                                           - DDR_A<4> is swapped with DDR_A<3>
03990                                                          When RANK_ENA=0, MIRRMASK<1> and MIRRMASK<3> MBZ */
03991     uint64_t rankmask                     : 4;  /**< Mask to select rank to be leveled/initialized.
03992                                                          To write-level/read-level/initialize rank i, set RANKMASK<i>
03993                                                                          RANK_ENA=1               RANK_ENA=0
03994                                                            RANKMASK<0> = DIMM0_CS0                DIMM0_CS0
03995                                                            RANKMASK<1> = DIMM0_CS1                  MBZ
03996                                                            RANKMASK<2> = DIMM1_CS0                DIMM1_CS0
03997                                                            RANKMASK<3> = DIMM1_CS1                  MBZ
03998                                                          For read/write leveling, each rank has to be leveled separately,
03999                                                          so RANKMASK should only have one bit set.
04000                                                          RANKMASK is not used during self-refresh entry/exit and
04001                                                          precharge power-down entry/exit instruction sequences.
04002                                                          When RANK_ENA=0, RANKMASK<1> and RANKMASK<3> MBZ */
04003     uint64_t rank_ena                     : 1;  /**< RANK ena (for use with dual-rank DIMMs)
04004                                                          For dual-rank DIMMs, the rank_ena bit will enable
04005                                                          the drive of the CS*_L[1:0] and ODT_<1:0> pins differently based on the
04006                                                          (pbank_lsb-1) address bit.
04007                                                          Write 0 for SINGLE ranked DIMM's. */
04008     uint64_t sref_with_dll                : 1;  /**< Self-refresh entry/exit write MR1 and MR2
04009                                                          When set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences
04010                                                          write MR1 and MR2 (in all ranks). (The writes occur before
04011                                                          self-refresh entry, and after self-refresh exit.)
04012                                                          When clear, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences
04013                                                          do not write any registers in the DDR3 parts. */
04014     uint64_t early_dqx                    : 1;  /**< Send DQx signals one CK cycle earlier for the case when
04015                                                          the shortest DQx lines have a larger delay than the CK line */
04016     uint64_t sequence                     : 3;  /**< Selects the sequence that LMC runs after a 0->1
04017                                                          transition on LMC*_CONFIG[INIT_START].
04018                                                          SEQUENCE=0=power-up/init:
04019                                                            - RANKMASK selects participating ranks (should be all ranks with attached DRAM)
04020                                                            - INIT_STATUS must equal RANKMASK
04021                                                            - DDR_CKE* signals activated (if they weren't already active)
04022                                                            - RDIMM register control words 0-15 will be written to RANKMASK-selected
04023                                                                RDIMM's when LMC(0)_CONTROL[RDIMM_ENA]=1 and corresponding
04024                                                                LMC*_DIMM_CTL[DIMM*_WMASK] bits are set. (Refer to LMC*_DIMM*_PARAMS and
04025                                                                LMC*_DIMM_CTL descriptions below for more details.)
04026                                                            - MR0, MR1, MR2, and MR3 will be written to selected ranks
04027                                                          SEQUENCE=1=read-leveling:
04028                                                            - RANKMASK selects the rank to be read-leveled
04029                                                            - MR3 written to selected rank
04030                                                          SEQUENCE=2=self-refresh entry:
04031                                                            - INIT_STATUS selects participating ranks (should be all ranks with attached DRAM)
04032                                                            - MR1 and MR2 will be written to selected ranks if SREF_WITH_DLL=1
04033                                                            - DDR_CKE* signals de-activated
04034                                                          SEQUENCE=3=self-refresh exit:
04035                                                            - INIT_STATUS must be set to indicate participating ranks (should be all ranks with attached DRAM)
04036                                                            - DDR_CKE* signals activated
04037                                                            - MR0, MR1, MR2, and MR3 will be written to participating ranks if SREF_WITH_DLL=1
04038                                                          SEQUENCE=4=precharge power-down entry:
04039                                                            - INIT_STATUS selects participating ranks (should be all ranks with attached DRAM)
04040                                                            - DDR_CKE* signals de-activated
04041                                                          SEQUENCE=5=precharge power-down exit:
04042                                                            - INIT_STATUS selects participating ranks (should be all ranks with attached DRAM)
04043                                                            - DDR_CKE* signals activated
04044                                                          SEQUENCE=6=write-leveling:
04045                                                            - RANKMASK selects the rank to be write-leveled
04046                                                            - INIT_STATUS must indicate all ranks with attached DRAM
04047                                                            - MR1 and MR2 written to INIT_STATUS-selected ranks
04048                                                          SEQUENCE=7=illegal
04049                                                          Precharge power-down entry and exit SEQUENCE's may also
04050                                                          be automatically generated by the HW when IDLEPOWER!=0.
04051                                                          Self-refresh entry SEQUENCE's may also be automatically
04052                                                          generated by hardware upon a chip warm or soft reset
04053                                                          sequence when LMC*_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT] are set.
04054                                                          LMC writes the LMC*_MODEREG_PARAMS0 and LMC*_MODEREG_PARAMS1 CSR field values
04055                                                          to the Mode registers in the DRAM parts (i.e. MR0, MR1, MR2, and MR3) as part of some of these sequences.
04056                                                          Refer to the LMC*_MODEREG_PARAMS0 and LMC*_MODEREG_PARAMS1 descriptions for more details.
04057                                                          If there are two consecutive power-up/init's without
04058                                                          a DRESET assertion between them, LMC asserts DDR_CKE* as part of
04059                                                          the first power-up/init, and continues to assert DDR_CKE*
04060                                                          through the remainder of the first and the second power-up/init.
04061                                                          If DDR_CKE* deactivation and reactivation is needed for
04062                                                          a second power-up/init, a DRESET assertion is required
04063                                                          between the first and the second. */
04064     uint64_t ref_zqcs_int                 : 19; /**< Refresh & ZQCS interval represented in \#of 512 CK cycle
04065                                                          increments. A Refresh sequence is triggered when bits
04066                                                          [24:18] are equal to 0, and a ZQCS sequence is triggered
04067                                                          when [36:18] are equal to 0.
04068                                                          Program [24:18] to RND-DN(tREFI/clkPeriod/512)
04069                                                          Program [36:25] to RND-DN(ZQCS_Interval/clkPeriod/(512*128)). Note
04070                                                          that this value should always be greater than 32, to account for
04071                                                          resistor calibration delays.
04072                                                          000_00000000_00000000: RESERVED
04073                                                          Max Refresh interval = 127 * 512           = 65024 CKs
04074                                                          Max ZQCS interval    = (8*256*256-1) * 512 = 268434944 CKs ~ 335ms for a 800 MHz CK
04075                                                          LMC*_CONFIG[INIT_STATUS] determines which ranks receive
04076                                                          the REF / ZQCS. LMC does not send any refreshes / ZQCS's
04077                                                          when LMC*_CONFIG[INIT_STATUS]=0. */
04078     uint64_t reset                        : 1;  /**< Reset oneshot pulse for refresh counter,
04079                                                          and LMC*_OPS_CNT, LMC*_IFB_CNT, and LMC*_DCLK_CNT
04080                                                          CSR's. SW should write this to a one, then re-write
04081                                                          it to a zero to cause the reset. */
04082     uint64_t ecc_adr                      : 1;  /**< Include memory reference address in the ECC calculation
04083                                                          0=disabled, 1=enabled */
04084     uint64_t forcewrite                   : 4;  /**< Force the oldest outstanding write to complete after
04085                                                          having waited for 2^FORCEWRITE CK cycles.  0=disabled. */
04086     uint64_t idlepower                    : 3;  /**< Enter precharge power-down mode after the memory
04087                                                          controller has been idle for 2^(2+IDLEPOWER) CK cycles.
04088                                                          0=disabled.
04089                                                          This field should only be programmed after initialization.
04090                                                          LMC*_MODEREG_PARAMS0[PPD] determines whether the DRAM DLL
04091                                                          is disabled during the precharge power-down. */
04092     uint64_t pbank_lsb                    : 4;  /**< DIMM address bit select
04093                                                          Reverting to the explanation for ROW_LSB,
04094                                                          PBank_LSB would be Row_LSB bit + \#rowbits + \#rankbits
04095                                                          Decoding for pbank_lsb
04096                                                               - 0000:DIMM = mem_adr[28]    / rank = mem_adr[27] (if RANK_ENA)
04097                                                               - 0001:DIMM = mem_adr[29]    / rank = mem_adr[28]      "
04098                                                               - 0010:DIMM = mem_adr[30]    / rank = mem_adr[29]      "
04099                                                               - 0011:DIMM = mem_adr[31]    / rank = mem_adr[30]      "
04100                                                               - 0100:DIMM = mem_adr[32]    / rank = mem_adr[31]      "
04101                                                               - 0101:DIMM = mem_adr[33]    / rank = mem_adr[32]      "
04102                                                               - 0110:DIMM = mem_adr[34]    / rank = mem_adr[33]      "
04103                                                               - 0111:DIMM = 0              / rank = mem_adr[34]      "
04104                                                               - 1000-1111: RESERVED
04105                                                          For example, for a DIMM made of Samsung's k4b1g0846c-f7 1Gb (16M x 8 bit x 8 bank)
04106                                                          DDR3 parts, the column address width = 10, so with
04107                                                          10b of col, 3b of bus, 3b of bank, row_lsb = 16. So, row = mem_adr[29:16]
04108                                                          With rank_ena = 0, pbank_lsb = 2
04109                                                          With rank_ena = 1, pbank_lsb = 3 */
04110     uint64_t row_lsb                      : 3;  /**< Row Address bit select
04111                                                          Encoding used to determine which memory address
04112                                                          bit position represents the low order DDR ROW address.
04113                                                          The processor's memory address[34:7] needs to be
04114                                                          translated to DRAM addresses (bnk,row,col,rank and DIMM)
04115                                                          and that is a function of the following:
04116                                                          1. Datapath Width (64)
04117                                                          2. \# Banks (8)
04118                                                          3. \# Column Bits of the memory part - spec'd indirectly
04119                                                          by this register.
04120                                                          4. \# Row Bits of the memory part - spec'd indirectly
04121                                                          5. \# Ranks in a DIMM - spec'd by RANK_ENA
04122                                                          6. \# DIMM's in the system by the register below (PBANK_LSB).
04123                                                          Decoding for row_lsb
04124                                                               - 000: row_lsb = mem_adr[14]
04125                                                               - 001: row_lsb = mem_adr[15]
04126                                                               - 010: row_lsb = mem_adr[16]
04127                                                               - 011: row_lsb = mem_adr[17]
04128                                                               - 100: row_lsb = mem_adr[18]
04129                                                               - 101: row_lsb = mem_adr[19]
04130                                                               - 110: row_lsb = mem_adr[20]
04131                                                               - 111: RESERVED
04132                                                          For example, for a DIMM made of Samsung's k4b1g0846c-f7 1Gb (16M x 8 bit x 8 bank)
04133                                                          DDR3 parts, the column address width = 10, so with
04134                                                          10b of col, 3b of bus, 3b of bank, row_lsb = 16. So, row = mem_adr[29:16] */
04135     uint64_t ecc_ena                      : 1;  /**< ECC Enable: When set will enable the 8b ECC
04136                                                          check/correct logic. Should be 1 when used with DIMMs
04137                                                          with ECC. 0, otherwise.
04138                                                          When this mode is turned on, DQ[71:64]
04139                                                          on writes, will contain the ECC code generated for
04140                                                          the 64 bits of data which will
04141                                                          written in the memory and then later on reads, used
04142                                                          to check for Single bit error (which will be auto-
04143                                                          corrected) and Double Bit error (which will be
04144                                                          reported). When not turned on, DQ[71:64]
04145                                                          are driven to 0.  Please refer to SEC_ERR, DED_ERR,
04146                                                          LMC*_FADR, LMC*_SCRAMBLED_FADR and LMC*_ECC_SYND registers
04147                                                          for diagnostics information when there is an error. */
04148     uint64_t init_start                   : 1;  /**< A 0->1 transition starts the DDR memory sequence that is
04149                                                          selected by LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE].  This register is a
04150                                                          oneshot and clears itself each time it is set. */
04151 #else
04152     uint64_t init_start                   : 1;
04153     uint64_t ecc_ena                      : 1;
04154     uint64_t row_lsb                      : 3;
04155     uint64_t pbank_lsb                    : 4;
04156     uint64_t idlepower                    : 3;
04157     uint64_t forcewrite                   : 4;
04158     uint64_t ecc_adr                      : 1;
04159     uint64_t reset                        : 1;
04160     uint64_t ref_zqcs_int                 : 19;
04161     uint64_t sequence                     : 3;
04162     uint64_t early_dqx                    : 1;
04163     uint64_t sref_with_dll                : 1;
04164     uint64_t rank_ena                     : 1;
04165     uint64_t rankmask                     : 4;
04166     uint64_t mirrmask                     : 4;
04167     uint64_t init_status                  : 4;
04168     uint64_t early_unload_d0_r0           : 1;
04169     uint64_t early_unload_d0_r1           : 1;
04170     uint64_t early_unload_d1_r0           : 1;
04171     uint64_t early_unload_d1_r1           : 1;
04172     uint64_t scrz                         : 1;
04173     uint64_t reserved_60_63               : 4;
04174 #endif
04175     } cn66xx;
04176     struct cvmx_lmcx_config_cn63xx        cn68xx;
04177     struct cvmx_lmcx_config_cn63xx        cn68xxp1;
04178     struct cvmx_lmcx_config_cn70xx {
04179 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
04180     uint64_t reserved_63_63               : 1;
04181     uint64_t bg2_enable                   : 1;  /**< BG2 pin is active for DDR4 mode. Only has an effect when LMC(0..0)_CONFIG[MODEDDR4] = 1.
04182                                                          Typically only cleared for DDR4 *16 devices, where there is no BG2 pin on the device. */
04183     uint64_t mode_x4dev                   : 1;  /**< Always reads as 0 for CN70XX devices, there is no x4 device support. */
04184     uint64_t mode32b                      : 1;  /**< Always reads as 1 for CN70XX devices, only 32b mode is supported. */
04185     uint64_t scrz                         : 1;  /**< Hide LMC(0..0)_SCRAMBLE_CFG0 and LMC(0..0)_SCRAMBLE_CFG1 when set. */
04186     uint64_t early_unload_d1_r1           : 1;  /**< Reserved, MBZ. */
04187     uint64_t early_unload_d1_r0           : 1;  /**< Reserved, MBZ. */
04188     uint64_t early_unload_d0_r1           : 1;  /**< Reserved, MBZ. */
04189     uint64_t early_unload_d0_r0           : 1;  /**< Reserved, MBZ. */
04190     uint64_t init_status                  : 4;  /**< Indicates status of initialization. INIT_STATUS[n] = 1 implies rank n has been
04191                                                          initialized.
04192                                                          Software must set necessary RANKMASK bits before executing the initialization sequence
04193                                                          using LMC(0..0)_SEQ_CTL. If the rank has been selected for init with the RANKMASK bits,
04194                                                          the INIT_STATUS bits will be set after successful initialization and after self-refresh
04195                                                          exit. INIT_STATUS determines the chip-selects that assert during refresh, ZQCS, precharge
04196                                                          power-down entry/exit, and self-refresh entry SEQ_SEL's.  For CN70XX/CN71XX, only bits
04197                                                          <1:0>
04198                                                          corresponding to 2 ranks should ever be set. */
04199     uint64_t mirrmask                     : 4;  /**< "Mask determining which ranks are address-mirrored.
04200                                                          [MIRRMASK]<n> = 1 means rank n addresses are mirrored for
04201                                                          0 <= n <= 3.
04202                                                          In DDR3, a mirrored read/write operation has the following differences:
04203                                                          DDR#_BA<1> is swapped with DDR#_BA<0>;
04204                                                          DDR#_A<8> is swapped with DDR#_A<7>;
04205                                                          DDR#_A<6> is swapped with DDR#_A<5>;
04206                                                          DDR#_A<4> is swapped with DDR#_A<3>.
04207                                                          For CN70XX/CN71XX, MIRRMASK<3:2> MBZ.
04208                                                          When RANK_ENA = 0, MIRRMASK<1> MBZ." */
04209     uint64_t rankmask                     : 4;  /**< Mask to select rank to be leveled/initialized. To write-level/read-level/initialize rank
04210                                                          i, set RANKMASK< i>
04211                                                                        RANK_ENA = 1 RANK_ENA = 0
04212                                                          RANKMASK<0> = DIMM0_CS0    DIMM0_CS0
04213                                                          RANKMASK<1> = DIMM0_CS1    MBZ
04214                                                          RANKMASK<2> = MBZ          MBZ
04215                                                          RANKMASK<3> = MBZ          MBZ
04216                                                          For read/write leveling, each rank has to be leveled separately, so RANKMASK should only
04217                                                          have one bit set. RANKMASK is not used during self-refresh entry/exit and precharge power-
04218                                                          down entry/exit instruction sequences. For CN70XX/CN71XX, RANKMASK<3:2> MBZ.  When
04219                                                          RANK_ENA = 0,
04220                                                          RANKMASK<1> MBZ. */
04221     uint64_t rank_ena                     : 1;  /**< "RANK enable (for use with dual-rank DIMMs).
04222                                                          * For dual-rank DIMMs, the RANK_ENA bit will enable the drive of the DDR_CS*_L and
04223                                                          ODT_<1:0> pins differently based on the (PBANK_LSB - 1) address bit.
04224                                                          * Write 0 for SINGLE ranked DIMMs." */
04225     uint64_t sref_with_dll                : 1;  /**< Self-refresh entry/exit write mode registers. When set, self-refresh entry sequence writes
04226                                                          MR2 and MR1 (in this order, in all ranks), and self-refresh exit sequence writes MR1, MR0,
04227                                                          MR2, and MR3 (in this order, for all ranks). The write operations occur before self-
04228                                                          refresh entry, and after self-refresh exit. When clear, self-refresh entry and exit
04229                                                          instruction sequences do not write any mode registers in the DDR3/4 parts. */
04230     uint64_t early_dqx                    : 1;  /**< Set this bit to send DQx signals one CK cycle earlier for the case when the shortest DQx
04231                                                          lines have a larger delay than the CK line. */
04232     uint64_t ref_zqcs_int                 : 22; /**< Refresh interval is represented in number of 512 CK cycle increments. ZQCS interval is
04233                                                          represented in a number of refresh intervals. A refresh sequence is triggered when bits
04234                                                          <24:18> are equal to 0x0, and a ZQCS sequence is triggered when <39:18> are equal to 0x0.
04235                                                          The ZQCS timer only decrements when the refresh timer is 0.
04236                                                          Program <24:18> to RND-DN(TREFI/clkPeriod/512).
04237                                                          A value of 0 in bits <24:18> will effectively turn off refresh.
04238                                                          Program <36:25> to (RND-DN(ZQCS_Period / Refresh_Period) - 1), where Refresh_Period is the
04239                                                          effective period programmed in bits <24:18>. Note that this value should always be greater
04240                                                          than 32, to account for resistor calibration delays.
04241                                                          000_00000000_0000000: Reserved
04242                                                          Max Refresh interval = 127 * 512= 65024 CK cycles
04243                                                          Max ZQCS interval = 32768 * 127 * 512 = 2130706432 CK cycles
04244                                                          If refresh interval is programmed to ~8us, max ZQCS interval is ~262ms, or ~4 ZQCS
04245                                                          operations per second.
04246                                                          LMC(0..0)_CONFIG[INIT_STATUS] determines which ranks receive the REF / ZQCS. LMC does not
04247                                                          send any refreshes / ZQCS's when LMC(0..0)_CONFIG[INIT_STATUS]=0. */
04248     uint64_t reset                        : 1;  /**< Reset one-shot pulse for LMC(0..0)_OPS_CNT, LMC(0..0)_IFB_CNT, and LMC(0..0)_DCLK_CNT
04249                                                          CSRs.
04250                                                          To cause the reset, software writes this to a 1, then rewrites it to a 0. */
04251     uint64_t ecc_adr                      : 1;  /**< Include memory reference address in the ECC calculation.
04252                                                          0 = disabled, 1 = enabled. */
04253     uint64_t forcewrite                   : 4;  /**< Force the oldest outstanding write to complete after having waited for 2^[FORCEWRITE] CK
04254                                                          cycles. 0 = disabled. */
04255     uint64_t idlepower                    : 3;  /**< Enter precharge power-down mode after the memory controller has been idle for
04256                                                          2^(2+IDLEPOWER) CK cycles. 0 = disabled.
04257                                                          This field should only be programmed after initialization.
04258                                                          LMC(0..0)_MODEREG_PARAMS0[PPD] determines whether the DRAM DLL is disabled during the
04259                                                          precharge power-down. */
04260     uint64_t pbank_lsb                    : 4;  /**< "DIMM address bit select. Reverting to the explanation for ROW_LSB, PBANK_LSB would be:
04261                                                          ROW_LSB bit + \#rowbits + \#rankbits
04262                                                          Decoding for PBANK_LSB:
04263                                                          0x0: DIMM = mem_adr<28>; if RANK_ENA=1, rank = mem_adr<27>
04264                                                          0x1: DIMM = mem_adr<29>; if RANK_ENA=1, rank = mem_adr<28>
04265                                                          0x2: DIMM = mem_adr<30>; if RANK_ENA=1, rank = mem_adr<29>
04266                                                          0x3: DIMM = mem_adr<31>; if RANK_ENA=1, rank = mem_adr<30>
04267                                                          0x4: DIMM = mem_adr<32>; if RANK_ENA=1, rank = mem_adr<31>
04268                                                          0x5: DIMM = mem_adr<33>; if RANK_ENA=1, rank = mem_adr<32>
04269                                                          0x6: DIMM = mem_adr<34>; if RANK_ENA=1, rank = mem_adr<33>
04270                                                          0x7: DIMM = mem_adr<35>; if RANK_ENA=1, rank = mem_adr<34>
04271                                                          0x8: DIMM = mem_adr<36>; if RANK_ENA=1, rank = mem_adr<35>
04272                                                          0x9: DIMM = 0; if RANK_ENA=1, rank = mem_adr<36>
04273                                                          0xA-0xF: reserved
04274                                                          For example, for a DIMM made of Samsung's K4B1G0846C-F7 1Gb (16M * 8 bit * 8 bank) DDR3
04275                                                          parts, the column address width = 10, so with 10b of col, 3b of bus, 3b of bank, ROW_LSB =
04276                                                          16. So, row = mem_adr<29:16>.
04277                                                          With RANK_ENA = 0, PBANK_LSB = 2.
04278                                                          With RANK_ENA = 1, PBANK_LSB = 3." */
04279     uint64_t row_lsb                      : 3;  /**< Row address bit select.
04280                                                          Encoding used to determine which memory address bit position represents the low order DDR
04281                                                          ROW address. The processor's memory address<34:7> needs to be translated to DRAM addresses
04282                                                          (bnk,row,col,rank and DIMM) and that is a function of the following:
04283                                                          Datapath width (32)
04284                                                          * Datapath width (64).
04285                                                          * Number of banks (8).
04286                                                          * Number of  column bits of the memory part--specified indirectly by this register.
04287                                                          * Number of row bits of the memory part--specified indirectly by PBANK_LSB.
04288                                                          * Number of ranks in a DIMM--specified by RANK_ENA.
04289                                                          * Number of DIMMs in the system by the register below (PBANK_LSB).
04290                                                          Col Address starts from mem_addr[2] for 32b (4Bytes) DQ width. ROW_LSB is mem_adr[14] for
04291                                                          32b mode. Therefore, the ROW_LSB parameter should be set to 000 (32b).
04292                                                          Decoding for row_lsb:
04293                                                          Mem address  Mem address
04294                                                          Value and corresponding bit that is LSB:
04295                                                          000 <14>. 100 <18>.
04296                                                          001 <15>. 101 <19>.
04297                                                          010 <16>. 110 <20>.
04298                                                          011 <17>. 111 Reserved.
04299                                                          For example, for a DIMM made of Samsung's K4B1G0846C-F7 1GB (16M * 8 bit * 8 bank) DDR3
04300                                                          parts, the column address width = 10, so with 10b of col, 2b of bus, 3b of bank, ROW_LSB =
04301                                                          15. So, row = mem_adr<28:15>, and ROW_LSB parameter should be set to 001.
04302                                                          Refer to Cache-block Read Transaction Example." */
04303     uint64_t ecc_ena                      : 1;  /**< ECC enable. When set, enables the 8b ECC check/correct logic. Should be 1 when used with
04304                                                          DIMMs with ECC; 0, otherwise.
04305                                                          When this mode is turned on, DQ<35:32> on write operations contains the ECC code generated
04306                                                          for the 64 bits of data which will be written in the memory. Later on read operations,
04307                                                          will be used to check for single-bit error (which will be auto-corrected) and double-bit
04308                                                          error (which will be reported).
04309                                                          When not turned on, DQ<35:32> are driven to 0. Please refer to SEC_ERR, DED_ERR,
04310                                                          LMC(0..0)_FADR, and LMC(0..0)_ECC_SYND registers for diagnostics information when there is
04311                                                          an error. */
04312     uint64_t reserved_0_0                 : 1;
04313 #else
04314     uint64_t reserved_0_0                 : 1;
04315     uint64_t ecc_ena                      : 1;
04316     uint64_t row_lsb                      : 3;
04317     uint64_t pbank_lsb                    : 4;
04318     uint64_t idlepower                    : 3;
04319     uint64_t forcewrite                   : 4;
04320     uint64_t ecc_adr                      : 1;
04321     uint64_t reset                        : 1;
04322     uint64_t ref_zqcs_int                 : 22;
04323     uint64_t early_dqx                    : 1;
04324     uint64_t sref_with_dll                : 1;
04325     uint64_t rank_ena                     : 1;
04326     uint64_t rankmask                     : 4;
04327     uint64_t mirrmask                     : 4;
04328     uint64_t init_status                  : 4;
04329     uint64_t early_unload_d0_r0           : 1;
04330     uint64_t early_unload_d0_r1           : 1;
04331     uint64_t early_unload_d1_r0           : 1;
04332     uint64_t early_unload_d1_r1           : 1;
04333     uint64_t scrz                         : 1;
04334     uint64_t mode32b                      : 1;
04335     uint64_t mode_x4dev                   : 1;
04336     uint64_t bg2_enable                   : 1;
04337     uint64_t reserved_63_63               : 1;
04338 #endif
04339     } cn70xx;
04340     struct cvmx_lmcx_config_cn70xx        cn70xxp1;
04341     struct cvmx_lmcx_config_cn73xx {
04342 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
04343     uint64_t lrdimm_ena                   : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
04344     uint64_t bg2_enable                   : 1;  /**< BG1 enable bit. Only has an effect when LMC()_CONFIG[MODEDDR4] = 1.
04345                                                          Set to one when using DDR4 x4 or x8 parts.
04346                                                          Clear to zero when using DDR4 x16 parts. */
04347     uint64_t mode_x4dev                   : 1;  /**< DDR x4 device mode. */
04348     uint64_t mode32b                      : 1;  /**< 32-bit datapath mode. When set, only 32 DQ pins are used. */
04349     uint64_t scrz                         : 1;  /**< Hide LMC()_SCRAMBLE_CFG0 and LMC()_SCRAMBLE_CFG1 when set. */
04350     uint64_t early_unload_d1_r1           : 1;  /**< Reserved, MBZ. */
04351     uint64_t early_unload_d1_r0           : 1;  /**< Reserved, MBZ. */
04352     uint64_t early_unload_d0_r1           : 1;  /**< Reserved, MBZ. */
04353     uint64_t early_unload_d0_r0           : 1;  /**< Reserved, MBZ. */
04354     uint64_t init_status                  : 4;  /**< Indicates status of initialization. [INIT_STATUS][n] = 1 implies rank n has been
04355                                                          initialized.
04356                                                          Software must set necessary [RANKMASK] bits before executing the initialization sequence
04357                                                          using LMC()_SEQ_CTL. If the rank has been selected for init with the [RANKMASK] bits,
04358                                                          the [INIT_STATUS] bits will be set after successful initialization and after self-refresh
04359                                                          exit. [INIT_STATUS] determines the chip-selects that assert during refresh, ZQCS,
04360                                                          precharge
04361                                                          power-down entry/exit, and self-refresh entry SEQ_SELs. */
04362     uint64_t mirrmask                     : 4;  /**< "Mask determining which ranks are address-mirrored.
04363                                                          [MIRRMASK]<n> = 1 means rank n addresses are mirrored for
04364                                                          0 <= n <= 3.
04365                                                          In DDR3, a mirrored read/write operation has the following differences:
04366                                                          * DDR#_BA<1> is swapped with DDR#_BA<0>.
04367                                                          * DDR#_A<8> is swapped with DDR#_A<7>.
04368                                                          * DDR#_A<6> is swapped with DDR#_A<5>.
04369                                                          * DDR#_A<4> is swapped with DDR#_A<3>.
04370                                                          When RANK_ENA = 0, MIRRMASK<1> MBZ.
04371                                                          In DDR4, a mirrored read/write operation has the following differences:
04372                                                          * DDR#_BG<1> is swapped with DDR#_BG<0>.
04373                                                          * DDR#_BA<1> is swapped with DDR#_BA<0>.
04374                                                          * DDR#_A<13> is swapped with DDR#_A<11>.
04375                                                          * DDR#_A<8> is swapped with DDR#_A<7>.
04376                                                          * DDR#_A<6> is swapped with DDR#_A<5>.
04377                                                          * DDR#_A<4> is swapped with DDR#_A<3>.
04378                                                          For CN70XX, MIRRMASK<3:2> MBZ.
04379                                                          * When RANK_ENA = 0, MIRRMASK<1> MBZ." */
04380     uint64_t rankmask                     : 4;  /**< Mask to select rank to be leveled/initialized. To write level/read level/initialize rank
04381                                                          i, set [RANKMASK]<i>:
04382                                                          <pre>
04383                                                                        RANK_ENA = 1   RANK_ENA = 0
04384                                                          RANKMASK<0> = DIMM0_CS0      DIMM0_CS0
04385                                                          RANKMASK<1> = DIMM0_CS1      MBZ
04386                                                          RANKMASK<2> = DIMM1_CS0      DIMM1_CS0
04387                                                          RANKMASK<3> = DIMM1_CS1      MBZ
04388                                                          </pre>
04389                                                          For read/write leveling, each rank has to be leveled separately, so [RANKMASK] should only
04390                                                          have one bit set. [RANKMASK] is not used during self-refresh entry/exit and precharge
04391                                                          power down entry/exit instruction sequences. When [RANK_ENA] = 0, [RANKMASK]<1> and
04392                                                          [RANKMASK]<3> MBZ. */
04393     uint64_t rank_ena                     : 1;  /**< "RANK enable (for use with dual-rank DIMMs).
04394                                                          * For dual-rank DIMMs, the [RANK_ENA] bit will enable the drive of the DDR#_DIMM*_CS*_L
04395                                                          and
04396                                                          ODT_<1:0> pins differently based on the ([PBANK_LSB] - 1) address bit.
04397                                                          * Write zero for SINGLE ranked DIMMs." */
04398     uint64_t sref_with_dll                : 1;  /**< Self-refresh entry/exit write mode registers. When set, self-refresh entry sequence writes
04399                                                          MR2 and MR1 (in this order, in all ranks), and self-refresh exit sequence writes MR1, MR0,
04400                                                          MR2, and MR3 (in this order, for all ranks). The write operations occur before self-
04401                                                          refresh entry, and after self-refresh exit. When clear, self-refresh entry and exit
04402                                                          instruction sequences do not write any mode registers in the DDR3/4 parts. */
04403     uint64_t early_dqx                    : 1;  /**< Set this bit to send DQx signals one CK cycle earlier for the case when the shortest DQx
04404                                                          lines have a larger delay than the CK line. */
04405     uint64_t ref_zqcs_int                 : 22; /**< Refresh interval is represented in number of 512 CK cycle increments. To get more precise
04406                                                          control of the refresh interval, LMC()_EXT_CONFIG[REF_INT_LSBS] can be set to a
04407                                                          nonzero value.
04408                                                          ZQCS interval is represented in a number of refresh intervals. A refresh sequence is
04409                                                          triggered when bits <24:18> are equal to 0x0, and a ZQCS sequence is triggered when
04410                                                          <39:18>
04411                                                          are equal to 0x0.
04412                                                          The ZQCS timer only decrements when the refresh timer is zero.
04413                                                          Program <24:18> to RND-DN(TREFI/clkPeriod/512).
