04414                                                          A value of zero in bits <24:18> will effectively turn off refresh.
04415                                                          Program <36:25> to (RND-DN(ZQCS_Period / Refresh_Period) - 1), where Refresh_Period is the
04416                                                          effective period programmed in bits <24:18>. Note that this value should always be greater
04417                                                          than 32, to account for resistor calibration delays.
04418                                                          000_00000000_0000000: Reserved
04419                                                          Max refresh interval = 127 * 512= 65024 CK cycles.
04420                                                          Max ZQCS interval = 32768 * 127 * 512 = 2130706432 CK cycles.
04421                                                          If refresh interval is programmed to ~8 us, max ZQCS interval is ~262 ms, or ~4 ZQCS
04422                                                          operations per second.
04423                                                          LMC()_CONFIG[INIT_STATUS] determines which ranks receive the REF / ZQCS. LMC does not
04424                                                          send any refreshes / ZQCS's when LMC()_CONFIG[INIT_STATUS]=0. */
04425     uint64_t reset                        : 1;  /**< Reset one-shot pulse for LMC()_OPS_CNT, LMC()_IFB_CNT, and LMC()_DCLK_CNT.
04426                                                          To cause the reset, software writes this to a one, then rewrites it to a zero. */
04427     uint64_t ecc_adr                      : 1;  /**< Include memory reference address in the ECC calculation.
04428                                                          0 = disabled, 1 = enabled. */
04429     uint64_t forcewrite                   : 4;  /**< Force the oldest outstanding write to complete after having waited for 2^[FORCEWRITE] CK
04430                                                          cycles. 0 = disabled. */
04431     uint64_t idlepower                    : 3;  /**< Enter precharge power-down mode after the memory controller has been idle for
04432                                                          2^(2+[IDLEPOWER]) CK cycles. 0 = disabled.
04433                                                          This field should only be programmed after initialization.
04434                                                          LMC()_MODEREG_PARAMS0[PPD] determines whether the DRAM DLL is disabled during the
04435                                                          precharge power-down. */
04436     uint64_t pbank_lsb                    : 4;  /**< DIMM address bit select. Reverting to the explanation for [ROW_LSB], [PBANK_LSB] would be:
04437                                                          [ROW_LSB] bit + num_rowbits + num_rankbits
04438                                                          Decoding for PBANK_LSB:
04439                                                          0x0: DIMM = mem_adr<28>; if [RANK_ENA]=1, rank = mem_adr<27>.
04440                                                          0x1: DIMM = mem_adr<29>; if [RANK_ENA]=1, rank = mem_adr<28>.
04441                                                          0x2: DIMM = mem_adr<30>; if [RANK_ENA]=1, rank = mem_adr<29>.
04442                                                          0x3: DIMM = mem_adr<31>; if [RANK_ENA]=1, rank = mem_adr<30>.
04443                                                          0x4: DIMM = mem_adr<32>; if [RANK_ENA]=1, rank = mem_adr<31>.
04444                                                          0x5: DIMM = mem_adr<33>; if [RANK_ENA]=1, rank = mem_adr<32>.
04445                                                          0x6: DIMM = mem_adr<34>; if [RANK_ENA]=1, rank = mem_adr<33>.
04446                                                          0x7: DIMM = mem_adr<35>; if [RANK_ENA]=1, rank = mem_adr<34>.
04447                                                          0x8: DIMM = mem_adr<36>; if [RANK_ENA]=1, rank = mem_adr<35>.
04448                                                          0x9: DIMM = mem_adr<37>; if [RANK_ENA]=1, rank = mem_adr<36>.
04449                                                          0xA: DIMM = 0;           if [RANK_ENA]=1, rank = mem_adr<37>.
04450                                                          0xB-0xF: Reserved.
04451                                                          For example, for a DIMM made of Samsung's K4B1G0846C-F7 1Gb (16M * 8 bit * 8 bank)
04452                                                          parts, the column address width = 10, so with 10b of col, 3b of bus, 3b of bank, ROW_LSB =
04453                                                          16. So, row = mem_adr<29:16>.
04454                                                          With [RANK_ENA] = 0, [PBANK_LSB] = 2.
04455                                                          With [RANK_ENA] = 1, [PBANK_LSB] = 3. */
04456     uint64_t row_lsb                      : 3;  /**< Row address bit select.
04457                                                          0x0 = Address bit 14 is LSB.
04458                                                          0x1 = Address bit 15 is LSB.
04459                                                          0x2 = Address bit 16 is LSB.
04460                                                          0x3 = Address bit 17 is LSB.
04461                                                          0x4 = Address bit 18 is LSB.
04462                                                          0x5 = Address bit 19 is LSB.
04463                                                          0x6 = Address bit 20 is LSB.
04464                                                          0x6 = Reserved.
04465                                                          Encoding used to determine which memory address bit position represents the low order DDR
04466                                                          ROW address. The processor's memory address<34:7> needs to be translated to DRAM addresses
04467                                                          (bnk,row,col,rank and DIMM) and that is a function of the following:
04468                                                          * Datapath width (64).
04469                                                          * Number of banks (8).
04470                                                          * Number of column bits of the memory part--specified indirectly by this register.
04471                                                          * Number of row bits of the memory part--specified indirectly by [PBANK_LSB].
04472                                                          * Number of ranks in a DIMM--specified by [RANK_ENA].
04473                                                          * Number of DIMMs in the system by the register below ([PBANK_LSB]).
04474                                                          Column address starts from mem_addr[3] for 64b (8 bytes) DQ width. [ROW_LSB] is
04475                                                          mem_adr[15] for 64b mode. Therefore, the [ROW_LSB] parameter should be set to
04476                                                          0x1 (64b).
04477                                                          For example, for a DIMM made of Samsung's K4B1G0846C-F7 1GB (16M * 8 bit * 8 bank)
04478                                                          parts, the column address width = 10, so with 10b of col, 3b of bus, 3b of bank, ROW_LSB =
04479                                                          16. So, row = mem_adr<29:16>.
04480                                                          Refer to cache-block read transaction example, Cache-block read transaction example. */
04481     uint64_t ecc_ena                      : 1;  /**< ECC enable. When set, enables the 8b ECC check/correct logic. Should be one when used with
04482                                                          DIMMs with ECC; zero, otherwise.
04483                                                          * When this mode is turned on, DQ<71:64> on write operations contains the ECC code
04484                                                          generated for the 64 bits of data which will be written in the memory. Later on read
04485                                                          operations, will be used to check for single-bit error (which will be auto-corrected) and
04486                                                          double-bit error (which will be reported).
04487                                                          * When not turned on, DQ<71:64> are driven to zero. Please refer to SEC_ERR, DED_ERR,
04488                                                          LMC()_FADR, and LMC()_ECC_SYND registers for diagnostics information when there is
04489                                                          an error. */
04490     uint64_t reserved_0_0                 : 1;
04491 #else
04492     uint64_t reserved_0_0                 : 1;
04493     uint64_t ecc_ena                      : 1;
04494     uint64_t row_lsb                      : 3;
04495     uint64_t pbank_lsb                    : 4;
04496     uint64_t idlepower                    : 3;
04497     uint64_t forcewrite                   : 4;
04498     uint64_t ecc_adr                      : 1;
04499     uint64_t reset                        : 1;
04500     uint64_t ref_zqcs_int                 : 22;
04501     uint64_t early_dqx                    : 1;
04502     uint64_t sref_with_dll                : 1;
04503     uint64_t rank_ena                     : 1;
04504     uint64_t rankmask                     : 4;
04505     uint64_t mirrmask                     : 4;
04506     uint64_t init_status                  : 4;
04507     uint64_t early_unload_d0_r0           : 1;
04508     uint64_t early_unload_d0_r1           : 1;
04509     uint64_t early_unload_d1_r0           : 1;
04510     uint64_t early_unload_d1_r1           : 1;
04511     uint64_t scrz                         : 1;
04512     uint64_t mode32b                      : 1;
04513     uint64_t mode_x4dev                   : 1;
04514     uint64_t bg2_enable                   : 1;
04515     uint64_t lrdimm_ena                   : 1;
04516 #endif
04517     } cn73xx;
04518     struct cvmx_lmcx_config_cn73xx        cn78xx;
04519     struct cvmx_lmcx_config_cn73xx        cn78xxp1;
04520     struct cvmx_lmcx_config_cn61xx        cnf71xx;
04521     struct cvmx_lmcx_config_cn73xx        cnf75xx;
04522 };
04523 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_config cvmx_lmcx_config_t;
04524 
04525 /**
04526  * cvmx_lmc#_control
04527  *
04528  * LMC_CONTROL = LMC Control
04529  * This register is an assortment of various control fields needed by the memory controller
04530  */
04531 union cvmx_lmcx_control {
04532     uint64_t u64;
04533     struct cvmx_lmcx_control_s {
04534 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
04535     uint64_t scramble_ena                 : 1;  /**< When set, will enable the scramble/descramble logic. */
04536     uint64_t thrcnt                       : 12; /**< Fine count. */
04537     uint64_t persub                       : 8;  /**< Offset for DFA rate-matching. */
04538     uint64_t thrmax                       : 4;  /**< Fine rate matching max bucket size. In conjunction with the coarse rate matching logic,
04539                                                          the fine rate matching logic gives software the ability to prioritize DFA reads over L2C
04540                                                          writes. Higher [PERSUB] values result in a lower DFA read bandwidth.
04541                                                          0x0 = Reserved. */
04542     uint64_t crm_cnt                      : 5;  /**< Coarse count. */
04543     uint64_t crm_thr                      : 5;  /**< Coarse rate matching threshold. */
04544     uint64_t crm_max                      : 5;  /**< Coarse rate matching max bucket size. The coarse rate matching logic is used to control
04545                                                          the bandwidth allocated to DFA reads. [CRM_MAX] is subdivided into two regions with DFA
04546                                                          reads being preferred over LMC reads/writes when [CRM_CNT] < [CRM_THR]. [CRM_CNT]
04547                                                          increments by
04548                                                          1 when a DFA read is slotted and by 2 when a LMC read/write is slotted, and rolls over
04549                                                          when [CRM_MAX] is reached.
04550                                                          0x0 = Reserved. */
04551     uint64_t rodt_bprch                   : 1;  /**< When set, the turn-off time for the ODT pin during a read command is delayed an additional
04552                                                          CK cycle. */
04553     uint64_t wodt_bprch                   : 1;  /**< When set, the turn-off time for the ODT pin during a write command is delayed an
04554                                                          additional CK cycle. */
04555     uint64_t bprch                        : 2;  /**< "Back porch enable. When set, the turn-on time for the default DDR#_DQ* /DDR#_DQS_*_P/N
04556                                                          drivers is delayed an additional BPRCH CK cycles.
04557                                                          0x0 = 0 CK cycles.
04558                                                          0x1 = 1 CK cycles.
04559                                                          0x2 = 2 CK cycles.
04560                                                          0x3 = 3 CK cycles." */
04561     uint64_t ext_zqcs_dis                 : 1;  /**< Disable (external) auto-ZQCS calibration. When clear, LMC runs external ZQ calibration
04562                                                          every LMC()_CONFIG [REF_ZQCS_INT] CK cycles. */
04563     uint64_t int_zqcs_dis                 : 1;  /**< Disable (internal) auto-ZQCS calibration. When clear, LMC runs internal ZQ calibration
04564                                                          every LMC()_CONFIG [REF_ZQCS_INT] CK cycles. */
04565     uint64_t auto_dclkdis                 : 1;  /**< When 1, LMC automatically shuts off its internal clock to conserve power when there is no
04566                                                          traffic. Note that this has no effect on the DDR3/DDR4 PHY and pads clocks. */
04567     uint64_t xor_bank                     : 1;  /**< Enable signal to XOR the bank bits. See LMC()_EXT_CONFIG2 on how LMC selects the L2C-LMC
04568                                                          address bits. */
04569     uint64_t max_write_batch              : 4;  /**< Maximum number of consecutive write operations to service before forcing read operations
04570                                                          to interrupt. */
04571     uint64_t nxm_write_en                 : 1;  /**< NXM write mode. When clear, LMC discards write operations to addresses that don't exist in
04572                                                          the DRAM (as defined by LMC()_NXM configuration). When set, LMC completes write
04573                                                          operations to addresses that don't exist in the DRAM at an aliased address. */
04574     uint64_t elev_prio_dis                : 1;  /**< Disable elevate priority logic. When set, write operations are sent in regardless of
04575                                                          priority information from L2C. */
04576     uint64_t inorder_wr                   : 1;  /**< Send write operations in order (regardless of priority). */
04577     uint64_t inorder_rd                   : 1;  /**< Send read operations in order (regardless of priority). */
04578     uint64_t throttle_wr                  : 1;  /**< When set, use at most one IFB for write operations. */
04579     uint64_t throttle_rd                  : 1;  /**< When set, use at most one IFB for read operations. */
04580     uint64_t fprch2                       : 2;  /**< "Front porch enable. When set, the turn-off time for the default DDR#_DQ* /DDR#_DQS_*_P/N
04581                                                          drivers is FPRCH2 CKs earlier.
04582                                                          0x0 = 0 CK cycles.
04583                                                          0x1 = 1 CK cycles.
04584                                                          0x2 = 2 CK cycles.
04585                                                          0x3 = Reserved." */
04586     uint64_t pocas                        : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
04587     uint64_t ddr2t                        : 1;  /**< Turn on the DDR 2T mode. 2 CK-cycle window for CMD and address. This mode helps relieve
04588                                                          setup time pressure on the address and command bus which nominally have a very large
04589                                                          fanout. Please refer to Micron's tech note tn_47_01 titled DDR2-533 Memory Design Guide
04590                                                          for Two Dimm Unbuffered Systems for physical details. */
04591     uint64_t bwcnt                        : 1;  /**< Bus utilization counter clear. Clears the LMC()_OPS_CNT, LMC()_IFB_CNT, and
04592                                                          LMC()_DCLK_CNT registers. To clear the CSRs, software should first write this field to
04593                                                          a one, then write this field to a zero. */
04594     uint64_t rdimm_ena                    : 1;  /**< Registered DIMM enable. When set allows the use of JEDEC Registered DIMMs which require
04595                                                          address and control bits to be registered in the controller. */
04596 #else
04597     uint64_t rdimm_ena                    : 1;
04598     uint64_t bwcnt                        : 1;
04599     uint64_t ddr2t                        : 1;
04600     uint64_t pocas                        : 1;
04601     uint64_t fprch2                       : 2;
04602     uint64_t throttle_rd                  : 1;
04603     uint64_t throttle_wr                  : 1;
04604     uint64_t inorder_rd                   : 1;
04605     uint64_t inorder_wr                   : 1;
04606     uint64_t elev_prio_dis                : 1;
04607     uint64_t nxm_write_en                 : 1;
04608     uint64_t max_write_batch              : 4;
04609     uint64_t xor_bank                     : 1;
04610     uint64_t auto_dclkdis                 : 1;
04611     uint64_t int_zqcs_dis                 : 1;
04612     uint64_t ext_zqcs_dis                 : 1;
04613     uint64_t bprch                        : 2;
04614     uint64_t wodt_bprch                   : 1;
04615     uint64_t rodt_bprch                   : 1;
04616     uint64_t crm_max                      : 5;
04617     uint64_t crm_thr                      : 5;
04618     uint64_t crm_cnt                      : 5;
04619     uint64_t thrmax                       : 4;
04620     uint64_t persub                       : 8;
04621     uint64_t thrcnt                       : 12;
04622     uint64_t scramble_ena                 : 1;
04623 #endif
04624     } s;
04625     struct cvmx_lmcx_control_s            cn61xx;
04626     struct cvmx_lmcx_control_cn63xx {
04627 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
04628     uint64_t reserved_24_63               : 40;
04629     uint64_t rodt_bprch                   : 1;  /**< When set, the turn-off time for the ODT pin during a
04630                                                          RD cmd is delayed an additional CK cycle. */
04631     uint64_t wodt_bprch                   : 1;  /**< When set, the turn-off time for the ODT pin during a
04632                                                          WR cmd is delayed an additional CK cycle. */
04633     uint64_t bprch                        : 2;  /**< Back Porch Enable: When set, the turn-on time for
04634                                                          the default DDR_DQ/DQS drivers is delayed an additional BPRCH
04635                                                          CK cycles.
04636                                                          00 = 0 CKs
04637                                                          01 = 1 CKs
04638                                                          10 = 2 CKs
04639                                                          11 = 3 CKs */
04640     uint64_t ext_zqcs_dis                 : 1;  /**< Disable (external) auto-zqcs calibration
04641                                                          When clear, LMC runs external ZQ calibration
04642                                                          every LMC*_CONFIG[REF_ZQCS_INT] CK cycles. */
04643     uint64_t int_zqcs_dis                 : 1;  /**< Disable (internal) auto-zqcs calibration
04644                                                          When clear, LMC runs internal ZQ calibration
04645                                                          every LMC*_CONFIG[REF_ZQCS_INT] CK cycles. */
04646     uint64_t auto_dclkdis                 : 1;  /**< When 1, LMC will automatically shut off its internal
04647                                                          clock to conserve power when there is no traffic. Note
04648                                                          that this has no effect on the DDR3 PHY and pads clocks. */
04649     uint64_t xor_bank                     : 1;  /**< If (XOR_BANK == 1), then
04650                                                           bank[2:0]=address[9:7] ^ address[14:12]
04651                                                          else
04652                                                           bank[2:0]=address[9:7] */
04653     uint64_t max_write_batch              : 4;  /**< Maximum number of consecutive writes to service before
04654                                                          forcing reads to interrupt. */
04655     uint64_t nxm_write_en                 : 1;  /**< NXM Write mode
04656                                                          When clear, LMC discards writes to addresses that don't
04657                                                          exist in the DRAM (as defined by LMC*_NXM configuration).
04658                                                          When set, LMC completes writes to addresses that don't
04659                                                          exist in the DRAM at an aliased address. */
04660     uint64_t elev_prio_dis                : 1;  /**< Disable elevate priority logic.
04661                                                          When set, writes are sent in
04662                                                          regardless of priority information from L2C. */
04663     uint64_t inorder_wr                   : 1;  /**< Send writes in order(regardless of priority) */
04664     uint64_t inorder_rd                   : 1;  /**< Send reads in order (regardless of priority) */
04665     uint64_t throttle_wr                  : 1;  /**< When set, use at most one IFB for writes */
04666     uint64_t throttle_rd                  : 1;  /**< When set, use at most one IFB for reads */
04667     uint64_t fprch2                       : 2;  /**< Front Porch Enable: When set, the turn-off
04668                                                          time for the default DDR_DQ/DQS drivers is FPRCH2 CKs earlier.
04669                                                          00 = 0 CKs
04670                                                          01 = 1 CKs
04671                                                          10 = 2 CKs
04672                                                          11 = RESERVED */
04673     uint64_t pocas                        : 1;  /**< Enable the Posted CAS feature of DDR3.
04674                                                          This bit must be set whenever LMC*_MODEREG_PARAMS0[AL]!=0,
04675                                                          and clear otherwise. */
04676     uint64_t ddr2t                        : 1;  /**< Turn on the DDR 2T mode. 2 CK cycle window for CMD and
04677                                                          address. This mode helps relieve setup time pressure
04678                                                          on the Address and command bus which nominally have
04679                                                          a very large fanout. Please refer to Micron's tech
04680                                                          note tn_47_01 titled "DDR2-533 Memory Design Guide
04681                                                          for Two Dimm Unbuffered Systems" for physical details. */
04682     uint64_t bwcnt                        : 1;  /**< Bus utilization counter Clear.
04683                                                          Clears the LMC*_OPS_CNT, LMC*_IFB_CNT, and
04684                                                          LMC*_DCLK_CNT registers. SW should first write this
04685                                                          field to a one, then write this field to a zero to
04686                                                          clear the CSR's. */
04687     uint64_t rdimm_ena                    : 1;  /**< Registered DIMM Enable - When set allows the use
04688                                                          of JEDEC Registered DIMMs which require address and
04689                                                          control bits to be registered in the controller. */
04690 #else
04691     uint64_t rdimm_ena                    : 1;
04692     uint64_t bwcnt                        : 1;
04693     uint64_t ddr2t                        : 1;
04694     uint64_t pocas                        : 1;
04695     uint64_t fprch2                       : 2;
04696     uint64_t throttle_rd                  : 1;
04697     uint64_t throttle_wr                  : 1;
04698     uint64_t inorder_rd                   : 1;
04699     uint64_t inorder_wr                   : 1;
04700     uint64_t elev_prio_dis                : 1;
04701     uint64_t nxm_write_en                 : 1;
04702     uint64_t max_write_batch              : 4;
04703     uint64_t xor_bank                     : 1;
04704     uint64_t auto_dclkdis                 : 1;
04705     uint64_t int_zqcs_dis                 : 1;
04706     uint64_t ext_zqcs_dis                 : 1;
04707     uint64_t bprch                        : 2;
04708     uint64_t wodt_bprch                   : 1;
04709     uint64_t rodt_bprch                   : 1;
04710     uint64_t reserved_24_63               : 40;
04711 #endif
04712     } cn63xx;
04713     struct cvmx_lmcx_control_cn63xx       cn63xxp1;
04714     struct cvmx_lmcx_control_cn66xx {
04715 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
04716     uint64_t scramble_ena                 : 1;  /**< When set, will enable the scramble/descramble logic */
04717     uint64_t reserved_24_62               : 39;
04718     uint64_t rodt_bprch                   : 1;  /**< When set, the turn-off time for the ODT pin during a
04719                                                          RD cmd is delayed an additional CK cycle. */
04720     uint64_t wodt_bprch                   : 1;  /**< When set, the turn-off time for the ODT pin during a
04721                                                          WR cmd is delayed an additional CK cycle. */
04722     uint64_t bprch                        : 2;  /**< Back Porch Enable: When set, the turn-on time for
04723                                                          the default DDR_DQ/DQS drivers is delayed an additional BPRCH
04724                                                          CK cycles.
04725                                                          00 = 0 CKs
04726                                                          01 = 1 CKs
04727                                                          10 = 2 CKs
04728                                                          11 = 3 CKs */
04729     uint64_t ext_zqcs_dis                 : 1;  /**< Disable (external) auto-zqcs calibration
04730                                                          When clear, LMC runs external ZQ calibration
04731                                                          every LMC*_CONFIG[REF_ZQCS_INT] CK cycles. */
04732     uint64_t int_zqcs_dis                 : 1;  /**< Disable (internal) auto-zqcs calibration
04733                                                          When clear, LMC runs internal ZQ calibration
04734                                                          every LMC*_CONFIG[REF_ZQCS_INT] CK cycles. */
04735     uint64_t auto_dclkdis                 : 1;  /**< When 1, LMC will automatically shut off its internal
04736                                                          clock to conserve power when there is no traffic. Note
04737                                                          that this has no effect on the DDR3 PHY and pads clocks. */
04738     uint64_t xor_bank                     : 1;  /**< If (XOR_BANK == 1), then
04739                                                           bank[2:0]=address[9:7] ^ address[14:12]
04740                                                          else
04741                                                           bank[2:0]=address[9:7] */
04742     uint64_t max_write_batch              : 4;  /**< Maximum number of consecutive writes to service before
04743                                                          forcing reads to interrupt. */
04744     uint64_t nxm_write_en                 : 1;  /**< NXM Write mode
04745                                                          When clear, LMC discards writes to addresses that don't
04746                                                          exist in the DRAM (as defined by LMC*_NXM configuration).
04747                                                          When set, LMC completes writes to addresses that don't
04748                                                          exist in the DRAM at an aliased address. */
04749     uint64_t elev_prio_dis                : 1;  /**< Disable elevate priority logic.
04750                                                          When set, writes are sent in
04751                                                          regardless of priority information from L2C. */
04752     uint64_t inorder_wr                   : 1;  /**< Send writes in order(regardless of priority) */
04753     uint64_t inorder_rd                   : 1;  /**< Send reads in order (regardless of priority) */
04754     uint64_t throttle_wr                  : 1;  /**< When set, use at most one IFB for writes */
04755     uint64_t throttle_rd                  : 1;  /**< When set, use at most one IFB for reads */
04756     uint64_t fprch2                       : 2;  /**< Front Porch Enable: When set, the turn-off
04757                                                          time for the default DDR_DQ/DQS drivers is FPRCH2 CKs earlier.
04758                                                          00 = 0 CKs
04759                                                          01 = 1 CKs
04760                                                          10 = 2 CKs
04761                                                          11 = RESERVED */
04762     uint64_t pocas                        : 1;  /**< Enable the Posted CAS feature of DDR3.
04763                                                          This bit must be set whenever LMC*_MODEREG_PARAMS0[AL]!=0,
04764                                                          and clear otherwise. */
04765     uint64_t ddr2t                        : 1;  /**< Turn on the DDR 2T mode. 2 CK cycle window for CMD and
04766                                                          address. This mode helps relieve setup time pressure
04767                                                          on the Address and command bus which nominally have
04768                                                          a very large fanout. Please refer to Micron's tech
04769                                                          note tn_47_01 titled "DDR2-533 Memory Design Guide
04770                                                          for Two Dimm Unbuffered Systems" for physical details. */
04771     uint64_t bwcnt                        : 1;  /**< Bus utilization counter Clear.
04772                                                          Clears the LMC*_OPS_CNT, LMC*_IFB_CNT, and
04773                                                          LMC*_DCLK_CNT registers. SW should first write this
04774                                                          field to a one, then write this field to a zero to
04775                                                          clear the CSR's. */
04776     uint64_t rdimm_ena                    : 1;  /**< Registered DIMM Enable - When set allows the use
04777                                                          of JEDEC Registered DIMMs which require address and
04778                                                          control bits to be registered in the controller. */
04779 #else
04780     uint64_t rdimm_ena                    : 1;
04781     uint64_t bwcnt                        : 1;
04782     uint64_t ddr2t                        : 1;
04783     uint64_t pocas                        : 1;
04784     uint64_t fprch2                       : 2;
04785     uint64_t throttle_rd                  : 1;
04786     uint64_t throttle_wr                  : 1;
04787     uint64_t inorder_rd                   : 1;
04788     uint64_t inorder_wr                   : 1;
04789     uint64_t elev_prio_dis                : 1;
04790     uint64_t nxm_write_en                 : 1;
04791     uint64_t max_write_batch              : 4;
04792     uint64_t xor_bank                     : 1;
04793     uint64_t auto_dclkdis                 : 1;
04794     uint64_t int_zqcs_dis                 : 1;
04795     uint64_t ext_zqcs_dis                 : 1;
04796     uint64_t bprch                        : 2;
04797     uint64_t wodt_bprch                   : 1;
04798     uint64_t rodt_bprch                   : 1;
04799     uint64_t reserved_24_62               : 39;
04800     uint64_t scramble_ena                 : 1;
04801 #endif
04802     } cn66xx;
04803     struct cvmx_lmcx_control_cn68xx {
04804 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
04805     uint64_t reserved_63_63               : 1;
04806     uint64_t thrcnt                       : 12; /**< Fine Count */
04807     uint64_t persub                       : 8;  /**< Offset for DFA rate-matching */
04808     uint64_t thrmax                       : 4;  /**< Fine Rate Matching Max Bucket Size
04809                                                          0 = Reserved
04810                                                          In conjunction with the Coarse Rate Matching Logic, the Fine Rate
04811                                                          Matching Logic gives SW the ability to prioritize DFA Rds over
04812                                                          L2C Writes. Higher PERSUB values result in a lower DFA Rd
04813                                                          bandwidth. */
04814     uint64_t crm_cnt                      : 5;  /**< Coarse Count */
04815     uint64_t crm_thr                      : 5;  /**< Coarse Rate Matching Threshold */
04816     uint64_t crm_max                      : 5;  /**< Coarse Rate Matching Max Bucket Size
04817                                                          0 = Reserved
04818                                                          The Coarse Rate Matching Logic is used to control the bandwidth
04819                                                          allocated to DFA Rds. CRM_MAX is subdivided into two regions
04820                                                          with DFA Rds being preferred over LMC Rd/Wrs when
04821                                                          CRM_CNT < CRM_THR. CRM_CNT increments by 1 when a DFA Rd is
04822                                                          slotted and by 2 when a LMC Rd/Wr is slotted, and rolls over
04823                                                          when CRM_MAX is reached. */
04824     uint64_t rodt_bprch                   : 1;  /**< When set, the turn-off time for the ODT pin during a
04825                                                          RD cmd is delayed an additional CK cycle. */
04826     uint64_t wodt_bprch                   : 1;  /**< When set, the turn-off time for the ODT pin during a
04827                                                          WR cmd is delayed an additional CK cycle. */
04828     uint64_t bprch                        : 2;  /**< Back Porch Enable: When set, the turn-on time for
04829                                                          the default DDR_DQ/DQS drivers is delayed an additional BPRCH
04830                                                          CK cycles.
04831                                                          00 = 0 CKs
04832                                                          01 = 1 CKs
04833                                                          10 = 2 CKs
04834                                                          11 = 3 CKs */
04835     uint64_t ext_zqcs_dis                 : 1;  /**< Disable (external) auto-zqcs calibration
04836                                                          When clear, LMC runs external ZQ calibration
04837                                                          every LMC*_CONFIG[REF_ZQCS_INT] CK cycles. */
04838     uint64_t int_zqcs_dis                 : 1;  /**< Disable (internal) auto-zqcs calibration
04839                                                          When clear, LMC runs internal ZQ calibration
04840                                                          every LMC*_CONFIG[REF_ZQCS_INT] CK cycles. */
04841     uint64_t auto_dclkdis                 : 1;  /**< When 1, LMC will automatically shut off its internal
04842                                                          clock to conserve power when there is no traffic. Note
04843                                                          that this has no effect on the DDR3 PHY and pads clocks. */
04844     uint64_t xor_bank                     : 1;  /**< If (XOR_BANK == 1), then
04845                                                           bank[2:0]=address[9:7] ^ address[14:12]
04846                                                          else
04847                                                           bank[2:0]=address[9:7] */
04848     uint64_t max_write_batch              : 4;  /**< Maximum number of consecutive writes to service before
04849                                                          forcing reads to interrupt. */
04850     uint64_t nxm_write_en                 : 1;  /**< NXM Write mode
04851                                                          When clear, LMC discards writes to addresses that don't
04852                                                          exist in the DRAM (as defined by LMC*_NXM configuration).
04853                                                          When set, LMC completes writes to addresses that don't
04854                                                          exist in the DRAM at an aliased address. */
04855     uint64_t elev_prio_dis                : 1;  /**< Disable elevate priority logic.
04856                                                          When set, writes are sent in
04857                                                          regardless of priority information from L2C. */
04858     uint64_t inorder_wr                   : 1;  /**< Send writes in order(regardless of priority) */
04859     uint64_t inorder_rd                   : 1;  /**< Send reads in order (regardless of priority) */
04860     uint64_t throttle_wr                  : 1;  /**< When set, use at most one IFB for writes */
04861     uint64_t throttle_rd                  : 1;  /**< When set, use at most one IFB for reads */
04862     uint64_t fprch2                       : 2;  /**< Front Porch Enable: When set, the turn-off
04863                                                          time for the default DDR_DQ/DQS drivers is FPRCH2 CKs earlier.
04864                                                          00 = 0 CKs
04865                                                          01 = 1 CKs
04866                                                          10 = 2 CKs
04867                                                          11 = RESERVED */
04868     uint64_t pocas                        : 1;  /**< Enable the Posted CAS feature of DDR3.
04869                                                          This bit must be set whenever LMC*_MODEREG_PARAMS0[AL]!=0,
04870                                                          and clear otherwise. */
04871     uint64_t ddr2t                        : 1;  /**< Turn on the DDR 2T mode. 2 CK cycle window for CMD and
04872                                                          address. This mode helps relieve setup time pressure
04873                                                          on the Address and command bus which nominally have
04874                                                          a very large fanout. Please refer to Micron's tech
04875                                                          note tn_47_01 titled "DDR2-533 Memory Design Guide
04876                                                          for Two Dimm Unbuffered Systems" for physical details. */
04877     uint64_t bwcnt                        : 1;  /**< Bus utilization counter Clear.
04878                                                          Clears the LMC*_OPS_CNT, LMC*_IFB_CNT, and
04879                                                          LMC*_DCLK_CNT registers. SW should first write this
04880                                                          field to a one, then write this field to a zero to
04881                                                          clear the CSR's. */
04882     uint64_t rdimm_ena                    : 1;  /**< Registered DIMM Enable - When set allows the use
04883                                                          of JEDEC Registered DIMMs which require address and
04884                                                          control bits to be registered in the controller. */
04885 #else
04886     uint64_t rdimm_ena                    : 1;
04887     uint64_t bwcnt                        : 1;
04888     uint64_t ddr2t                        : 1;
04889     uint64_t pocas                        : 1;
04890     uint64_t fprch2                       : 2;
04891     uint64_t throttle_rd                  : 1;
04892     uint64_t throttle_wr                  : 1;
04893     uint64_t inorder_rd                   : 1;
04894     uint64_t inorder_wr                   : 1;
04895     uint64_t elev_prio_dis                : 1;
04896     uint64_t nxm_write_en                 : 1;
04897     uint64_t max_write_batch              : 4;
04898     uint64_t xor_bank                     : 1;
04899     uint64_t auto_dclkdis                 : 1;
04900     uint64_t int_zqcs_dis                 : 1;
04901     uint64_t ext_zqcs_dis                 : 1;
04902     uint64_t bprch                        : 2;
04903     uint64_t wodt_bprch                   : 1;
04904     uint64_t rodt_bprch                   : 1;
04905     uint64_t crm_max                      : 5;
04906     uint64_t crm_thr                      : 5;
04907     uint64_t crm_cnt                      : 5;
04908     uint64_t thrmax                       : 4;
04909     uint64_t persub                       : 8;
04910     uint64_t thrcnt                       : 12;
04911     uint64_t reserved_63_63               : 1;
04912 #endif
04913     } cn68xx;
04914     struct cvmx_lmcx_control_cn68xx       cn68xxp1;
04915     struct cvmx_lmcx_control_s            cn70xx;
04916     struct cvmx_lmcx_control_s            cn70xxp1;
04917     struct cvmx_lmcx_control_s            cn73xx;
04918     struct cvmx_lmcx_control_s            cn78xx;
04919     struct cvmx_lmcx_control_s            cn78xxp1;
04920     struct cvmx_lmcx_control_cn66xx       cnf71xx;
04921     struct cvmx_lmcx_control_s            cnf75xx;
04922 };
04923 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_control cvmx_lmcx_control_t;
04924 
04925 /**
04926  * cvmx_lmc#_ctl
04927  *
04928  * LMC_CTL = LMC Control
04929  * This register is an assortment of various control fields needed by the memory controller
04930  */
04931 union cvmx_lmcx_ctl {
04932     uint64_t u64;
04933     struct cvmx_lmcx_ctl_s {
04934 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
04935     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
04936     uint64_t ddr__nctl                    : 4;  /**< DDR nctl from compensation circuit
04937                                                          The encoded value on this will adjust the drive strength
04938                                                          of the DDR DQ pulldns. */
04939     uint64_t ddr__pctl                    : 4;  /**< DDR pctl from compensation circuit
04940                                                          The encoded value on this will adjust the drive strength
04941                                                          of the DDR DQ pullup. */
04942     uint64_t slow_scf                     : 1;  /**< Should be cleared to zero */
04943     uint64_t xor_bank                     : 1;  /**< If (XOR_BANK == 1), then
04944                                                            bank[n:0]=address[n+7:7] ^ address[n+7+5:7+5]
04945                                                          else
04946                                                            bank[n:0]=address[n+7:7]
04947                                                          where n=1 for a 4 bank part and n=2 for an 8 bank part */
04948     uint64_t max_write_batch              : 4;  /**< Maximum number of consecutive writes to service before
04949                                                          allowing reads to interrupt. */
04950     uint64_t pll_div2                     : 1;  /**< PLL Div2. */
04951     uint64_t pll_bypass                   : 1;  /**< PLL Bypass. */
04952     uint64_t rdimm_ena                    : 1;  /**< Registered DIMM Enable - When set allows the use
04953                                                          of JEDEC Registered DIMMs which require Write
04954                                                          data to be registered in the controller. */
04955     uint64_t r2r_slot                     : 1;  /**< R2R Slot Enable: When set, all read-to-read trans
04956                                                          will slot an additional 1 cycle data bus bubble to
04957                                                          avoid DQ/DQS bus contention. This is only a CYA bit,
04958                                                          in case the "built-in" DIMM and RANK crossing logic
04959                                                          which should auto-detect and perfectly slot
04960                                                          read-to-reads to the same DIMM/RANK. */
04961     uint64_t inorder_mwf                  : 1;  /**< Reads as zero */
04962     uint64_t inorder_mrf                  : 1;  /**< Always clear to zero */
04963     uint64_t reserved_10_11               : 2;
04964     uint64_t fprch2                       : 1;  /**< Front Porch Enable: When set, the turn-off
04965                                                          time for the DDR_DQ/DQS drivers is 1 dclk earlier.
04966                                                          This bit should typically be set. */
04967     uint64_t bprch                        : 1;  /**< Back Porch Enable: When set, the turn-on time for
04968                                                          the DDR_DQ/DQS drivers is delayed an additional DCLK
04969                                                          cycle. This should be set to one whenever both SILO_HC
04970                                                          and SILO_QC are set. */
04971     uint64_t sil_lat                      : 2;  /**< SILO Latency: On reads, determines how many additional
04972                                                          dclks to wait (on top of TCL+1+TSKW) before pulling
04973                                                          data out of the pad silos.
04974                                                              - 00: illegal
04975                                                              - 01: 1 dclks
04976                                                              - 10: 2 dclks
04977                                                              - 11: illegal
04978                                                          This should always be set to 1. */
04979     uint64_t tskw                         : 2;  /**< This component is a representation of total BOARD
04980                                                          DELAY on DQ (used in the controller to determine the
04981                                                          R->W spacing to avoid DQS/DQ bus conflicts). Enter
04982                                                          the largest of the per byte Board delay
04983                                                              - 00: 0 dclk
04984                                                              - 01: 1 dclks
04985                                                              - 10: 2 dclks
04986                                                              - 11: 3 dclks */
04987     uint64_t qs_dic                       : 2;  /**< DDR2 Termination Resistor Setting
04988                                                          A non Zero value in this register
04989                                                          enables the On Die Termination (ODT) in DDR parts.
04990                                                          These two bits are loaded into the RTT
04991                                                          portion of the EMRS register bits A6 & A2. If DDR2's
04992                                                          termination (for the memory's DQ/DQS/DM pads) is not
04993                                                          desired, set it to 00. If it is, chose between
04994                                                          01 for 75 ohm and 10 for 150 ohm termination.
04995                                                              00 = ODT Disabled
04996                                                              01 = 75 ohm Termination
04997                                                              10 = 150 ohm Termination
04998                                                              11 = 50 ohm Termination
04999                                                          Octeon, on writes, by default, drives the 4/8 ODT
05000                                                          pins (64/128b mode) based on what the masks
05001                                                          (LMC_WODT_CTL) are programmed to.
05002                                                          LMC_DDR2_CTL->ODT_ENA enables Octeon to drive ODT pins
05003                                                          for READS. LMC_RODT_CTL needs to be programmed based
05004                                                          on the system's needs for ODT. */
05005     uint64_t dic                          : 2;  /**< Drive Strength Control:
05006                                                          DIC[0] is
05007                                                          loaded into the Extended Mode Register (EMRS) A1 bit
05008                                                          during initialization.
05009                                                              0 = Normal
05010                                                              1 = Reduced
05011                                                          DIC[1] is used to load into EMRS
05012                                                          bit 10 - DQSN Enable/Disable field. By default, we
05013                                                          program the DDR's to drive the DQSN also. Set it to
05014                                                          1 if DQSN should be Hi-Z.
05015                                                              0 - DQSN Enable
05016                                                              1 - DQSN Disable */
05017 #else
05018     uint64_t dic                          : 2;
05019     uint64_t qs_dic                       : 2;
05020     uint64_t tskw                         : 2;
05021     uint64_t sil_lat                      : 2;
05022     uint64_t bprch                        : 1;
05023     uint64_t fprch2                       : 1;
05024     uint64_t reserved_10_11               : 2;
05025     uint64_t inorder_mrf                  : 1;
05026     uint64_t inorder_mwf                  : 1;
05027     uint64_t r2r_slot                     : 1;
05028     uint64_t rdimm_ena                    : 1;
05029     uint64_t pll_bypass                   : 1;
05030     uint64_t pll_div2                     : 1;
05031     uint64_t max_write_batch              : 4;
05032     uint64_t xor_bank                     : 1;
05033     uint64_t slow_scf                     : 1;
05034     uint64_t ddr__pctl                    : 4;
05035     uint64_t ddr__nctl                    : 4;
05036     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
05037 #endif
05038     } s;
05039     struct cvmx_lmcx_ctl_cn30xx {
05040 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05041     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
05042     uint64_t ddr__nctl                    : 4;  /**< DDR nctl from compensation circuit
05043                                                          The encoded value on this will adjust the drive strength
05044                                                          of the DDR DQ pulldns. */
05045     uint64_t ddr__pctl                    : 4;  /**< DDR pctl from compensation circuit
05046                                                          The encoded value on this will adjust the drive strength
05047                                                          of the DDR DQ pullup. */
05048     uint64_t slow_scf                     : 1;  /**< 1=SCF has pass1 latency, 0=SCF has 1 cycle lower latency
05049                                                          when compared to pass1 */
05050     uint64_t xor_bank                     : 1;  /**< If (XOR_BANK == 1), then
05051                                                            bank[n:0]=address[n+7:7] ^ address[n+7+5:7+5]
05052                                                          else
05053                                                            bank[n:0]=address[n+7:7]
05054                                                          where n=1 for a 4 bank part and n=2 for an 8 bank part */
05055     uint64_t max_write_batch              : 4;  /**< Maximum number of consecutive writes to service before
05056                                                          allowing reads to interrupt. */
05057     uint64_t pll_div2                     : 1;  /**< PLL Div2. */
05058     uint64_t pll_bypass                   : 1;  /**< PLL Bypass. */
05059     uint64_t rdimm_ena                    : 1;  /**< Registered DIMM Enable - When set allows the use
05060                                                          of JEDEC Registered DIMMs which require Write
05061                                                          data to be registered in the controller. */
05062     uint64_t r2r_slot                     : 1;  /**< R2R Slot Enable: When set, all read-to-read trans
05063                                                          will slot an additional 1 cycle data bus bubble to
05064                                                          avoid DQ/DQS bus contention. This is only a CYA bit,
05065                                                          in case the "built-in" DIMM and RANK crossing logic
05066                                                          which should auto-detect and perfectly slot
05067                                                          read-to-reads to the same DIMM/RANK. */
05068     uint64_t inorder_mwf                  : 1;  /**< Reads as zero */
05069     uint64_t inorder_mrf                  : 1;  /**< Always set to zero */
05070     uint64_t dreset                       : 1;  /**< Dclk domain reset.  The reset signal that is used by the
05071                                                          Dclk domain is (DRESET || ECLK_RESET). */
05072     uint64_t mode32b                      : 1;  /**< 32b data Path Mode
05073                                                          Set to 1 if we use only 32 DQ pins
05074                                                          0 for 16b DQ mode. */
05075     uint64_t fprch2                       : 1;  /**< Front Porch Enable: When set, the turn-off
05076                                                          time for the DDR_DQ/DQS drivers is 1 dclk earlier.
05077                                                          This bit should typically be set. */
05078     uint64_t bprch                        : 1;  /**< Back Porch Enable: When set, the turn-on time for
05079                                                          the DDR_DQ/DQS drivers is delayed an additional DCLK
05080                                                          cycle. This should be set to one whenever both SILO_HC
05081                                                          and SILO_QC are set. */
05082     uint64_t sil_lat                      : 2;  /**< SILO Latency: On reads, determines how many additional
05083                                                          dclks to wait (on top of TCL+1+TSKW) before pulling
05084                                                          data out of the pad silos.
05085                                                              - 00: illegal
05086                                                              - 01: 1 dclks
05087                                                              - 10: 2 dclks
05088                                                              - 11: illegal
05089                                                          This should always be set to 1. */
05090     uint64_t tskw                         : 2;  /**< This component is a representation of total BOARD
05091                                                          DELAY on DQ (used in the controller to determine the
05092                                                          R->W spacing to avoid DQS/DQ bus conflicts). Enter
05093                                                          the largest of the per byte Board delay
05094                                                              - 00: 0 dclk
05095                                                              - 01: 1 dclks
05096                                                              - 10: 2 dclks
05097                                                              - 11: 3 dclks */
05098     uint64_t qs_dic                       : 2;  /**< QS Drive Strength Control (DDR1):
05099                                                          & DDR2 Termination Resistor Setting
05100                                                          When in DDR2, a non Zero value in this register
05101                                                          enables the On Die Termination (ODT) in DDR parts.
05102                                                          These two bits are loaded into the RTT
05103                                                          portion of the EMRS register bits A6 & A2. If DDR2's
05104                                                          termination (for the memory's DQ/DQS/DM pads) is not
05105                                                          desired, set it to 00. If it is, chose between
05106                                                          01 for 75 ohm and 10 for 150 ohm termination.
05107                                                              00 = ODT Disabled
05108                                                              01 = 75 ohm Termination
05109                                                              10 = 150 ohm Termination
05110                                                              11 = 50 ohm Termination
05111                                                          Octeon, on writes, by default, drives the 8 ODT
05112                                                          pins based on what the masks (LMC_WODT_CTL1 & 2)
05113                                                          are programmed to. LMC_DDR2_CTL->ODT_ENA
05114                                                          enables Octeon to drive ODT pins for READS.
05115                                                          LMC_RODT_CTL needs to be programmed based on
05116                                                          the system's needs for ODT. */
05117     uint64_t dic                          : 2;  /**< Drive Strength Control:
05118                                                          For DDR-I/II Mode, DIC[0] is
05119                                                          loaded into the Extended Mode Register (EMRS) A1 bit
05120                                                          during initialization. (see DDR-I data sheet EMRS
05121                                                          description)
05122                                                              0 = Normal
05123                                                              1 = Reduced
05124                                                          For DDR-II Mode, DIC[1] is used to load into EMRS
05125                                                          bit 10 - DQSN Enable/Disable field. By default, we
05126                                                          program the DDR's to drive the DQSN also. Set it to
05127                                                          1 if DQSN should be Hi-Z.
05128                                                              0 - DQSN Enable
05129                                                              1 - DQSN Disable */
05130 #else
05131     uint64_t dic                          : 2;
05132     uint64_t qs_dic                       : 2;
05133     uint64_t tskw                         : 2;
05134     uint64_t sil_lat                      : 2;
05135     uint64_t bprch                        : 1;
05136     uint64_t fprch2                       : 1;
05137     uint64_t mode32b                      : 1;
05138     uint64_t dreset                       : 1;
05139     uint64_t inorder_mrf                  : 1;
05140     uint64_t inorder_mwf                  : 1;
05141     uint64_t r2r_slot                     : 1;
05142     uint64_t rdimm_ena                    : 1;
05143     uint64_t pll_bypass                   : 1;
05144     uint64_t pll_div2                     : 1;
05145     uint64_t max_write_batch              : 4;
05146     uint64_t xor_bank                     : 1;
05147     uint64_t slow_scf                     : 1;
05148     uint64_t ddr__pctl                    : 4;
05149     uint64_t ddr__nctl                    : 4;
05150     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
05151 #endif
05152     } cn30xx;
05153     struct cvmx_lmcx_ctl_cn30xx           cn31xx;
05154     struct cvmx_lmcx_ctl_cn38xx {
05155 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05156     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
05157     uint64_t ddr__nctl                    : 4;  /**< DDR nctl from compensation circuit
05158                                                          The encoded value on this will adjust the drive strength
05159                                                          of the DDR DQ pulldns. */
05160     uint64_t ddr__pctl                    : 4;  /**< DDR pctl from compensation circuit
05161                                                          The encoded value on this will adjust the drive strength
05162                                                          of the DDR DQ pullup. */
05163     uint64_t slow_scf                     : 1;  /**< 1=SCF has pass1 latency, 0=SCF has 1 cycle lower latency
05164                                                          when compared to pass1
05165                                                          NOTE - This bit has NO effect in PASS1 */
05166     uint64_t xor_bank                     : 1;  /**< If (XOR_BANK == 1), then
05167                                                            bank[n:0]=address[n+7:7] ^ address[n+7+5:7+5]
05168                                                          else
05169                                                            bank[n:0]=address[n+7:7]
05170                                                          where n=1 for a 4 bank part and n=2 for an 8 bank part */
05171     uint64_t max_write_batch              : 4;  /**< Maximum number of consecutive writes to service before
05172                                                          allowing reads to interrupt. */
05173     uint64_t reserved_16_17               : 2;
05174     uint64_t rdimm_ena                    : 1;  /**< Registered DIMM Enable - When set allows the use
05175                                                          of JEDEC Registered DIMMs which require Write
05176                                                          data to be registered in the controller. */
05177     uint64_t r2r_slot                     : 1;  /**< R2R Slot Enable: When set, all read-to-read trans
05178                                                          will slot an additional 1 cycle data bus bubble to
05179                                                          avoid DQ/DQS bus contention. This is only a CYA bit,
05180                                                          in case the "built-in" DIMM and RANK crossing logic
05181                                                          which should auto-detect and perfectly slot
05182                                                          read-to-reads to the same DIMM/RANK. */
05183     uint64_t inorder_mwf                  : 1;  /**< When set, forces LMC_MWF (writes) into strict, in-order
05184                                                          mode.  When clear, writes may be serviced out of order
05185                                                          (optimized to keep multiple banks active).
05186                                                          This bit is ONLY to be set at power-on and
05187                                                          should not be set for normal use.
05188                                                          NOTE: For PASS1, set as follows:
05189                                                              DDR-I -> 1
05190                                                              DDR-II -> 0
05191                                                          For Pass2, this bit is RA0, write ignore (this feature
05192                                                          is permanently disabled) */
05193     uint64_t inorder_mrf                  : 1;  /**< When set, forces LMC_MRF (reads) into strict, in-order
05194                                                          mode.  When clear, reads may be serviced out of order
05195                                                          (optimized to keep multiple banks active).
05196                                                          This bit is ONLY to be set at power-on and
05197                                                          should not be set for normal use.
05198                                                          NOTE: For PASS1, set as follows:
05199                                                              DDR-I -> 1
05200                                                              DDR-II -> 0
05201                                                          For Pass2, this bit should be written ZERO for
05202                                                          DDR I & II */
05203     uint64_t set_zero                     : 1;  /**< Reserved. Always Set this Bit to Zero */
05204     uint64_t mode128b                     : 1;  /**< 128b data Path Mode
05205                                                          Set to 1 if we use all 128 DQ pins
05206                                                          0 for 64b DQ mode. */
05207     uint64_t fprch2                       : 1;  /**< Front Porch Enable: When set, the turn-off
05208                                                          time for the DDR_DQ/DQS drivers is 1 dclk earlier.
05209                                                          This bit should typically be set. */
05210     uint64_t bprch                        : 1;  /**< Back Porch Enable: When set, the turn-on time for
05211                                                          the DDR_DQ/DQS drivers is delayed an additional DCLK
05212                                                          cycle. This should be set to one whenever both SILO_HC
05213                                                          and SILO_QC are set. */
05214     uint64_t sil_lat                      : 2;  /**< SILO Latency: On reads, determines how many additional
05215                                                          dclks to wait (on top of TCL+1+TSKW) before pulling
05216                                                          data out of the pad silos.
05217                                                              - 00: illegal
05218                                                              - 01: 1 dclks
05219                                                              - 10: 2 dclks
05220                                                              - 11: illegal
05221                                                          This should always be set to 1. */
05222     uint64_t tskw                         : 2;  /**< This component is a representation of total BOARD
05223                                                          DELAY on DQ (used in the controller to determine the
05224                                                          R->W spacing to avoid DQS/DQ bus conflicts). Enter
05225                                                          the largest of the per byte Board delay
05226                                                              - 00: 0 dclk
05227                                                              - 01: 1 dclks
05228                                                              - 10: 2 dclks
05229                                                              - 11: 3 dclks */
05230     uint64_t qs_dic                       : 2;  /**< QS Drive Strength Control (DDR1):
05231                                                          & DDR2 Termination Resistor Setting
05232                                                          When in DDR2, a non Zero value in this register
05233                                                          enables the On Die Termination (ODT) in DDR parts.
05234                                                          These two bits are loaded into the RTT
05235                                                          portion of the EMRS register bits A6 & A2. If DDR2's
05236                                                          termination (for the memory's DQ/DQS/DM pads) is not
05237                                                          desired, set it to 00. If it is, chose between
05238                                                          01 for 75 ohm and 10 for 150 ohm termination.
05239                                                              00 = ODT Disabled
05240                                                              01 = 75 ohm Termination
05241                                                              10 = 150 ohm Termination
05242                                                              11 = 50 ohm Termination
05243                                                          Octeon, on writes, by default, drives the 4/8 ODT
05244                                                          pins (64/128b mode) based on what the masks
05245                                                          (LMC_WODT_CTL) are programmed to.
05246                                                          LMC_DDR2_CTL->ODT_ENA enables Octeon to drive ODT pins
05247                                                          for READS. LMC_RODT_CTL needs to be programmed based
05248                                                          on the system's needs for ODT. */
05249     uint64_t dic                          : 2;  /**< Drive Strength Control:
05250                                                          For DDR-I/II Mode, DIC[0] is
05251                                                          loaded into the Extended Mode Register (EMRS) A1 bit
05252                                                          during initialization. (see DDR-I data sheet EMRS
05253                                                          description)
05254                                                              0 = Normal
05255                                                              1 = Reduced
05256                                                          For DDR-II Mode, DIC[1] is used to load into EMRS
05257                                                          bit 10 - DQSN Enable/Disable field. By default, we
05258                                                          program the DDR's to drive the DQSN also. Set it to
05259                                                          1 if DQSN should be Hi-Z.
05260                                                              0 - DQSN Enable
05261                                                              1 - DQSN Disable */
05262 #else
05263     uint64_t dic                          : 2;
05264     uint64_t qs_dic                       : 2;
05265     uint64_t tskw                         : 2;
05266     uint64_t sil_lat                      : 2;
05267     uint64_t bprch                        : 1;
05268     uint64_t fprch2                       : 1;
05269     uint64_t mode128b                     : 1;
05270     uint64_t set_zero                     : 1;
05271     uint64_t inorder_mrf                  : 1;
05272     uint64_t inorder_mwf                  : 1;
05273     uint64_t r2r_slot                     : 1;
05274     uint64_t rdimm_ena                    : 1;
05275     uint64_t reserved_16_17               : 2;
05276     uint64_t max_write_batch              : 4;
05277     uint64_t xor_bank                     : 1;
05278     uint64_t slow_scf                     : 1;
05279     uint64_t ddr__pctl                    : 4;
05280     uint64_t ddr__nctl                    : 4;
05281     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
05282 #endif
05283     } cn38xx;
05284     struct cvmx_lmcx_ctl_cn38xx           cn38xxp2;
05285     struct cvmx_lmcx_ctl_cn50xx {
05286 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05287     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
05288     uint64_t ddr__nctl                    : 4;  /**< DDR nctl from compensation circuit
05289                                                          The encoded value on this will adjust the drive strength
05290                                                          of the DDR DQ pulldns. */
05291     uint64_t ddr__pctl                    : 4;  /**< DDR pctl from compensation circuit
05292                                                          The encoded value on this will adjust the drive strength
05293                                                          of the DDR DQ pullup. */
05294     uint64_t slow_scf                     : 1;  /**< Should be cleared to zero */
05295     uint64_t xor_bank                     : 1;  /**< If (XOR_BANK == 1), then
05296                                                            bank[n:0]=address[n+7:7] ^ address[n+7+5:7+5]
05297                                                          else
05298                                                            bank[n:0]=address[n+7:7]
05299                                                          where n=1 for a 4 bank part and n=2 for an 8 bank part */
05300     uint64_t max_write_batch              : 4;  /**< Maximum number of consecutive writes to service before
05301                                                          allowing reads to interrupt. */
05302     uint64_t reserved_17_17               : 1;
05303     uint64_t pll_bypass                   : 1;  /**< PLL Bypass. */
05304     uint64_t rdimm_ena                    : 1;  /**< Registered DIMM Enable - When set allows the use
05305                                                          of JEDEC Registered DIMMs which require Write
05306                                                          data to be registered in the controller. */
05307     uint64_t r2r_slot                     : 1;  /**< R2R Slot Enable: When set, all read-to-read trans
05308                                                          will slot an additional 1 cycle data bus bubble to
05309                                                          avoid DQ/DQS bus contention. This is only a CYA bit,
05310                                                          in case the "built-in" DIMM and RANK crossing logic
05311                                                          which should auto-detect and perfectly slot
05312                                                          read-to-reads to the same DIMM/RANK. */
05313     uint64_t inorder_mwf                  : 1;  /**< Reads as zero */
05314     uint64_t inorder_mrf                  : 1;  /**< Always clear to zero */
05315     uint64_t dreset                       : 1;  /**< Dclk domain reset.  The reset signal that is used by the
05316                                                          Dclk domain is (DRESET || ECLK_RESET). */
05317     uint64_t mode32b                      : 1;  /**< 32b data Path Mode
05318                                                          Set to 1 if we use 32 DQ pins
05319                                                          0 for 16b DQ mode. */
05320     uint64_t fprch2                       : 1;  /**< Front Porch Enable: When set, the turn-off
05321                                                          time for the DDR_DQ/DQS drivers is 1 dclk earlier.
05322                                                          This bit should typically be set. */
05323     uint64_t bprch                        : 1;  /**< Back Porch Enable: When set, the turn-on time for
05324                                                          the DDR_DQ/DQS drivers is delayed an additional DCLK
05325                                                          cycle. This should be set to one whenever both SILO_HC
