05326                                                          and SILO_QC are set. */
05327     uint64_t sil_lat                      : 2;  /**< SILO Latency: On reads, determines how many additional
05328                                                          dclks to wait (on top of TCL+1+TSKW) before pulling
05329                                                          data out of the pad silos.
05330                                                              - 00: illegal
05331                                                              - 01: 1 dclks
05332                                                              - 10: 2 dclks
05333                                                              - 11: illegal
05334                                                          This should always be set to 1. */
05335     uint64_t tskw                         : 2;  /**< This component is a representation of total BOARD
05336                                                          DELAY on DQ (used in the controller to determine the
05337                                                          R->W spacing to avoid DQS/DQ bus conflicts). Enter
05338                                                          the largest of the per byte Board delay
05339                                                              - 00: 0 dclk
05340                                                              - 01: 1 dclks
05341                                                              - 10: 2 dclks
05342                                                              - 11: 3 dclks */
05343     uint64_t qs_dic                       : 2;  /**< DDR2 Termination Resistor Setting
05344                                                          When in DDR2, a non Zero value in this register
05345                                                          enables the On Die Termination (ODT) in DDR parts.
05346                                                          These two bits are loaded into the RTT
05347                                                          portion of the EMRS register bits A6 & A2. If DDR2's
05348                                                          termination (for the memory's DQ/DQS/DM pads) is not
05349                                                          desired, set it to 00. If it is, chose between
05350                                                          01 for 75 ohm and 10 for 150 ohm termination.
05351                                                              00 = ODT Disabled
05352                                                              01 = 75 ohm Termination
05353                                                              10 = 150 ohm Termination
05354                                                              11 = 50 ohm Termination
05355                                                          Octeon, on writes, by default, drives the ODT
05356                                                          pins based on what the masks
05357                                                          (LMC_WODT_CTL) are programmed to.
05358                                                          LMC_DDR2_CTL->ODT_ENA enables Octeon to drive ODT pins
05359                                                          for READS. LMC_RODT_CTL needs to be programmed based
05360                                                          on the system's needs for ODT. */
05361     uint64_t dic                          : 2;  /**< Drive Strength Control:
05362                                                          DIC[0] is
05363                                                          loaded into the Extended Mode Register (EMRS) A1 bit
05364                                                          during initialization.
05365                                                              0 = Normal
05366                                                              1 = Reduced
05367                                                          DIC[1] is used to load into EMRS
05368                                                          bit 10 - DQSN Enable/Disable field. By default, we
05369                                                          program the DDR's to drive the DQSN also. Set it to
05370                                                          1 if DQSN should be Hi-Z.
05371                                                              0 - DQSN Enable
05372                                                              1 - DQSN Disable */
05373 #else
05374     uint64_t dic                          : 2;
05375     uint64_t qs_dic                       : 2;
05376     uint64_t tskw                         : 2;
05377     uint64_t sil_lat                      : 2;
05378     uint64_t bprch                        : 1;
05379     uint64_t fprch2                       : 1;
05380     uint64_t mode32b                      : 1;
05381     uint64_t dreset                       : 1;
05382     uint64_t inorder_mrf                  : 1;
05383     uint64_t inorder_mwf                  : 1;
05384     uint64_t r2r_slot                     : 1;
05385     uint64_t rdimm_ena                    : 1;
05386     uint64_t pll_bypass                   : 1;
05387     uint64_t reserved_17_17               : 1;
05388     uint64_t max_write_batch              : 4;
05389     uint64_t xor_bank                     : 1;
05390     uint64_t slow_scf                     : 1;
05391     uint64_t ddr__pctl                    : 4;
05392     uint64_t ddr__nctl                    : 4;
05393     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
05394 #endif
05395     } cn50xx;
05396     struct cvmx_lmcx_ctl_cn52xx {
05397 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05398     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
05399     uint64_t ddr__nctl                    : 4;  /**< DDR nctl from compensation circuit
05400                                                          The encoded value on this will adjust the drive strength
05401                                                          of the DDR DQ pulldns. */
05402     uint64_t ddr__pctl                    : 4;  /**< DDR pctl from compensation circuit
05403                                                          The encoded value on this will adjust the drive strength
05404                                                          of the DDR DQ pullup. */
05405     uint64_t slow_scf                     : 1;  /**< Always clear to zero */
05406     uint64_t xor_bank                     : 1;  /**< If (XOR_BANK == 1), then
05407                                                            bank[n:0]=address[n+7:7] ^ address[n+7+5:7+5]
05408                                                          else
05409                                                            bank[n:0]=address[n+7:7]
05410                                                          where n=1 for a 4 bank part and n=2 for an 8 bank part */
05411     uint64_t max_write_batch              : 4;  /**< Maximum number of consecutive writes to service before
05412                                                          allowing reads to interrupt. */
05413     uint64_t reserved_16_17               : 2;
05414     uint64_t rdimm_ena                    : 1;  /**< Registered DIMM Enable - When set allows the use
05415                                                          of JEDEC Registered DIMMs which require Write
05416                                                          data to be registered in the controller. */
05417     uint64_t r2r_slot                     : 1;  /**< R2R Slot Enable: When set, all read-to-read trans
05418                                                          will slot an additional 1 cycle data bus bubble to
05419                                                          avoid DQ/DQS bus contention. This is only a CYA bit,
05420                                                          in case the "built-in" DIMM and RANK crossing logic
05421                                                          which should auto-detect and perfectly slot
05422                                                          read-to-reads to the same DIMM/RANK. */
05423     uint64_t inorder_mwf                  : 1;  /**< Reads as zero */
05424     uint64_t inorder_mrf                  : 1;  /**< Always set to zero */
05425     uint64_t dreset                       : 1;  /**< MBZ
05426                                                          THIS IS OBSOLETE.  Use LMC_DLL_CTL[DRESET] instead. */
05427     uint64_t mode32b                      : 1;  /**< 32b data Path Mode
05428                                                          Set to 1 if we use only 32 DQ pins
05429                                                          0 for 64b DQ mode. */
05430     uint64_t fprch2                       : 1;  /**< Front Porch Enable: When set, the turn-off
05431                                                          time for the DDR_DQ/DQS drivers is 1 dclk earlier.
05432                                                          This bit should typically be set. */
05433     uint64_t bprch                        : 1;  /**< Back Porch Enable: When set, the turn-on time for
05434                                                          the DDR_DQ/DQS drivers is delayed an additional DCLK
05435                                                          cycle. This should be set to one whenever both SILO_HC
05436                                                          and SILO_QC are set. */
05437     uint64_t sil_lat                      : 2;  /**< SILO Latency: On reads, determines how many additional
05438                                                          dclks to wait (on top of TCL+1+TSKW) before pulling
05439                                                          data out of the pad silos.
05440                                                              - 00: illegal
05441                                                              - 01: 1 dclks
05442                                                              - 10: 2 dclks
05443                                                              - 11: illegal
05444                                                          This should always be set to 1.
05445                                                          THIS IS OBSOLETE.  Use READ_LEVEL_RANK instead. */
05446     uint64_t tskw                         : 2;  /**< This component is a representation of total BOARD
05447                                                          DELAY on DQ (used in the controller to determine the
05448                                                          R->W spacing to avoid DQS/DQ bus conflicts). Enter
05449                                                          the largest of the per byte Board delay
05450                                                              - 00: 0 dclk
05451                                                              - 01: 1 dclks
05452                                                              - 10: 2 dclks
05453                                                              - 11: 3 dclks
05454                                                          THIS IS OBSOLETE.  Use READ_LEVEL_RANK instead. */
05455     uint64_t qs_dic                       : 2;  /**< DDR2 Termination Resistor Setting
05456                                                          When in DDR2, a non Zero value in this register
05457                                                          enables the On Die Termination (ODT) in DDR parts.
05458                                                          These two bits are loaded into the RTT
05459                                                          portion of the EMRS register bits A6 & A2. If DDR2's
05460                                                          termination (for the memory's DQ/DQS/DM pads) is not
05461                                                          desired, set it to 00. If it is, chose between
05462                                                          01 for 75 ohm and 10 for 150 ohm termination.
05463                                                              00 = ODT Disabled
05464                                                              01 = 75 ohm Termination
05465                                                              10 = 150 ohm Termination
05466                                                              11 = 50 ohm Termination
05467                                                          Octeon, on writes, by default, drives the 4/8 ODT
05468                                                          pins (64/128b mode) based on what the masks
05469                                                          (LMC_WODT_CTL0 & 1) are programmed to.
05470                                                          LMC_DDR2_CTL->ODT_ENA enables Octeon to drive ODT pins
05471                                                          for READS. LMC_RODT_CTL needs to be programmed based
05472                                                          on the system's needs for ODT. */
05473     uint64_t dic                          : 2;  /**< Drive Strength Control:
05474                                                          DIC[0] is
05475                                                          loaded into the Extended Mode Register (EMRS) A1 bit
05476                                                          during initialization.
05477                                                              0 = Normal
05478                                                              1 = Reduced
05479                                                          DIC[1] is used to load into EMRS
05480                                                          bit 10 - DQSN Enable/Disable field. By default, we
05481                                                          program the DDR's to drive the DQSN also. Set it to
05482                                                          1 if DQSN should be Hi-Z.
05483                                                              0 - DQSN Enable
05484                                                              1 - DQSN Disable */
05485 #else
05486     uint64_t dic                          : 2;
05487     uint64_t qs_dic                       : 2;
05488     uint64_t tskw                         : 2;
05489     uint64_t sil_lat                      : 2;
05490     uint64_t bprch                        : 1;
05491     uint64_t fprch2                       : 1;
05492     uint64_t mode32b                      : 1;
05493     uint64_t dreset                       : 1;
05494     uint64_t inorder_mrf                  : 1;
05495     uint64_t inorder_mwf                  : 1;
05496     uint64_t r2r_slot                     : 1;
05497     uint64_t rdimm_ena                    : 1;
05498     uint64_t reserved_16_17               : 2;
05499     uint64_t max_write_batch              : 4;
05500     uint64_t xor_bank                     : 1;
05501     uint64_t slow_scf                     : 1;
05502     uint64_t ddr__pctl                    : 4;
05503     uint64_t ddr__nctl                    : 4;
05504     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
05505 #endif
05506     } cn52xx;
05507     struct cvmx_lmcx_ctl_cn52xx           cn52xxp1;
05508     struct cvmx_lmcx_ctl_cn52xx           cn56xx;
05509     struct cvmx_lmcx_ctl_cn52xx           cn56xxp1;
05510     struct cvmx_lmcx_ctl_cn58xx {
05511 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05512     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
05513     uint64_t ddr__nctl                    : 4;  /**< DDR nctl from compensation circuit
05514                                                          The encoded value on this will adjust the drive strength
05515                                                          of the DDR DQ pulldns. */
05516     uint64_t ddr__pctl                    : 4;  /**< DDR pctl from compensation circuit
05517                                                          The encoded value on this will adjust the drive strength
05518                                                          of the DDR DQ pullup. */
05519     uint64_t slow_scf                     : 1;  /**< Should be cleared to zero */
05520     uint64_t xor_bank                     : 1;  /**< If (XOR_BANK == 1), then
05521                                                            bank[n:0]=address[n+7:7] ^ address[n+7+5:7+5]
05522                                                          else
05523                                                            bank[n:0]=address[n+7:7]
05524                                                          where n=1 for a 4 bank part and n=2 for an 8 bank part */
05525     uint64_t max_write_batch              : 4;  /**< Maximum number of consecutive writes to service before
05526                                                          allowing reads to interrupt. */
05527     uint64_t reserved_16_17               : 2;
05528     uint64_t rdimm_ena                    : 1;  /**< Registered DIMM Enable - When set allows the use
05529                                                          of JEDEC Registered DIMMs which require Write
05530                                                          data to be registered in the controller. */
05531     uint64_t r2r_slot                     : 1;  /**< R2R Slot Enable: When set, all read-to-read trans
05532                                                          will slot an additional 1 cycle data bus bubble to
05533                                                          avoid DQ/DQS bus contention. This is only a CYA bit,
05534                                                          in case the "built-in" DIMM and RANK crossing logic
05535                                                          which should auto-detect and perfectly slot
05536                                                          read-to-reads to the same DIMM/RANK. */
05537     uint64_t inorder_mwf                  : 1;  /**< Reads as zero */
05538     uint64_t inorder_mrf                  : 1;  /**< Always clear to zero */
05539     uint64_t dreset                       : 1;  /**< Dclk domain reset.  The reset signal that is used by the
05540                                                          Dclk domain is (DRESET || ECLK_RESET). */
05541     uint64_t mode128b                     : 1;  /**< 128b data Path Mode
05542                                                          Set to 1 if we use all 128 DQ pins
05543                                                          0 for 64b DQ mode. */
05544     uint64_t fprch2                       : 1;  /**< Front Porch Enable: When set, the turn-off
05545                                                          time for the DDR_DQ/DQS drivers is 1 dclk earlier.
05546                                                          This bit should typically be set. */
05547     uint64_t bprch                        : 1;  /**< Back Porch Enable: When set, the turn-on time for
05548                                                          the DDR_DQ/DQS drivers is delayed an additional DCLK
05549                                                          cycle. This should be set to one whenever both SILO_HC
05550                                                          and SILO_QC are set. */
05551     uint64_t sil_lat                      : 2;  /**< SILO Latency: On reads, determines how many additional
05552                                                          dclks to wait (on top of TCL+1+TSKW) before pulling
05553                                                          data out of the pad silos.
05554                                                              - 00: illegal
05555                                                              - 01: 1 dclks
05556                                                              - 10: 2 dclks
05557                                                              - 11: illegal
05558                                                          This should always be set to 1. */
05559     uint64_t tskw                         : 2;  /**< This component is a representation of total BOARD
05560                                                          DELAY on DQ (used in the controller to determine the
05561                                                          R->W spacing to avoid DQS/DQ bus conflicts). Enter
05562                                                          the largest of the per byte Board delay
05563                                                              - 00: 0 dclk
05564                                                              - 01: 1 dclks
05565                                                              - 10: 2 dclks
05566                                                              - 11: 3 dclks */
05567     uint64_t qs_dic                       : 2;  /**< DDR2 Termination Resistor Setting
05568                                                          A non Zero value in this register
05569                                                          enables the On Die Termination (ODT) in DDR parts.
05570                                                          These two bits are loaded into the RTT
05571                                                          portion of the EMRS register bits A6 & A2. If DDR2's
05572                                                          termination (for the memory's DQ/DQS/DM pads) is not
05573                                                          desired, set it to 00. If it is, chose between
05574                                                          01 for 75 ohm and 10 for 150 ohm termination.
05575                                                              00 = ODT Disabled
05576                                                              01 = 75 ohm Termination
05577                                                              10 = 150 ohm Termination
05578                                                              11 = 50 ohm Termination
05579                                                          Octeon, on writes, by default, drives the 4/8 ODT
05580                                                          pins (64/128b mode) based on what the masks
05581                                                          (LMC_WODT_CTL) are programmed to.
05582                                                          LMC_DDR2_CTL->ODT_ENA enables Octeon to drive ODT pins
05583                                                          for READS. LMC_RODT_CTL needs to be programmed based
05584                                                          on the system's needs for ODT. */
05585     uint64_t dic                          : 2;  /**< Drive Strength Control:
05586                                                          DIC[0] is
05587                                                          loaded into the Extended Mode Register (EMRS) A1 bit
05588                                                          during initialization.
05589                                                              0 = Normal
05590                                                              1 = Reduced
05591                                                          DIC[1] is used to load into EMRS
05592                                                          bit 10 - DQSN Enable/Disable field. By default, we
05593                                                          program the DDR's to drive the DQSN also. Set it to
05594                                                          1 if DQSN should be Hi-Z.
05595                                                              0 - DQSN Enable
05596                                                              1 - DQSN Disable */
05597 #else
05598     uint64_t dic                          : 2;
05599     uint64_t qs_dic                       : 2;
05600     uint64_t tskw                         : 2;
05601     uint64_t sil_lat                      : 2;
05602     uint64_t bprch                        : 1;
05603     uint64_t fprch2                       : 1;
05604     uint64_t mode128b                     : 1;
05605     uint64_t dreset                       : 1;
05606     uint64_t inorder_mrf                  : 1;
05607     uint64_t inorder_mwf                  : 1;
05608     uint64_t r2r_slot                     : 1;
05609     uint64_t rdimm_ena                    : 1;
05610     uint64_t reserved_16_17               : 2;
05611     uint64_t max_write_batch              : 4;
05612     uint64_t xor_bank                     : 1;
05613     uint64_t slow_scf                     : 1;
05614     uint64_t ddr__pctl                    : 4;
05615     uint64_t ddr__nctl                    : 4;
05616     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
05617 #endif
05618     } cn58xx;
05619     struct cvmx_lmcx_ctl_cn58xx           cn58xxp1;
05620 };
05621 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_ctl cvmx_lmcx_ctl_t;
05622 
05623 /**
05624  * cvmx_lmc#_ctl1
05625  *
05626  * LMC_CTL1 = LMC Control1
05627  * This register is an assortment of various control fields needed by the memory controller
05628  */
05629 union cvmx_lmcx_ctl1 {
05630     uint64_t u64;
05631     struct cvmx_lmcx_ctl1_s {
05632 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05633     uint64_t reserved_21_63               : 43;
05634     uint64_t ecc_adr                      : 1;  /**< Include memory reference address in the ECC calculation
05635                                                          0=disabled, 1=enabled */
05636     uint64_t forcewrite                   : 4;  /**< Force the oldest outstanding write to complete after
05637                                                          having waited for 2^FORCEWRITE cycles.  0=disabled. */
05638     uint64_t idlepower                    : 3;  /**< Enter power-down mode after the memory controller has
05639                                                          been idle for 2^(2+IDLEPOWER) cycles.  0=disabled. */
05640     uint64_t sequence                     : 3;  /**< Instruction sequence that is run after a 0->1 transition
05641                                                          on LMC_MEM_CFG0[INIT_START].
05642                                                          0=DDR2 power-up/init, 1=read-leveling
05643                                                          2=self-refresh entry, 3=self-refresh exit,
05644                                                          4=power-down entry, 5=power-down exit, 6=7=illegal */
05645     uint64_t sil_mode                     : 1;  /**< Read Silo mode.  0=envelope, 1=self-timed. */
05646     uint64_t dcc_enable                   : 1;  /**< Duty Cycle Corrector Enable.
05647                                                          0=disable, 1=enable
05648                                                          If the memory part does not support DCC, then this bit
05649                                                          must be set to 0. */
05650     uint64_t reserved_2_7                 : 6;
05651     uint64_t data_layout                  : 2;  /**< Logical data layout per DQ byte lane:
05652                                                          In 32b mode, this setting has no effect and the data
05653                                                          layout DQ[35:0] is the following:
05654                                                              [E[3:0], D[31:24], D[23:16], D[15:8], D[7:0]]
05655                                                          In 16b mode, the DQ[35:0] layouts are the following:
05656                                                          0 - [0[3:0], 0[7:0], [0[7:2], E[1:0]], D[15:8], D[7:0]]
05657                                                          1 - [0[3:0], [0[7:2], E[1:0]], D[15:8], D[7:0], 0[7:0]]
05658                                                          2 - [[0[1:0], E[1:0]], D[15:8], D[7:0], 0[7:0], 0[7:0]]
05659                                                          where E means ecc, D means data, and 0 means unused
05660                                                          (ignored on reads and written as 0 on writes) */
05661 #else
05662     uint64_t data_layout                  : 2;
05663     uint64_t reserved_2_7                 : 6;
05664     uint64_t dcc_enable                   : 1;
05665     uint64_t sil_mode                     : 1;
05666     uint64_t sequence                     : 3;
05667     uint64_t idlepower                    : 3;
05668     uint64_t forcewrite                   : 4;
05669     uint64_t ecc_adr                      : 1;
05670     uint64_t reserved_21_63               : 43;
05671 #endif
05672     } s;
05673     struct cvmx_lmcx_ctl1_cn30xx {
05674 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05675     uint64_t reserved_2_63                : 62;
05676     uint64_t data_layout                  : 2;  /**< Logical data layout per DQ byte lane:
05677                                                          In 32b mode, this setting has no effect and the data
05678                                                          layout DQ[35:0] is the following:
05679                                                              [E[3:0], D[31:24], D[23:16], D[15:8], D[7:0]]
05680                                                          In 16b mode, the DQ[35:0] layouts are the following:
05681                                                          0 - [0[3:0], 0[7:0], [0[7:2], E[1:0]], D[15:8], D[7:0]]
05682                                                          1 - [0[3:0], [0[7:2], E[1:0]], D[15:8], D[7:0], 0[7:0]]
05683                                                          2 - [[0[1:0], E[1:0]], D[15:8], D[7:0], 0[7:0], 0[7:0]]
05684                                                          where E means ecc, D means data, and 0 means unused
05685                                                          (ignored on reads and written as 0 on writes) */
05686 #else
05687     uint64_t data_layout                  : 2;
05688     uint64_t reserved_2_63                : 62;
05689 #endif
05690     } cn30xx;
05691     struct cvmx_lmcx_ctl1_cn50xx {
05692 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05693     uint64_t reserved_10_63               : 54;
05694     uint64_t sil_mode                     : 1;  /**< Read Silo mode.  0=envelope, 1=self-timed. */
05695     uint64_t dcc_enable                   : 1;  /**< Duty Cycle Corrector Enable.
05696                                                          0=disable, 1=enable
05697                                                          If the memory part does not support DCC, then this bit
05698                                                          must be set to 0. */
05699     uint64_t reserved_2_7                 : 6;
05700     uint64_t data_layout                  : 2;  /**< Logical data layout per DQ byte lane:
05701                                                          In 32b mode, this setting has no effect and the data
05702                                                          layout DQ[35:0] is the following:
05703                                                              [E[3:0], D[31:24], D[23:16], D[15:8], D[7:0]]
05704                                                          In 16b mode, the DQ[35:0] layouts are the following:
05705                                                          0 - [0[3:0], 0[7:0], [0[7:2], E[1:0]], D[15:8], D[7:0]]
05706                                                          1 - [0[3:0], [0[7:2], E[1:0]], D[15:8], D[7:0], 0[7:0]]
05707                                                          2 - [[0[1:0], E[1:0]], D[15:8], D[7:0], 0[7:0], 0[7:0]]
05708                                                          where E means ecc, D means data, and 0 means unused
05709                                                          (ignored on reads and written as 0 on writes) */
05710 #else
05711     uint64_t data_layout                  : 2;
05712     uint64_t reserved_2_7                 : 6;
05713     uint64_t dcc_enable                   : 1;
05714     uint64_t sil_mode                     : 1;
05715     uint64_t reserved_10_63               : 54;
05716 #endif
05717     } cn50xx;
05718     struct cvmx_lmcx_ctl1_cn52xx {
05719 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05720     uint64_t reserved_21_63               : 43;
05721     uint64_t ecc_adr                      : 1;  /**< Include memory reference address in the ECC calculation
05722                                                          0=disabled, 1=enabled */
05723     uint64_t forcewrite                   : 4;  /**< Force the oldest outstanding write to complete after
05724                                                          having waited for 2^FORCEWRITE cycles.  0=disabled. */
05725     uint64_t idlepower                    : 3;  /**< Enter power-down mode after the memory controller has
05726                                                          been idle for 2^(2+IDLEPOWER) cycles.  0=disabled. */
05727     uint64_t sequence                     : 3;  /**< Instruction sequence that is run after a 0->1 transition
05728                                                          on LMC_MEM_CFG0[INIT_START].
05729                                                          0=DDR2 power-up/init, 1=read-leveling
05730                                                          2=self-refresh entry, 3=self-refresh exit,
05731                                                          4=power-down entry, 5=power-down exit, 6=7=illegal */
05732     uint64_t sil_mode                     : 1;  /**< Read Silo mode.  0=envelope, 1=self-timed. */
05733     uint64_t dcc_enable                   : 1;  /**< Duty Cycle Corrector Enable.
05734                                                          0=disable, 1=enable
05735                                                          If the memory part does not support DCC, then this bit
05736                                                          must be set to 0. */
05737     uint64_t reserved_0_7                 : 8;
05738 #else
05739     uint64_t reserved_0_7                 : 8;
05740     uint64_t dcc_enable                   : 1;
05741     uint64_t sil_mode                     : 1;
05742     uint64_t sequence                     : 3;
05743     uint64_t idlepower                    : 3;
05744     uint64_t forcewrite                   : 4;
05745     uint64_t ecc_adr                      : 1;
05746     uint64_t reserved_21_63               : 43;
05747 #endif
05748     } cn52xx;
05749     struct cvmx_lmcx_ctl1_cn52xx          cn52xxp1;
05750     struct cvmx_lmcx_ctl1_cn52xx          cn56xx;
05751     struct cvmx_lmcx_ctl1_cn52xx          cn56xxp1;
05752     struct cvmx_lmcx_ctl1_cn58xx {
05753 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05754     uint64_t reserved_10_63               : 54;
05755     uint64_t sil_mode                     : 1;  /**< Read Silo mode.  0=envelope, 1=self-timed. */
05756     uint64_t dcc_enable                   : 1;  /**< Duty Cycle Corrector Enable.
05757                                                          0=disable, 1=enable
05758                                                          If the memory part does not support DCC, then this bit
05759                                                          must be set to 0. */
05760     uint64_t reserved_0_7                 : 8;
05761 #else
05762     uint64_t reserved_0_7                 : 8;
05763     uint64_t dcc_enable                   : 1;
05764     uint64_t sil_mode                     : 1;
05765     uint64_t reserved_10_63               : 54;
05766 #endif
05767     } cn58xx;
05768     struct cvmx_lmcx_ctl1_cn58xx          cn58xxp1;
05769 };
05770 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_ctl1 cvmx_lmcx_ctl1_t;
05771 
05772 /**
05773  * cvmx_lmc#_dbtrain_ctl
05774  *
05775  * Reserved.
05776  *
05777  */
05778 union cvmx_lmcx_dbtrain_ctl {
05779     uint64_t u64;
05780     struct cvmx_lmcx_dbtrain_ctl_s {
05781 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05782     uint64_t reserved_63_63               : 1;
05783     uint64_t lfsr_pattern_sel             : 1;  /**< If set high, the sequence uses 32-bit LFSR pattern when generating data sequence
05784                                                          during the general R/W training (LMC()_DBTRAIN_CTL[RW_TRAIN] = 1). */
05785     uint64_t cmd_count_ext                : 2;  /**< Extension bits to the field DBTRAIN_CTL[READ_CMD_COUNT]. This enables
05786                                                          up to 128 read and write commands. */
05787     uint64_t db_output_impedance          : 3;  /**< Reserved. */
05788     uint64_t db_sel                       : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
05789     uint64_t tccd_sel                     : 1;  /**< When set, the sequence uses MODEREG_PARAMS3[TCCD_L] to space out
05790                                                          back-to-back read commands. Otherwise it will space out back-to-back
05791                                                          reads with a default value of 4 cycles.
05792                                                          While in DRAM MPR mode, reads from Page 0 may use tCCD_S or tCCD_L.
05793                                                          Reads from Pages 1, 2 or 3 however must use tCCD_L, thereby requring
05794                                                          this bit to be set. */
05795     uint64_t rw_train                     : 1;  /**< When set, the sequence will perform a Write to the DRAM
05796                                                          memory array using burst patern that are set in the CSRs
05797                                                          LMC()_GENERAL_PURPOSE0[DATA]<61:0>, LMC()_GENERAL_PURPOSE1[DATA]<61:0> and
05798                                                          LMC()_GENERAL_PURPOSE2[DATA]<15:0>.
05799                                                          This burst pattern gets shifted by one byte at every cycle.
05800                                                          The sequence will then do the reads to the same location and compare
05801                                                          the data coming back with this pattern.
05802                                                          The bit-wise comparison result gets stored in
05803                                                          LMC()_MPR_DATA0[MPR_DATA]<63:0> and LMC()_MPR_DATA1[MPR_DATA]<7:0>. */
05804     uint64_t read_dq_count                : 7;  /**< Reserved. */
05805     uint64_t read_cmd_count               : 5;  /**< The amount of Read and Write Commands to be sent during the R/W training. */
05806     uint64_t write_ena                    : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
05807     uint64_t activate                     : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
05808     uint64_t prank                        : 2;  /**< Physical rank bits for read/write/activate operation. */
05809     uint64_t lrank                        : 3;  /**< Reserved. */
05810     uint64_t row_a                        : 18; /**< The row address for the Activate command. */
05811     uint64_t bg                           : 2;  /**< The bank group that the R/W commands are directed to. */
05812     uint64_t ba                           : 2;  /**< The bank address for the R/W commands are directed to. */
05813     uint64_t column_a                     : 13; /**< Column address for the R/W operation. */
05814 #else
05815     uint64_t column_a                     : 13;
05816     uint64_t ba                           : 2;
05817     uint64_t bg                           : 2;
05818     uint64_t row_a                        : 18;
05819     uint64_t lrank                        : 3;
05820     uint64_t prank                        : 2;
05821     uint64_t activate                     : 1;
05822     uint64_t write_ena                    : 1;
05823     uint64_t read_cmd_count               : 5;
05824     uint64_t read_dq_count                : 7;
05825     uint64_t rw_train                     : 1;
05826     uint64_t tccd_sel                     : 1;
05827     uint64_t db_sel                       : 1;
05828     uint64_t db_output_impedance          : 3;
05829     uint64_t cmd_count_ext                : 2;
05830     uint64_t lfsr_pattern_sel             : 1;
05831     uint64_t reserved_63_63               : 1;
05832 #endif
05833     } s;
05834     struct cvmx_lmcx_dbtrain_ctl_cn73xx {
05835 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05836     uint64_t reserved_60_63               : 4;
05837     uint64_t db_output_impedance          : 3;  /**< Reserved. */
05838     uint64_t db_sel                       : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
05839     uint64_t tccd_sel                     : 1;  /**< When set, the sequence uses MODEREG_PARAMS3[TCCD_L] to space out
05840                                                          back-to-back read commands. Otherwise it will space out back-to-back
05841                                                          reads with a default value of 4 cycles.
05842                                                          While in DRAM MPR mode, reads from page 0 may use tCCD_S or tCCD_L.
05843                                                          Reads from pages 1, 2 or 3 however must use tCCD_L, thereby requiring
05844                                                          this bit to be set. */
05845     uint64_t rw_train                     : 1;  /**< When set, the sequence will perform a Write to the DRAM
05846                                                          memory array using burst patern that are set in the CSRs
05847                                                          LMC()_GENERAL_PURPOSE0[DATA]<61:0>, LMC()_GENERAL_PURPOSE1[DATA]<61:0> and
05848                                                          LMC()_GENERAL_PURPOSE2[DATA]<15:0>.
05849                                                          This burst pattern gets shifted by one byte at every cycle.
05850                                                          The sequence will then do the reads to the same location and compare
05851                                                          the data coming back with this pattern.
05852                                                          The bit-wise comparison result gets stored in
05853                                                          LMC()_MPR_DATA0[MPR_DATA]<63:0> and LMC()_MPR_DATA1[MPR_DATA]<7:0>. */
05854     uint64_t read_dq_count                : 7;  /**< The amount of cycles until a pulse is issued to sample the DQ into the
05855                                                          MPR register. This bits control the timing of when to sample the data
05856                                                          buffer training result. */
05857     uint64_t read_cmd_count               : 5;  /**< The amount of Read and Write Commands to be sent during the R/W training. */
05858     uint64_t write_ena                    : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
05859     uint64_t activate                     : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
05860     uint64_t prank                        : 2;  /**< Physical rank bits for read/write/activate operation. */
05861     uint64_t lrank                        : 3;  /**< Reserved. */
05862     uint64_t row_a                        : 18; /**< The row address for the activate command. */
05863     uint64_t bg                           : 2;  /**< The bank group that the R/W commands are directed to. */
05864     uint64_t ba                           : 2;  /**< The bank address that the R/W commands are directed to. */
05865     uint64_t column_a                     : 13; /**< Column address for the R/W operation. */
05866 #else
05867     uint64_t column_a                     : 13;
05868     uint64_t ba                           : 2;
05869     uint64_t bg                           : 2;
05870     uint64_t row_a                        : 18;
05871     uint64_t lrank                        : 3;
05872     uint64_t prank                        : 2;
05873     uint64_t activate                     : 1;
05874     uint64_t write_ena                    : 1;
05875     uint64_t read_cmd_count               : 5;
05876     uint64_t read_dq_count                : 7;
05877     uint64_t rw_train                     : 1;
05878     uint64_t tccd_sel                     : 1;
05879     uint64_t db_sel                       : 1;
05880     uint64_t db_output_impedance          : 3;
05881     uint64_t reserved_60_63               : 4;
05882 #endif
05883     } cn73xx;
05884     struct cvmx_lmcx_dbtrain_ctl_s        cn78xx;
05885     struct cvmx_lmcx_dbtrain_ctl_cnf75xx {
05886 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05887     uint64_t reserved_62_63               : 2;
05888     uint64_t cmd_count_ext                : 2;  /**< Extension bits to the field DBTRAIN_CTL[READ_CMD_COUNT]. This enables
05889                                                          up to 128 read and write commands. */
05890     uint64_t db_output_impedance          : 3;  /**< Reserved. */
05891     uint64_t db_sel                       : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
05892     uint64_t tccd_sel                     : 1;  /**< When set, the sequence uses MODEREG_PARAMS3[TCCD_L] to space out
05893                                                          back-to-back read commands. Otherwise it will space out back-to-back
05894                                                          reads with a default value of 4 cycles.
05895                                                          While in DRAM MPR mode, reads from Page 0 may use tCCD_S or tCCD_L.
05896                                                          Reads from Pages 1, 2 or 3 however must use tCCD_L, thereby requring
05897                                                          this bit to be set. */
05898     uint64_t rw_train                     : 1;  /**< When set, the sequence will perform a Write to the DRAM
05899                                                          memory array using burst patern that are set in the CSRs
05900                                                          LMC()_GENERAL_PURPOSE0[DATA]<61:0>, LMC()_GENERAL_PURPOSE1[DATA]<61:0> and
05901                                                          LMC()_GENERAL_PURPOSE2[DATA]<15:0>.
05902                                                          This burst pattern gets shifted by one byte at every cycle.
05903                                                          The sequence will then do the reads to the same location and compare
05904                                                          the data coming back with this pattern.
05905                                                          The bit-wise comparison result gets stored in
05906                                                          LMC()_MPR_DATA0[MPR_DATA]<63:0> and LMC()_MPR_DATA1[MPR_DATA]<7:0>. */
05907     uint64_t read_dq_count                : 7;  /**< Reserved. */
05908     uint64_t read_cmd_count               : 5;  /**< The amount of Read and Write Commands to be sent during the R/W training. */
05909     uint64_t write_ena                    : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
05910     uint64_t activate                     : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
05911     uint64_t prank                        : 2;  /**< Physical rank bits for read/write/activate operation. */
05912     uint64_t lrank                        : 3;  /**< Reserved. */
05913     uint64_t row_a                        : 18; /**< The row address for the Activate command. */
05914     uint64_t bg                           : 2;  /**< The bank group that the R/W commands are directed to. */
05915     uint64_t ba                           : 2;  /**< The bank address for the R/W commands are directed to. */
05916     uint64_t column_a                     : 13; /**< Column address for the R/W operation. */
05917 #else
05918     uint64_t column_a                     : 13;
05919     uint64_t ba                           : 2;
05920     uint64_t bg                           : 2;
05921     uint64_t row_a                        : 18;
05922     uint64_t lrank                        : 3;
05923     uint64_t prank                        : 2;
05924     uint64_t activate                     : 1;
05925     uint64_t write_ena                    : 1;
05926     uint64_t read_cmd_count               : 5;
05927     uint64_t read_dq_count                : 7;
05928     uint64_t rw_train                     : 1;
05929     uint64_t tccd_sel                     : 1;
05930     uint64_t db_sel                       : 1;
05931     uint64_t db_output_impedance          : 3;
05932     uint64_t cmd_count_ext                : 2;
05933     uint64_t reserved_62_63               : 2;
05934 #endif
05935     } cnf75xx;
05936 };
05937 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_dbtrain_ctl cvmx_lmcx_dbtrain_ctl_t;
05938 
05939 /**
05940  * cvmx_lmc#_dclk_cnt
05941  *
05942  * LMC_DCLK_CNT  = Performance Counters
05943  *
05944  */
05945 union cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt {
05946     uint64_t u64;
05947     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_s {
05948 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05949     uint64_t dclkcnt                      : 64; /**< Performance counter. A 64-bit counter that increments every CK cycle. */
05950 #else
05951     uint64_t dclkcnt                      : 64;
05952 #endif
05953     } s;
05954     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_s           cn61xx;
05955     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_s           cn63xx;
05956     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_s           cn63xxp1;
05957     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_s           cn66xx;
05958     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_s           cn68xx;
05959     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_s           cn68xxp1;
05960     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_s           cn70xx;
05961     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_s           cn70xxp1;
05962     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_s           cn73xx;
05963     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_s           cn78xx;
05964     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_s           cn78xxp1;
05965     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_s           cnf71xx;
05966     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_s           cnf75xx;
05967 };
05968 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_t;
05969 
05970 /**
05971  * cvmx_lmc#_dclk_cnt_hi
05972  *
05973  * LMC_DCLK_CNT_HI  = Performance Counters
05974  *
05975  */
05976 union cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_hi {
05977     uint64_t u64;
05978     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_hi_s {
05979 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05980     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
05981     uint64_t dclkcnt_hi                   : 32; /**< Performance Counter that counts dclks
05982                                                          Upper 32-bits of a 64-bit counter. */
05983 #else
05984     uint64_t dclkcnt_hi                   : 32;
05985     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
05986 #endif
05987     } s;
05988     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_hi_s        cn30xx;
05989     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_hi_s        cn31xx;
05990     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_hi_s        cn38xx;
05991     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_hi_s        cn38xxp2;
05992     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_hi_s        cn50xx;
05993     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_hi_s        cn52xx;
05994     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_hi_s        cn52xxp1;
05995     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_hi_s        cn56xx;
05996     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_hi_s        cn56xxp1;
05997     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_hi_s        cn58xx;
05998     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_hi_s        cn58xxp1;
05999 };
06000 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_hi cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_hi_t;
06001 
06002 /**
06003  * cvmx_lmc#_dclk_cnt_lo
06004  *
06005  * LMC_DCLK_CNT_LO  = Performance Counters
06006  *
06007  */
06008 union cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_lo {
06009     uint64_t u64;
06010     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_lo_s {
06011 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
06012     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
06013     uint64_t dclkcnt_lo                   : 32; /**< Performance Counter that counts dclks
06014                                                          Lower 32-bits of a 64-bit counter. */
06015 #else
06016     uint64_t dclkcnt_lo                   : 32;
06017     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
06018 #endif
06019     } s;
06020     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_lo_s        cn30xx;
06021     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_lo_s        cn31xx;
06022     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_lo_s        cn38xx;
06023     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_lo_s        cn38xxp2;
06024     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_lo_s        cn50xx;
06025     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_lo_s        cn52xx;
06026     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_lo_s        cn52xxp1;
06027     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_lo_s        cn56xx;
06028     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_lo_s        cn56xxp1;
06029     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_lo_s        cn58xx;
06030     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_lo_s        cn58xxp1;
06031 };
06032 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_lo cvmx_lmcx_dclk_cnt_lo_t;
06033 
06034 /**
06035  * cvmx_lmc#_dclk_ctl
06036  *
06037  * LMC_DCLK_CTL = LMC DCLK generation control
06038  *
06039  *
06040  * Notes:
06041  * This CSR is only relevant for LMC1. LMC0_DCLK_CTL is not used.
06042  *
06043  */
06044 union cvmx_lmcx_dclk_ctl {
06045     uint64_t u64;
06046     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_ctl_s {
06047 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
06048     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
06049     uint64_t off90_ena                    : 1;  /**< 0=use global DCLK (i.e. the PLL) directly for LMC1
06050                                                          1=use the 90 degree DCLK DLL to offset LMC1 DCLK */
06051     uint64_t dclk90_byp                   : 1;  /**< 0=90 degree DCLK DLL uses sampled delay from LMC0
06052                                                          1=90 degree DCLK DLL uses DCLK90_VLU
06053                                                          See DCLK90_VLU. */
06054     uint64_t dclk90_ld                    : 1;  /**< The 90 degree DCLK DLL samples the delay setting
06055                                                          from LMC0's DLL when this field transitions 0->1 */
06056     uint64_t dclk90_vlu                   : 5;  /**< Manual open-loop delay setting.
06057                                                          The LMC1 90 degree DCLK DLL uses DCLK90_VLU rather
06058                                                          than the delay setting sampled from LMC0 when
06059                                                          DCLK90_BYP=1. */
06060 #else
06061     uint64_t dclk90_vlu                   : 5;
06062     uint64_t dclk90_ld                    : 1;
06063     uint64_t dclk90_byp                   : 1;
06064     uint64_t off90_ena                    : 1;
06065     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
06066 #endif
06067     } s;
06068     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_ctl_s           cn56xx;
06069     struct cvmx_lmcx_dclk_ctl_s           cn56xxp1;
06070 };
06071 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_dclk_ctl cvmx_lmcx_dclk_ctl_t;
06072 
06073 /**
06074  * cvmx_lmc#_ddr2_ctl
06075  *
06076  * LMC_DDR2_CTL = LMC DDR2 & DLL Control Register
06077  *
06078  */
06079 union cvmx_lmcx_ddr2_ctl {
06080     uint64_t u64;
06081     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr2_ctl_s {
06082 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
06083     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
06084     uint64_t bank8                        : 1;  /**< For 8 bank DDR2 parts
06085                                                          1 - DDR2 parts have 8 internal banks (BA is 3 bits
06086                                                          wide).
06087                                                          0 - DDR2 parts have 4 internal banks (BA is 2 bits
06088                                                          wide). */
06089     uint64_t burst8                       : 1;  /**< 8-burst mode.
06090                                                          1 - DDR data transfer happens in burst of 8
06091                                                          0 - DDR data transfer happens in burst of 4
06092                                                          BURST8 should be set when DDR2T is set
06093                                                          to minimize the command bandwidth loss. */
06094     uint64_t addlat                       : 3;  /**< Additional Latency for posted CAS
06095                                                          When Posted CAS is on, this configures the additional
06096                                                          latency. This should be set to
06097                                                                 1 .. LMC_MEM_CFG1[TRCD]-2
06098                                                          (Note the implication that posted CAS should not
06099                                                          be used when tRCD is two.) */
06100     uint64_t pocas                        : 1;  /**< Enable the Posted CAS feature of DDR2. */
06101     uint64_t bwcnt                        : 1;  /**< Bus utilization counter Clear.
06102                                                          Clears the LMC_OPS_CNT_*, LMC_IFB_CNT_*, and
06103                                                          LMC_DCLK_CNT_* registers. SW should first write this
06104                                                          field to a one, then write this field to a zero to
06105                                                          clear the CSR's. */
06106     uint64_t twr                          : 3;  /**< DDR Write Recovery time (tWR). Last Wr Brst to Pre delay
06107                                                          This is not a direct encoding of the value. Its
06108                                                          programmed as below per DDR2 spec. The decimal number
06109                                                          on the right is RNDUP(tWR(ns) / tCYC(ns))
06110                                                           TYP=15ns
06111                                                              - 000: RESERVED
06112                                                              - 001: 2
06113                                                              - 010: 3
06114                                                              - 011: 4
06115                                                              - 100: 5
06116                                                              - 101: 6
06117                                                              - 110: 7
06118                                                              - 111: 8 */
06119     uint64_t silo_hc                      : 1;  /**< Delays the read sample window by a Half Cycle. */
06120     uint64_t ddr_eof                      : 4;  /**< Early Fill Counter Init.
06121                                                          L2 needs to know a few cycle before a fill completes so
06122                                                          it can get its Control pipe started (for better overall
06123                                                          performance). This counter contains  an init value which
06124                                                          is a function of Eclk/Dclk ratio to account for the
06125                                                          asynchronous boundary between L2 cache and the DRAM
06126                                                          controller. This init value will
06127                                                          determine when to safely let the L2 know that a fill
06128                                                          termination is coming up.
06129                                                          Set DDR_EOF according to the following rule:
06130                                                          eclkFreq/dclkFreq = dclkPeriod/eclkPeriod = RATIO
06131                                                                 RATIO < 6/6  -> illegal
06132                                                          6/6 <= RATIO < 6/5  -> DDR_EOF=3
06133                                                          6/5 <= RATIO < 6/4  -> DDR_EOF=3
06134                                                          6/4 <= RATIO < 6/3  -> DDR_EOF=2
06135                                                          6/3 <= RATIO < 6/2  -> DDR_EOF=1
06136                                                          6/2 <= RATIO < 6/1  -> DDR_EOF=0
06137                                                          6/1 <= RATIO        -> DDR_EOF=0 */
06138     uint64_t tfaw                         : 5;  /**< tFAW - Cycles = RNDUP[tFAW(ns)/tcyc(ns)] - 1
06139                                                          Four Access Window time. Relevant only in DDR2 AND in
06140                                                          8-bank parts.
06141                                                              tFAW = 5'b0 in DDR2-4bank
06142                                                              tFAW = RNDUP[tFAW(ns)/tcyc(ns)] - 1
06143                                                                       in DDR2-8bank */
06144     uint64_t crip_mode                    : 1;  /**< Cripple Mode - When set, the LMC allows only
06145                                                          1 inflight transaction (.vs. 8 in normal mode).
06146                                                          This bit is ONLY to be set at power-on and
06147                                                          should not be set for normal use. */
06148     uint64_t ddr2t                        : 1;  /**< Turn on the DDR 2T mode. 2 cycle window for CMD and
06149                                                          address. This mode helps relieve setup time pressure
06150                                                          on the Address and command bus which nominally have
06151                                                          a very large fanout. Please refer to Micron's tech
06152                                                          note tn_47_01 titled "DDR2-533 Memory Design Guide
06153                                                          for Two Dimm Unbuffered Systems" for physical details.
06154                                                          BURST8 should be set when DDR2T is set to minimize
06155                                                          add/cmd loss. */
06156     uint64_t odt_ena                      : 1;  /**< Enable Obsolete ODT on Reads
06157                                                          Obsolete Read ODT wiggles DDR_ODT_* pins on reads.
06158                                                          Should normally be cleared to zero.
06159                                                          When this is on, the following fields must also be
06160                                                          programmed:
06161                                                              LMC_CTL->QS_DIC - programs the termination value
06162                                                              LMC_RODT_CTL - programs the ODT I/O mask for Reads */
06163     uint64_t qdll_ena                     : 1;  /**< DDR Quad DLL Enable: A 0->1 transition on this bit after
06164                                                          DCLK init sequence will reset the DDR 90 DLL. Should
06165                                                          happen at startup before any activity in DDR.
06166                                                          DRESET should be asserted before and for 10 usec
06167                                                          following the 0->1 transition on QDLL_ENA. */
06168     uint64_t dll90_vlu                    : 5;  /**< Contains the open loop setting value for the DDR90 delay
06169                                                          line. */
06170     uint64_t dll90_byp                    : 1;  /**< DDR DLL90 Bypass: When set, the DDR90 DLL is to be
06171                                                          bypassed and the setting is defined by DLL90_VLU */
06172     uint64_t rdqs                         : 1;  /**< DDR2 RDQS mode. When set, configures memory subsystem to
06173                                                          use unidirectional DQS pins. RDQS/DM - Rcv & DQS - Xmit */
06174     uint64_t ddr2                         : 1;  /**< Should be set */
06175 #else
06176     uint64_t ddr2                         : 1;
06177     uint64_t rdqs                         : 1;
06178     uint64_t dll90_byp                    : 1;
06179     uint64_t dll90_vlu                    : 5;
06180     uint64_t qdll_ena                     : 1;
06181     uint64_t odt_ena                      : 1;
06182     uint64_t ddr2t                        : 1;
06183     uint64_t crip_mode                    : 1;
06184     uint64_t tfaw                         : 5;
06185     uint64_t ddr_eof                      : 4;
06186     uint64_t silo_hc                      : 1;
06187     uint64_t twr                          : 3;
06188     uint64_t bwcnt                        : 1;
06189     uint64_t pocas                        : 1;
06190     uint64_t addlat                       : 3;
06191     uint64_t burst8                       : 1;
06192     uint64_t bank8                        : 1;
06193     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
06194 #endif
06195     } s;
06196     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr2_ctl_cn30xx {
06197 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
06198     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
06199     uint64_t bank8                        : 1;  /**< For 8 bank DDR2 parts
06200                                                          1 - DDR2 parts have 8 internal banks (BA is 3 bits
06201                                                          wide).
06202                                                          0 - DDR2 parts have 4 internal banks (BA is 2 bits
06203                                                          wide). */
06204     uint64_t burst8                       : 1;  /**< 8-burst mode.
06205                                                          1 - DDR data transfer happens in burst of 8
06206                                                          0 - DDR data transfer happens in burst of 4
06207                                                          BURST8 should be set when DDR2T is set to minimize
06208                                                          add/cmd bandwidth loss. */
06209     uint64_t addlat                       : 3;  /**< Additional Latency for posted CAS
06210                                                          When Posted CAS is on, this configures the additional
06211                                                          latency. This should be set to
06212                                                                 1 .. LMC_MEM_CFG1[TRCD]-2
06213                                                          (Note the implication that posted CAS should not
06214                                                          be used when tRCD is two.) */
06215     uint64_t pocas                        : 1;  /**< Enable the Posted CAS feature of DDR2. */
06216     uint64_t bwcnt                        : 1;  /**< Bus utilization counter Clear.
06217                                                          Clears the LMC_OPS_CNT_*, LMC_IFB_CNT_*, and
06218                                                          LMC_DCLK_CNT_* registers. SW should first write this
06219                                                          field to a one, then write this field to a zero to
06220                                                          clear the CSR's. */
06221     uint64_t twr                          : 3;  /**< DDR Write Recovery time (tWR). Last Wr Brst to Pre delay
06222                                                          This is not a direct encoding of the value. Its
06223                                                          programmed as below per DDR2 spec. The decimal number
06224                                                          on the right is RNDUP(tWR(ns) / tCYC(ns))
06225                                                           TYP=15ns
06226                                                              - 000: RESERVED
06227                                                              - 001: 2
06228                                                              - 010: 3
06229                                                              - 011: 4
06230                                                              - 100: 5
06231                                                              - 101: 6
06232                                                              - 110-111: RESERVED */
06233     uint64_t silo_hc                      : 1;  /**< Delays the read sample window by a Half Cycle. */
06234     uint64_t ddr_eof                      : 4;  /**< Early Fill Counter Init.
06235                                                          L2 needs to know a few cycle before a fill completes so
06236                                                          it can get its Control pipe started (for better overall
06237                                                          performance). This counter contains  an init value which
06238                                                          is a function of Eclk/Dclk ratio to account for the
06239                                                          asynchronous boundary between L2 cache and the DRAM
06240                                                          controller. This init value will
06241                                                          determine when to safely let the L2 know that a fill
06242                                                          termination is coming up.
06243                                                          DDR_EOF = RNDUP (DCLK period/Eclk Period). If the ratio
06244                                                          is above 3, set DDR_EOF to 3.
06245                                                              DCLK/ECLK period         DDR_EOF
06246                                                                 Less than 1            1
06247                                                                 Less than 2            2
06248                                                                 More than 2            3 */
06249     uint64_t tfaw                         : 5;  /**< tFAW - Cycles = RNDUP[tFAW(ns)/tcyc(ns)] - 1
06250                                                          Four Access Window time. Relevant only in
06251                                                          8-bank parts.
06252                                                              TFAW = 5'b0 for DDR2-4bank
06253                                                              TFAW = RNDUP[tFAW(ns)/tcyc(ns)] - 1 in DDR2-8bank */
06254     uint64_t crip_mode                    : 1;  /**< Cripple Mode - When set, the LMC allows only
06255                                                          1 inflight transaction (.vs. 8 in normal mode).
06256                                                          This bit is ONLY to be set at power-on and
06257                                                          should not be set for normal use. */
06258     uint64_t ddr2t                        : 1;  /**< Turn on the DDR 2T mode. 2 cycle window for CMD and
06259                                                          address. This mode helps relieve setup time pressure
06260                                                          on the Address and command bus which nominally have
06261                                                          a very large fanout. Please refer to Micron's tech
06262                                                          note tn_47_01 titled "DDR2-533 Memory Design Guide
06263                                                          for Two Dimm Unbuffered Systems" for physical details.
06264                                                          BURST8 should be used when DDR2T is set to minimize
06265                                                          add/cmd bandwidth loss. */
06266     uint64_t odt_ena                      : 1;  /**< Enable ODT for DDR2 on Reads
06267                                                          When this is on, the following fields must also be
06268                                                          programmed:
06269                                                              LMC_CTL->QS_DIC - programs the termination value
06270                                                              LMC_RODT_CTL - programs the ODT I/O mask for writes
06271                                                          Program as 0 for DDR1 mode and ODT needs to be off
06272                                                          on Octeon Reads */
06273     uint64_t qdll_ena                     : 1;  /**< DDR Quad DLL Enable: A 0->1 transition on this bit after
06274                                                          erst deassertion will reset the DDR 90 DLL. Should
06275                                                          happen at startup before any activity in DDR. */
06276     uint64_t dll90_vlu                    : 5;  /**< Contains the open loop setting value for the DDR90 delay
06277                                                          line. */
06278     uint64_t dll90_byp                    : 1;  /**< DDR DLL90 Bypass: When set, the DDR90 DLL is to be
06279                                                          bypassed and the setting is defined by DLL90_VLU */
06280     uint64_t reserved_1_1                 : 1;
06281     uint64_t ddr2                         : 1;  /**< DDR2 Enable: When set, configures memory subsystem for
06282                                                          DDR-II SDRAMs. */
06283 #else
06284     uint64_t ddr2                         : 1;
06285     uint64_t reserved_1_1                 : 1;
06286     uint64_t dll90_byp                    : 1;
06287     uint64_t dll90_vlu                    : 5;
06288     uint64_t qdll_ena                     : 1;
06289     uint64_t odt_ena                      : 1;
06290     uint64_t ddr2t                        : 1;
06291     uint64_t crip_mode                    : 1;
06292     uint64_t tfaw                         : 5;
06293     uint64_t ddr_eof                      : 4;
06294     uint64_t silo_hc                      : 1;
06295     uint64_t twr                          : 3;
06296     uint64_t bwcnt                        : 1;
06297     uint64_t pocas                        : 1;
06298     uint64_t addlat                       : 3;
06299     uint64_t burst8                       : 1;
06300     uint64_t bank8                        : 1;
06301     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
06302 #endif
06303     } cn30xx;
06304     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr2_ctl_cn30xx      cn31xx;
06305     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr2_ctl_s           cn38xx;
06306     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr2_ctl_s           cn38xxp2;
06307     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr2_ctl_s           cn50xx;
06308     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr2_ctl_s           cn52xx;
06309     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr2_ctl_s           cn52xxp1;
06310     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr2_ctl_s           cn56xx;
06311     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr2_ctl_s           cn56xxp1;
06312     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr2_ctl_s           cn58xx;
06313     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr2_ctl_s           cn58xxp1;
06314 };
06315 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_ddr2_ctl cvmx_lmcx_ddr2_ctl_t;
06316 
06317 /**
06318  * cvmx_lmc#_ddr4_dimm_ctl
06319  *
06320  * Bits 0-21 of this register are used only when LMC()_CONTROL[RDIMM_ENA] = 1.
06321  *
06322  * During an RCW initialization sequence, bits 0-21 control LMC's write
06323  * operations to the extended DDR4 control words in the JEDEC standard
06324  * registering clock driver on an RDIMM.
06325  */
06326 union cvmx_lmcx_ddr4_dimm_ctl {
06327     uint64_t u64;
06328     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr4_dimm_ctl_s {
06329 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
06330     uint64_t reserved_28_63               : 36;
06331     uint64_t rank_timing_enable           : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
06332     uint64_t bodt_trans_mode              : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
06333     uint64_t trans_mode_ena               : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
06334     uint64_t read_preamble_mode           : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
06335     uint64_t buff_config_da3              : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
06336     uint64_t mpr_over_ena                 : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
06337     uint64_t ddr4_dimm1_wmask             : 11; /**< DIMM1 write mask. If (DIMM1_WMASK[n] = 1), write DIMM1.RCn. */
06338     uint64_t ddr4_dimm0_wmask             : 11; /**< DIMM0 write mask. If (DIMM0_WMASK[n] = 1), write DIMM0.RCn. */
06339 #else
06340     uint64_t ddr4_dimm0_wmask             : 11;
06341     uint64_t ddr4_dimm1_wmask             : 11;
06342     uint64_t mpr_over_ena                 : 1;
06343     uint64_t buff_config_da3              : 1;
06344     uint64_t read_preamble_mode           : 1;
06345     uint64_t trans_mode_ena               : 1;
06346     uint64_t bodt_trans_mode              : 1;
06347     uint64_t rank_timing_enable           : 1;
06348     uint64_t reserved_28_63               : 36;
06349 #endif
06350     } s;
06351     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr4_dimm_ctl_cn70xx {
06352 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
06353     uint64_t reserved_22_63               : 42;
06354     uint64_t ddr4_dimm1_wmask             : 11; /**< DIMM1 write mask. If (DIMM1_WMASK[n] = 1), write DIMM1.RCn. */
06355     uint64_t ddr4_dimm0_wmask             : 11; /**< DIMM0 write mask. If (DIMM0_WMASK[n] = 1), write DIMM0.RCn. */
06356 #else
06357     uint64_t ddr4_dimm0_wmask             : 11;
06358     uint64_t ddr4_dimm1_wmask             : 11;
06359     uint64_t reserved_22_63               : 42;
06360 #endif
06361     } cn70xx;
06362     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr4_dimm_ctl_cn70xx cn70xxp1;
06363     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr4_dimm_ctl_s      cn73xx;
06364     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr4_dimm_ctl_s      cn78xx;
06365     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr4_dimm_ctl_s      cn78xxp1;
06366     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr4_dimm_ctl_s      cnf75xx;
06367 };
06368 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_ddr4_dimm_ctl cvmx_lmcx_ddr4_dimm_ctl_t;
06369 
06370 /**
06371  * cvmx_lmc#_ddr_pll_ctl
06372  *
06373  * This register controls the DDR_CK frequency. For details, refer to CK Speed Programming. See
06374  * LMC Initialization Sequence for the initialization sequence.
06375  * DDR PLL Bringup sequence:
06376  *
06377  * 1. Write [CLKF], [DDR_PS_EN], DFM_PS_EN, DIFFAMP, CPS, CPB.
06378  *
06379  * 2. Wait 128 ref clock cycles (7680 rclk cycles).
06380  *
06381  * 3. Write 1 to RESET_N.
06382  *
06383  * 4. Wait 1152 ref clocks (1152*16 rclk cycles).
06384  *
06385  * 5. Write 0 to DDR_DIV_RESET and DFM_DIV_RESET.
06386  *
06387  * 6. Wait 10 ref clock cycles (160 rclk cycles) before bringing up the DDR interface
06388  */
06389 union cvmx_lmcx_ddr_pll_ctl {
06390     uint64_t u64;
06391     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr_pll_ctl_s {
06392 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
06393     uint64_t reserved_45_63               : 19;
06394     uint64_t dclk_alt_refclk_sel          : 1;  /**< Select alternate reference clock for DCLK PLL. */
06395     uint64_t bwadj                        : 12; /**< Bandwidth control for DCLK PLLs. */
06396     uint64_t dclk_invert                  : 1;  /**< Invert dclk that feeds LMC/DDR at the south side of the chip. */
06397     uint64_t phy_dcok                     : 1;  /**< Set to power up PHY logic after setting LMC()_DDR_PLL_CTL[DDR4_MODE]. */
06398     uint64_t ddr4_mode                    : 1;  /**< DDR4 mode select: 1 = DDR4, 0 = DDR3. */
06399     uint64_t pll_fbslip                   : 1;  /**< PLL FBSLIP indication. */
