06400     uint64_t pll_lock                     : 1;  /**< PLL LOCK indication. */
06401     uint64_t reserved_18_26               : 9;
06402     uint64_t diffamp                      : 4;  /**< PLL diffamp input transconductance */
06403     uint64_t cps                          : 3;  /**< PLL charge-pump current */
06404     uint64_t reserved_8_10                : 3;
06405     uint64_t reset_n                      : 1;  /**< PLL reset */
06406     uint64_t clkf                         : 7;  /**< Multiply reference by [CLKF]. 31 <= [CLKF] <= 99. LMC PLL frequency = 50 * [CLKF]. min =
06407                                                          1.6
06408                                                          GHz, max = 5 GHz. */
06409 #else
06410     uint64_t clkf                         : 7;
06411     uint64_t reset_n                      : 1;
06412     uint64_t reserved_8_10                : 3;
06413     uint64_t cps                          : 3;
06414     uint64_t diffamp                      : 4;
06415     uint64_t reserved_18_26               : 9;
06416     uint64_t pll_lock                     : 1;
06417     uint64_t pll_fbslip                   : 1;
06418     uint64_t ddr4_mode                    : 1;
06419     uint64_t phy_dcok                     : 1;
06420     uint64_t dclk_invert                  : 1;
06421     uint64_t bwadj                        : 12;
06422     uint64_t dclk_alt_refclk_sel          : 1;
06423     uint64_t reserved_45_63               : 19;
06424 #endif
06425     } s;
06426     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr_pll_ctl_cn61xx {
06427 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
06428     uint64_t reserved_27_63               : 37;
06429     uint64_t jtg_test_mode                : 1;  /**< JTAG Test Mode
06430                                                          Clock alignment between DCLK & REFCLK as well as FCLK &
06431                                                          REFCLK can only be performed after the ddr_pll_divider_reset
06432                                                          is deasserted. SW need to wait atleast 10 reference clock
06433                                                          cycles after deasserting pll_divider_reset before asserting
06434                                                          LMC(0)_DDR_PLL_CTL[JTG_TEST_MODE]. During alignment (which can
06435                                                          take upto 160 microseconds) DCLK and FCLK can exhibit some
06436                                                          high frequency pulses. Therefore, all bring up activities in
06437                                                          that clock domain need to be delayed (when the chip operates
06438                                                          in jtg_test_mode) by about 160 microseconds to ensure that
06439                                                          lock is achieved. */
06440     uint64_t dfm_div_reset                : 1;  /**< DFM postscalar divider reset */
06441     uint64_t dfm_ps_en                    : 3;  /**< DFM postscalar divide ratio
06442                                                          Determines the DFM CK speed.
06443                                                          0x0 : Divide LMC+DFM PLL output by 1
06444                                                          0x1 : Divide LMC+DFM PLL output by 2
06445                                                          0x2 : Divide LMC+DFM PLL output by 3
06446                                                          0x3 : Divide LMC+DFM PLL output by 4
06447                                                          0x4 : Divide LMC+DFM PLL output by 6
06448                                                          0x5 : Divide LMC+DFM PLL output by 8
06449                                                          0x6 : Divide LMC+DFM PLL output by 12
06450                                                          0x7 : Divide LMC+DFM PLL output by 12
06451                                                          DFM_PS_EN is not used when DFM_DIV_RESET = 1 */
06452     uint64_t ddr_div_reset                : 1;  /**< DDR postscalar divider reset */
06453     uint64_t ddr_ps_en                    : 3;  /**< DDR postscalar divide ratio
06454                                                          Determines the LMC CK speed.
06455                                                          0x0 : Divide LMC+DFM PLL output by 1
06456                                                          0x1 : Divide LMC+DFM PLL output by 2
06457                                                          0x2 : Divide LMC+DFM PLL output by 3
06458                                                          0x3 : Divide LMC+DFM PLL output by 4
06459                                                          0x4 : Divide LMC+DFM PLL output by 6
06460                                                          0x5 : Divide LMC+DFM PLL output by 8
06461                                                          0x6 : Divide LMC+DFM PLL output by 12
06462                                                          0x7 : Divide LMC+DFM PLL output by 12
06463                                                          DDR_PS_EN is not used when DDR_DIV_RESET = 1 */
06464     uint64_t diffamp                      : 4;  /**< PLL diffamp input transconductance */
06465     uint64_t cps                          : 3;  /**< PLL charge-pump current */
06466     uint64_t cpb                          : 3;  /**< PLL charge-pump current */
06467     uint64_t reset_n                      : 1;  /**< PLL reset */
06468     uint64_t clkf                         : 7;  /**< Multiply reference by CLKF
06469                                                          32 <= CLKF <= 64
06470                                                          LMC+DFM PLL frequency = 50 * CLKF
06471                                                          min = 1.6 GHz, max = 3.2 GHz */
06472 #else
06473     uint64_t clkf                         : 7;
06474     uint64_t reset_n                      : 1;
06475     uint64_t cpb                          : 3;
06476     uint64_t cps                          : 3;
06477     uint64_t diffamp                      : 4;
06478     uint64_t ddr_ps_en                    : 3;
06479     uint64_t ddr_div_reset                : 1;
06480     uint64_t dfm_ps_en                    : 3;
06481     uint64_t dfm_div_reset                : 1;
06482     uint64_t jtg_test_mode                : 1;
06483     uint64_t reserved_27_63               : 37;
06484 #endif
06485     } cn61xx;
06486     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr_pll_ctl_cn61xx   cn63xx;
06487     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr_pll_ctl_cn61xx   cn63xxp1;
06488     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr_pll_ctl_cn61xx   cn66xx;
06489     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr_pll_ctl_cn61xx   cn68xx;
06490     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr_pll_ctl_cn61xx   cn68xxp1;
06491     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr_pll_ctl_cn70xx {
06492 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
06493     uint64_t reserved_31_63               : 33;
06494     uint64_t phy_dcok                     : 1;  /**< Set to power up PHY logic after setting LMC(0..0)_DDR_PLL_CTL[DDR4_MODE]. */
06495     uint64_t ddr4_mode                    : 1;  /**< DDR4 mode select (0 for DDR3). */
06496     uint64_t pll_fbslip                   : 1;  /**< PLL FBSLIP indication. */
06497     uint64_t pll_lock                     : 1;  /**< PLL LOCK indication. */
06498     uint64_t pll_rfslip                   : 1;  /**< PLL RFSLIP indication. */
06499     uint64_t clkr                         : 2;  /**< PLL post-divider control. */
06500     uint64_t jtg_test_mode                : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
06501     uint64_t ddr_div_reset                : 1;  /**< DDR postscalar divider reset. */
06502     uint64_t ddr_ps_en                    : 4;  /**< DDR postscalar divide ratio. Determines the LMC CK speed.
06503                                                          0x0 = Divide LMC PLL by 1.
06504                                                          0x1 = Divide LMC PLL by 2.
06505                                                          0x2 = Divide LMC PLL by 3.
06506                                                          0x3 = Divide LMC PLL by 4.
06507                                                          0x4 = Divide LMC PLL by 5.
06508                                                          0x5 = Divide LMC PLL by 6.
06509                                                          0x6 = Divide LMC PLL by 7.
06510                                                          0x7 = Divide LMC PLL by 8.
06511                                                          0x8 = Divide LMC PLL by 10.
06512                                                          0x9 = Divide LMC PLL by 12.
06513                                                          0xA-0xF = Reserved.
06514                                                          DDR_PS_EN is not used when DDR_DIV_RESET = 1 */
06515     uint64_t reserved_8_17                : 10;
06516     uint64_t reset_n                      : 1;  /**< PLL reset */
06517     uint64_t clkf                         : 7;  /**< Multiply reference by CLKF. 32 <= CLKF <= 64. LMC PLL frequency = 50 * CLKF. min = 1.6
06518                                                          GHz, max = 3.2 GHz. */
06519 #else
06520     uint64_t clkf                         : 7;
06521     uint64_t reset_n                      : 1;
06522     uint64_t reserved_8_17                : 10;
06523     uint64_t ddr_ps_en                    : 4;
06524     uint64_t ddr_div_reset                : 1;
06525     uint64_t jtg_test_mode                : 1;
06526     uint64_t clkr                         : 2;
06527     uint64_t pll_rfslip                   : 1;
06528     uint64_t pll_lock                     : 1;
06529     uint64_t pll_fbslip                   : 1;
06530     uint64_t ddr4_mode                    : 1;
06531     uint64_t phy_dcok                     : 1;
06532     uint64_t reserved_31_63               : 33;
06533 #endif
06534     } cn70xx;
06535     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr_pll_ctl_cn70xx   cn70xxp1;
06536     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr_pll_ctl_cn73xx {
06537 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
06538     uint64_t reserved_45_63               : 19;
06539     uint64_t dclk_alt_refclk_sel          : 1;  /**< Select alternate reference clock for DCLK PLL. */
06540     uint64_t bwadj                        : 12; /**< Bandwidth control for DCLK PLLs. */
06541     uint64_t dclk_invert                  : 1;  /**< Invert DCLK that feeds LMC/DDR at the south side of the chip. */
06542     uint64_t phy_dcok                     : 1;  /**< Set to power up PHY logic after setting LMC()_DDR_PLL_CTL[DDR4_MODE]. */
06543     uint64_t ddr4_mode                    : 1;  /**< DDR4 mode select: 1 = DDR4, 0 = DDR3. */
06544     uint64_t pll_fbslip                   : 1;  /**< PLL FBSLIP indication. */
06545     uint64_t pll_lock                     : 1;  /**< PLL LOCK indication. */
06546     uint64_t pll_rfslip                   : 1;  /**< PLL RFSLIP indication. */
06547     uint64_t clkr                         : 2;  /**< PLL post-divider control. */
06548     uint64_t jtg_test_mode                : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
06549     uint64_t ddr_div_reset                : 1;  /**< DDR postscalar divider reset. */
06550     uint64_t ddr_ps_en                    : 4;  /**< DDR postscalar divide ratio. Determines the LMC CK speed.
06551                                                          0x0 = divide LMC PLL by 1.
06552                                                          0x1 = divide LMC PLL by 2.
06553                                                          0x2 = divide LMC PLL by 3.
06554                                                          0x3 = divide LMC PLL by 4.
06555                                                          0x4 = divide LMC PLL by 5.
06556                                                          0x5 = divide LMC PLL by 6.
06557                                                          0x6 = divide LMC PLL by 7.
06558                                                          0x7 = divide LMC PLL by 8.
06559                                                          0x8 = divide LMC PLL by 10.
06560                                                          0x9 = divide LMC PLL by 12.
06561                                                          0xA = Reserved.
06562                                                          0xB = Reserved.
06563                                                          0xC = Reserved.
06564                                                          0xD = Reserved.
06565                                                          0xE = Reserved.
06566                                                          0xF = Reserved.
06567                                                          [DDR_PS_EN] is not used when [DDR_DIV_RESET] = 1. */
06568     uint64_t reserved_9_17                : 9;
06569     uint64_t clkf_ext                     : 1;  /**< A 1-bit extension to the [CLKF] register to support for DDR4-2666. */
06570     uint64_t reset_n                      : 1;  /**< PLL reset */
06571     uint64_t clkf                         : 7;  /**< Multiply reference by [CLKF]. 31 <= [CLKF] <= 99. LMC PLL frequency = 50 * [CLKF]. min =
06572                                                          1.6
06573                                                          GHz, max = 5 GHz. */
06574 #else
06575     uint64_t clkf                         : 7;
06576     uint64_t reset_n                      : 1;
06577     uint64_t clkf_ext                     : 1;
06578     uint64_t reserved_9_17                : 9;
06579     uint64_t ddr_ps_en                    : 4;
06580     uint64_t ddr_div_reset                : 1;
06581     uint64_t jtg_test_mode                : 1;
06582     uint64_t clkr                         : 2;
06583     uint64_t pll_rfslip                   : 1;
06584     uint64_t pll_lock                     : 1;
06585     uint64_t pll_fbslip                   : 1;
06586     uint64_t ddr4_mode                    : 1;
06587     uint64_t phy_dcok                     : 1;
06588     uint64_t dclk_invert                  : 1;
06589     uint64_t bwadj                        : 12;
06590     uint64_t dclk_alt_refclk_sel          : 1;
06591     uint64_t reserved_45_63               : 19;
06592 #endif
06593     } cn73xx;
06594     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr_pll_ctl_cn73xx   cn78xx;
06595     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr_pll_ctl_cn73xx   cn78xxp1;
06596     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr_pll_ctl_cn61xx   cnf71xx;
06597     struct cvmx_lmcx_ddr_pll_ctl_cn73xx   cnf75xx;
06598 };
06599 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_ddr_pll_ctl cvmx_lmcx_ddr_pll_ctl_t;
06600 
06601 /**
06602  * cvmx_lmc#_delay_cfg
06603  *
06604  * LMC_DELAY_CFG = Open-loop delay line settings
06605  *
06606  *
06607  * Notes:
06608  * The DQ bits add OUTGOING delay only to dq, dqs_[p,n], cb, cbs_[p,n], dqm.  Delay is approximately
06609  * 50-80ps per setting depending on process/voltage.  There is no need to add incoming delay since by
06610  * default all strobe bits are delayed internally by 90 degrees (as was always the case in previous
06611  * passes and past chips.
06612  *
06613  * The CMD add delay to all command bits DDR_RAS, DDR_CAS, DDR_A<15:0>, DDR_BA<2:0>, DDR_n_CS<1:0>_L,
06614  * DDR_WE, DDR_CKE and DDR_ODT_<7:0>. Again, delay is 50-80ps per tap.
06615  *
06616  * The CLK bits add delay to all clock signals DDR_CK_<5:0>_P and DDR_CK_<5:0>_N.  Again, delay is
06617  * 50-80ps per tap.
06618  *
06619  * The usage scenario is the following: There is too much delay on command signals and setup on command
06620  * is not met. The user can then delay the clock until setup is met.
06621  *
06622  * At the same time though, dq/dqs should be delayed because there is also a DDR spec tying dqs with
06623  * clock. If clock is too much delayed with respect to dqs, writes will start to fail.
06624  *
06625  * This scheme should eliminate the board need of adding routing delay to clock signals to make high
06626  * frequencies work.
06627  */
06628 union cvmx_lmcx_delay_cfg {
06629     uint64_t u64;
06630     struct cvmx_lmcx_delay_cfg_s {
06631 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
06632     uint64_t reserved_15_63               : 49;
06633     uint64_t dq                           : 5;  /**< Setting for DQ  delay line */
06634     uint64_t cmd                          : 5;  /**< Setting for CMD delay line */
06635     uint64_t clk                          : 5;  /**< Setting for CLK delay line */
06636 #else
06637     uint64_t clk                          : 5;
06638     uint64_t cmd                          : 5;
06639     uint64_t dq                           : 5;
06640     uint64_t reserved_15_63               : 49;
06641 #endif
06642     } s;
06643     struct cvmx_lmcx_delay_cfg_s          cn30xx;
06644     struct cvmx_lmcx_delay_cfg_cn38xx {
06645 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
06646     uint64_t reserved_14_63               : 50;
06647     uint64_t dq                           : 4;  /**< Setting for DQ  delay line */
06648     uint64_t reserved_9_9                 : 1;
06649     uint64_t cmd                          : 4;  /**< Setting for CMD delay line */
06650     uint64_t reserved_4_4                 : 1;
06651     uint64_t clk                          : 4;  /**< Setting for CLK delay line */
06652 #else
06653     uint64_t clk                          : 4;
06654     uint64_t reserved_4_4                 : 1;
06655     uint64_t cmd                          : 4;
06656     uint64_t reserved_9_9                 : 1;
06657     uint64_t dq                           : 4;
06658     uint64_t reserved_14_63               : 50;
06659 #endif
06660     } cn38xx;
06661     struct cvmx_lmcx_delay_cfg_cn38xx     cn50xx;
06662     struct cvmx_lmcx_delay_cfg_cn38xx     cn52xx;
06663     struct cvmx_lmcx_delay_cfg_cn38xx     cn52xxp1;
06664     struct cvmx_lmcx_delay_cfg_cn38xx     cn56xx;
06665     struct cvmx_lmcx_delay_cfg_cn38xx     cn56xxp1;
06666     struct cvmx_lmcx_delay_cfg_cn38xx     cn58xx;
06667     struct cvmx_lmcx_delay_cfg_cn38xx     cn58xxp1;
06668 };
06669 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_delay_cfg cvmx_lmcx_delay_cfg_t;
06670 
06671 /**
06672  * cvmx_lmc#_dimm#_ddr4_params0
06673  *
06674  * This register contains values to be programmed into the extra DDR4 control words in the
06675  * corresponding (registered) DIMM. These are control words RC1x through RC8x.
06676  */
06677 union cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_ddr4_params0 {
06678     uint64_t u64;
06679     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_ddr4_params0_s {
06680 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
06681     uint64_t rc8x                         : 8;  /**< RC8x. */
06682     uint64_t rc7x                         : 8;  /**< RC7x. */
06683     uint64_t rc6x                         : 8;  /**< RC6x. */
06684     uint64_t rc5x                         : 8;  /**< RC5x. */
06685     uint64_t rc4x                         : 8;  /**< RC4x. */
06686     uint64_t rc3x                         : 8;  /**< RC3x. */
06687     uint64_t rc2x                         : 8;  /**< RC2x. */
06688     uint64_t rc1x                         : 8;  /**< RC1x. */
06689 #else
06690     uint64_t rc1x                         : 8;
06691     uint64_t rc2x                         : 8;
06692     uint64_t rc3x                         : 8;
06693     uint64_t rc4x                         : 8;
06694     uint64_t rc5x                         : 8;
06695     uint64_t rc6x                         : 8;
06696     uint64_t rc7x                         : 8;
06697     uint64_t rc8x                         : 8;
06698 #endif
06699     } s;
06700     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_ddr4_params0_s cn70xx;
06701     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_ddr4_params0_s cn70xxp1;
06702     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_ddr4_params0_s cn73xx;
06703     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_ddr4_params0_s cn78xx;
06704     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_ddr4_params0_s cn78xxp1;
06705     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_ddr4_params0_s cnf75xx;
06706 };
06707 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_ddr4_params0 cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_ddr4_params0_t;
06708 
06709 /**
06710  * cvmx_lmc#_dimm#_ddr4_params1
06711  *
06712  * This register contains values to be programmed into the extra DDR4 control words in the
06713  * corresponding (registered) DIMM. These are control words RC9x through RCBx.
06714  */
06715 union cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_ddr4_params1 {
06716     uint64_t u64;
06717     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_ddr4_params1_s {
06718 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
06719     uint64_t reserved_24_63               : 40;
06720     uint64_t rcbx                         : 8;  /**< RCBx. */
06721     uint64_t rcax                         : 8;  /**< RCAx. */
06722     uint64_t rc9x                         : 8;  /**< RC9x. */
06723 #else
06724     uint64_t rc9x                         : 8;
06725     uint64_t rcax                         : 8;
06726     uint64_t rcbx                         : 8;
06727     uint64_t reserved_24_63               : 40;
06728 #endif
06729     } s;
06730     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_ddr4_params1_s cn70xx;
06731     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_ddr4_params1_s cn70xxp1;
06732     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_ddr4_params1_s cn73xx;
06733     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_ddr4_params1_s cn78xx;
06734     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_ddr4_params1_s cn78xxp1;
06735     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_ddr4_params1_s cnf75xx;
06736 };
06737 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_ddr4_params1 cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_ddr4_params1_t;
06738 
06739 /**
06740  * cvmx_lmc#_dimm#_params
06741  *
06742  * This register contains values to be programmed into each control word in the corresponding
06743  * (registered) DIMM. The control words allow optimization of the device properties for different
06744  * raw card designs. Note that LMC only uses this CSR when LMC()_CONTROL[RDIMM_ENA]=1. During
06745  * a power-up/init sequence, LMC writes these fields into the control words in the JEDEC standard
06746  * DDR3 SSTE32882 registering clock driver or DDR4 Register DDR4RCD01 on an RDIMM when
06747  * corresponding
06748  * LMC()_DIMM_CTL[DIMM*_WMASK] bits are set.
06749  */
06750 union cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_params {
06751     uint64_t u64;
06752     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_params_s {
06753 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
06754     uint64_t rc15                         : 4;  /**< RC15, Reserved. */
06755     uint64_t rc14                         : 4;  /**< RC14, Reserved. */
06756     uint64_t rc13                         : 4;  /**< RC13, Reserved. */
06757     uint64_t rc12                         : 4;  /**< RC12, Reserved. */
06758     uint64_t rc11                         : 4;  /**< RC11, Encoding for RDIMM operating VDD. */
06759     uint64_t rc10                         : 4;  /**< RC10, Encoding for RDIMM operating speed. */
06760     uint64_t rc9                          : 4;  /**< RC9, Power savings settings control word. */
06761     uint64_t rc8                          : 4;  /**< RC8, Additional IBT settings control word. */
06762     uint64_t rc7                          : 4;  /**< RC7, Reserved. */
06763     uint64_t rc6                          : 4;  /**< RC6, Reserved. */
06764     uint64_t rc5                          : 4;  /**< RC5, CK driver characteristics control word. */
06765     uint64_t rc4                          : 4;  /**< RC4, Control signals driver characteristics control word. */
06766     uint64_t rc3                          : 4;  /**< RC3, CA signals driver characteristics control word. */
06767     uint64_t rc2                          : 4;  /**< RC2, Timing control word. */
06768     uint64_t rc1                          : 4;  /**< RC1, Clock driver enable control word. */
06769     uint64_t rc0                          : 4;  /**< RC0, Global features control word. */
06770 #else
06771     uint64_t rc0                          : 4;
06772     uint64_t rc1                          : 4;
06773     uint64_t rc2                          : 4;
06774     uint64_t rc3                          : 4;
06775     uint64_t rc4                          : 4;
06776     uint64_t rc5                          : 4;
06777     uint64_t rc6                          : 4;
06778     uint64_t rc7                          : 4;
06779     uint64_t rc8                          : 4;
06780     uint64_t rc9                          : 4;
06781     uint64_t rc10                         : 4;
06782     uint64_t rc11                         : 4;
06783     uint64_t rc12                         : 4;
06784     uint64_t rc13                         : 4;
06785     uint64_t rc14                         : 4;
06786     uint64_t rc15                         : 4;
06787 #endif
06788     } s;
06789     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_params_s       cn61xx;
06790     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_params_s       cn63xx;
06791     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_params_s       cn63xxp1;
06792     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_params_s       cn66xx;
06793     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_params_s       cn68xx;
06794     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_params_s       cn68xxp1;
06795     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_params_s       cn70xx;
06796     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_params_s       cn70xxp1;
06797     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_params_s       cn73xx;
06798     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_params_s       cn78xx;
06799     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_params_s       cn78xxp1;
06800     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_params_s       cnf71xx;
06801     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_params_s       cnf75xx;
06802 };
06803 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_params cvmx_lmcx_dimmx_params_t;
06804 
06805 /**
06806  * cvmx_lmc#_dimm_ctl
06807  *
06808  * Note that this CSR is only used when LMC()_CONTROL[RDIMM_ENA] = 1. During a power-up/init
06809  * sequence, this CSR controls LMC's write operations to the control words in the JEDEC standard
06810  * DDR3 SSTE32882 registering clock driver or DDR4 Register DDR4RCD01 on an RDIMM.
06811  */
06812 union cvmx_lmcx_dimm_ctl {
06813     uint64_t u64;
06814     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimm_ctl_s {
06815 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
06816     uint64_t reserved_46_63               : 18;
06817     uint64_t parity                       : 1;  /**< "Parity. The Par_In input of a registered DIMM should be tied off. LMC adjusts the value
06818                                                          of the DDR_WE_L (DWE#) pin during DDR3 register part control word writes to ensure the
06819                                                          parity is observed correctly by the receiving DDR3 SSTE32882 or DDR4 DDR4RCD01 register
06820                                                          part. When Par_In is grounded, PARITY should be cleared to 0." */
06821     uint64_t tcws                         : 13; /**< LMC waits for this time period before and after a RDIMM control word access during a
06822                                                          power-up/init SEQUENCE. TCWS is in multiples of 8 CK cycles.
06823                                                          Set TCWS (CSR field) = RNDUP[TCWS(ns)/(8 * TCYC(ns))], where TCWS is the desired time
06824                                                          (ns), and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
06825                                                          TYP = 0x4E0 (equivalent to 15 us) when changing clock timing (RC2.DBA1, RC6.DA4, RC10.DA3,
06826                                                          RC10.DA4, RC11.DA3, and RC11.DA4)
06827                                                          TYP = 0x8, otherwise
06828                                                          0x0 = Reserved. */
06829     uint64_t dimm1_wmask                  : 16; /**< DIMM1 write mask. If (DIMM1_WMASK[n] = 1), write DIMM1.RCn. */
06830     uint64_t dimm0_wmask                  : 16; /**< DIMM0 write mask. If (DIMM0_WMASK[n] = 1), write DIMM0.RCn. */
06831 #else
06832     uint64_t dimm0_wmask                  : 16;
06833     uint64_t dimm1_wmask                  : 16;
06834     uint64_t tcws                         : 13;
06835     uint64_t parity                       : 1;
06836     uint64_t reserved_46_63               : 18;
06837 #endif
06838     } s;
06839     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimm_ctl_s           cn61xx;
06840     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimm_ctl_s           cn63xx;
06841     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimm_ctl_s           cn63xxp1;
06842     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimm_ctl_s           cn66xx;
06843     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimm_ctl_s           cn68xx;
06844     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimm_ctl_s           cn68xxp1;
06845     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimm_ctl_s           cn70xx;
06846     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimm_ctl_s           cn70xxp1;
06847     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimm_ctl_s           cn73xx;
06848     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimm_ctl_s           cn78xx;
06849     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimm_ctl_s           cn78xxp1;
06850     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimm_ctl_s           cnf71xx;
06851     struct cvmx_lmcx_dimm_ctl_s           cnf75xx;
06852 };
06853 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_dimm_ctl cvmx_lmcx_dimm_ctl_t;
06854 
06855 /**
06856  * cvmx_lmc#_dll_ctl
06857  *
06858  * LMC_DLL_CTL = LMC DLL control and DCLK reset
06859  *
06860  */
06861 union cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl {
06862     uint64_t u64;
06863     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl_s {
06864 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
06865     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
06866     uint64_t dreset                       : 1;  /**< Dclk domain reset.  The reset signal that is used by the
06867                                                          Dclk domain is (DRESET || ECLK_RESET). */
06868     uint64_t dll90_byp                    : 1;  /**< DDR DLL90 Bypass: When set, the DDR90 DLL is to be
06869                                                          bypassed and the setting is defined by DLL90_VLU */
06870     uint64_t dll90_ena                    : 1;  /**< DDR Quad DLL Enable: A 0->1 transition on this bit after
06871                                                          DCLK init sequence resets the DDR 90 DLL. Should
06872                                                          happen at startup before any activity in DDR. QDLL_ENA
06873                                                          must not transition 1->0 outside of a DRESET sequence
06874                                                          (i.e. it must remain 1 until the next DRESET).
06875                                                          DRESET should be asserted before and for 10 usec
06876                                                          following the 0->1 transition on QDLL_ENA. */
06877     uint64_t dll90_vlu                    : 5;  /**< Contains the open loop setting value for the DDR90 delay
06878                                                          line. */
06879 #else
06880     uint64_t dll90_vlu                    : 5;
06881     uint64_t dll90_ena                    : 1;
06882     uint64_t dll90_byp                    : 1;
06883     uint64_t dreset                       : 1;
06884     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
06885 #endif
06886     } s;
06887     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl_s            cn52xx;
06888     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl_s            cn52xxp1;
06889     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl_s            cn56xx;
06890     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl_s            cn56xxp1;
06891 };
06892 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl_t;
06893 
06894 /**
06895  * cvmx_lmc#_dll_ctl2
06896  *
06897  * See LMC Initialization Sequence for the initialization sequence.
06898  *
06899  */
06900 union cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl2 {
06901     uint64_t u64;
06902     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl2_s {
06903 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
06904     uint64_t reserved_0_63                : 64;
06905 #else
06906     uint64_t reserved_0_63                : 64;
06907 #endif
06908     } s;
06909     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl2_cn61xx {
06910 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
06911     uint64_t reserved_16_63               : 48;
06912     uint64_t intf_en                      : 1;  /**< Interface Enable */
06913     uint64_t dll_bringup                  : 1;  /**< DLL Bringup */
06914     uint64_t dreset                       : 1;  /**< Dclk domain reset.  The reset signal that is used by the
06915                                                          Dclk domain is (DRESET || ECLK_RESET). */
06916     uint64_t quad_dll_ena                 : 1;  /**< DLL Enable */
06917     uint64_t byp_sel                      : 4;  /**< Bypass select
06918                                                          0000 : no byte
06919                                                          0001 : byte 0
06920                                                          - ...
06921                                                          1001 : byte 8
06922                                                          1010 : all bytes
06923                                                          1011-1111 : Reserved */
06924     uint64_t byp_setting                  : 8;  /**< Bypass setting
06925                                                          DDR3-1600: 00100010
06926                                                          DDR3-1333: 00110010
06927                                                          DDR3-1066: 01001011
06928                                                          DDR3-800 : 01110101
06929                                                          DDR3-667 : 10010110
06930                                                          DDR3-600 : 10101100 */
06931 #else
06932     uint64_t byp_setting                  : 8;
06933     uint64_t byp_sel                      : 4;
06934     uint64_t quad_dll_ena                 : 1;
06935     uint64_t dreset                       : 1;
06936     uint64_t dll_bringup                  : 1;
06937     uint64_t intf_en                      : 1;
06938     uint64_t reserved_16_63               : 48;
06939 #endif
06940     } cn61xx;
06941     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl2_cn63xx {
06942 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
06943     uint64_t reserved_15_63               : 49;
06944     uint64_t dll_bringup                  : 1;  /**< DLL Bringup */
06945     uint64_t dreset                       : 1;  /**< Dclk domain reset.  The reset signal that is used by the
06946                                                          Dclk domain is (DRESET || ECLK_RESET). */
06947     uint64_t quad_dll_ena                 : 1;  /**< DLL Enable */
06948     uint64_t byp_sel                      : 4;  /**< Bypass select
06949                                                          0000 : no byte
06950                                                          0001 : byte 0
06951                                                          - ...
06952                                                          1001 : byte 8
06953                                                          1010 : all bytes
06954                                                          1011-1111 : Reserved */
06955     uint64_t byp_setting                  : 8;  /**< Bypass setting
06956                                                          DDR3-1600: 00100010
06957                                                          DDR3-1333: 00110010
06958                                                          DDR3-1066: 01001011
06959                                                          DDR3-800 : 01110101
06960                                                          DDR3-667 : 10010110
06961                                                          DDR3-600 : 10101100 */
06962 #else
06963     uint64_t byp_setting                  : 8;
06964     uint64_t byp_sel                      : 4;
06965     uint64_t quad_dll_ena                 : 1;
06966     uint64_t dreset                       : 1;
06967     uint64_t dll_bringup                  : 1;
06968     uint64_t reserved_15_63               : 49;
06969 #endif
06970     } cn63xx;
06971     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl2_cn63xx      cn63xxp1;
06972     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl2_cn63xx      cn66xx;
06973     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl2_cn61xx      cn68xx;
06974     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl2_cn61xx      cn68xxp1;
06975     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl2_cn70xx {
06976 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
06977     uint64_t reserved_17_63               : 47;
06978     uint64_t intf_en                      : 1;  /**< Interface enable. */
06979     uint64_t dll_bringup                  : 1;  /**< DLL bring up. */
06980     uint64_t dreset                       : 1;  /**< System-memory-clock domain reset. The reset signal that is used by the system-memory-clock
06981                                                          domain is
06982                                                          (DRESET -OR- core-clock reset). */
06983     uint64_t quad_dll_ena                 : 1;  /**< DLL enable. */
06984     uint64_t byp_sel                      : 4;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
06985     uint64_t byp_setting                  : 9;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
06986 #else
06987     uint64_t byp_setting                  : 9;
06988     uint64_t byp_sel                      : 4;
06989     uint64_t quad_dll_ena                 : 1;
06990     uint64_t dreset                       : 1;
06991     uint64_t dll_bringup                  : 1;
06992     uint64_t intf_en                      : 1;
06993     uint64_t reserved_17_63               : 47;
06994 #endif
06995     } cn70xx;
06996     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl2_cn70xx      cn70xxp1;
06997     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl2_cn70xx      cn73xx;
06998     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl2_cn70xx      cn78xx;
06999     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl2_cn70xx      cn78xxp1;
07000     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl2_cn61xx      cnf71xx;
07001     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl2_cn70xx      cnf75xx;
07002 };
07003 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl2 cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl2_t;
07004 
07005 /**
07006  * cvmx_lmc#_dll_ctl3
07007  *
07008  * LMC_DLL_CTL3 = LMC DLL control and DCLK reset
07009  *
07010  */
07011 union cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl3 {
07012     uint64_t u64;
07013     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl3_s {
07014 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
07015     uint64_t reserved_50_63               : 14;
07016     uint64_t wr_deskew_ena                : 1;  /**< When set, it enables the write bit deskew feature. */
07017     uint64_t wr_deskew_ld                 : 1;  /**< When set, the bit deskew settings in DLL_CTL3[OFFSET] gets loaded to
07018                                                          the designated byte DLL_CTL3[BYTE_SEL] and bit DLL_CTL3[BIT_SELECT]
07019                                                          for write bit deskew. This is a oneshot and clears itself each time
07020                                                          it is set. */
07021     uint64_t bit_select                   : 4;  /**< 0x0-0x7 = Selects bit 0 - bit 8 for write deskew setting assignment.
07022                                                          0x8 = Selects dbi for write deskew setting assignment.
07023                                                          0x9 = No-op.
07024                                                          0xA = Reuse deskew setting on.
07025                                                          0xB = Reuse deskew setting off.
07026                                                          0xC = Vref bypass setting load.
07027                                                          0xD = Vref bypass on.
07028                                                          0xE = Vref bypass off.
07029                                                          0xF = Bit select reset. Clear write deskew settings to default value 0x40 in each DQ bit.
07030                                                          Also sets Vref bypass to off and deskew reuse setting to off. */
07031     uint64_t reserved_0_43                : 44;
07032 #else
07033     uint64_t reserved_0_43                : 44;
07034     uint64_t bit_select                   : 4;
07035     uint64_t wr_deskew_ld                 : 1;
07036     uint64_t wr_deskew_ena                : 1;
07037     uint64_t reserved_50_63               : 14;
07038 #endif
07039     } s;
07040     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl3_cn61xx {
07041 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
07042     uint64_t reserved_41_63               : 23;
07043     uint64_t dclk90_fwd                   : 1;  /**< Forward setting
07044                                                          0 : disable
07045                                                          1 : forward (generates a 1 cycle pulse to forward setting)
07046                                                          This register is oneshot and clears itself each time
07047                                                          it is set */
07048     uint64_t ddr_90_dly_byp               : 1;  /**< Bypass DDR90_DLY in Clock Tree */
07049     uint64_t dclk90_recal_dis             : 1;  /**< Disable periodic recalibration of DDR90 Delay Line in */
07050     uint64_t dclk90_byp_sel               : 1;  /**< Bypass Setting Select for DDR90 Delay Line */
07051     uint64_t dclk90_byp_setting           : 8;  /**< Bypass Setting for DDR90 Delay Line */
07052     uint64_t dll_fast                     : 1;  /**< DLL lock
07053                                                          0 = DLL locked */
07054     uint64_t dll90_setting                : 8;  /**< Encoded DLL settings. Works in conjuction with
07055                                                          DLL90_BYTE_SEL */
07056     uint64_t fine_tune_mode               : 1;  /**< DLL Fine Tune Mode
07057                                                          0 = disabled
07058                                                          1 = enable.
07059                                                          When enabled, calibrate internal PHY DLL every
07060                                                          LMC*_CONFIG[REF_ZQCS_INT] CK cycles. */
07061     uint64_t dll_mode                     : 1;  /**< DLL Mode */
07062     uint64_t dll90_byte_sel               : 4;  /**< Observe DLL settings for selected byte
07063                                                          0001 : byte 0
07064                                                          - ...
07065                                                          1001 : byte 8
07066                                                          0000,1010-1111 : Reserved */
07067     uint64_t offset_ena                   : 1;  /**< Offset enable
07068                                                          0 = disable
07069                                                          1 = enable */
07070     uint64_t load_offset                  : 1;  /**< Load offset
07071                                                          0 : disable
07072                                                          1 : load (generates a 1 cycle pulse to the PHY)
07073                                                          This register is oneshot and clears itself each time
07074                                                          it is set */
07075     uint64_t mode_sel                     : 2;  /**< Mode select
07076                                                          00 : reset
07077                                                          01 : write
07078                                                          10 : read
07079                                                          11 : write & read */
07080     uint64_t byte_sel                     : 4;  /**< Byte select
07081                                                          0000 : no byte
07082                                                          0001 : byte 0
07083                                                          - ...
07084                                                          1001 : byte 8
07085                                                          1010 : all bytes
07086                                                          1011-1111 : Reserved */
07087     uint64_t offset                       : 6;  /**< Write/read offset setting
07088                                                          [4:0] : offset
07089                                                          [5]   : 0 = increment, 1 = decrement
07090                                                          Not a 2's complement value */
07091 #else
07092     uint64_t offset                       : 6;
07093     uint64_t byte_sel                     : 4;
07094     uint64_t mode_sel                     : 2;
07095     uint64_t load_offset                  : 1;
07096     uint64_t offset_ena                   : 1;
07097     uint64_t dll90_byte_sel               : 4;
07098     uint64_t dll_mode                     : 1;
07099     uint64_t fine_tune_mode               : 1;
07100     uint64_t dll90_setting                : 8;
07101     uint64_t dll_fast                     : 1;
07102     uint64_t dclk90_byp_setting           : 8;
07103     uint64_t dclk90_byp_sel               : 1;
07104     uint64_t dclk90_recal_dis             : 1;
07105     uint64_t ddr_90_dly_byp               : 1;
07106     uint64_t dclk90_fwd                   : 1;
07107     uint64_t reserved_41_63               : 23;
07108 #endif
07109     } cn61xx;
07110     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl3_cn63xx {
07111 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
07112     uint64_t reserved_29_63               : 35;
07113     uint64_t dll_fast                     : 1;  /**< DLL lock
07114                                                          0 = DLL locked */
07115     uint64_t dll90_setting                : 8;  /**< Encoded DLL settings. Works in conjuction with
07116                                                          DLL90_BYTE_SEL */
07117     uint64_t fine_tune_mode               : 1;  /**< DLL Fine Tune Mode
07118                                                          0 = disabled
07119                                                          1 = enable.
07120                                                          When enabled, calibrate internal PHY DLL every
07121                                                          LMC*_CONFIG[REF_ZQCS_INT] CK cycles. */
07122     uint64_t dll_mode                     : 1;  /**< DLL Mode */
07123     uint64_t dll90_byte_sel               : 4;  /**< Observe DLL settings for selected byte
07124                                                          0001 : byte 0
07125                                                          - ...
07126                                                          1001 : byte 8
07127                                                          0000,1010-1111 : Reserved */
07128     uint64_t offset_ena                   : 1;  /**< Offset enable
07129                                                          0 = disable
07130                                                          1 = enable */
07131     uint64_t load_offset                  : 1;  /**< Load offset
07132                                                          0 : disable
07133                                                          1 : load (generates a 1 cycle pulse to the PHY)
07134                                                          This register is oneshot and clears itself each time
07135                                                          it is set */
07136     uint64_t mode_sel                     : 2;  /**< Mode select
07137                                                          00 : reset
07138                                                          01 : write
07139                                                          10 : read
07140                                                          11 : write & read */
07141     uint64_t byte_sel                     : 4;  /**< Byte select
07142                                                          0000 : no byte
07143                                                          0001 : byte 0
07144                                                          - ...
07145                                                          1001 : byte 8
07146                                                          1010 : all bytes
07147                                                          1011-1111 : Reserved */
07148     uint64_t offset                       : 6;  /**< Write/read offset setting
07149                                                          [4:0] : offset
07150                                                          [5]   : 0 = increment, 1 = decrement
07151                                                          Not a 2's complement value */
07152 #else
07153     uint64_t offset                       : 6;
07154     uint64_t byte_sel                     : 4;
07155     uint64_t mode_sel                     : 2;
07156     uint64_t load_offset                  : 1;
07157     uint64_t offset_ena                   : 1;
07158     uint64_t dll90_byte_sel               : 4;
07159     uint64_t dll_mode                     : 1;
07160     uint64_t fine_tune_mode               : 1;
07161     uint64_t dll90_setting                : 8;
07162     uint64_t dll_fast                     : 1;
07163     uint64_t reserved_29_63               : 35;
07164 #endif
07165     } cn63xx;
07166     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl3_cn63xx      cn63xxp1;
07167     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl3_cn63xx      cn66xx;
07168     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl3_cn61xx      cn68xx;
07169     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl3_cn61xx      cn68xxp1;
07170     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl3_cn70xx {
07171 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
07172     uint64_t reserved_44_63               : 20;
07173     uint64_t dclk90_fwd                   : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
07174     uint64_t ddr_90_dly_byp               : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
07175     uint64_t dclk90_recal_dis             : 1;  /**< Disable periodic recalibration of DDR90 delay line in. */
07176     uint64_t dclk90_byp_sel               : 1;  /**< Bypass setting select for DDR90 delay line. */
07177     uint64_t dclk90_byp_setting           : 9;  /**< Bypass setting for DDR90 delay line. */
07178     uint64_t dll_fast                     : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
07179     uint64_t dll90_setting                : 9;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
07180     uint64_t fine_tune_mode               : 1;  /**< DLL fine tune mode. 0 = disabled; 1 = enable. When enabled, calibrate internal PHY DLL
07181                                                          every LMC(0..0)_CONFIG[REF_ZQCS_INT] CK cycles. */
07182     uint64_t dll_mode                     : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
07183     uint64_t dll90_byte_sel               : 4;  /**< Observe DLL settings for selected byte.
07184                                                          - 0011: byte 4
07185                                                          - 0100: byte 3
07186                                                          - 0101: byte 2
07187                                                          - 0110: byte 1
07188                                                          - 0111: byte 0
07189                                                          0000-0010,1000-1111: Reserved */
07190     uint64_t offset_ena                   : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
07191     uint64_t load_offset                  : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
07192     uint64_t mode_sel                     : 2;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
07193     uint64_t byte_sel                     : 4;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
07194     uint64_t offset                       : 7;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
07195 #else
07196     uint64_t offset                       : 7;
07197     uint64_t byte_sel                     : 4;
07198     uint64_t mode_sel                     : 2;
07199     uint64_t load_offset                  : 1;
07200     uint64_t offset_ena                   : 1;
07201     uint64_t dll90_byte_sel               : 4;
07202     uint64_t dll_mode                     : 1;
07203     uint64_t fine_tune_mode               : 1;
07204     uint64_t dll90_setting                : 9;
07205     uint64_t dll_fast                     : 1;
07206     uint64_t dclk90_byp_setting           : 9;
07207     uint64_t dclk90_byp_sel               : 1;
07208     uint64_t dclk90_recal_dis             : 1;
07209     uint64_t ddr_90_dly_byp               : 1;
07210     uint64_t dclk90_fwd                   : 1;
07211     uint64_t reserved_44_63               : 20;
07212 #endif
07213     } cn70xx;
07214     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl3_cn70xx      cn70xxp1;
07215     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl3_cn73xx {
07216 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
07217     uint64_t reserved_50_63               : 14;
07218     uint64_t wr_deskew_ena                : 1;  /**< When set, it enables the write bit deskew feature. */
07219     uint64_t wr_deskew_ld                 : 1;  /**< When set, the bit deskew settings in DLL_CTL3[OFFSET] gets loaded to
07220                                                          the designated byte DLL_CTL3[BYTE_SEL] and bit DLL_CTL3[BIT_SELECT]
07221                                                          for write bit deskew. This is a oneshot and clears itself each time
07222                                                          it is set. */
07223     uint64_t bit_select                   : 4;  /**< 0x0-0x7 = Selects bit 0 - bit 8 for write deskew setting assignment.
07224                                                          0x8 = Selects dbi for write deskew setting assignment.
07225                                                          0x9 = No-op.
07226                                                          0xA = Reuse deskew setting on.
07227                                                          0xB = Reuse deskew setting off.
07228                                                          0xC = Vref bypass setting load.
07229                                                          0xD = Vref bypass on.
07230                                                          0xE = Vref bypass off.
07231                                                          0xF = Bit select reset. Clear write deskew settings to default value 0x40 in each DQ bit.
07232                                                          Also sets Vref bypass to off and deskew reuse setting to off. */
07233     uint64_t dclk90_fwd                   : 1;  /**< When set to one, clock-delay information is forwarded to the neighboring LMC. See LMC CK
07234                                                          Locak Initialization step for the LMC bring-up sequence. */
07235     uint64_t ddr_90_dly_byp               : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
07236     uint64_t dclk90_recal_dis             : 1;  /**< Disable periodic recalibration of DDR90 delay line in. */
07237     uint64_t dclk90_byp_sel               : 1;  /**< Bypass setting select for DDR90 delay line. */
07238     uint64_t dclk90_byp_setting           : 9;  /**< Bypass setting for DDR90 delay line. */
07239     uint64_t dll_fast                     : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
07240     uint64_t dll90_setting                : 9;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
07241     uint64_t fine_tune_mode               : 1;  /**< DLL fine tune mode. 0 = disabled; 1 = enable. When enabled, calibrate internal PHY DLL
07242                                                          every LMC()_CONFIG[REF_ZQCS_INT] CK cycles. */
07243     uint64_t dll_mode                     : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
07244     uint64_t dll90_byte_sel               : 4;  /**< Observe DLL settings for selected byte.
07245                                                          0x0 = byte 0.
07246                                                          0x1 = byte 1.
07247                                                          - ...
07248                                                          0x8: byte 8.
07249                                                          0x9-0xF: reserved. */
07250     uint64_t offset_ena                   : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
07251     uint64_t load_offset                  : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
07252     uint64_t mode_sel                     : 2;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
07253     uint64_t byte_sel                     : 4;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
07254     uint64_t offset                       : 7;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
07255 #else
07256     uint64_t offset                       : 7;
07257     uint64_t byte_sel                     : 4;
07258     uint64_t mode_sel                     : 2;
07259     uint64_t load_offset                  : 1;
07260     uint64_t offset_ena                   : 1;
07261     uint64_t dll90_byte_sel               : 4;
07262     uint64_t dll_mode                     : 1;
07263     uint64_t fine_tune_mode               : 1;
07264     uint64_t dll90_setting                : 9;
07265     uint64_t dll_fast                     : 1;
07266     uint64_t dclk90_byp_setting           : 9;
07267     uint64_t dclk90_byp_sel               : 1;
07268     uint64_t dclk90_recal_dis             : 1;
07269     uint64_t ddr_90_dly_byp               : 1;
07270     uint64_t dclk90_fwd                   : 1;
07271     uint64_t bit_select                   : 4;
07272     uint64_t wr_deskew_ld                 : 1;
07273     uint64_t wr_deskew_ena                : 1;
07274     uint64_t reserved_50_63               : 14;
07275 #endif
07276     } cn73xx;
07277     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl3_cn73xx      cn78xx;
07278     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl3_cn73xx      cn78xxp1;
07279     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl3_cn61xx      cnf71xx;
07280     struct cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl3_cn73xx      cnf75xx;
07281 };
07282 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl3 cvmx_lmcx_dll_ctl3_t;
07283 
07284 /**
07285  * cvmx_lmc#_dual_memcfg
07286  *
07287  * This register controls certain parameters of dual-memory configuration.
07288  *
07289  * This register enables the design to have two separate memory configurations, selected
07290  * dynamically by the reference address. Note however, that both configurations share
07291  * LMC()_CONTROL[XOR_BANK], LMC()_CONFIG [PBANK_LSB], LMC()_CONFIG[RANK_ENA], and all
07292  * timing parameters.
07293  *
07294  * In this description:
07295  * * config0 refers to the normal memory configuration that is defined by the
07296  * LMC()_CONFIG[ROW_LSB] parameter
07297  * * config1 refers to the dual (or second) memory configuration that is defined by this
07298  * register.
07299  */
07300 union cvmx_lmcx_dual_memcfg {
07301     uint64_t u64;
07302     struct cvmx_lmcx_dual_memcfg_s {
07303 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
07304     uint64_t reserved_20_63               : 44;
07305     uint64_t bank8                        : 1;  /**< See LMC_DDR2_CTL[BANK8] */
07306     uint64_t row_lsb                      : 3;  /**< Encoding used to determine which memory address bit position represents the low order DDR
07307                                                          ROW address. Refer to
07308                                                          LMC()_CONFIG[ROW_LSB].
07309                                                          Refer to cache-block read transaction example. */
07310     uint64_t reserved_8_15                : 8;
07311     uint64_t cs_mask                      : 8;  /**< Chip-select mask. This mask corresponds to the four chip-select signals for a memory
07312                                                          configuration. Each reference address asserts one of the chip-select signals. If that
07313                                                          chip-select signal has its corresponding CS_MASK bit set, then the config1 parameters are
07314                                                          used, otherwise the config0 parameters are used. */
07315 #else
07316     uint64_t cs_mask                      : 8;
07317     uint64_t reserved_8_15                : 8;
07318     uint64_t row_lsb                      : 3;
07319     uint64_t bank8                        : 1;
07320     uint64_t reserved_20_63               : 44;
07321 #endif
07322     } s;
07323     struct cvmx_lmcx_dual_memcfg_s        cn50xx;
07324     struct cvmx_lmcx_dual_memcfg_s        cn52xx;
07325     struct cvmx_lmcx_dual_memcfg_s        cn52xxp1;
07326     struct cvmx_lmcx_dual_memcfg_s        cn56xx;
07327     struct cvmx_lmcx_dual_memcfg_s        cn56xxp1;
07328     struct cvmx_lmcx_dual_memcfg_s        cn58xx;
07329     struct cvmx_lmcx_dual_memcfg_s        cn58xxp1;
07330     struct cvmx_lmcx_dual_memcfg_cn61xx {
07331 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
07332     uint64_t reserved_19_63               : 45;
07333     uint64_t row_lsb                      : 3;  /**< See LMC*_CONFIG[ROW_LSB] */
07334     uint64_t reserved_8_15                : 8;
07335     uint64_t cs_mask                      : 8;  /**< Chip select mask.
07336                                                          This mask corresponds to the 8 chip selects for a memory
07337                                                          configuration.  Each reference address will assert one of
07338                                                          the chip selects.  If that chip select has its
07339                                                          corresponding CS_MASK bit set, then the "config1"
07340                                                          parameters are used, otherwise the "config0" parameters
07341                                                          are used.  See additional notes below.
07342                                                          [7:4] *UNUSED IN 6xxx* */
07343 #else
07344     uint64_t cs_mask                      : 8;
07345     uint64_t reserved_8_15                : 8;
07346     uint64_t row_lsb                      : 3;
07347     uint64_t reserved_19_63               : 45;
07348 #endif
07349     } cn61xx;
07350     struct cvmx_lmcx_dual_memcfg_cn61xx   cn63xx;
07351     struct cvmx_lmcx_dual_memcfg_cn61xx   cn63xxp1;
07352     struct cvmx_lmcx_dual_memcfg_cn61xx   cn66xx;
07353     struct cvmx_lmcx_dual_memcfg_cn61xx   cn68xx;
07354     struct cvmx_lmcx_dual_memcfg_cn61xx   cn68xxp1;
07355     struct cvmx_lmcx_dual_memcfg_cn70xx {
07356 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
07357     uint64_t reserved_19_63               : 45;
07358     uint64_t row_lsb                      : 3;  /**< Encoding used to determine which memory address bit position represents the low order DDR
07359                                                          ROW address. Refer to
07360                                                          LMC(0..0)_CONFIG[ROW_LSB].
07361                                                          Refer to cache-block read transaction example. */
07362     uint64_t reserved_4_15                : 12;
07363     uint64_t cs_mask                      : 4;  /**< Chip-select mask. This mask corresponds to the four chip-select signals for a memory
07364                                                          configuration. Each reference address asserts one of the chip-select signals. If that
07365                                                          chip-select signal has its corresponding CS_MASK bit set, then the config1 parameters are
07366                                                          used, otherwise the config0 parameters are used. */
07367 #else
07368     uint64_t cs_mask                      : 4;
07369     uint64_t reserved_4_15                : 12;
07370     uint64_t row_lsb                      : 3;
07371     uint64_t reserved_19_63               : 45;
07372 #endif
07373     } cn70xx;
07374     struct cvmx_lmcx_dual_memcfg_cn70xx   cn70xxp1;
07375     struct cvmx_lmcx_dual_memcfg_cn70xx   cn73xx;
07376     struct cvmx_lmcx_dual_memcfg_cn70xx   cn78xx;
07377     struct cvmx_lmcx_dual_memcfg_cn70xx   cn78xxp1;
07378     struct cvmx_lmcx_dual_memcfg_cn61xx   cnf71xx;
07379     struct cvmx_lmcx_dual_memcfg_cn70xx   cnf75xx;
07380 };
07381 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_dual_memcfg cvmx_lmcx_dual_memcfg_t;
07382 
07383 /**
07384  * cvmx_lmc#_ecc_parity_test
07385  *
07386  * This register has bits to control the generation of ECC and Command Address parity errors.
07387  * ECC error is generated by enabling [CA_PARITY_CORRUPT_ENA] and selecting any of the
07388  * [ECC_CORRUPT_IDX] index of the dataword from the cacheline to be corrupted.
07389  * User needs to select which bit of the 128-bits dataword to corrupt by asserting any of the
07390  * CHAR_MASK0 and CHAR_MASK2 bits. (CHAR_MASK0 and CHAR_MASK2 corresponds to the lower and upper
07391  * 64-bit signal that can corrupt any individual bit of the data).
07392  *
07393  * Command Address parity error is generated by enabling [CA_PARITY_CORRUPT_ENA] and
07394  * selecting the DDR command that the parity is to be corrupted with through [CA_PARITY_SEL].
07395  */
07396 union cvmx_lmcx_ecc_parity_test {
07397     uint64_t u64;
07398     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_parity_test_s {
07399 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
07400     uint64_t reserved_12_63               : 52;
07401     uint64_t ecc_corrupt_ena              : 1;  /**< Enables the ECC data corruption. */
07402     uint64_t ecc_corrupt_idx              : 3;  /**< Selects the cacheline index that the dataword is to be corrupted with. */
07403     uint64_t reserved_6_7                 : 2;
07404     uint64_t ca_parity_corrupt_ena        : 1;  /**< Enables the CA parity bit corruption. */
07405     uint64_t ca_parity_sel                : 5;  /**< Selects the type of DDR command to corrupt the parity bit.
07406                                                          0x0  = No command selected.
07407                                                          0x1  = NOP.
07408                                                          0x2  = ACT.
07409                                                          0x3  = REF.
07410                                                          0x4  = WRS4.
07411                                                          0x5  = WRS8.
07412                                                          0x6  = WRAS4.
07413                                                          0x7  = WRAS8.
07414                                                          0x8  = RDS4.
07415                                                          0x9  = RDS8.
07416                                                          0xa  = RDAS4.
07417                                                          0xb  = RDAS8.
07418                                                          0xc  = SRE.
07419                                                          0xd  = SRX.
07420                                                          0xe  = PRE.
07421                                                          0xf  = PREA.
07422                                                          0x10 = MRS.
07423                                                          0x11-0x13 = Reserved.
07424                                                          0x14 = ZQCL.
07425                                                          0x15 = ZQCS.
07426                                                          0x16-0x16 = Reserved. */
07427 #else
07428     uint64_t ca_parity_sel                : 5;
07429     uint64_t ca_parity_corrupt_ena        : 1;
07430     uint64_t reserved_6_7                 : 2;
07431     uint64_t ecc_corrupt_idx              : 3;
07432     uint64_t ecc_corrupt_ena              : 1;
07433     uint64_t reserved_12_63               : 52;
07434 #endif
07435     } s;
07436     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_parity_test_s    cn73xx;
07437     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_parity_test_s    cn78xx;
07438     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_parity_test_s    cn78xxp1;
07439     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_parity_test_s    cnf75xx;
07440 };
07441 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_ecc_parity_test cvmx_lmcx_ecc_parity_test_t;
07442 
07443 /**
07444  * cvmx_lmc#_ecc_synd
07445  *
07446  * LMC_ECC_SYND = MRD ECC Syndromes
07447  *
07448  */
07449 union cvmx_lmcx_ecc_synd {
07450     uint64_t u64;
07451     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_synd_s {
07452 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
07453     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
07454     uint64_t mrdsyn3                      : 8;  /**< MRD ECC syndrome quad 3. [MRDSYN3] corresponds to DQ[63:0]_c1_p1, or in 32-bit mode
07455                                                          DQ[31:0]_c3_p1/0, where _cC_pP denotes cycle C and phase P. */
07456     uint64_t mrdsyn2                      : 8;  /**< MRD ECC syndrome quad 2. [MRDSYN2] corresponds to DQ[63:0]_c1_p0, or in 32-bit mode
07457                                                          DQ[31:0]_c2_p1/0, where _cC_pP denotes cycle C and phase P. */
07458     uint64_t mrdsyn1                      : 8;  /**< MRD ECC syndrome quad 1. [MRDSYN1] corresponds to DQ[63:0]_c0_p1, or in 32-bit mode
07459                                                          DQ[31:0]_c1_p1/0, where _cC_pP denotes cycle C and phase P. */
07460     uint64_t mrdsyn0                      : 8;  /**< MRD ECC syndrome quad 0. [MRDSYN0] corresponds to DQ[63:0]_c0_p0, or in 32-bit mode
07461                                                          DQ[31:0]_c0_p1/0, where _cC_pP denotes cycle C and phase P. */
07462 #else
07463     uint64_t mrdsyn0                      : 8;
07464     uint64_t mrdsyn1                      : 8;
07465     uint64_t mrdsyn2                      : 8;
07466     uint64_t mrdsyn3                      : 8;
07467     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
07468 #endif
07469     } s;
07470     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_synd_s           cn30xx;
07471     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_synd_s           cn31xx;
07472     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_synd_s           cn38xx;
07473     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_synd_s           cn38xxp2;
07474     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_synd_s           cn50xx;
07475     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_synd_s           cn52xx;
07476     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_synd_s           cn52xxp1;
07477     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_synd_s           cn56xx;
07478     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_synd_s           cn56xxp1;
07479     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_synd_s           cn58xx;
07480     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_synd_s           cn58xxp1;
07481     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_synd_s           cn61xx;
07482     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_synd_s           cn63xx;
07483     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_synd_s           cn63xxp1;
07484     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_synd_s           cn66xx;
07485     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_synd_s           cn68xx;
07486     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_synd_s           cn68xxp1;
07487     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_synd_s           cn70xx;
07488     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_synd_s           cn70xxp1;
07489     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_synd_s           cn73xx;
07490     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_synd_s           cn78xx;
07491     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_synd_s           cn78xxp1;
07492     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_synd_s           cnf71xx;
07493     struct cvmx_lmcx_ecc_synd_s           cnf75xx;
07494 };
07495 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_ecc_synd cvmx_lmcx_ecc_synd_t;
07496 
07497 /**
07498  * cvmx_lmc#_ext_config
07499  *
07500  * This register has additional configuration and control bits for the LMC.
07501  *
07502  */
07503 union cvmx_lmcx_ext_config {
07504     uint64_t u64;
07505     struct cvmx_lmcx_ext_config_s {
07506 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
07507     uint64_t reserved_61_63               : 3;
07508     uint64_t bc4_dqs_ena                  : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
07509     uint64_t ref_block                    : 1;  /**< When set, LMC is blocked to initiate any refresh sequence. LMC then will only
07510                                                          allow refresh sequence to start when LMC()_REF_STATUS[REF_COUNT] has
07511                                                          reached the maximum value of 0x7. */
07512     uint64_t mrs_side                     : 1;  /**< Only applies when EXT_CONFIG[MRS_ONE_SIDE] is set.
07513                                                          0 = MRS command is sent to the A side of an RDIMM.
07514                                                          1 = MRS command is sent to the B side of an RDIMM. */
07515     uint64_t mrs_one_side                 : 1;  /**< Only applies to DDR4 RDIMM.
07516                                                          When set, MRS commands are directed to either the A or B
07517                                                          side of the RCD.
07518                                                          PDA operation is NOT allowed when this bit is set. In
07519                                                          other words, MR_MPR_CTL[MR_WR_PDA_ENABLE]
07520                                                          must be cleared before running MRW sequence with this
07521                                                          bit turned on. */
07522     uint64_t mrs_bside_invert_disable     : 1;  /**< When set, the command decoder cancels the auto inversion of
07523                                                          A3-A9, A11, A13, A17, BA0, BA1 and BG0 during MRS/MRS_PDA
07524                                                          command to the B side of the RDIMM.
07525                                                          When set, make sure that the RCD's control word
07526                                                          RC00 DA[0] = 1 so that the output inversion is disabled in
07527                                                          the DDR4 RCD. */
07528     uint64_t dimm_sel_invert_off          : 1;  /**< During coalesce_address_mode, the default logic would be to invert
07529                                                          the pbank bit whenever NXM[MEM_MSB_D1_R0] > NXM[MEM_MSB_D0_R0].
07530                                                          When this bit is set to 1, it disables this default behaviour.
07531                                                          This configuration has lower priority compared to
07532                                                          [DIMM_SEL_FORCE_INVERT]. */
07533     uint64_t dimm_sel_force_invert        : 1;  /**< When set to 1, this bit forces the pbank bit to be inverted
07534                                                          when in coalesce_address_mode. That is, pbank value of 0 selects
07535                                                          DIMM1 instead of DIMM0.
07536                                                          Intended to be use for the case of DIMM1 having bigger rank/s
07537                                                          than DIMM0. This bit has priority over [DIMM_SEL_INVERT_OFF]. */
07538     uint64_t coalesce_address_mode        : 1;  /**< When set to 1, LMC coalesces the L2C+LMC internal address mapping
07539                                                          to create a uniform memory space that are free from holes in
07540                                                          between ranks. When different size DIMMs are used, the DIMM with
07541                                                          the higher capacity is mapped to the lower address space. */
07542     uint64_t dimm1_cid                    : 2;  /**< Reserved. */
07543     uint64_t dimm0_cid                    : 2;  /**< Reserved. */
07544     uint64_t rcd_parity_check             : 1;  /**< Enables the one cycle delay of the CA parity output. This MUST be set to 1 when using DDR4
07545                                                          RDIMM AND parity checking in RCD is enabled (RC0E DA0 = 1). Set this to 0 otherwise.
07546                                                          To enable the parity checking in RCD, set this bit first BEFORE issuing the RCW write RC0E
07547                                                          DA0 = 1. */
07548     uint64_t reserved_46_47               : 2;
07549     uint64_t error_alert_n_sample         : 1;  /**< Read to get a sample of the DDR*_ERROR_ALERT_L signal. */
07550     uint64_t ea_int_polarity              : 1;  /**< Set to invert DDR*_ERROR_ALERT_L interrupt polarity. When clear, interrupt is signaled on
07551                                                          the rising edge of DDR*_ERROR_ALERT_L. When set, interrupt is signalled on the falling
07552                                                          edge of DDR*_ERROR_ALERT_L. */
07553     uint64_t reserved_43_43               : 1;
07554     uint64_t par_addr_mask                : 3;  /**< Mask applied to parity for address bits 14, 13, and 12. Clear to exclude these address
07555                                                          bits from the parity calculation, necessary if the DRAM device does not have these pins. */
07556     uint64_t reserved_38_39               : 2;
07557     uint64_t mrs_cmd_override             : 1;  /**< Set to override the behavior of MRS and RCW operations.
07558                                                          If this bit is set, the override behavior is governed by the control field
07559                                                          [MRS_CMD_SELECT]. See LMC()_EXT_CONFIG[MRS_CMD_SELECT] for detail.
07560                                                          If this bit is cleared, select operation where signals other than CS are active before
07561                                                          and after the CS_N active cycle (except for the case when interfacing with DDR3 RDIMM). */
07562     uint64_t mrs_cmd_select               : 1;  /**< When [MRS_CMD_OVERRIDE] is set, use this bit to select which style of operation for MRS
07563                                                          and
07564                                                          RCW commands.
07565                                                          If this bit is clear, select operation where signals other than CS are active before and
07566                                                          after the CS_N active cycle.
07567                                                          When this bit is set, select the operation where the other command signals (DDR*_RAS_L,
07568                                                          DDR*_CAS_L, DDR*_WE_L, DDR*_A<15:0>, etc) all are active only during the cycle where the
07569                                                          CS_N is also active. */
07570     uint64_t reserved_33_35               : 3;
07571     uint64_t invert_data                  : 1;  /**< Set this bit to cause all data to be inverted before writing or reading to/from DRAM. This
07572                                                          effectively uses the scramble logic to instead invert all the data, so this bit must not
07573                                                          be set if data scrambling is enabled. May be useful if data inversion will result in lower
07574                                                          power. */
07575     uint64_t reserved_30_31               : 2;
07576     uint64_t cmd_rti                      : 1;  /**< Set this bit to change the behavior of the LMC to return to a completely idle command (no
07577                                                          CS active, no command pins active, and address/bank address/bank group all low) on the
07578                                                          interface after an active command, rather than only forcing the CS inactive between
07579                                                          commands. */
07580     uint64_t cal_ena                      : 1;  /**< Set to cause LMC to operate in CAL mode. First set LMC()_MODEREG_PARAMS3[CAL], then
07581                                                          set CAL_ENA. */
07582     uint64_t reserved_27_27               : 1;
07583     uint64_t par_include_a17              : 1;  /**< If set, include A17 in parity calculations in DDR4 mode. */
07584     uint64_t par_include_bg1              : 1;  /**< If set, include BG1 in parity calculations in DDR4 mode. */
