07585     uint64_t gen_par                      : 1;  /**< Enable parity generation in the DRAM commands; must be set prior to enabling parity in
07586                                                          register or DRAM devices. */
07587     uint64_t reserved_21_23               : 3;
07588     uint64_t vrefint_seq_deskew           : 1;  /**< Personality bit to change the operation of what is normally the internal Vref training
07589                                                          sequence into the deskew training sequence. */
07590     uint64_t read_ena_bprch               : 1;  /**< Enable pad receiver one cycle longer than normal during read operations. */
07591     uint64_t read_ena_fprch               : 1;  /**< Enable pad receiver starting one cycle earlier than normal during read operations. */
07592     uint64_t slot_ctl_reset_force         : 1;  /**< Write 1 to reset the slot-control override for all slot-control registers. After writing a
07593                                                          1 to this bit, slot-control registers will update with changes made to other timing-
07594                                                          control registers. This is a one-shot operation; it automatically returns to 0 after a
07595                                                          write to 1. */
07596     uint64_t ref_int_lsbs                 : 9;  /**< Refresh-interval value least-significant bits. The default is 0x0.
07597                                                          Refresh interval is represented in number of 512 CK cycle increments and is controlled by
07598                                                          LMC()_CONFIG[REF_ZQCS_INT]. More precise refresh interval however (in number of
07599                                                          1 CK cycle) can be achieved by setting this field to a nonzero value. */
07600     uint64_t drive_ena_bprch              : 1;  /**< Drive DQx for one cycle longer than normal during write operations. */
07601     uint64_t drive_ena_fprch              : 1;  /**< Drive DQx starting one cycle earlier than normal during write operations. */
07602     uint64_t dlcram_flip_synd             : 2;  /**< Reserved. */
07603     uint64_t dlcram_cor_dis               : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
07604     uint64_t dlc_nxm_rd                   : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
07605     uint64_t l2c_nxm_rd                   : 1;  /**< When set, enable NXM events for L2C read operations. */
07606     uint64_t l2c_nxm_wr                   : 1;  /**< When set, enable NXM events for L2C write operations. */
07607 #else
07608     uint64_t l2c_nxm_wr                   : 1;
07609     uint64_t l2c_nxm_rd                   : 1;
07610     uint64_t dlc_nxm_rd                   : 1;
07611     uint64_t dlcram_cor_dis               : 1;
07612     uint64_t dlcram_flip_synd             : 2;
07613     uint64_t drive_ena_fprch              : 1;
07614     uint64_t drive_ena_bprch              : 1;
07615     uint64_t ref_int_lsbs                 : 9;
07616     uint64_t slot_ctl_reset_force         : 1;
07617     uint64_t read_ena_fprch               : 1;
07618     uint64_t read_ena_bprch               : 1;
07619     uint64_t vrefint_seq_deskew           : 1;
07620     uint64_t reserved_21_23               : 3;
07621     uint64_t gen_par                      : 1;
07622     uint64_t par_include_bg1              : 1;
07623     uint64_t par_include_a17              : 1;
07624     uint64_t reserved_27_27               : 1;
07625     uint64_t cal_ena                      : 1;
07626     uint64_t cmd_rti                      : 1;
07627     uint64_t reserved_30_31               : 2;
07628     uint64_t invert_data                  : 1;
07629     uint64_t reserved_33_35               : 3;
07630     uint64_t mrs_cmd_select               : 1;
07631     uint64_t mrs_cmd_override             : 1;
07632     uint64_t reserved_38_39               : 2;
07633     uint64_t par_addr_mask                : 3;
07634     uint64_t reserved_43_43               : 1;
07635     uint64_t ea_int_polarity              : 1;
07636     uint64_t error_alert_n_sample         : 1;
07637     uint64_t reserved_46_47               : 2;
07638     uint64_t rcd_parity_check             : 1;
07639     uint64_t dimm0_cid                    : 2;
07640     uint64_t dimm1_cid                    : 2;
07641     uint64_t coalesce_address_mode        : 1;
07642     uint64_t dimm_sel_force_invert        : 1;
07643     uint64_t dimm_sel_invert_off          : 1;
07644     uint64_t mrs_bside_invert_disable     : 1;
07645     uint64_t mrs_one_side                 : 1;
07646     uint64_t mrs_side                     : 1;
07647     uint64_t ref_block                    : 1;
07648     uint64_t bc4_dqs_ena                  : 1;
07649     uint64_t reserved_61_63               : 3;
07650 #endif
07651     } s;
07652     struct cvmx_lmcx_ext_config_cn70xx {
07653 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
07654     uint64_t reserved_21_63               : 43;
07655     uint64_t vrefint_seq_deskew           : 1;  /**< Personality bit to change the operation of what is normally the internal Vref training
07656                                                          sequence into the deskew training sequence. */
07657     uint64_t read_ena_bprch               : 1;  /**< Enable pad receiver one cycle longer than normal during read operations. */
07658     uint64_t read_ena_fprch               : 1;  /**< Enable pad receiver starting one cycle earlier than normal during read operations. */
07659     uint64_t slot_ctl_reset_force         : 1;  /**< Write 1 to reset the slot-control override for all slot-control registers. After writing a
07660                                                          1 to this bit, slot-control registers will update with changes made to other timing-
07661                                                          control registers. This is a one-shot operation; it automatically returns to 0 after a
07662                                                          write to 1. */
07663     uint64_t ref_int_lsbs                 : 9;  /**< Refresh-interval value least-significant bits. The default is 0x0; but it can be set to a
07664                                                          non-zero value to get a more precise refresh interval. */
07665     uint64_t drive_ena_bprch              : 1;  /**< Drive DQx for one cycle longer than normal during write operations. */
07666     uint64_t drive_ena_fprch              : 1;  /**< Drive DQx starting one cycle earlier than normal during write operations. */
07667     uint64_t dlcram_flip_synd             : 2;  /**< Reserved. */
07668     uint64_t dlcram_cor_dis               : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
07669     uint64_t dlc_nxm_rd                   : 1;  /**< When set, enable NXM events for HFA read operations. */
07670     uint64_t l2c_nxm_rd                   : 1;  /**< When set, enable NXM events for L2C read operations. */
07671     uint64_t l2c_nxm_wr                   : 1;  /**< When set, enable NXM events for L2C write operations. */
07672 #else
07673     uint64_t l2c_nxm_wr                   : 1;
07674     uint64_t l2c_nxm_rd                   : 1;
07675     uint64_t dlc_nxm_rd                   : 1;
07676     uint64_t dlcram_cor_dis               : 1;
07677     uint64_t dlcram_flip_synd             : 2;
07678     uint64_t drive_ena_fprch              : 1;
07679     uint64_t drive_ena_bprch              : 1;
07680     uint64_t ref_int_lsbs                 : 9;
07681     uint64_t slot_ctl_reset_force         : 1;
07682     uint64_t read_ena_fprch               : 1;
07683     uint64_t read_ena_bprch               : 1;
07684     uint64_t vrefint_seq_deskew           : 1;
07685     uint64_t reserved_21_63               : 43;
07686 #endif
07687     } cn70xx;
07688     struct cvmx_lmcx_ext_config_cn70xx    cn70xxp1;
07689     struct cvmx_lmcx_ext_config_cn73xx {
07690 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
07691     uint64_t reserved_60_63               : 4;
07692     uint64_t ref_block                    : 1;  /**< When set, LMC is blocked to initiate any refresh sequence. LMC then will only
07693                                                          allow refresh sequence to start when LMC()_REF_STATUS[REF_COUNT] has
07694                                                          reached the maximum value of 0x7. */
07695     uint64_t mrs_side                     : 1;  /**< Only applies when EXT_CONFIG[MRS_ONE_SIDE] is set.
07696                                                          0 = MRS command is sent to the A side of an RDIMM.
07697                                                          1 = MRS command is sent to the B side of an RDIMM. */
07698     uint64_t mrs_one_side                 : 1;  /**< Only applies to DDR4 RDIMM.
07699                                                          When set, MRS commands are directed to either the A or B
07700                                                          side of the RCD.
07701                                                          PDA operation is NOT allowed when this bit is set. In
07702                                                          other words, [MR_WR_PDA_ENABLE]
07703                                                          must be cleared before running MRW sequence with this
07704                                                          bit turned on. */
07705     uint64_t mrs_bside_invert_disable     : 1;  /**< When set, the command decoder cancels the auto inversion of
07706                                                          A3-A9, A11, A13, A17, BA0, BA1 and BG0 during MRS/MRS_PDA
07707                                                          command to the B side of the RDIMM.
07708                                                          When set, make sure that the RCD's control word
07709                                                          RC00 DA[0] = 1 so that the output inversion is disabled in
07710                                                          the DDR4 RCD. */
07711     uint64_t dimm_sel_invert_off          : 1;  /**< During coalesce_address_mode, the default logic would be to invert
07712                                                          the pbank bit whenever [MEM_MSB_D1_R0] > [MEM_MSB_D0_R0].
07713                                                          When this bit is set to one, it disables this default behavior.
07714                                                          This configuration has lower priority compared to
07715                                                          [DIMM_SEL_FORCE_INVERT]. */
07716     uint64_t dimm_sel_force_invert        : 1;  /**< When set to one, this bit forces the pbank bit to be inverted
07717                                                          when in coalesce_address_mode. That is, pbank value of zero selects
07718                                                          DIMM1 instead of DIMM0.
07719                                                          Intended to be used for the case of DIMM1 having bigger rank/s
07720                                                          than DIMM0. This bit has priority over [DIMM_SEL_INVERT_OFF]. */
07721     uint64_t coalesce_address_mode        : 1;  /**< When set to 1, LMC coalesces the L2C+LMC internal address mapping
07722                                                          to create a uniform memory space that are free from holes in
07723                                                          between ranks. When different size DIMMs are used, the DIMM with
07724                                                          the higher capacity is mapped to the lower address space. */
07725     uint64_t dimm1_cid                    : 2;  /**< Reserved. */
07726     uint64_t dimm0_cid                    : 2;  /**< Reserved. */
07727     uint64_t rcd_parity_check             : 1;  /**< Enables the one cycle delay of the CA parity output. This MUST be set to one
07728                                                          when using DDR4 RDIMM AND parity checking in RCD is enabled (RC0E DA0 = 1). Set
07729                                                          this to zero otherwise. To enable the parity checking in RCD, set this bit first
07730                                                          BEFORE issuing the RCW write RC0E DA0 = 1. */
07731     uint64_t reserved_46_47               : 2;
07732     uint64_t error_alert_n_sample         : 1;  /**< Read to get a sample of the DDR*_ERROR_ALERT_L signal. */
07733     uint64_t ea_int_polarity              : 1;  /**< Set to invert DDR*_ERROR_ALERT_L interrupt polarity. When clear, interrupt is signaled on
07734                                                          the rising edge of DDR*_ERROR_ALERT_L. When set, interrupt is signalled on the falling
07735                                                          edge of DDR*_ERROR_ALERT_L. */
07736     uint64_t reserved_43_43               : 1;
07737     uint64_t par_addr_mask                : 3;  /**< Mask applied to parity for address bits 14, 13, and 12. Clear to exclude these address
07738                                                          bits from the parity calculation, necessary if the DRAM device does not have these pins. */
07739     uint64_t reserved_38_39               : 2;
07740     uint64_t mrs_cmd_override             : 1;  /**< Set to override the behavior of MRS and RCW operations.
07741                                                          If this bit is set, the override behavior is governed by the control field
07742                                                          [MRS_CMD_SELECT]. See LMC()_EXT_CONFIG[MRS_CMD_SELECT] for detail.
07743                                                          If this bit is cleared, select operation where signals other than CS are active before
07744                                                          and after the CS_N active cycle (except for the case when interfacing with DDR3 RDIMM). */
07745     uint64_t mrs_cmd_select               : 1;  /**< When [MRS_CMD_OVERRIDE] is set, use this bit to select which style of operation for MRS
07746                                                          and
07747                                                          RCW commands.
07748                                                          If this bit is clear, select operation where signals other than CS are active before and
07749                                                          after the CS_N active cycle.
07750                                                          When this bit is set, select the operation where the other command signals (DDR*_RAS_L,
07751                                                          DDR*_CAS_L, DDR*_WE_L, DDR*_A<15:0>, etc.) all are active only during the cycle where the
07752                                                          CS_N is also active. */
07753     uint64_t reserved_33_35               : 3;
07754     uint64_t invert_data                  : 1;  /**< Set this bit to cause all data to be inverted before writing or reading to/from DRAM. This
07755                                                          effectively uses the scramble logic to instead invert all the data, so this bit must not
07756                                                          be set if data scrambling is enabled. May be useful if data inversion will result in lower
07757                                                          power. */
07758     uint64_t reserved_30_31               : 2;
07759     uint64_t cmd_rti                      : 1;  /**< Set this bit to change the behavior of the LMC to return to a completely idle command (no
07760                                                          CS active, no command pins active, and address/bank address/bank group all low) on the
07761                                                          interface after an active command, rather than only forcing the CS inactive between
07762                                                          commands. */
07763     uint64_t cal_ena                      : 1;  /**< Set to cause LMC to operate in CAL mode. First set LMC()_MODEREG_PARAMS3[CAL], then
07764                                                          set CAL_ENA. */
07765     uint64_t reserved_27_27               : 1;
07766     uint64_t par_include_a17              : 1;  /**< If set, include A17 in parity calculations in DDR4 mode. */
07767     uint64_t par_include_bg1              : 1;  /**< If set, include BG1 in parity calculations in DDR4 mode. */
07768     uint64_t gen_par                      : 1;  /**< Enable parity generation in the DRAM commands; must be set prior to enabling parity in
07769                                                          register or DRAM devices. */
07770     uint64_t reserved_21_23               : 3;
07771     uint64_t vrefint_seq_deskew           : 1;  /**< Personality bit to change the operation of what is normally the internal Vref training
07772                                                          sequence into the deskew training sequence. */
07773     uint64_t read_ena_bprch               : 1;  /**< Enable pad receiver one cycle longer than normal during read operations. */
07774     uint64_t read_ena_fprch               : 1;  /**< Enable pad receiver starting one cycle earlier than normal during read operations. */
07775     uint64_t slot_ctl_reset_force         : 1;  /**< Write 1 to reset the slot-control override for all slot-control registers. After writing a
07776                                                          1 to this bit, slot-control registers will update with changes made to other timing-
07777                                                          control registers. This is a one-shot operation; it automatically returns to 0 after a
07778                                                          write to 1. */
07779     uint64_t ref_int_lsbs                 : 9;  /**< Refresh-interval value least-significant bits. The default is 0x0.
07780                                                          Refresh interval is represented in number of 512 CK cycle increments and is controlled by
07781                                                          LMC()_CONFIG[REF_ZQCS_INT]. More precise refresh interval however (in number of
07782                                                          1 CK cycle) can be achieved by setting this field to a nonzero value. */
07783     uint64_t drive_ena_bprch              : 1;  /**< Drive DQx for one cycle longer than normal during write operations. */
07784     uint64_t drive_ena_fprch              : 1;  /**< Drive DQx starting one cycle earlier than normal during write operations. */
07785     uint64_t dlcram_flip_synd             : 2;  /**< Reserved. */
07786     uint64_t dlcram_cor_dis               : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
07787     uint64_t dlc_nxm_rd                   : 1;  /**< When set, enable NXM events for HFA read operations. */
07788     uint64_t l2c_nxm_rd                   : 1;  /**< When set, corresponding LMC()_INT[NXM_WR_ERR] will be set and LMC()_NXM_FADR will be
07789                                                          loaded for L2C NXM read operations. NXM read operations may occur during normal operation
07790                                                          (due to prefetches), so [L2C_NXM_RD] should not be set during normal operation to allow
07791                                                          LMC()_INT[NXM_WR_ERR] to indicate NXM writes. */
07792     uint64_t l2c_nxm_wr                   : 1;  /**< When set, corresponding LMC()_INT[NXM_WR_ERR] will be set and LMC()_NXM_FADR will be
07793                                                          loaded for L2C NXM write operations. NXM writes are generally an indication of
07794                                                          failure, so [L2C_NXM_WR] can generally be set. */
07795 #else
07796     uint64_t l2c_nxm_wr                   : 1;
07797     uint64_t l2c_nxm_rd                   : 1;
07798     uint64_t dlc_nxm_rd                   : 1;
07799     uint64_t dlcram_cor_dis               : 1;
07800     uint64_t dlcram_flip_synd             : 2;
07801     uint64_t drive_ena_fprch              : 1;
07802     uint64_t drive_ena_bprch              : 1;
07803     uint64_t ref_int_lsbs                 : 9;
07804     uint64_t slot_ctl_reset_force         : 1;
07805     uint64_t read_ena_fprch               : 1;
07806     uint64_t read_ena_bprch               : 1;
07807     uint64_t vrefint_seq_deskew           : 1;
07808     uint64_t reserved_21_23               : 3;
07809     uint64_t gen_par                      : 1;
07810     uint64_t par_include_bg1              : 1;
07811     uint64_t par_include_a17              : 1;
07812     uint64_t reserved_27_27               : 1;
07813     uint64_t cal_ena                      : 1;
07814     uint64_t cmd_rti                      : 1;
07815     uint64_t reserved_30_31               : 2;
07816     uint64_t invert_data                  : 1;
07817     uint64_t reserved_33_35               : 3;
07818     uint64_t mrs_cmd_select               : 1;
07819     uint64_t mrs_cmd_override             : 1;
07820     uint64_t reserved_38_39               : 2;
07821     uint64_t par_addr_mask                : 3;
07822     uint64_t reserved_43_43               : 1;
07823     uint64_t ea_int_polarity              : 1;
07824     uint64_t error_alert_n_sample         : 1;
07825     uint64_t reserved_46_47               : 2;
07826     uint64_t rcd_parity_check             : 1;
07827     uint64_t dimm0_cid                    : 2;
07828     uint64_t dimm1_cid                    : 2;
07829     uint64_t coalesce_address_mode        : 1;
07830     uint64_t dimm_sel_force_invert        : 1;
07831     uint64_t dimm_sel_invert_off          : 1;
07832     uint64_t mrs_bside_invert_disable     : 1;
07833     uint64_t mrs_one_side                 : 1;
07834     uint64_t mrs_side                     : 1;
07835     uint64_t ref_block                    : 1;
07836     uint64_t reserved_60_63               : 4;
07837 #endif
07838     } cn73xx;
07839     struct cvmx_lmcx_ext_config_s         cn78xx;
07840     struct cvmx_lmcx_ext_config_s         cn78xxp1;
07841     struct cvmx_lmcx_ext_config_cn73xx    cnf75xx;
07842 };
07843 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_ext_config cvmx_lmcx_ext_config_t;
07844 
07845 /**
07846  * cvmx_lmc#_ext_config2
07847  *
07848  * This register has additional configuration and control bits for the LMC.
07849  *
07850  */
07851 union cvmx_lmcx_ext_config2 {
07852     uint64_t u64;
07853     struct cvmx_lmcx_ext_config2_s {
07854 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
07855     uint64_t reserved_27_63               : 37;
07856     uint64_t sref_auto_idle_thres         : 5;  /**< Reserved. */
07857     uint64_t sref_auto_enable             : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
07858     uint64_t delay_unload_r3              : 1;  /**< Reserved, MBZ. */
07859     uint64_t delay_unload_r2              : 1;  /**< Reserved, MBZ. */
07860     uint64_t delay_unload_r1              : 1;  /**< Reserved, MBZ. */
07861     uint64_t delay_unload_r0              : 1;  /**< Reserved, MBZ. */
07862     uint64_t early_dqx2                   : 1;  /**< Similar to LMC()_CONFIG[EARLY_DQX]. This field provides an additional setting to send DQx
07863                                                          signals one more CK cycle earlier on top of LMC()_CONFIG[EARLY_DQX]. */
07864     uint64_t xor_bank_sel                 : 4;  /**< When LMC()_CONTROL[XOR_BANK] is set to 1, this field selects which
07865                                                           L2C-LMC address bits are used to XOR the bank bits with.
07866                                                           The address selection is as follows:
07867                                                          - 0:  bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<15:12>
07868                                                          - 1:  bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<14:11>
07869                                                          - 2:  bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<16:13>
07870                                                          - 3:  bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<17:14>
07871                                                          - 4:  bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<18:15>
07872                                                          - 5:  bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<19:16>
07873                                                          - 6:  bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<23:20>
07874                                                          - 7:  bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<24:21>
07875                                                          - 8:  bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<27:24>
07876                                                          - 9:  bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<28:25>
07877                                                           - 10: bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<31:28>
07878                                                           - 11: bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<32:29>
07879                                                           - 12: bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<33:30>
07880                                                           - 13: bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<36:33>
07881                                                           - 14: bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<37:34>
07882                                                           - 15: Reserved. */
07883     uint64_t reserved_10_11               : 2;
07884     uint64_t row_col_switch               : 1;  /**< When set, the memory address bit position that represents bit 4 of the COLUMN
07885                                                          address (bit 5 in 32-bit mode) becomes the low order DDR ROW address bit.
07886                                                          The upper DDR COLUMN address portion is selected using LMC()_CONFIG[ROW_LSB]
07887                                                          (and LMC()_DUAL_MEMCFG[ROW_LSB] for dual-memory configuration).
07888                                                          It is recommended to set this bit to 1 when TRR_ON is set. */
07889     uint64_t trr_on                       : 1;  /**< When set, this enables row activates counts of the
07890                                                          DRAM used in target row refresh mode. This bit can
07891                                                          be safely set after the LMC()_EXT_CONFIG2[MACRAM_SCRUB_DONE]
07892                                                          has a value of 1. */
07893     uint64_t mac                          : 3;  /**< Sets the maximum number of activates allowed within a tMAW interval.
07894                                                          0x0 = 100K.
07895                                                          0x1 = 400K/2.
07896                                                          0x2 = 500K/2.
07897                                                          0x3 = 600K/2.
07898                                                          0x4 = 700K/2.
07899                                                          0x5 = 800K/2.
07900                                                          0x6 = 900K/2.
07901                                                          0x7 = 1000K/2. */
07902     uint64_t macram_scrub_done            : 1;  /**< Maximum activate count memory scrub complete indication;
07903                                                          1 means the memory has been scrubbed to all zero. */
07904     uint64_t macram_scrub                 : 1;  /**< When set, the maximum activate count memory will be scrubbed to all zero values. This
07905                                                          should be done before enabling TRR mode by setting LMC()_EXT_CONFIG2[TRR_ON].
07906                                                          This is a one-shot operation; it automatically returns to 0 after a write to 1. */
07907     uint64_t macram_flip_synd             : 2;  /**< Reserved. */
07908     uint64_t macram_cor_dis               : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
07909 #else
07910     uint64_t macram_cor_dis               : 1;
07911     uint64_t macram_flip_synd             : 2;
07912     uint64_t macram_scrub                 : 1;
07913     uint64_t macram_scrub_done            : 1;
07914     uint64_t mac                          : 3;
07915     uint64_t trr_on                       : 1;
07916     uint64_t row_col_switch               : 1;
07917     uint64_t reserved_10_11               : 2;
07918     uint64_t xor_bank_sel                 : 4;
07919     uint64_t early_dqx2                   : 1;
07920     uint64_t delay_unload_r0              : 1;
07921     uint64_t delay_unload_r1              : 1;
07922     uint64_t delay_unload_r2              : 1;
07923     uint64_t delay_unload_r3              : 1;
07924     uint64_t sref_auto_enable             : 1;
07925     uint64_t sref_auto_idle_thres         : 5;
07926     uint64_t reserved_27_63               : 37;
07927 #endif
07928     } s;
07929     struct cvmx_lmcx_ext_config2_cn73xx {
07930 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
07931     uint64_t reserved_10_63               : 54;
07932     uint64_t row_col_switch               : 1;  /**< When set, the memory address bit position that represents bit 4 of the COLUMN
07933                                                          address (bit 5 in 32-bit mode) becomes the low order DDR ROW address bit.
07934                                                          The upper DDR COLUMN address portion is selected using LMC()_CONFIG[ROW_LSB]
07935                                                          (and LMC()_DUAL_MEMCFG[ROW_LSB] for dual-memory configuration).
07936                                                          It is recommended to set this bit to one when TRR_ON is set. */
07937     uint64_t trr_on                       : 1;  /**< When set, this enables row activates counts of the
07938                                                          DRAM used in target row refresh mode. This bit can
07939                                                          be safely set after the LMC()_EXT_CONFIG2[MACRAM_SCRUB_DONE]
07940                                                          has a value of 1. */
07941     uint64_t mac                          : 3;  /**< Sets the maximum number of activates allowed within a tMAW interval.
07942                                                          0x0 = 100K.
07943                                                          0x1 = 400K/2.
07944                                                          0x2 = 500K/2.
07945                                                          0x3 = 600K/2.
07946                                                          0x4 = 700K/2.
07947                                                          0x5 = 800K/2.
07948                                                          0x6 = 900K/2.
07949                                                          0x7 = 1000K/2. */
07950     uint64_t macram_scrub_done            : 1;  /**< Maximum activate count memory scrub complete indication;
07951                                                          1 means the memory has been scrubbed to all zero. */
07952     uint64_t macram_scrub                 : 1;  /**< When set, the maximum activate count memory will be scrubbed to all zero values. This
07953                                                          should be done before enabling TRR mode by setting LMC()_EXT_CONFIG2[TRR_ON].
07954                                                          This is a one-shot operation; it automatically returns to 0 after a write to 1. */
07955     uint64_t macram_flip_synd             : 2;  /**< Reserved. */
07956     uint64_t macram_cor_dis               : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
07957 #else
07958     uint64_t macram_cor_dis               : 1;
07959     uint64_t macram_flip_synd             : 2;
07960     uint64_t macram_scrub                 : 1;
07961     uint64_t macram_scrub_done            : 1;
07962     uint64_t mac                          : 3;
07963     uint64_t trr_on                       : 1;
07964     uint64_t row_col_switch               : 1;
07965     uint64_t reserved_10_63               : 54;
07966 #endif
07967     } cn73xx;
07968     struct cvmx_lmcx_ext_config2_s        cn78xx;
07969     struct cvmx_lmcx_ext_config2_cnf75xx {
07970 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
07971     uint64_t reserved_21_63               : 43;
07972     uint64_t delay_unload_r3              : 1;  /**< Reserved, MBZ. */
07973     uint64_t delay_unload_r2              : 1;  /**< Reserved, MBZ. */
07974     uint64_t delay_unload_r1              : 1;  /**< Reserved, MBZ. */
07975     uint64_t delay_unload_r0              : 1;  /**< Reserved, MBZ. */
07976     uint64_t early_dqx2                   : 1;  /**< Similar to LMC()_CONFIG[EARLY_DQX]. This field provides an additional setting to send DQx
07977                                                          signals one more CK cycle earlier on top of LMC()_CONFIG[EARLY_DQX]. */
07978     uint64_t xor_bank_sel                 : 4;  /**< When LMC()_CONTROL[XOR_BANK] is set to 1, this field selects which
07979                                                           L2C-LMC address bits are used to XOR the bank bits with.
07980                                                           The address selection is as follows:
07981                                                          - 0:  bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<15:12>
07982                                                          - 1:  bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<14:11>
07983                                                          - 2:  bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<16:13>
07984                                                          - 3:  bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<17:14>
07985                                                          - 4:  bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<18:15>
07986                                                          - 5:  bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<19:16>
07987                                                          - 6:  bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<23:20>
07988                                                          - 7:  bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<24:21>
07989                                                          - 8:  bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<27:24>
07990                                                          - 9:  bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<28:25>
07991                                                           - 10: bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<31:28>
07992                                                           - 11: bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<32:29>
07993                                                           - 12: bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<33:30>
07994                                                           - 13: bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<36:33>
07995                                                           - 14: bank<3:0> = address<10:7> ^ address<37:34>
07996                                                           - 15: Reserved. */
07997     uint64_t reserved_10_11               : 2;
07998     uint64_t row_col_switch               : 1;  /**< When set, the memory address bit position that represents bit 4 of the COLUMN
07999                                                          address (bit 5 in 32-bit mode) becomes the low order DDR ROW address bit.
08000                                                          The upper DDR COLUMN address portion is selected using LMC()_CONFIG[ROW_LSB]
08001                                                          (and LMC()_DUAL_MEMCFG[ROW_LSB] for dual-memory configuration).
08002                                                          It is recommended to set this bit to 1 when TRR_ON is set. */
08003     uint64_t trr_on                       : 1;  /**< When set, this enables row activates counts of the
08004                                                          DRAM used in target row refresh mode. This bit can
08005                                                          be safely set after the LMC()_EXT_CONFIG2[MACRAM_SCRUB_DONE]
08006                                                          has a value of 1. */
08007     uint64_t mac                          : 3;  /**< Sets the maximum number of activates allowed within a tMAW interval.
08008                                                          0x0 = 100K.
08009                                                          0x1 = 400K/2.
08010                                                          0x2 = 500K/2.
08011                                                          0x3 = 600K/2.
08012                                                          0x4 = 700K/2.
08013                                                          0x5 = 800K/2.
08014                                                          0x6 = 900K/2.
08015                                                          0x7 = 1000K/2. */
08016     uint64_t macram_scrub_done            : 1;  /**< Maximum activate count memory scrub complete indication;
08017                                                          1 means the memory has been scrubbed to all zero. */
08018     uint64_t macram_scrub                 : 1;  /**< When set, the maximum activate count memory will be scrubbed to all zero values. This
08019                                                          should be done before enabling TRR mode by setting LMC()_EXT_CONFIG2[TRR_ON].
08020                                                          This is a one-shot operation; it automatically returns to 0 after a write to 1. */
08021     uint64_t macram_flip_synd             : 2;  /**< Reserved. */
08022     uint64_t macram_cor_dis               : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
08023 #else
08024     uint64_t macram_cor_dis               : 1;
08025     uint64_t macram_flip_synd             : 2;
08026     uint64_t macram_scrub                 : 1;
08027     uint64_t macram_scrub_done            : 1;
08028     uint64_t mac                          : 3;
08029     uint64_t trr_on                       : 1;
08030     uint64_t row_col_switch               : 1;
08031     uint64_t reserved_10_11               : 2;
08032     uint64_t xor_bank_sel                 : 4;
08033     uint64_t early_dqx2                   : 1;
08034     uint64_t delay_unload_r0              : 1;
08035     uint64_t delay_unload_r1              : 1;
08036     uint64_t delay_unload_r2              : 1;
08037     uint64_t delay_unload_r3              : 1;
08038     uint64_t reserved_21_63               : 43;
08039 #endif
08040     } cnf75xx;
08041 };
08042 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_ext_config2 cvmx_lmcx_ext_config2_t;
08043 
08044 /**
08045  * cvmx_lmc#_fadr
08046  *
08047  * This register only captures the first transaction with ECC errors. A DED error can over-write
08048  * this register with its failing addresses if the first error was a SEC. If you write
08049  * LMC()_INT -> SEC_ERR/DED_ERR, it clears the error bits and captures the next failing
08050  * address. If FDIMM is 1, that means the error is in the high DIMM.
08051  * LMC()_FADR captures the failing pre-scrambled address location (split into DIMM, bunk,
08052  * bank, etc). If scrambling is off, then LMC()_FADR will also capture the failing physical
08053  * location in the DRAM parts. LMC()_SCRAMBLED_FADR captures the actual failing address
08054  * location in the physical DRAM parts, i.e.,
08055  * * If scrambling is on, LMC()_SCRAMBLED_FADR contains the failing physical location in the
08056  * DRAM parts (split into DIMM, bunk, bank, etc.)
08057  * If scrambling is off, the pre-scramble and post-scramble addresses are the same; and so the
08058  * contents of LMC()_SCRAMBLED_FADR match the contents of LMC()_FADR.
08059  */
08060 union cvmx_lmcx_fadr {
08061     uint64_t u64;
08062     struct cvmx_lmcx_fadr_s {
08063 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
08064     uint64_t reserved_43_63               : 21;
08065     uint64_t fcid                         : 3;  /**< Reserved. */
08066     uint64_t fill_order                   : 2;  /**< Fill order for failing transaction. */
08067     uint64_t reserved_0_37                : 38;
08068 #else
08069     uint64_t reserved_0_37                : 38;
08070     uint64_t fill_order                   : 2;
08071     uint64_t fcid                         : 3;
08072     uint64_t reserved_43_63               : 21;
08073 #endif
08074     } s;
08075     struct cvmx_lmcx_fadr_cn30xx {
08076 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
08077     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
08078     uint64_t fdimm                        : 2;  /**< Failing DIMM# */
08079     uint64_t fbunk                        : 1;  /**< Failing Rank */
08080     uint64_t fbank                        : 3;  /**< Failing Bank[2:0] */
08081     uint64_t frow                         : 14; /**< Failing Row Address[13:0] */
08082     uint64_t fcol                         : 12; /**< Failing Column Start Address[11:0]
08083                                                          Represents the Failing read's starting column address
08084                                                          (and not the exact column address in which the SEC/DED
08085                                                          was detected) */
08086 #else
08087     uint64_t fcol                         : 12;
08088     uint64_t frow                         : 14;
08089     uint64_t fbank                        : 3;
08090     uint64_t fbunk                        : 1;
08091     uint64_t fdimm                        : 2;
08092     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
08093 #endif
08094     } cn30xx;
08095     struct cvmx_lmcx_fadr_cn30xx          cn31xx;
08096     struct cvmx_lmcx_fadr_cn30xx          cn38xx;
08097     struct cvmx_lmcx_fadr_cn30xx          cn38xxp2;
08098     struct cvmx_lmcx_fadr_cn30xx          cn50xx;
08099     struct cvmx_lmcx_fadr_cn30xx          cn52xx;
08100     struct cvmx_lmcx_fadr_cn30xx          cn52xxp1;
08101     struct cvmx_lmcx_fadr_cn30xx          cn56xx;
08102     struct cvmx_lmcx_fadr_cn30xx          cn56xxp1;
08103     struct cvmx_lmcx_fadr_cn30xx          cn58xx;
08104     struct cvmx_lmcx_fadr_cn30xx          cn58xxp1;
08105     struct cvmx_lmcx_fadr_cn61xx {
08106 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
08107     uint64_t reserved_36_63               : 28;
08108     uint64_t fdimm                        : 2;  /**< Failing DIMM# */
08109     uint64_t fbunk                        : 1;  /**< Failing Rank */
08110     uint64_t fbank                        : 3;  /**< Failing Bank[2:0] */
08111     uint64_t frow                         : 16; /**< Failing Row Address[15:0] */
08112     uint64_t fcol                         : 14; /**< Failing Column Address[13:0]
08113                                                          Technically, represents the address of the 128b data
08114                                                          that had an ecc error, i.e., fcol[0] is always 0. Can
08115                                                          be used in conjuction with LMC*_CONFIG[DED_ERR] to
08116                                                          isolate the 64b chunk of data in error */
08117 #else
08118     uint64_t fcol                         : 14;
08119     uint64_t frow                         : 16;
08120     uint64_t fbank                        : 3;
08121     uint64_t fbunk                        : 1;
08122     uint64_t fdimm                        : 2;
08123     uint64_t reserved_36_63               : 28;
08124 #endif
08125     } cn61xx;
08126     struct cvmx_lmcx_fadr_cn61xx          cn63xx;
08127     struct cvmx_lmcx_fadr_cn61xx          cn63xxp1;
08128     struct cvmx_lmcx_fadr_cn61xx          cn66xx;
08129     struct cvmx_lmcx_fadr_cn61xx          cn68xx;
08130     struct cvmx_lmcx_fadr_cn61xx          cn68xxp1;
08131     struct cvmx_lmcx_fadr_cn70xx {
08132 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
08133     uint64_t reserved_40_63               : 24;
08134     uint64_t fill_order                   : 2;  /**< Fill order for failing transaction. */
08135     uint64_t fdimm                        : 1;  /**< Failing DIMM number. CN70XX/CN71XX only supports one DIMM, so this bit will always
08136                                                          return a 0. */
08137     uint64_t fbunk                        : 1;  /**< Failing rank number. */
08138     uint64_t fbank                        : 4;  /**< Failing bank number. Bits <3:0>. */
08139     uint64_t frow                         : 18; /**< Failing row address. Bits <17:0>. */
08140     uint64_t fcol                         : 14; /**< Failing column address <13:0>. Technically, represents the address of the 64b data that
08141                                                          had an ECC error, i.e., FCOL[0] is always 0. Can be used in conjunction with
08142                                                          LMC(0..0)_INT[DED_ERR] to isolate the 64b chunk of data in error. */
08143 #else
08144     uint64_t fcol                         : 14;
08145     uint64_t frow                         : 18;
08146     uint64_t fbank                        : 4;
08147     uint64_t fbunk                        : 1;
08148     uint64_t fdimm                        : 1;
08149     uint64_t fill_order                   : 2;
08150     uint64_t reserved_40_63               : 24;
08151 #endif
08152     } cn70xx;
08153     struct cvmx_lmcx_fadr_cn70xx          cn70xxp1;
08154     struct cvmx_lmcx_fadr_cn73xx {
08155 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
08156     uint64_t reserved_43_63               : 21;
08157     uint64_t fcid                         : 3;  /**< Reserved. */
08158     uint64_t fill_order                   : 2;  /**< Fill order for failing transaction. */
08159     uint64_t fdimm                        : 1;  /**< Failing DIMM number. */
08160     uint64_t fbunk                        : 1;  /**< Failing rank number. */
08161     uint64_t fbank                        : 4;  /**< Failing bank number. Bits <3:0>. */
08162     uint64_t frow                         : 18; /**< Failing row address. Bits <17:0>. */
08163     uint64_t fcol                         : 14; /**< Failing column address <13:0>. Technically, represents the address of the 64b data that
08164                                                          had an ECC error, i.e., FCOL[0] is always 0. Can be used in conjunction with
08165                                                          LMC()_INT[DED_ERR] to isolate the 64b chunk of data in error. */
08166 #else
08167     uint64_t fcol                         : 14;
08168     uint64_t frow                         : 18;
08169     uint64_t fbank                        : 4;
08170     uint64_t fbunk                        : 1;
08171     uint64_t fdimm                        : 1;
08172     uint64_t fill_order                   : 2;
08173     uint64_t fcid                         : 3;
08174     uint64_t reserved_43_63               : 21;
08175 #endif
08176     } cn73xx;
08177     struct cvmx_lmcx_fadr_cn73xx          cn78xx;
08178     struct cvmx_lmcx_fadr_cn73xx          cn78xxp1;
08179     struct cvmx_lmcx_fadr_cn61xx          cnf71xx;
08180     struct cvmx_lmcx_fadr_cn73xx          cnf75xx;
08181 };
08182 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_fadr cvmx_lmcx_fadr_t;
08183 
08184 /**
08185  * cvmx_lmc#_general_purpose0
08186  */
08187 union cvmx_lmcx_general_purpose0 {
08188     uint64_t u64;
08189     struct cvmx_lmcx_general_purpose0_s {
08190 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
08191     uint64_t data                         : 64; /**< General purpose data register.  See LMC()_PPR_CTL and LMC()_DBTRAIN_CTL[RW_TRAIN]. */
08192 #else
08193     uint64_t data                         : 64;
08194 #endif
08195     } s;
08196     struct cvmx_lmcx_general_purpose0_s   cn73xx;
08197     struct cvmx_lmcx_general_purpose0_s   cn78xx;
08198     struct cvmx_lmcx_general_purpose0_s   cnf75xx;
08199 };
08200 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_general_purpose0 cvmx_lmcx_general_purpose0_t;
08201 
08202 /**
08203  * cvmx_lmc#_general_purpose1
08204  */
08205 union cvmx_lmcx_general_purpose1 {
08206     uint64_t u64;
08207     struct cvmx_lmcx_general_purpose1_s {
08208 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
08209     uint64_t data                         : 64; /**< General purpose data register.  See LMC()_PPR_CTL and LMC()_DBTRAIN_CTL[RW_TRAIN]. */
08210 #else
08211     uint64_t data                         : 64;
08212 #endif
08213     } s;
08214     struct cvmx_lmcx_general_purpose1_s   cn73xx;
08215     struct cvmx_lmcx_general_purpose1_s   cn78xx;
08216     struct cvmx_lmcx_general_purpose1_s   cnf75xx;
08217 };
08218 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_general_purpose1 cvmx_lmcx_general_purpose1_t;
08219 
08220 /**
08221  * cvmx_lmc#_general_purpose2
08222  */
08223 union cvmx_lmcx_general_purpose2 {
08224     uint64_t u64;
08225     struct cvmx_lmcx_general_purpose2_s {
08226 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
08227     uint64_t reserved_16_63               : 48;
08228     uint64_t data                         : 16; /**< General purpose data register.  See LMC()_PPR_CTL and LMC()_DBTRAIN_CTL[RW_TRAIN]. */
08229 #else
08230     uint64_t data                         : 16;
08231     uint64_t reserved_16_63               : 48;
08232 #endif
08233     } s;
08234     struct cvmx_lmcx_general_purpose2_s   cn73xx;
08235     struct cvmx_lmcx_general_purpose2_s   cn78xx;
08236     struct cvmx_lmcx_general_purpose2_s   cnf75xx;
08237 };
08238 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_general_purpose2 cvmx_lmcx_general_purpose2_t;
08239 
08240 /**
08241  * cvmx_lmc#_ifb_cnt
08242  *
08243  * LMC_IFB_CNT  = Performance Counters
08244  *
08245  */
08246 union cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt {
08247     uint64_t u64;
08248     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_s {
08249 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
08250     uint64_t ifbcnt                       : 64; /**< Performance counter. 64-bit counter that increments every CK cycle that there is something
08251                                                          in the in-flight buffer. */
08252 #else
08253     uint64_t ifbcnt                       : 64;
08254 #endif
08255     } s;
08256     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_s            cn61xx;
08257     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_s            cn63xx;
08258     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_s            cn63xxp1;
08259     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_s            cn66xx;
08260     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_s            cn68xx;
08261     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_s            cn68xxp1;
08262     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_s            cn70xx;
08263     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_s            cn70xxp1;
08264     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_s            cn73xx;
08265     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_s            cn78xx;
08266     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_s            cn78xxp1;
08267     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_s            cnf71xx;
08268     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_s            cnf75xx;
08269 };
08270 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_t;
08271 
08272 /**
08273  * cvmx_lmc#_ifb_cnt_hi
08274  *
08275  * LMC_IFB_CNT_HI  = Performance Counters
08276  *
08277  */
08278 union cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_hi {
08279     uint64_t u64;
08280     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_hi_s {
08281 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
08282     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
08283     uint64_t ifbcnt_hi                    : 32; /**< Performance Counter to measure Bus Utilization
08284                                                          Upper 32-bits of 64-bit counter that increments every
08285                                                          cycle there is something in the in-flight buffer. */
08286 #else
08287     uint64_t ifbcnt_hi                    : 32;
08288     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
08289 #endif
08290     } s;
08291     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_hi_s         cn30xx;
08292     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_hi_s         cn31xx;
08293     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_hi_s         cn38xx;
08294     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_hi_s         cn38xxp2;
08295     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_hi_s         cn50xx;
08296     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_hi_s         cn52xx;
08297     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_hi_s         cn52xxp1;
08298     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_hi_s         cn56xx;
08299     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_hi_s         cn56xxp1;
08300     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_hi_s         cn58xx;
08301     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_hi_s         cn58xxp1;
08302 };
08303 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_hi cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_hi_t;
08304 
08305 /**
08306  * cvmx_lmc#_ifb_cnt_lo
08307  *
08308  * LMC_IFB_CNT_LO  = Performance Counters
08309  *
08310  */
08311 union cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_lo {
08312     uint64_t u64;
08313     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_lo_s {
08314 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
08315     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
08316     uint64_t ifbcnt_lo                    : 32; /**< Performance Counter
08317                                                          Low 32-bits of 64-bit counter that increments every
08318                                                          cycle there is something in the in-flight buffer. */
08319 #else
08320     uint64_t ifbcnt_lo                    : 32;
08321     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
08322 #endif
08323     } s;
08324     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_lo_s         cn30xx;
08325     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_lo_s         cn31xx;
08326     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_lo_s         cn38xx;
08327     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_lo_s         cn38xxp2;
08328     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_lo_s         cn50xx;
08329     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_lo_s         cn52xx;
08330     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_lo_s         cn52xxp1;
08331     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_lo_s         cn56xx;
08332     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_lo_s         cn56xxp1;
08333     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_lo_s         cn58xx;
08334     struct cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_lo_s         cn58xxp1;
08335 };
08336 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_lo cvmx_lmcx_ifb_cnt_lo_t;
08337 
08338 /**
08339  * cvmx_lmc#_int
08340  *
08341  * This register contains the different interrupt-summary bits of the LMC.
08342  *
08343  */
08344 union cvmx_lmcx_int {
08345     uint64_t u64;
08346     struct cvmx_lmcx_int_s {
08347 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
08348     uint64_t reserved_14_63               : 50;
08349     uint64_t macram_ded_err               : 1;  /**< MAC RAM ECC double error detect (DED). */
08350     uint64_t macram_sec_err               : 1;  /**< MAC RAM ECC single error correct (SEC). */
08351     uint64_t ddr_err                      : 1;  /**< DDR RAM error alert interrupt. */
08352     uint64_t dlcram_ded_err               : 1;  /**< DLC RAM ECC double error detect (DED). */
08353     uint64_t dlcram_sec_err               : 1;  /**< DLC RAM ECC single error correct (SEC). */
08354     uint64_t ded_err                      : 4;  /**< Double error detected (DED) of Rd Data.
08355                                                          In 64b mode:
08356                                                          _ <5> corresponds to DQ[63:0]_c0_p0
08357                                                          _ <6> corresponds to DQ[63:0]_c0_p1
08358                                                          _ <7> corresponds to DQ[63:0]_c1_p0
08359                                                          _ <8> corresponds to DQ[63:0]_c1_p1
08360                                                          _ where _cC_pP denotes cycle C and phase P.
08361                                                          In 32b mode, each bit corresponds to 2 phases:
08362                                                          _ <5> corresponds to DQ[31:0]_c0_p1/0
08363                                                          _ <6> corresponds to DQ[31:0]_c1_p1/0
08364                                                          _ <7> corresponds to DQ[31:0]_c2_p1/0
08365                                                          _ <8> corresponds to DQ[31:0]_c3_p1/0 */
08366     uint64_t sec_err                      : 4;  /**< Single error (corrected) of Rd Data.
08367                                                          _ <1> corresponds to DQ[63:0]_c0_p0
08368                                                          _ <2> corresponds to DQ[63:0]_c0_p1
08369                                                          _ <3> corresponds to DQ[63:0]_c1_p0
08370                                                          _ <4> corresponds to DQ[63:0]_c1_p1
08371                                                          _ where _cC_pP denotes cycle C and phase P.
08372                                                          In 32b mode, each bit corresponds to 2 phases:
08373                                                          <5> corresponds to DQ[31:0]_c0_p1/0
08374                                                          <6> corresponds to DQ[31:0]_c1_p1/0
08375                                                          <7> corresponds to DQ[31:0]_c2_p1/0
08376                                                          <8> corresponds to DQ[31:0]_c3_p1/0 */
08377     uint64_t nxm_wr_err                   : 1;  /**< Write to nonexistent memory. */
08378 #else
08379     uint64_t nxm_wr_err                   : 1;
08380     uint64_t sec_err                      : 4;
08381     uint64_t ded_err                      : 4;
08382     uint64_t dlcram_sec_err               : 1;
08383     uint64_t dlcram_ded_err               : 1;
08384     uint64_t ddr_err                      : 1;
08385     uint64_t macram_sec_err               : 1;
08386     uint64_t macram_ded_err               : 1;
08387     uint64_t reserved_14_63               : 50;
08388 #endif
08389     } s;
08390     struct cvmx_lmcx_int_cn61xx {
08391 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
08392     uint64_t reserved_9_63                : 55;
08393     uint64_t ded_err                      : 4;  /**< Double Error detected (DED) of Rd Data
08394                                                          [0] corresponds to DQ[63:0]_c0_p0
08395                                                          [1] corresponds to DQ[63:0]_c0_p1
08396                                                          [2] corresponds to DQ[63:0]_c1_p0
08397                                                          [3] corresponds to DQ[63:0]_c1_p1
08398                                                          In 32b mode, ecc is calculated on 4 cycle worth of data
08399                                                          [0] corresponds to [DQ[31:0]_c0_p1, DQ[31:0]_c0_p0]
08400                                                          [1] corresponds to [DQ[31:0]_c1_p1, DQ[31:0]_c1_p0]
08401                                                          [2] corresponds to [DQ[31:0]_c2_p1, DQ[31:0]_c2_p0]
08402                                                          [3] corresponds to [DQ[31:0]_c3_p1, DQ[31:0]_c3_p0]
08403                                                           where _cC_pP denotes cycle C and phase P
08404                                                           Write of 1 will clear the corresponding error bit */
08405     uint64_t sec_err                      : 4;  /**< Single Error (corrected) of Rd Data
08406                                                          [0] corresponds to DQ[63:0]_c0_p0
08407                                                          [1] corresponds to DQ[63:0]_c0_p1
08408                                                          [2] corresponds to DQ[63:0]_c1_p0
08409                                                          [3] corresponds to DQ[63:0]_c1_p1
08410                                                          In 32b mode, ecc is calculated on 4 cycle worth of data
08411                                                          [0] corresponds to [DQ[31:0]_c0_p1, DQ[31:0]_c0_p0]
08412                                                          [1] corresponds to [DQ[31:0]_c1_p1, DQ[31:0]_c1_p0]
08413                                                          [2] corresponds to [DQ[31:0]_c2_p1, DQ[31:0]_c2_p0]
08414                                                          [3] corresponds to [DQ[31:0]_c3_p1, DQ[31:0]_c3_p0]
08415                                                           where _cC_pP denotes cycle C and phase P
08416                                                           Write of 1 will clear the corresponding error bit */
08417     uint64_t nxm_wr_err                   : 1;  /**< Write to non-existent memory
08418                                                          Write of 1 will clear the corresponding error bit */
08419 #else
08420     uint64_t nxm_wr_err                   : 1;
08421     uint64_t sec_err                      : 4;
08422     uint64_t ded_err                      : 4;
08423     uint64_t reserved_9_63                : 55;
08424 #endif
08425     } cn61xx;
08426     struct cvmx_lmcx_int_cn61xx           cn63xx;
08427     struct cvmx_lmcx_int_cn61xx           cn63xxp1;
08428     struct cvmx_lmcx_int_cn61xx           cn66xx;
08429     struct cvmx_lmcx_int_cn61xx           cn68xx;
08430     struct cvmx_lmcx_int_cn61xx           cn68xxp1;
08431     struct cvmx_lmcx_int_cn70xx {
08432 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
08433     uint64_t reserved_12_63               : 52;
08434     uint64_t ddr_err                      : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
08435     uint64_t dlcram_ded_err               : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
08436     uint64_t dlcram_sec_err               : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
08437     uint64_t ded_err                      : 4;  /**< Double error detected (DED) of Rd Data.
08438                                                          In 32b mode, each bit corresponds to 2 phases:
08439                                                          <5> corresponds to DQ[31:0]_c0_p1/0
08440                                                          <6> corresponds to DQ[31:0]_c1_p1/0
08441                                                          <7> corresponds to DQ[31:0]_c2_p1/0
08442                                                          <8> corresponds to DQ[31:0]_c3_p1/0 */
08443     uint64_t sec_err                      : 4;  /**< Single error (corrected) of Rd Data.
08444                                                          In 32b mode, each bit corresponds to 2 phases:
08445                                                          <1> corresponds to DQ[31:0]_c0_p1/0
08446                                                          <2> corresponds to DQ[31:0]_c1_p1/0
08447                                                          <3> corresponds to DQ[31:0]_c2_p1/0
08448                                                          <4> corresponds to DQ[31:0]_c3_p1/0 */
08449     uint64_t nxm_wr_err                   : 1;  /**< Write to nonexistent memory. */
08450 #else
08451     uint64_t nxm_wr_err                   : 1;
08452     uint64_t sec_err                      : 4;
08453     uint64_t ded_err                      : 4;
08454     uint64_t dlcram_sec_err               : 1;
08455     uint64_t dlcram_ded_err               : 1;
08456     uint64_t ddr_err                      : 1;
08457     uint64_t reserved_12_63               : 52;
08458 #endif
08459     } cn70xx;
08460     struct cvmx_lmcx_int_cn70xx           cn70xxp1;
08461     struct cvmx_lmcx_int_s                cn73xx;
08462     struct cvmx_lmcx_int_s                cn78xx;
08463     struct cvmx_lmcx_int_s                cn78xxp1;
08464     struct cvmx_lmcx_int_cn61xx           cnf71xx;
08465     struct cvmx_lmcx_int_s                cnf75xx;
08466 };
08467 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_int cvmx_lmcx_int_t;
08468 
08469 /**
08470  * cvmx_lmc#_int_en
08471  *
08472  * Unused CSR in O75.
08473  *
08474  */
08475 union cvmx_lmcx_int_en {
08476     uint64_t u64;
08477     struct cvmx_lmcx_int_en_s {
08478 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
08479     uint64_t reserved_6_63                : 58;
08480     uint64_t ddr_error_alert_ena          : 1;  /**< DDR4 error alert interrupt enable bit. */
08481     uint64_t dlcram_ded_ena               : 1;  /**< DLC RAM ECC double error detect (DED) interrupt enable bit. */
08482     uint64_t dlcram_sec_ena               : 1;  /**< DLC RAM ECC single error correct (SEC) interrupt enable bit. */
08483     uint64_t intr_ded_ena                 : 1;  /**< ECC double error detect (DED) interrupt enable bit. When set, the memory controller raises
08484                                                          a processor interrupt on detecting an uncorrectable double-bit ECC error. */
08485     uint64_t intr_sec_ena                 : 1;  /**< ECC single error correct (SEC) interrupt enable bit. When set, the memory controller
08486                                                          raises a processor interrupt on detecting a correctable single-bit ECC error. */
08487     uint64_t intr_nxm_wr_ena              : 1;  /**< Nonwrite error interrupt enable bit. When set, the memory controller raises a processor
08488                                                          interrupt on detecting an nonexistent memory write. */
08489 #else
08490     uint64_t intr_nxm_wr_ena              : 1;
08491     uint64_t intr_sec_ena                 : 1;
08492     uint64_t intr_ded_ena                 : 1;
08493     uint64_t dlcram_sec_ena               : 1;
08494     uint64_t dlcram_ded_ena               : 1;
08495     uint64_t ddr_error_alert_ena          : 1;
08496     uint64_t reserved_6_63                : 58;
08497 #endif
08498     } s;
08499     struct cvmx_lmcx_int_en_cn61xx {
08500 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
08501     uint64_t reserved_3_63                : 61;
08502     uint64_t intr_ded_ena                 : 1;  /**< ECC Double Error Detect(DED) Interrupt Enable bit
08503                                                          When set, the memory controller raises a processor
08504                                                          interrupt on detecting an uncorrectable Dbl Bit ECC
08505                                                          error. */
08506     uint64_t intr_sec_ena                 : 1;  /**< ECC Single Error Correct(SEC) Interrupt Enable bit
08507                                                          When set, the memory controller raises a processor
08508                                                          interrupt on detecting a correctable Single Bit ECC
08509                                                          error. */
08510     uint64_t intr_nxm_wr_ena              : 1;  /**< Non Write Error Interrupt Enable bit
08511                                                          When set, the memory controller raises a processor
08512                                                          interrupt on detecting an non-existent memory write */
08513 #else
08514     uint64_t intr_nxm_wr_ena              : 1;
08515     uint64_t intr_sec_ena                 : 1;
08516     uint64_t intr_ded_ena                 : 1;
08517     uint64_t reserved_3_63                : 61;
08518 #endif
08519     } cn61xx;
08520     struct cvmx_lmcx_int_en_cn61xx        cn63xx;
08521     struct cvmx_lmcx_int_en_cn61xx        cn63xxp1;
08522     struct cvmx_lmcx_int_en_cn61xx        cn66xx;
08523     struct cvmx_lmcx_int_en_cn61xx        cn68xx;
08524     struct cvmx_lmcx_int_en_cn61xx        cn68xxp1;
08525     struct cvmx_lmcx_int_en_s             cn70xx;
08526     struct cvmx_lmcx_int_en_s             cn70xxp1;
08527     struct cvmx_lmcx_int_en_s             cn73xx;
08528     struct cvmx_lmcx_int_en_s             cn78xx;
08529     struct cvmx_lmcx_int_en_s             cn78xxp1;
08530     struct cvmx_lmcx_int_en_cn61xx        cnf71xx;
08531     struct cvmx_lmcx_int_en_s             cnf75xx;
08532 };
08533 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_int_en cvmx_lmcx_int_en_t;
08534 
08535 /**
08536  * cvmx_lmc#_lane#_crc_swiz
08537  *
08538  * This register contains the CRC bit swizzle for even and odd ranks.
08539  *
08540  */
08541 union cvmx_lmcx_lanex_crc_swiz {
08542     uint64_t u64;
08543     struct cvmx_lmcx_lanex_crc_swiz_s {
08544 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
08545     uint64_t reserved_56_63               : 8;
08546     uint64_t r1_swiz7                     : 3;  /**< Bit select for odd rank, bit 7. */
08547     uint64_t r1_swiz6                     : 3;  /**< Bit select for odd rank, bit 6. */
08548     uint64_t r1_swiz5                     : 3;  /**< Bit select for odd rank, bit 5. */
08549     uint64_t r1_swiz4                     : 3;  /**< Bit select for odd rank, bit 4. */
08550     uint64_t r1_swiz3                     : 3;  /**< Bit select for odd rank, bit 3. */
08551     uint64_t r1_swiz2                     : 3;  /**< Bit select for odd rank, bit 2. */
08552     uint64_t r1_swiz1                     : 3;  /**< Bit select for odd rank, bit 1. */
08553     uint64_t r1_swiz0                     : 3;  /**< Bit select for odd rank, bit 0. */
08554     uint64_t reserved_24_31               : 8;
08555     uint64_t r0_swiz7                     : 3;  /**< Bit select for even rank, bit 7. */
08556     uint64_t r0_swiz6                     : 3;  /**< Bit select for even rank, bit 6. */
08557     uint64_t r0_swiz5                     : 3;  /**< Bit select for even rank, bit 5. */
08558     uint64_t r0_swiz4                     : 3;  /**< Bit select for even rank, bit 4. */
08559     uint64_t r0_swiz3                     : 3;  /**< Bit select for even rank, bit 3. */
08560     uint64_t r0_swiz2                     : 3;  /**< Bit select for even rank, bit 2. */
08561     uint64_t r0_swiz1                     : 3;  /**< Bit select for even rank, bit 1. */
08562     uint64_t r0_swiz0                     : 3;  /**< Bit select for even rank, bit 0. */
08563 #else
08564     uint64_t r0_swiz0                     : 3;
08565     uint64_t r0_swiz1                     : 3;
08566     uint64_t r0_swiz2                     : 3;
08567     uint64_t r0_swiz3                     : 3;
08568     uint64_t r0_swiz4                     : 3;
08569     uint64_t r0_swiz5                     : 3;
08570     uint64_t r0_swiz6                     : 3;
08571     uint64_t r0_swiz7                     : 3;
08572     uint64_t reserved_24_31               : 8;
08573     uint64_t r1_swiz0                     : 3;
08574     uint64_t r1_swiz1                     : 3;
08575     uint64_t r1_swiz2                     : 3;
08576     uint64_t r1_swiz3                     : 3;
08577     uint64_t r1_swiz4                     : 3;
08578     uint64_t r1_swiz5                     : 3;
08579     uint64_t r1_swiz6                     : 3;
08580     uint64_t r1_swiz7                     : 3;
08581     uint64_t reserved_56_63               : 8;
08582 #endif
08583     } s;
08584     struct cvmx_lmcx_lanex_crc_swiz_s     cn73xx;
08585     struct cvmx_lmcx_lanex_crc_swiz_s     cn78xx;
08586     struct cvmx_lmcx_lanex_crc_swiz_s     cn78xxp1;
08587     struct cvmx_lmcx_lanex_crc_swiz_s     cnf75xx;
08588 };
08589 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_lanex_crc_swiz cvmx_lmcx_lanex_crc_swiz_t;
08590 
08591 /**
08592  * cvmx_lmc#_mem_cfg0
08593  *
08594  * Specify the RSL base addresses for the block
08595  *
08596  *                  LMC_MEM_CFG0 = LMC Memory Configuration Register0
08597  *
08598  * This register controls certain parameters of  Memory Configuration
08599  */
08600 union cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg0 {
08601     uint64_t u64;
08602     struct cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg0_s {
08603 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
08604     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
08605     uint64_t reset                        : 1;  /**< Reset oneshot pulse for refresh counter,
08606                                                          and LMC_OPS_CNT_*, LMC_IFB_CNT_*, and LMC_DCLK_CNT_*
08607                                                          CSR's. SW should write this to a one, then re-write
08608                                                          it to a zero to cause the reset. */
08609     uint64_t silo_qc                      : 1;  /**< Adds a Quarter Cycle granularity to generate
08610                                                          dqs pulse generation for silo.
08611                                                          Combination of Silo_HC and Silo_QC gives the
08612                                                          ability to position the read enable with quarter
08613                                                          cycle resolution. This is applied on all the bytes
08614                                                          uniformly. */
08615     uint64_t bunk_ena                     : 1;  /**< Bunk Enable aka RANK ena (for use with dual-rank DIMMs)
08616                                                          For dual-rank DIMMs, the bunk_ena bit will enable
08617                                                          the drive of the CS_N[1:0] pins based on the
08618                                                          (pbank_lsb-1) address bit.
08619                                                          Write 0 for SINGLE ranked DIMM's. */
08620     uint64_t ded_err                      : 4;  /**< Double Error detected (DED) of Rd Data
08621                                                          In 128b mode, ecc is calulated on 1 cycle worth of data
08622                                                          [25] corresponds to DQ[63:0], Phase0
08623                                                          [26] corresponds to DQ[127:64], Phase0
08624                                                          [27] corresponds to DQ[63:0], Phase1
08625                                                          [28] corresponds to DQ[127:64], Phase1
08626                                                          In 64b mode, ecc is calculated on 2 cycle worth of data
08627                                                          [25] corresponds to DQ[63:0], Phase0, cycle0
08628                                                          [26] corresponds to DQ[63:0], Phase0, cycle1
08629                                                          [27] corresponds to DQ[63:0], Phase1, cycle0
08630                                                          [28] corresponds to DQ[63:0], Phase1, cycle1
08631                                                          Write of 1 will clear the corresponding error bit */
08632     uint64_t sec_err                      : 4;  /**< Single Error (corrected) of Rd Data
08633                                                          In 128b mode, ecc is calulated on 1 cycle worth of data
08634                                                          [21] corresponds to DQ[63:0], Phase0
08635                                                          [22] corresponds to DQ[127:64], Phase0
08636                                                          [23] corresponds to DQ[63:0], Phase1
08637                                                          [24] corresponds to DQ[127:64], Phase1
08638                                                          In 64b mode, ecc is calculated on 2 cycle worth of data
08639                                                          [21] corresponds to DQ[63:0], Phase0, cycle0
08640                                                          [22] corresponds to DQ[63:0], Phase0, cycle1
08641                                                          [23] corresponds to DQ[63:0], Phase1, cycle0
08642                                                          [24] corresponds to DQ[63:0], Phase1, cycle1
08643                                                          Write of 1 will clear the corresponding error bit */
08644     uint64_t intr_ded_ena                 : 1;  /**< ECC Double Error Detect(DED) Interrupt Enable bit
08645                                                          When set, the memory controller raises a processor
08646                                                          interrupt on detecting an uncorrectable Dbl Bit ECC
08647                                                          error. */
08648     uint64_t intr_sec_ena                 : 1;  /**< ECC Single Error Correct(SEC) Interrupt Enable bit
08649                                                          When set, the memory controller raises a processor
08650                                                          interrupt on detecting a correctable Single Bit ECC
08651                                                          error. */
08652     uint64_t tcl                          : 4;  /**< This register is not used */
08653     uint64_t ref_int                      : 6;  /**< Refresh interval represented in \#of 512 dclk increments.
08654                                                          Program this to RND-DN(tREFI/clkPeriod/512)
08655                                                             - 000000: RESERVED
08656                                                             - 000001: 1 * 512  = 512 dclks
08657                                                              - ...
08658                                                             - 111111: 63 * 512 = 32256 dclks */
08659     uint64_t pbank_lsb                    : 4;  /**< Physical Bank address select
08660                                                                                  Reverting to the explanation for ROW_LSB,
08661                                                                                  PBank_LSB would be Row_LSB bit + \#rowbits
08662                                                                                  + \#rankbits
08663                                                                                  In the 512MB DIMM Example, assuming no rank bits:
08664                                                                                  pbank_lsb=mem_addr[15+13] for 64 b mode
08665                                                                                           =mem_addr[16+13] for 128b mode
08666                                                                                  Hence the parameter
08667                                                          0000:pbank[1:0] = mem_adr[28:27]    / rank = mem_adr[26] (if bunk_ena)
08668                                                          0001:pbank[1:0] = mem_adr[29:28]    / rank = mem_adr[27]      "
08669                                                          0010:pbank[1:0] = mem_adr[30:29]    / rank = mem_adr[28]      "
08670                                                          0011:pbank[1:0] = mem_adr[31:30]    / rank = mem_adr[29]      "
08671                                                          0100:pbank[1:0] = mem_adr[32:31]    / rank = mem_adr[30]      "
08672                                                          0101:pbank[1:0] = mem_adr[33:32]    / rank = mem_adr[31]      "
08673                                                          0110:pbank[1:0] =[1'b0,mem_adr[33]] / rank = mem_adr[32]      "
08674                                                          0111:pbank[1:0] =[2'b0]             / rank = mem_adr[33]      "
08675                                                          1000-1111: RESERVED */
08676     uint64_t row_lsb                      : 3;  /**< Encoding used to determine which memory address
08677                                                          bit position represents the low order DDR ROW address.
08678                                                          The processor's memory address[33:7] needs to be
