08679                                                          translated to DRAM addresses (bnk,row,col,rank and dimm)
08680                                                          and that is a function of the following:
08681                                                          1. \# Banks (4 or 8) - spec'd by BANK8
08682                                                          2. Datapath Width(64 or 128) - MODE128b
08683                                                          3. \# Ranks in a DIMM - spec'd by BUNK_ENA
08684                                                          4. \# DIMM's in the system
08685                                                          5. \# Column Bits of the memory part - spec'd indirectly
08686                                                          by this register.
08687                                                          6. \# Row Bits of the memory part - spec'd indirectly
08688                                                          by the register below (PBANK_LSB).
08689                                                          Illustration: For Micron's MT18HTF6472A,512MB DDR2
08690                                                          Unbuffered DIMM which uses 256Mb parts (8M x 8 x 4),
08691                                                          \# Banks = 4 -> 2 bits of BA
08692                                                          \# Columns = 1K -> 10 bits of Col
08693                                                          \# Rows = 8K -> 13 bits of Row
08694                                                          Assuming that the total Data width is 128, this is how
08695                                                          we arrive at row_lsb:
08696                                                          Col Address starts from mem_addr[4] for 128b (16Bytes)
08697                                                          dq width or from mem_addr[3] for 64b (8Bytes) dq width
08698                                                          \# col + \# bank = 12. Hence row_lsb is mem_adr[15] for
08699                                                          64bmode or mem_adr[16] for 128b mode. Hence row_lsb
08700                                                          parameter should be set to 001 (64b) or 010 (128b).
08701                                                               - 000: row_lsb = mem_adr[14]
08702                                                               - 001: row_lsb = mem_adr[15]
08703                                                               - 010: row_lsb = mem_adr[16]
08704                                                               - 011: row_lsb = mem_adr[17]
08705                                                               - 100: row_lsb = mem_adr[18]
08706                                                               - 101-111:row_lsb = RESERVED */
08707     uint64_t ecc_ena                      : 1;  /**< ECC Enable: When set will enable the 8b ECC
08708                                                          check/correct logic. Should be 1 when used with DIMMs
08709                                                          with ECC. 0, otherwise.
08710                                                          When this mode is turned on, DQ[71:64] and DQ[143:137]
08711                                                          on writes, will contain the ECC code generated for
08712                                                          the lower 64 and upper 64 bits of data which will
08713                                                          written in the memory and then later on reads, used
08714                                                          to check for Single bit error (which will be auto-
08715                                                          corrected) and Double Bit error (which will be
08716                                                          reported). When not turned on, DQ[71:64] and DQ[143:137]
08717                                                          are driven to 0.  Please refer to SEC_ERR, DED_ERR,
08718                                                          LMC_FADR, and LMC_ECC_SYND registers
08719                                                          for diagnostics information when there is an error. */
08720     uint64_t init_start                   : 1;  /**< A 0->1 transition starts the DDR memory initialization
08721                                                          sequence. */
08722 #else
08723     uint64_t init_start                   : 1;
08724     uint64_t ecc_ena                      : 1;
08725     uint64_t row_lsb                      : 3;
08726     uint64_t pbank_lsb                    : 4;
08727     uint64_t ref_int                      : 6;
08728     uint64_t tcl                          : 4;
08729     uint64_t intr_sec_ena                 : 1;
08730     uint64_t intr_ded_ena                 : 1;
08731     uint64_t sec_err                      : 4;
08732     uint64_t ded_err                      : 4;
08733     uint64_t bunk_ena                     : 1;
08734     uint64_t silo_qc                      : 1;
08735     uint64_t reset                        : 1;
08736     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
08737 #endif
08738     } s;
08739     struct cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg0_s           cn30xx;
08740     struct cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg0_s           cn31xx;
08741     struct cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg0_s           cn38xx;
08742     struct cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg0_s           cn38xxp2;
08743     struct cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg0_s           cn50xx;
08744     struct cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg0_s           cn52xx;
08745     struct cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg0_s           cn52xxp1;
08746     struct cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg0_s           cn56xx;
08747     struct cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg0_s           cn56xxp1;
08748     struct cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg0_s           cn58xx;
08749     struct cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg0_s           cn58xxp1;
08750 };
08751 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg0 cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg0_t;
08752 
08753 /**
08754  * cvmx_lmc#_mem_cfg1
08755  *
08756  * LMC_MEM_CFG1 = LMC Memory Configuration Register1
08757  *
08758  * This register controls the External Memory Configuration Timing Parameters. Please refer to the
08759  * appropriate DDR part spec from your memory vendor for the various values in this CSR.
08760  * The details of each of these timing parameters can be found in the JEDEC spec or the vendor
08761  * spec of the memory parts.
08762  */
08763 union cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg1 {
08764     uint64_t u64;
08765     struct cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg1_s {
08766 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
08767     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
08768     uint64_t comp_bypass                  : 1;  /**< Compensation bypass. */
08769     uint64_t trrd                         : 3;  /**< tRRD cycles: ACT-ACT timing parameter for different
08770                                                          banks. (Represented in tCYC cycles == 1dclks)
08771                                                          TYP=15ns (66MHz=1,167MHz=3,200MHz=3)
08772                                                          For DDR2, TYP=7.5ns
08773                                                             - 000: RESERVED
08774                                                             - 001: 1 tCYC
08775                                                             - 010: 2 tCYC
08776                                                             - 011: 3 tCYC
08777                                                             - 100: 4 tCYC
08778                                                             - 101: 5 tCYC
08779                                                             - 110: 6 tCYC
08780                                                             - 111: 7 tCYC */
08781     uint64_t caslat                       : 3;  /**< CAS Latency Encoding which is loaded into each DDR
08782                                                          SDRAM device (MRS[6:4]) upon power-up (INIT_START=1).
08783                                                          (Represented in tCYC cycles == 1 dclks)
08784                                                             000 RESERVED
08785                                                             001 RESERVED
08786                                                             010 2.0 tCYC
08787                                                             011 3.0 tCYC
08788                                                             100 4.0 tCYC
08789                                                             101 5.0 tCYC
08790                                                             110 6.0 tCYC
08791                                                             111 RESERVED
08792                                                          eg). The parameters TSKW, SILO_HC, and SILO_QC can
08793                                                          account for 1/4 cycle granularity in board/etch delays. */
08794     uint64_t tmrd                         : 3;  /**< tMRD Cycles
08795                                                          (Represented in dclk tCYC)
08796                                                          For DDR2, its TYP 2*tCYC)
08797                                                              - 000: RESERVED
08798                                                              - 001: 1
08799                                                              - 010: 2
08800                                                              - 011: 3
08801                                                              - 100: 4
08802                                                              - 101-111: RESERVED */
08803     uint64_t trfc                         : 5;  /**< Indicates tRFC constraints.
08804                                                          Set TRFC (CSR field) = RNDUP[tRFC(ns)/4*tcyc(ns)],
08805                                                          where tRFC is from the DDR2 spec, and tcyc(ns)
08806                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
08807                                                          For example, with 2Gb, DDR2-667 parts,
08808                                                          typ tRFC=195ns, so TRFC (CSR field) = 0x11.
08809                                                              TRFC (binary): Corresponding tRFC Cycles
08810                                                              ----------------------------------------
08811                                                              - 00000-00001: RESERVED
08812                                                              - 00010: 0-8
08813                                                              - 00011: 9-12
08814                                                              - 00100: 13-16
08815                                                              - ...
08816                                                              - 11110: 117-120
08817                                                              - 11111: 121-124 */
08818     uint64_t trp                          : 4;  /**< tRP Cycles = RNDUP[tRP(ns)/tcyc(ns)]
08819                                                          (Represented in tCYC cycles == 1dclk)
08820                                                          TYP=15ns (66MHz=1,167MHz=3,400MHz=6 for TYP)
08821                                                              - 0000: RESERVED
08822                                                              - 0001: 1
08823                                                              - ...
08824                                                              - 1001: 9
08825                                                              - 1010-1111: RESERVED
08826                                                          When using parts with 8 banks (LMC_DDR2_CTL->BANK8
08827                                                          is 1), load tRP cycles + 1 into this register. */
08828     uint64_t twtr                         : 4;  /**< tWTR Cycles = RNDUP[tWTR(ns)/tcyc(ns)]
08829                                                          Last Wr Data to Rd Command time.
08830                                                          (Represented in tCYC cycles == 1dclks)
08831                                                          TYP=15ns (66MHz=1,167MHz=3,400MHz=6, for TYP)
08832                                                              - 0000: RESERVED
08833                                                              - 0001: 1
08834                                                              - ...
08835                                                              - 0111: 7
08836                                                              - 1000-1111: RESERVED */
08837     uint64_t trcd                         : 4;  /**< tRCD Cycles = RNDUP[tRCD(ns)/tcyc(ns)]
08838                                                          (Represented in tCYC cycles == 1dclk)
08839                                                          TYP=15ns (66MHz=1,167MHz=3,400MHz=6 for TYP)
08840                                                              - 0000: RESERVED
08841                                                              - 0001: 2 (2 is the smallest value allowed)
08842                                                              - 0002: 2
08843                                                              - ...
08844                                                              - 1001: 9
08845                                                              - 1010-1111: RESERVED
08846                                                          In 2T mode, make this register TRCD-1, not going
08847                                                          below 2. */
08848     uint64_t tras                         : 5;  /**< tRAS Cycles = RNDUP[tRAS(ns)/tcyc(ns)]
08849                                                          (Represented in tCYC cycles == 1 dclk)
08850                                                              - 00000-0001: RESERVED
08851                                                              - 00010: 2
08852                                                              - ...
08853                                                              - 11111: 31 */
08854 #else
08855     uint64_t tras                         : 5;
08856     uint64_t trcd                         : 4;
08857     uint64_t twtr                         : 4;
08858     uint64_t trp                          : 4;
08859     uint64_t trfc                         : 5;
08860     uint64_t tmrd                         : 3;
08861     uint64_t caslat                       : 3;
08862     uint64_t trrd                         : 3;
08863     uint64_t comp_bypass                  : 1;
08864     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
08865 #endif
08866     } s;
08867     struct cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg1_s           cn30xx;
08868     struct cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg1_s           cn31xx;
08869     struct cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg1_cn38xx {
08870 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
08871     uint64_t reserved_31_63               : 33;
08872     uint64_t trrd                         : 3;  /**< tRRD cycles: ACT-ACT timing parameter for different
08873                                                          banks. (Represented in tCYC cycles == 1dclks)
08874                                                          TYP=15ns (66MHz=1,167MHz=3,200MHz=3)
08875                                                          For DDR2, TYP=7.5ns
08876                                                             - 000: RESERVED
08877                                                             - 001: 1 tCYC
08878                                                             - 010: 2 tCYC
08879                                                             - 011: 3 tCYC
08880                                                             - 100: 4 tCYC
08881                                                             - 101: 5 tCYC
08882                                                             - 110-111: RESERVED */
08883     uint64_t caslat                       : 3;  /**< CAS Latency Encoding which is loaded into each DDR
08884                                                          SDRAM device (MRS[6:4]) upon power-up (INIT_START=1).
08885                                                          (Represented in tCYC cycles == 1 dclks)
08886                                                             000 RESERVED
08887                                                             001 RESERVED
08888                                                             010 2.0 tCYC
08889                                                             011 3.0 tCYC
08890                                                             100 4.0 tCYC
08891                                                             101 5.0 tCYC
08892                                                             110 6.0 tCYC (DDR2)
08893                                                                 2.5 tCYC (DDR1)
08894                                                             111 RESERVED
08895                                                          eg). The parameters TSKW, SILO_HC, and SILO_QC can
08896                                                          account for 1/4 cycle granularity in board/etch delays. */
08897     uint64_t tmrd                         : 3;  /**< tMRD Cycles
08898                                                          (Represented in dclk tCYC)
08899                                                          For DDR2, its TYP 2*tCYC)
08900                                                              - 000: RESERVED
08901                                                              - 001: 1
08902                                                              - 010: 2
08903                                                              - 011: 3
08904                                                              - 100: 4
08905                                                              - 101-111: RESERVED */
08906     uint64_t trfc                         : 5;  /**< Indicates tRFC constraints.
08907                                                          Set TRFC (CSR field) = RNDUP[tRFC(ns)/4*tcyc(ns)],
08908                                                          where tRFC is from the DDR2 spec, and tcyc(ns)
08909                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
08910                                                          For example, with 2Gb, DDR2-667 parts,
08911                                                          typ tRFC=195ns, so TRFC (CSR field) = 0x11.
08912                                                              TRFC (binary): Corresponding tRFC Cycles
08913                                                              ----------------------------------------
08914                                                              - 00000-00001: RESERVED
08915                                                              - 00010: 0-8
08916                                                              - 00011: 9-12
08917                                                              - 00100: 13-16
08918                                                              - ...
08919                                                              - 11110: 117-120
08920                                                              - 11111: 121-124 */
08921     uint64_t trp                          : 4;  /**< tRP Cycles = RNDUP[tRP(ns)/tcyc(ns)]
08922                                                          (Represented in tCYC cycles == 1dclk)
08923                                                          TYP=15ns (66MHz=1,167MHz=3,400MHz=6 for TYP)
08924                                                              - 0000: RESERVED
08925                                                              - 0001: 1
08926                                                              - ...
08927                                                              - 0111: 7
08928                                                              - 1000-1111: RESERVED
08929                                                          When using parts with 8 banks (LMC_DDR2_CTL->BANK8
08930                                                          is 1), load tRP cycles + 1 into this register. */
08931     uint64_t twtr                         : 4;  /**< tWTR Cycles = RNDUP[tWTR(ns)/tcyc(ns)]
08932                                                          Last Wr Data to Rd Command time.
08933                                                          (Represented in tCYC cycles == 1dclks)
08934                                                          TYP=15ns (66MHz=1,167MHz=3,400MHz=6, for TYP)
08935                                                              - 0000: RESERVED
08936                                                              - 0001: 1
08937                                                              - ...
08938                                                              - 0111: 7
08939                                                              - 1000-1111: RESERVED */
08940     uint64_t trcd                         : 4;  /**< tRCD Cycles = RNDUP[tRCD(ns)/tcyc(ns)]
08941                                                          (Represented in tCYC cycles == 1dclk)
08942                                                          TYP=15ns (66MHz=1,167MHz=3,400MHz=6 for TYP)
08943                                                              - 0000: RESERVED
08944                                                              - 0001: 2 (2 is the smallest value allowed)
08945                                                              - 0002: 2
08946                                                              - ...
08947                                                              - 0111: 7
08948                                                              - 1110-1111: RESERVED
08949                                                          In 2T mode, make this register TRCD-1, not going
08950                                                          below 2. */
08951     uint64_t tras                         : 5;  /**< tRAS Cycles = RNDUP[tRAS(ns)/tcyc(ns)]
08952                                                          (Represented in tCYC cycles == 1 dclk)
08953                                                          For DDR-I mode:
08954                                                          TYP=45ns (66MHz=3,167MHz=8,400MHz=18
08955                                                              - 00000-0001: RESERVED
08956                                                              - 00010: 2
08957                                                              - ...
08958                                                              - 10100: 20
08959                                                              - 10101-11111: RESERVED */
08960 #else
08961     uint64_t tras                         : 5;
08962     uint64_t trcd                         : 4;
08963     uint64_t twtr                         : 4;
08964     uint64_t trp                          : 4;
08965     uint64_t trfc                         : 5;
08966     uint64_t tmrd                         : 3;
08967     uint64_t caslat                       : 3;
08968     uint64_t trrd                         : 3;
08969     uint64_t reserved_31_63               : 33;
08970 #endif
08971     } cn38xx;
08972     struct cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg1_cn38xx      cn38xxp2;
08973     struct cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg1_s           cn50xx;
08974     struct cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg1_cn38xx      cn52xx;
08975     struct cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg1_cn38xx      cn52xxp1;
08976     struct cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg1_cn38xx      cn56xx;
08977     struct cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg1_cn38xx      cn56xxp1;
08978     struct cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg1_cn38xx      cn58xx;
08979     struct cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg1_cn38xx      cn58xxp1;
08980 };
08981 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg1 cvmx_lmcx_mem_cfg1_t;
08982 
08983 /**
08984  * cvmx_lmc#_modereg_params0
08985  *
08986  * These parameters are written into the DDR3/DDR4 MR0, MR1, MR2 and MR3 registers.
08987  *
08988  */
08989 union cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params0 {
08990     uint64_t u64;
08991     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params0_s {
08992 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
08993     uint64_t reserved_28_63               : 36;
08994     uint64_t wrp_ext                      : 1;  /**< A 1 bit extension to the WRP register. */
08995     uint64_t cl_ext                       : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
08996     uint64_t al_ext                       : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
08997     uint64_t ppd                          : 1;  /**< DLL control for precharge powerdown.
08998                                                          0 = Slow exit (DLL off).
08999                                                          1 = Fast exit (DLL on).
09000                                                          LMC writes this value to MR0[PPD] in the selected DDR3/DDR4 parts during power-up/init
09001                                                          and, if
09002                                                          LMC()_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh exit instruction sequences. See
09003                                                          LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK]. This value must
09004                                                          equal
09005                                                          the MR0[PPD] value in all the DDR3/DDR4 parts attached to all ranks during normal
09006                                                          operation. */
09007     uint64_t wrp                          : 3;  /**< Write recovery for auto precharge. Should be programmed to be equal to or greater than
09008                                                          RNDUP[TWR(ns) / Tcyc(ns)].
09009                                                          DDR3:
09010                                                          0x0 = 16.
09011                                                          0x1 = 5.
09012                                                          0x2 = 6.
09013                                                          0x3 = 7.
09014                                                          0x4 = 8.
09015                                                          0x5 = 10.
09016                                                          0x6 = 12.
09017                                                          0x7 = 14.
09018                                                          DDR4:
09019                                                          0x0 = 10.
09020                                                          0x1 = 12.
09021                                                          0x2 = 14.
09022                                                          0x3 = 16.
09023                                                          0x4 = 18.
09024                                                          0x5 = 20.
09025                                                          0x6 = 24.
09026                                                          0x7 = 22.
09027                                                          0x8-0xf = Reserved. (Note that LMC()_MODEREG_PARAMS0[WRP_EXT] = 1).
09028                                                          LMC writes this value to MR0[WR] in the selected DDR3/DDR4 parts during power-up/init and,
09029                                                          if
09030                                                          LMC()_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh exit instruction sequences. See
09031                                                          LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK]. This value must
09032                                                          equal
09033                                                          the MR0[WR] value in all the DDR3/DDR4 parts attached to all ranks during normal
09034                                                          operation. */
09035     uint64_t dllr                         : 1;  /**< DLL reset. LMC writes this value to MR0[DLL] in the selected DDR3/DDR4 parts during power-
09036                                                          up/init and, if LMC()_CONFIG [SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh exit instruction
09037                                                          sequences. See LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK].
09038                                                          The MR0[DLL] value must be 0 in all the DDR3/DDR4 parts attached to all ranks during
09039                                                          normal operation. */
09040     uint64_t tm                           : 1;  /**< Test mode. LMC writes this value to MR0[TM] in the selected DDR3/DDR4 parts during power-
09041                                                          up/init and, if LMC()_CONFIG [SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh exit instruction
09042                                                          sequences. See LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK].
09043                                                          The MR0[TM] value must be 0 in all the DDR3/DDR4 parts attached to all ranks during normal
09044                                                          operation. */
09045     uint64_t rbt                          : 1;  /**< Read burst. Type 1 = interleaved (fixed). LMC writes this value to MR0[RBT] in the
09046                                                          selected DDR3/DDR4 parts during power-up/init and, if LMC()_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09047                                                          self-refresh exit instruction sequences. See LMC()_CONFIG[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START,
09048                                                          RANKMASK]. The MR0[RBT] value must be 1 in all the DDR3/DDR4 parts attached to all ranks
09049                                                          during normal operation. */
09050     uint64_t cl                           : 4;  /**< CAS latency.
09051                                                          In DDR3 mode:
09052                                                          0x2 = 5. 0x1 = 12.
09053                                                          0x4 = 6. 0x3 = 13.
09054                                                          0x6 = 7. 0x5 = 14.
09055                                                          0x8 = 8. 0x7 = 15.
09056                                                          0xA = 9. 0x9 = 16.
09057                                                          0xC = 10.
09058                                                          0xE = 11.
09059                                                          0x0, 0xB, 0xD, 0xF = Reserved.
09060                                                          In DDR4 mode:
09061                                                          0x0 =  9. 0x1 = 10.
09062                                                          0x2 = 11. 0x3 = 12.
09063                                                          0x4 = 13. 0x5 = 14.
09064                                                          0x6 = 15. 0x7 = 16.
09065                                                          0x8 = 18. 0x9 = 20.
09066                                                          0xA = 22. 0xB = 24.
09067                                                          0xD = 17, 0xE = 19.
09068                                                          0xF = 21, 0xC = Reserved.
09069                                                          LMC writes this value to MR0[CAS Latency / CL] in the selected DDR3 parts during power-
09070                                                          up/init and, if LMC()_CONFIG [SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh exit instruction
09071                                                          sequences. See LMC()_CONFIG[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START,RANKMASK]. This value must equal the
09072                                                          MR0[CAS Latency / CL] value in all the DDR3/4 parts attached to all ranks during normal
09073                                                          operation.
09074                                                          tCL must be programmed to greater than or equal to tCWL for proper LMC operation. */
09075     uint64_t bl                           : 2;  /**< Burst length.
09076                                                          0x0 = 8 (fixed).
09077                                                          0x1 = 4 or 8 (on-the-fly).
09078                                                          LMC writes this value to MR0[BL] in the selected DDR3 parts during power-up/init and, if
09079                                                          LMC()_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh exit instruction sequences. See
09080                                                          LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK]. The MR0[BL] value
09081                                                          must be 1 in all the DDR3/4 parts attached to all ranks during normal operation. */
09082     uint64_t qoff                         : 1;  /**< Qoff enable. 0: enable; 1: disable.
09083                                                          LMC writes this value to MR1[Qoff] in the DDR3 parts in the selected ranks during power-
09084                                                          up/init, write-leveling, and if LMC()_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh entry
09085                                                          and exit instruction sequences. See LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and
09086                                                          LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK,INIT_STATUS] and LMC()_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM, DDR3PSOFT]. The
09087                                                          MR1[Qoff] value must be 0 in all the DDR3 parts attached to all ranks during normal
09088                                                          operation. */
09089     uint64_t tdqs                         : 1;  /**< TDQS enable. 0: disable. LMC writes this value to MR1[TDQS] in the DDR3 parts in the
09090                                                          selected ranks during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if
09091                                                          LMC()_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09092                                                          See LMC()_CONFIG[SEQ_SEL, INIT_START,RANKMASK,INIT_STATUS] and
09093                                                          LMC()_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. */
09094     uint64_t wlev                         : 1;  /**< Write leveling enable. 0: disable. LMC writes MR1[Level]=0 in the DDR3 parts in the
09095                                                          selected ranks during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if
09096                                                          LMC()_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh entry and exit sequences. (Write
09097                                                          leveling can only be initiated via the write leveling instruction sequence.) See
09098                                                          LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK,INIT_STATUS] and
09099                                                          LMC()_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM, DDR3PSOFT]. */
09100     uint64_t al                           : 2;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
09101     uint64_t dll                          : 1;  /**< DLL Enable. 0: enable; 1: disable. LMC writes this value to MR1[DLL] in the selected DDR3
09102                                                          parts during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC()_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is
09103                                                          set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences. See
09104                                                          LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START]
09105                                                          and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK] and LMC()_RESET_CTL [DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. This value
09106                                                          must equal the MR1[DLL] value in all the DDR3 parts attached to all ranks during normal
09107                                                          operation. In DLL-off mode, CL/CWL must be programmed equal to 6/6, respectively, as per
09108                                                          the JEDEC DDR3 specifications. */
09109     uint64_t mpr                          : 1;  /**< MPR. LMC writes this value to MR3[MPR] in the selected DDR3 parts during power-up/init,
09110                                                          read-leveling, and, if LMC()_CONFIG [SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh exit
09111                                                          instruction sequences. (LMC also writes MR3[MPR] = 1 at the beginning of the read-leveling
09112                                                          instruction sequence. Read-leveling should only be initiated via the read-leveling
09113                                                          instruction sequence.) See LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and
09114                                                          LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK].
09115                                                          The MR3[MPR] value must be 0 in all the DDR3 parts attached to all ranks during normal
09116                                                          operation. */
09117     uint64_t mprloc                       : 2;  /**< MPR location. LMC writes this value to MR3[MPRLoc] in the selected DDR3 parts during
09118                                                          power-up/init, read-leveling, and, if LMC()_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh
09119                                                          exit instruction sequences. (LMC also writes MR3[MPRLoc] = 0 at the beginning of the read-
09120                                                          leveling instruction sequence.) See LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and
09121                                                          LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK]. The MR3[MPRLoc] value must be 0 in all the DDR3 parts attached
09122                                                          to all ranks during normal operation. */
09123     uint64_t cwl                          : 3;  /**< CAS write latency.
09124                                                          In DDR3 mode:
09125                                                          0x0 = 5.
09126                                                          0x1 = 6.
09127                                                          0x2 = 7.
09128                                                          0x3 = 8.
09129                                                          0x4 = 9.
09130                                                          0x5 = 10.
09131                                                          0x6 = 11.
09132                                                          0x7 = 12.
09133                                                          In DDR4 mode:
09134                                                          0x0 = 9.
09135                                                          0x1 = 10.
09136                                                          0x2 = 11.
09137                                                          0x3 = 12.
09138                                                          0x4 = 13.
09139                                                          0x5 = 16.
09140                                                          0x6 = 18.
09141                                                          0x7 = Reserved.
09142                                                          LMC writes this value to MR2[CWL] in the selected DDR3 parts during power-up/init, write
09143                                                          leveling, and, if LMC()_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh entry and exit
09144                                                          instruction sequences. See LMC()_CONFIG[SEQ_SEL, INIT_START,RANKMASK] and
09145                                                          LMC()_RESET_CTL [DDR3PWARM, DDR3PSOFT]. This value must equal the MR2[CWL] value in
09146                                                          all the DDR3 parts attached to all ranks during normal operation.
09147                                                          tCWL must be programmed to less than or equal to tCL for proper LMC operation. */
09148 #else
09149     uint64_t cwl                          : 3;
09150     uint64_t mprloc                       : 2;
09151     uint64_t mpr                          : 1;
09152     uint64_t dll                          : 1;
09153     uint64_t al                           : 2;
09154     uint64_t wlev                         : 1;
09155     uint64_t tdqs                         : 1;
09156     uint64_t qoff                         : 1;
09157     uint64_t bl                           : 2;
09158     uint64_t cl                           : 4;
09159     uint64_t rbt                          : 1;
09160     uint64_t tm                           : 1;
09161     uint64_t dllr                         : 1;
09162     uint64_t wrp                          : 3;
09163     uint64_t ppd                          : 1;
09164     uint64_t al_ext                       : 1;
09165     uint64_t cl_ext                       : 1;
09166     uint64_t wrp_ext                      : 1;
09167     uint64_t reserved_28_63               : 36;
09168 #endif
09169     } s;
09170     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params0_cn61xx {
09171 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
09172     uint64_t reserved_25_63               : 39;
09173     uint64_t ppd                          : 1;  /**< DLL Control for precharge powerdown
09174                                                          0 = Slow exit (DLL off)
09175                                                          1 = Fast exit (DLL on)
09176                                                          LMC writes this value to MR0[PPD] in the selected DDR3 parts
09177                                                          during power-up/init and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09178                                                          self-refresh exit instruction sequences.
09179                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK].
09180                                                          This value must equal the MR0[PPD] value in all the DDR3
09181                                                          parts attached to all ranks during normal operation. */
09182     uint64_t wrp                          : 3;  /**< Write recovery for auto precharge
09183                                                          Should be programmed to be equal to or greater than
09184                                                          RNDUP[tWR(ns)/tCYC(ns)]
09185                                                          000 = 5
09186                                                          001 = 5
09187                                                          010 = 6
09188                                                          011 = 7
09189                                                          100 = 8
09190                                                          101 = 10
09191                                                          110 = 12
09192                                                          111 = 14
09193                                                          LMC writes this value to MR0[WR] in the selected DDR3 parts
09194                                                          during power-up/init and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09195                                                          self-refresh exit instruction sequences.
09196                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK].
09197                                                          This value must equal the MR0[WR] value in all the DDR3
09198                                                          parts attached to all ranks during normal operation. */
09199     uint64_t dllr                         : 1;  /**< DLL Reset
09200                                                          LMC writes this value to MR0[DLL] in the selected DDR3 parts
09201                                                          during power-up/init and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09202                                                          self-refresh exit instruction sequences.
09203                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK].
09204                                                          The MR0[DLL] value must be 0 in all the DDR3
09205                                                          parts attached to all ranks during normal operation. */
09206     uint64_t tm                           : 1;  /**< Test Mode
09207                                                          LMC writes this value to MR0[TM] in the selected DDR3 parts
09208                                                          during power-up/init and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09209                                                          self-refresh exit instruction sequences.
09210                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK].
09211                                                          The MR0[TM] value must be 0 in all the DDR3
09212                                                          parts attached to all ranks during normal operation. */
09213     uint64_t rbt                          : 1;  /**< Read Burst Type
09214                                                          1 = interleaved (fixed)
09215                                                          LMC writes this value to MR0[RBT] in the selected DDR3 parts
09216                                                          during power-up/init and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09217                                                          self-refresh exit instruction sequences.
09218                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK].
09219                                                          The MR0[RBT] value must be 1 in all the DDR3
09220                                                          parts attached to all ranks during normal operation. */
09221     uint64_t cl                           : 4;  /**< CAS Latency
09222                                                          0010 = 5
09223                                                          0100 = 6
09224                                                          0110 = 7
09225                                                          1000 = 8
09226                                                          1010 = 9
09227                                                          1100 = 10
09228                                                          1110 = 11
09229                                                          0001 = 12
09230                                                          0011 = 13
09231                                                          0101 = 14
09232                                                          0111 = 15
09233                                                          1001 = 16
09234                                                          0000, 1011, 1101, 1111 = Reserved
09235                                                          LMC writes this value to MR0[CAS Latency / CL] in the selected DDR3 parts
09236                                                          during power-up/init and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09237                                                          self-refresh exit instruction sequences.
09238                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK].
09239                                                          This value must equal the MR0[CAS Latency / CL] value in all the DDR3
09240                                                          parts attached to all ranks during normal operation. */
09241     uint64_t bl                           : 2;  /**< Burst Length
09242                                                          0 = 8 (fixed)
09243                                                          LMC writes this value to MR0[BL] in the selected DDR3 parts
09244                                                          during power-up/init and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09245                                                          self-refresh exit instruction sequences.
09246                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK].
09247                                                          The MR0[BL] value must be 0 in all the DDR3
09248                                                          parts attached to all ranks during normal operation. */
09249     uint64_t qoff                         : 1;  /**< Qoff Enable
09250                                                          0 = enable
09251                                                          1 = disable
09252                                                          LMC writes this value to MR1[Qoff] in the DDR3 parts in the selected ranks
09253                                                          during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09254                                                          self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09255                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK,INIT_STATUS] and
09256                                                          LMC*_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT].
09257                                                          The MR1[Qoff] value must be 0 in all the DDR3
09258                                                          parts attached to all ranks during normal operation. */
09259     uint64_t tdqs                         : 1;  /**< TDQS Enable
09260                                                          0 = disable
09261                                                          LMC writes this value to MR1[TDQS] in the DDR3 parts in the selected ranks
09262                                                          during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09263                                                          self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09264                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK,INIT_STATUS] and
09265                                                          LMC*_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. */
09266     uint64_t wlev                         : 1;  /**< Write Leveling Enable
09267                                                          0 = disable
09268                                                          LMC writes MR1[Level]=0 in the DDR3 parts in the selected ranks
09269                                                          during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09270                                                          self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09271                                                          (Write-leveling can only be initiated via the
09272                                                          write-leveling instruction sequence.)
09273                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK,INIT_STATUS] and
09274                                                          LMC*_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. */
09275     uint64_t al                           : 2;  /**< Additive Latency
09276                                                          00 = 0
09277                                                          01 = CL-1
09278                                                          10 = CL-2
09279                                                          11 = Reserved
09280                                                          LMC writes this value to MR1[AL] in the selected DDR3 parts
09281                                                          during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09282                                                          self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09283                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK] and
09284                                                          LMC*_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT].
09285                                                          This value must equal the MR1[AL] value in all the DDR3
09286                                                          parts attached to all ranks during normal operation.
09287                                                          See also LMC*_CONTROL[POCAS]. */
09288     uint64_t dll                          : 1;  /**< DLL Enable
09289                                                          0 = enable
09290                                                          1 = disable.
09291                                                          LMC writes this value to MR1[DLL] in the selected DDR3 parts
09292                                                          during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09293                                                          self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09294                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK] and
09295                                                          LMC*_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT].
09296                                                          This value must equal the MR1[DLL] value in all the DDR3
09297                                                          parts attached to all ranks during normal operation.
09298                                                          In dll-off mode, CL/CWL must be programmed
09299                                                          equal to 6/6, respectively, as per the DDR3 specifications. */
09300     uint64_t mpr                          : 1;  /**< MPR
09301                                                          LMC writes this value to MR3[MPR] in the selected DDR3 parts
09302                                                          during power-up/init, read-leveling, and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09303                                                          self-refresh exit instruction sequences.
09304                                                          (LMC also writes MR3[MPR]=1 at the beginning of the
09305                                                          read-leveling instruction sequence. Read-leveling should only be initiated via the
09306                                                          read-leveling instruction sequence.)
09307                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK].
09308                                                          The MR3[MPR] value must be 0 in all the DDR3
09309                                                          parts attached to all ranks during normal operation. */
09310     uint64_t mprloc                       : 2;  /**< MPR Location
09311                                                          LMC writes this value to MR3[MPRLoc] in the selected DDR3 parts
09312                                                          during power-up/init, read-leveling, and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09313                                                          self-refresh exit instruction sequences.
09314                                                          (LMC also writes MR3[MPRLoc]=0 at the beginning of the
09315                                                          read-leveling instruction sequence.)
09316                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK].
09317                                                          The MR3[MPRLoc] value must be 0 in all the DDR3
09318                                                          parts attached to all ranks during normal operation. */
09319     uint64_t cwl                          : 3;  /**< CAS Write Latency
09320                                                          - 000: 5
09321                                                          - 001: 6
09322                                                          - 010: 7
09323                                                          - 011: 8
09324                                                          - 100: 9
09325                                                          - 101: 10
09326                                                          - 110: 11
09327                                                          - 111: 12
09328                                                          LMC writes this value to MR2[CWL] in the selected DDR3 parts
09329                                                          during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09330                                                          self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09331                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK] and
09332                                                          LMC*_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT].
09333                                                          This value must equal the MR2[CWL] value in all the DDR3
09334                                                          parts attached to all ranks during normal operation. */
09335 #else
09336     uint64_t cwl                          : 3;
09337     uint64_t mprloc                       : 2;
09338     uint64_t mpr                          : 1;
09339     uint64_t dll                          : 1;
09340     uint64_t al                           : 2;
09341     uint64_t wlev                         : 1;
09342     uint64_t tdqs                         : 1;
09343     uint64_t qoff                         : 1;
09344     uint64_t bl                           : 2;
09345     uint64_t cl                           : 4;
09346     uint64_t rbt                          : 1;
09347     uint64_t tm                           : 1;
09348     uint64_t dllr                         : 1;
09349     uint64_t wrp                          : 3;
09350     uint64_t ppd                          : 1;
09351     uint64_t reserved_25_63               : 39;
09352 #endif
09353     } cn61xx;
09354     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params0_cn61xx cn63xx;
09355     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params0_cn61xx cn63xxp1;
09356     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params0_cn61xx cn66xx;
09357     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params0_cn61xx cn68xx;
09358     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params0_cn61xx cn68xxp1;
09359     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params0_cn61xx cn70xx;
09360     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params0_cn61xx cn70xxp1;
09361     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params0_s    cn73xx;
09362     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params0_s    cn78xx;
09363     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params0_s    cn78xxp1;
09364     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params0_cn61xx cnf71xx;
09365     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params0_s    cnf75xx;
09366 };
09367 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params0 cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params0_t;
09368 
09369 /**
09370  * cvmx_lmc#_modereg_params1
09371  *
09372  * These parameters are written into the DDR3 MR0, MR1, MR2 and MR3 registers.
09373  *
09374  */
09375 union cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params1 {
09376     uint64_t u64;
09377     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params1_s {
09378 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
09379     uint64_t reserved_55_63               : 9;
09380     uint64_t rtt_wr_11_ext                : 1;  /**< RTT_WR rank 3 extension bit for DDR4. */
09381     uint64_t rtt_wr_10_ext                : 1;  /**< RTT_WR rank 2 extension bit for DDR4. */
09382     uint64_t rtt_wr_01_ext                : 1;  /**< RTT_WR rank 1 extension bit for DDR4. */
09383     uint64_t rtt_wr_00_ext                : 1;  /**< RTT_WR rank 0 extension bit for DDR4. */
09384     uint64_t db_output_impedance          : 3;  /**< Reserved. */
09385     uint64_t rtt_nom_11                   : 3;  /**< RTT_NOM rank 3. LMC writes this value to MR1[RTT_NOM] in the rank 3 (i.e. DIMM1_CS1) DDR3
09386                                                          parts when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if
09387                                                          LMC()_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09388                                                          See LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK] and
09389                                                          LMC()_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. Per JEDEC DDR3 specifications, if RTT_NOM is
09390                                                          used during write operations, only values MR1[RTT_NOM] = 1 (RZQ/4), 2 (RZQ/2), or 3
09391                                                          (RZQ/6) are allowed. Otherwise, values MR1[RTT_NOM] = 4 (RZQ/12) and 5 (RZQ/8) are also
09392                                                          allowed. */
09393     uint64_t dic_11                       : 2;  /**< Output driver impedance control rank 3. LMC writes this value to MR1[D.I.C.] in the rank 3
09394                                                          (i.e. DIMM1_CS1) DDR3 parts when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if
09395                                                          LMC()_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09396                                                          See LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK] and
09397                                                          LMC()_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM, DDR3PSOFT]. */
09398     uint64_t rtt_wr_11                    : 2;  /**< RTT_WR rank 3. LMC writes this value to MR2[Rtt_WR] in the rank 3 (i.e. DIMM1_CS1) DDR3
09399                                                          parts when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC()_CONFIG
09400                                                          [SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences. See
09401                                                          LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK] and
09402                                                          LMC()_RESET_CTL [DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. */
09403     uint64_t srt_11                       : 1;  /**< Self-refresh temperature range rank 3. LMC writes this value to MR2[SRT] in the rank 3
09404                                                          (i.e. DIMM1_CS1) DDR3 parts when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if
09405                                                          LMC()_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09406                                                          See LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START], LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK] and
09407                                                          LMC()_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. */
09408     uint64_t asr_11                       : 1;  /**< Auto self-refresh rank 3. LMC writes this value to MR2[ASR] in the rank 3 (i.e. DIMM1_CS1)
09409                                                          DDR3 parts when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC()_CONFIG
09410                                                          [SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences. See
09411                                                          LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START], LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK] and
09412                                                          LMC()_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. */
09413     uint64_t pasr_11                      : 3;  /**< Partial array self-refresh rank 3. LMC writes this value to MR2[PASR] in the rank 3 (i.e.
09414                                                          DIMM1_CS1) DDR3 parts when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if
09415                                                          LMC()_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09416                                                          See LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK] and
09417                                                          LMC()_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. */
09418     uint64_t rtt_nom_10                   : 3;  /**< RTT_NOM rank 2. LMC writes this value to MR1[Rtt_Nom] in the rank 2 (i.e. DIMM1_CS0) DDR3
09419                                                          parts when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC()_CONFIG
09420                                                          [SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences. See
09421                                                          LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK] and
09422                                                          LMC()_RESET_CTL [DDR3PWARM, DDR3PSOFT]. Per JEDEC DDR3 specifications, if RTT_NOM
09423                                                          is used during write operations, only values MR1[RTT_NOM] = 1 (RZQ/4), 2 (RZQ/2), or
09424                                                          3 (RZQ/6) are allowed. Otherwise, values MR1[RTT_NOM] = 4 (RZQ/12) and 5 (RZQ/8) are
09425                                                          also allowed. */
09426     uint64_t dic_10                       : 2;  /**< Output driver impedance control rank 2. LMC writes this value to MR1[D.I.C.] in the rank 2
09427                                                          (i.e. DIMM1_CS0) DDR3 parts when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if
09428                                                          LMC()_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09429                                                          See LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK] and
09430                                                          LMC()_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. */
09431     uint64_t rtt_wr_10                    : 2;  /**< RTT_WR rank 2. LMC writes this value to MR2[Rtt_WR] in the rank 2 (i.e. DIMM1_CS0) DDR3
09432                                                          parts when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC()_CONFIG
09433                                                          [SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences. See
09434                                                          LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK] and
09435                                                          LMC()_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM, DDR3PSOFT]. */
09436     uint64_t srt_10                       : 1;  /**< Self-refresh temperature range rank 2. LMC writes this value to MR2[SRT] in the rank 2
09437                                                          (i.e. DIMM1_CS0) DDR3 parts when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if
09438                                                          LMC()_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09439                                                          See LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK] and
09440                                                          LMC()_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. */
09441     uint64_t asr_10                       : 1;  /**< Auto self-refresh rank 2. LMC writes this value to MR2[ASR] in the rank 2 (i.e. DIMM1_CS0)
09442                                                          DDR3 parts when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC()_CONFIG
09443                                                          [SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences. See
09444                                                          LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK] and
09445                                                          LMC()_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM, DDR3PSOFT]. */
09446     uint64_t pasr_10                      : 3;  /**< Partial array self-refresh rank 2. LMC writes this value to MR2[PASR] in the rank 2 (i.e.
09447                                                          DIMM1_CS0) DDR3 parts when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if
09448                                                          LMC()_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09449                                                          See LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK] and
09450                                                          LMC()_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. */
09451     uint64_t rtt_nom_01                   : 3;  /**< RTT_NOM rank 1. LMC writes this value to MR1[RTT_NOM] in the rank 1 (i.e. DIMM0_CS1) DDR3
09452                                                          parts when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if
09453                                                          LMC()_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09454                                                          See LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK] and
09455                                                          LMC()_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. Per JEDEC DDR3 specifications, if RTT_NOM is
09456                                                          used during write operations, only values MR1[RTT_NOM] = 1 (RZQ/4), 2 (RZQ/2), or 3
09457                                                          (RZQ/6) are allowed. Otherwise, values MR1[RTT_NOM] = 4 (RZQ/12) and 5 (RZQ/8) are also
09458                                                          allowed. */
09459     uint64_t dic_01                       : 2;  /**< Output driver impedance control rank 1. LMC writes this value to MR1[D.I.C.] in the rank 1
09460                                                          (i.e. DIMM0_CS1) DDR3 parts when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if
09461                                                          LMC()_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09462                                                          See LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK] and
09463                                                          LMC()_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. */
09464     uint64_t rtt_wr_01                    : 2;  /**< RTT_WR rank 1. LMC writes this value to MR2[RTT_WR] in the rank 1 (i.e. DIMM0_CS1) DDR3
09465                                                          parts when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC()_CONFIG
09466                                                          [SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences. See
09467                                                          LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK] and
09468                                                          LMC()_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM, DDR3PSOFT]. */
09469     uint64_t srt_01                       : 1;  /**< Self-refresh temperature range rank 1. LMC writes this value to MR2[SRT] in the rank 1
09470                                                          (i.e. DIMM0_CS1) DDR3 parts when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if
09471                                                          LMC()_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09472                                                          See LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK] and
09473                                                          LMC()_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. */

09475                                                          DDR3 parts when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC()_CONFIG
09476                                                          [SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences. See
09477                                                          LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK] and
09478                                                          LMC()_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM, DDR3PSOFT]. */
09479     uint64_t pasr_01                      : 3;  /**< Partial array self-refresh rank 1. LMC writes this value to MR2[PASR] in the rank 1 (i.e.
09480                                                          DIMM0_CS1) DDR3 parts when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if
09481                                                          LMC()_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09482                                                          See LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK] and

09484     uint64_t rtt_nom_00                   : 3;  /**< RTT_NOM rank 0. LMC writes this value to MR1[RTT_NOM] in the rank 0 (i.e. DIMM0_CS0) DDR3
09485                                                          parts when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC()_CONFIG
09486                                                          [SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences. See
09487                                                          LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK] and
09488                                                          LMC()_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM, DDR3PSOFT]. Per JEDEC DDR3 specifications, if RTT_NOM is
09489                                                          used during write operations, only values MR1[RTT_NOM] = 1 (RZQ/4), 2 (RZQ/2),
09490                                                          or 3 (RZQ/6) are allowed. Otherwise, values MR1[RTT_NOM] = 4 (RZQ/12) and 5 (RZQ/8)
09491                                                          are also allowed. */
09492     uint64_t dic_00                       : 2;  /**< Output driver impedance control rank 0. LMC writes this value to MR1[D.I.C.] in the rank 0
09493                                                          (i.e. DIMM0_CS0) DDR3 parts when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if
09494                                                          LMC()_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09495                                                          See LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK] and

09499                                                          [SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences. See
09500                                                          LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK] and
09501                                                          LMC()_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM, DDR3PSOFT]. */
09502     uint64_t srt_00                       : 1;  /**< Self-refresh temperature range rank 0. LMC writes this value to MR2[SRT] in the rank 0
09503                                                          (i.e. DIMM0_CS0) DDR3 parts when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if
09504                                                          LMC()_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09505                                                          See LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK] and
09506                                                          LMC()_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. */

09508                                                          DDR3 parts when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC()_CONFIG
09509                                                          [SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences. See
09510                                                          LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK] and
09511                                                          LMC()_RESET_CTL [DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. */
