09513                                                          DIMM0_CS0) DDR3 parts when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if
09514                                                          LMC()_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set, self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09515                                                          See LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] and LMC()_CONFIG[RANKMASK] and
09516                                                          LMC()_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. */
09517 #else
09518     uint64_t pasr_00                      : 3;
09519     uint64_t asr_00                       : 1;
09520     uint64_t srt_00                       : 1;
09521     uint64_t rtt_wr_00                    : 2;
09522     uint64_t dic_00                       : 2;
09523     uint64_t rtt_nom_00                   : 3;
09524     uint64_t pasr_01                      : 3;
09525     uint64_t asr_01                       : 1;
09526     uint64_t srt_01                       : 1;
09527     uint64_t rtt_wr_01                    : 2;
09528     uint64_t dic_01                       : 2;
09529     uint64_t rtt_nom_01                   : 3;
09530     uint64_t pasr_10                      : 3;
09531     uint64_t asr_10                       : 1;
09532     uint64_t srt_10                       : 1;
09533     uint64_t rtt_wr_10                    : 2;
09534     uint64_t dic_10                       : 2;
09535     uint64_t rtt_nom_10                   : 3;
09536     uint64_t pasr_11                      : 3;
09537     uint64_t asr_11                       : 1;
09538     uint64_t srt_11                       : 1;
09539     uint64_t rtt_wr_11                    : 2;
09540     uint64_t dic_11                       : 2;
09541     uint64_t rtt_nom_11                   : 3;
09542     uint64_t db_output_impedance          : 3;
09543     uint64_t rtt_wr_00_ext                : 1;
09544     uint64_t rtt_wr_01_ext                : 1;
09545     uint64_t rtt_wr_10_ext                : 1;
09546     uint64_t rtt_wr_11_ext                : 1;
09547     uint64_t reserved_55_63               : 9;
09548 #endif
09549     } s;
09550     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params1_cn61xx {
09551 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
09552     uint64_t reserved_48_63               : 16;
09553     uint64_t rtt_nom_11                   : 3;  /**< RTT_NOM Rank 3
09554                                                          LMC writes this value to MR1[Rtt_Nom] in the rank 3 (i.e. DIMM1_CS1) DDR3 parts
09555                                                          when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09556                                                          self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09557                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK] and
09558                                                          LMC*_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT].
09559                                                          Per JEDEC DDR3 specifications, if RTT_Nom is used during writes,
09560                                                          only values MR1[Rtt_Nom] = 1 (RQZ/4), 2 (RQZ/2), or 3 (RQZ/6) are allowed.
09561                                                          Otherwise, values MR1[Rtt_Nom] = 4 (RQZ/12) and 5 (RQZ/8) are also allowed. */
09562     uint64_t dic_11                       : 2;  /**< Output Driver Impedance Control Rank 3
09563                                                          LMC writes this value to MR1[D.I.C.] in the rank 3 (i.e. DIMM1_CS1) DDR3 parts
09564                                                          when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09565                                                          self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09566                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK] and
09567                                                          LMC*_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. */
09568     uint64_t rtt_wr_11                    : 2;  /**< RTT_WR Rank 3
09569                                                          LMC writes this value to MR2[Rtt_WR] in the rank 3 (i.e. DIMM1_CS1) DDR3 parts
09570                                                          when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09571                                                          self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09572                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK] and
09573                                                          LMC*_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. */
09574     uint64_t srt_11                       : 1;  /**< Self-refresh temperature range Rank 3
09575                                                          LMC writes this value to MR2[SRT] in the rank 3 (i.e. DIMM1_CS1) DDR3 parts
09576                                                          when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09577                                                          self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09578                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK] and
09579                                                          LMC*_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. */
09580     uint64_t asr_11                       : 1;  /**< Auto self-refresh Rank 3
09581                                                          LMC writes this value to MR2[ASR] in the rank 3 (i.e. DIMM1_CS1) DDR3 parts
09582                                                          when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09583                                                          self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09584                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK] and

09586     uint64_t pasr_11                      : 3;  /**< Partial array self-refresh Rank 3
09587                                                          LMC writes this value to MR2[PASR] in the rank 3 (i.e. DIMM1_CS1) DDR3 parts
09588                                                          when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09589                                                          self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09590                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK] and
09591                                                          LMC*_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. */
09592     uint64_t rtt_nom_10                   : 3;  /**< RTT_NOM Rank 2
09593                                                          LMC writes this value to MR1[Rtt_Nom] in the rank 2 (i.e. DIMM1_CS0) DDR3 parts
09594                                                          when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09595                                                          self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09596                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK] and
09597                                                          LMC*_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT].
09598                                                          Per JEDEC DDR3 specifications, if RTT_Nom is used during writes,
09599                                                          only values MR1[Rtt_Nom] = 1 (RQZ/4), 2 (RQZ/2), or 3 (RQZ/6) are allowed.
09600                                                          Otherwise, values MR1[Rtt_Nom] = 4 (RQZ/12) and 5 (RQZ/8) are also allowed. */
09601     uint64_t dic_10                       : 2;  /**< Output Driver Impedance Control Rank 2
09602                                                          LMC writes this value to MR1[D.I.C.] in the rank 2 (i.e. DIMM1_CS0) DDR3 parts

09640     uint64_t dic_01                       : 2;  /**< Output Driver Impedance Control Rank 1
09641                                                          LMC writes this value to MR1[D.I.C.] in the rank 1 (i.e. DIMM0_CS1) DDR3 parts

09654                                                          when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,

09665                                                          LMC writes this value to MR2[PASR] in the rank 1 (i.e. DIMM0_CS1) DDR3 parts
09666                                                          when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09667                                                          self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09668                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK] and
09669                                                          LMC*_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. */
09670     uint64_t rtt_nom_00                   : 3;  /**< RTT_NOM Rank 0
09671                                                          LMC writes this value to MR1[Rtt_Nom] in the rank 0 (i.e. DIMM0_CS0) DDR3 parts
09672                                                          when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09673                                                          self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09674                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK] and
09675                                                          LMC*_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT].
09676                                                          Per JEDEC DDR3 specifications, if RTT_Nom is used during writes,
09677                                                          only values MR1[Rtt_Nom] = 1 (RQZ/4), 2 (RQZ/2), or 3 (RQZ/6) are allowed.
09678                                                          Otherwise, values MR1[Rtt_Nom] = 4 (RQZ/12) and 5 (RQZ/8) are also allowed. */
09679     uint64_t dic_00                       : 2;  /**< Output Driver Impedance Control Rank 0
09680                                                          LMC writes this value to MR1[D.I.C.] in the rank 0 (i.e. DIMM0_CS0) DDR3 parts
09681                                                          when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09682                                                          self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09683                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK] and
09684                                                          LMC*_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. */
09685     uint64_t rtt_wr_00                    : 2;  /**< RTT_WR Rank 0
09686                                                          LMC writes this value to MR2[Rtt_WR] in the rank 0 (i.e. DIMM0_CS0) DDR3 parts
09687                                                          when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09688                                                          self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09689                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK] and
09690                                                          LMC*_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. */
09691     uint64_t srt_00                       : 1;  /**< Self-refresh temperature range Rank 0
09692                                                          LMC writes this value to MR2[SRT] in the rank 0 (i.e. DIMM0_CS0) DDR3 parts
09693                                                          when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09694                                                          self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09695                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK] and
09696                                                          LMC*_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. */
09697     uint64_t asr_00                       : 1;  /**< Auto self-refresh Rank 0
09698                                                          LMC writes this value to MR2[ASR] in the rank 0 (i.e. DIMM0_CS0) DDR3 parts
09699                                                          when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09700                                                          self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09701                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK] and
09702                                                          LMC*_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. */
09703     uint64_t pasr_00                      : 3;  /**< Partial array self-refresh Rank 0
09704                                                          LMC writes this value to MR2[PASR] in the rank 0 (i.e. DIMM0_CS0) DDR3 parts
09705                                                          when selected during power-up/init, write-leveling, and, if LMC*_CONFIG[SREF_WITH_DLL] is set,
09706                                                          self-refresh entry and exit instruction sequences.
09707                                                          See LMC*_CONFIG[SEQUENCE,INIT_START,RANKMASK] and
09708                                                          LMC*_RESET_CTL[DDR3PWARM,DDR3PSOFT]. */
09709 #else
09710     uint64_t pasr_00                      : 3;
09711     uint64_t asr_00                       : 1;
09712     uint64_t srt_00                       : 1;
09713     uint64_t rtt_wr_00                    : 2;
09714     uint64_t dic_00                       : 2;
09715     uint64_t rtt_nom_00                   : 3;
09716     uint64_t pasr_01                      : 3;
09717     uint64_t asr_01                       : 1;
09718     uint64_t srt_01                       : 1;
09719     uint64_t rtt_wr_01                    : 2;
09720     uint64_t dic_01                       : 2;
09721     uint64_t rtt_nom_01                   : 3;
09722     uint64_t pasr_10                      : 3;
09723     uint64_t asr_10                       : 1;
09724     uint64_t srt_10                       : 1;
09725     uint64_t rtt_wr_10                    : 2;
09726     uint64_t dic_10                       : 2;
09727     uint64_t rtt_nom_10                   : 3;
09728     uint64_t pasr_11                      : 3;
09729     uint64_t asr_11                       : 1;
09730     uint64_t srt_11                       : 1;
09731     uint64_t rtt_wr_11                    : 2;
09732     uint64_t dic_11                       : 2;
09733     uint64_t rtt_nom_11                   : 3;
09734     uint64_t reserved_48_63               : 16;
09735 #endif
09736     } cn61xx;
09737     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params1_cn61xx cn63xx;
09738     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params1_cn61xx cn63xxp1;
09739     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params1_cn61xx cn66xx;
09740     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params1_cn61xx cn68xx;
09741     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params1_cn61xx cn68xxp1;
09742     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params1_cn61xx cn70xx;
09743     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params1_cn61xx cn70xxp1;
09744     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params1_s    cn73xx;
09745     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params1_s    cn78xx;
09746     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params1_s    cn78xxp1;
09747     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params1_cn61xx cnf71xx;
09748     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params1_s    cnf75xx;
09749 };
09750 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params1 cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params1_t;
09751 
09752 /**
09753  * cvmx_lmc#_modereg_params2
09754  *
09755  * These parameters are written into the DDR4 mode registers.
09756  *
09757  */
09758 union cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params2 {
09759     uint64_t u64;
09760     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params2_s {
09761 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
09762     uint64_t reserved_41_63               : 23;
09763     uint64_t vrefdq_train_en              : 1;  /**< Vref training mode enable, used for all ranks. */
09764     uint64_t vref_range_11                : 1;  /**< VREF range for rank 3. */
09765     uint64_t vref_value_11                : 6;  /**< VREF value for rank 3. */
09766     uint64_t rtt_park_11                  : 3;  /**< RTT park value for rank 3. */
09767     uint64_t vref_range_10                : 1;  /**< VREF range for rank 2. */
09768     uint64_t vref_value_10                : 6;  /**< VREF value for rank 2. */
09769     uint64_t rtt_park_10                  : 3;  /**< RTT park value for rank 2. */
09770     uint64_t vref_range_01                : 1;  /**< VREF range for rank 1. */
09771     uint64_t vref_value_01                : 6;  /**< VREF value for rank 1. */
09772     uint64_t rtt_park_01                  : 3;  /**< RTT park value for rank 1. */
09773     uint64_t vref_range_00                : 1;  /**< VREF range for rank 0. */
09774     uint64_t vref_value_00                : 6;  /**< VREF value for rank 0. */
09775     uint64_t rtt_park_00                  : 3;  /**< RTT park value for rank 0. */
09776 #else
09777     uint64_t rtt_park_00                  : 3;
09778     uint64_t vref_value_00                : 6;
09779     uint64_t vref_range_00                : 1;
09780     uint64_t rtt_park_01                  : 3;
09781     uint64_t vref_value_01                : 6;
09782     uint64_t vref_range_01                : 1;
09783     uint64_t rtt_park_10                  : 3;
09784     uint64_t vref_value_10                : 6;
09785     uint64_t vref_range_10                : 1;
09786     uint64_t rtt_park_11                  : 3;
09787     uint64_t vref_value_11                : 6;
09788     uint64_t vref_range_11                : 1;
09789     uint64_t vrefdq_train_en              : 1;
09790     uint64_t reserved_41_63               : 23;
09791 #endif
09792     } s;
09793     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params2_s    cn70xx;
09794     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params2_cn70xxp1 {
09795 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
09796     uint64_t reserved_40_63               : 24;
09797     uint64_t vref_range_11                : 1;  /**< VREF range for rank 3.  Not used in CN70XX/CN71XX. */
09798     uint64_t vref_value_11                : 6;  /**< VREF value for rank 3.  Not used in CN70XX/CN71XX. */
09799     uint64_t rtt_park_11                  : 3;  /**< RTT park value for rank 3.  Not used in CN70XX/CN71XX. */
09800     uint64_t vref_range_10                : 1;  /**< VREF range for rank 2.  Not used in CN70XX/CN71XX. */
09801     uint64_t vref_value_10                : 6;  /**< VREF value for rank 2.  Not used in CN70XX/CN71XX. */
09802     uint64_t rtt_park_10                  : 3;  /**< RTT park value for rank 2.  Not used in CN70XX/CN71XX. */
09803     uint64_t vref_range_01                : 1;  /**< VREF range for rank 1. */
09804     uint64_t vref_value_01                : 6;  /**< VREF value for rank 1. */
09805     uint64_t rtt_park_01                  : 3;  /**< RTT park value for rank 1. */
09806     uint64_t vref_range_00                : 1;  /**< VREF range for rank 0. */
09807     uint64_t vref_value_00                : 6;  /**< VREF value for rank 0. */
09808     uint64_t rtt_park_00                  : 3;  /**< RTT park value for rank 0. */
09809 #else
09810     uint64_t rtt_park_00                  : 3;
09811     uint64_t vref_value_00                : 6;
09812     uint64_t vref_range_00                : 1;
09813     uint64_t rtt_park_01                  : 3;
09814     uint64_t vref_value_01                : 6;
09815     uint64_t vref_range_01                : 1;

09820     uint64_t vref_value_11                : 6;
09821     uint64_t vref_range_11                : 1;
09822     uint64_t reserved_40_63               : 24;
09823 #endif
09824     } cn70xxp1;
09825     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params2_s    cn73xx;

09831 
09832 /**
09833  * cvmx_lmc#_modereg_params3
09834  *
09835  * These parameters are written into the DDR4 mode registers.
09836  *
09837  */
09838 union cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params3 {
09839     uint64_t u64;
09840     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params3_s {
09841 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
09842     uint64_t reserved_39_63               : 25;
09843     uint64_t xrank_add_tccd_l             : 3;  /**< Reserved. */
09844     uint64_t xrank_add_tccd_s             : 3;  /**< Reserved. */
09845     uint64_t mpr_fmt                      : 2;  /**< MPR format. */
09846     uint64_t wr_cmd_lat                   : 2;  /**< Write command latency when CRC and DM are both enabled. */
09847     uint64_t fgrm                         : 3;  /**< Fine granularity refresh mode. */
09848     uint64_t temp_sense                   : 1;  /**< Temperature sensor readout enable. */
09849     uint64_t pda                          : 1;  /**< Per DRAM addressability. */
09850     uint64_t gd                           : 1;  /**< Gear-down mode. */
09851     uint64_t crc                          : 1;  /**< CRC mode. */
09852     uint64_t lpasr                        : 2;  /**< LP auto self refresh. */
09853     uint64_t tccd_l                       : 3;  /**< TCCD_L timing parameter:
09854                                                          0x0 = 4.
09855                                                          0x1 = 5.
09856                                                          0x2 = 6.
09857                                                          0x3 = 7.
09858                                                          0x4 = 8.
09859                                                          0x5-0x7 = reserved. */
09860     uint64_t rd_dbi                       : 1;  /**< Read DBI. */
09861     uint64_t wr_dbi                       : 1;  /**< Write DBI. */
09862     uint64_t dm                           : 1;  /**< Data mask enable. */
09863     uint64_t ca_par_pers                  : 1;  /**< Command/address persistent parity error mode. */
09864     uint64_t odt_pd                       : 1;  /**< ODT in PD mode. */
09865     uint64_t par_lat_mode                 : 3;  /**< Parity latency mode. */
09866     uint64_t wr_preamble                  : 1;  /**< Write preamble, 0 = one nCK, 1 = two nCK. */
09867     uint64_t rd_preamble                  : 1;  /**< Write preamble, 0 = one nCK, 1 = two nCK. */
09868     uint64_t sre_abort                    : 1;  /**< Self refresh abort. */
09869     uint64_t cal                          : 3;  /**< CS-to-CMD/ADDR latency mode (cycles). */
09870     uint64_t vref_mon                     : 1;  /**< Internal VREF monitor: 0 = disable, 1 = enable. */
09871     uint64_t tc_ref                       : 1;  /**< Temperature controlled refresh range: 0 = normal, 1 = extended. */
09872     uint64_t max_pd                       : 1;  /**< Maximum power-down mode: 0 = disable, 1 = enable. */
09873 #else
09874     uint64_t max_pd                       : 1;
09875     uint64_t tc_ref                       : 1;
09876     uint64_t vref_mon                     : 1;
09877     uint64_t cal                          : 3;
09878     uint64_t sre_abort                    : 1;
09879     uint64_t rd_preamble                  : 1;
09880     uint64_t wr_preamble                  : 1;
09881     uint64_t par_lat_mode                 : 3;
09882     uint64_t odt_pd                       : 1;
09883     uint64_t ca_par_pers                  : 1;
09884     uint64_t dm                           : 1;
09885     uint64_t wr_dbi                       : 1;
09886     uint64_t rd_dbi                       : 1;
09887     uint64_t tccd_l                       : 3;
09888     uint64_t lpasr                        : 2;
09889     uint64_t crc                          : 1;
09890     uint64_t gd                           : 1;
09891     uint64_t pda                          : 1;
09892     uint64_t temp_sense                   : 1;
09893     uint64_t fgrm                         : 3;
09894     uint64_t wr_cmd_lat                   : 2;
09895     uint64_t mpr_fmt                      : 2;
09896     uint64_t xrank_add_tccd_s             : 3;
09897     uint64_t xrank_add_tccd_l             : 3;
09898     uint64_t reserved_39_63               : 25;
09899 #endif
09900     } s;
09901     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params3_cn70xx {
09902 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
09903     uint64_t reserved_33_63               : 31;
09904     uint64_t mpr_fmt                      : 2;  /**< MPR format. */
09905     uint64_t wr_cmd_lat                   : 2;  /**< Write command latency when CRC and DM are both enabled. */
09906     uint64_t fgrm                         : 3;  /**< Fine granularity refresh mode. */
09907     uint64_t temp_sense                   : 1;  /**< Temperature sensor readout enable. */
09908     uint64_t pda                          : 1;  /**< Per DRAM addressability. */
09909     uint64_t gd                           : 1;  /**< Gear-down mode. */
09910     uint64_t crc                          : 1;  /**< CRC mode. */
09911     uint64_t lpasr                        : 2;  /**< LP auto self refresh. */
09912     uint64_t tccd_l                       : 3;  /**< TCCD_L timing parameter:
09913                                                          0x0 = 4. 0x3 = 7.
09914                                                          0x1 = 5. 0x4 = 8.
09915                                                          0x2 = 6. 0x5-0x7 = reserved. */
09916     uint64_t rd_dbi                       : 1;  /**< Read DBI, must be 0. */
09917     uint64_t wr_dbi                       : 1;  /**< Write DBI, must be 0. */
09918     uint64_t dm                           : 1;  /**< Data mask enable. */
09919     uint64_t ca_par_pers                  : 1;  /**< Command/address persistent parity error mode. */
09920     uint64_t odt_pd                       : 1;  /**< ODT in PD mode. */
09921     uint64_t par_lat_mode                 : 3;  /**< Parity latency mode. */
09922     uint64_t wr_preamble                  : 1;  /**< Write preamble, 0 = one nCK, 1 = two nCK. */
09923     uint64_t rd_preamble                  : 1;  /**< Write preamble, 0 = one nCK, 1 = two nCK. */
09924     uint64_t sre_abort                    : 1;  /**< Self refresh abort. */
09925     uint64_t cal                          : 3;  /**< CS-to-CMD/ADDR latency mode (cycles). */
09926     uint64_t vref_mon                     : 1;  /**< Internal VREF monitor: 0 = disable, 1 = enable. */
09927     uint64_t tc_ref                       : 1;  /**< Temperature controlled refresh range: 0 = normal, 1 = extended. */
09928     uint64_t max_pd                       : 1;  /**< Maximum power-down mode: 0 = disable, 1 = enable. */
09929 #else
09930     uint64_t max_pd                       : 1;
09931     uint64_t tc_ref                       : 1;
09932     uint64_t vref_mon                     : 1;
09933     uint64_t cal                          : 3;
09934     uint64_t sre_abort                    : 1;
09935     uint64_t rd_preamble                  : 1;
09936     uint64_t wr_preamble                  : 1;
09937     uint64_t par_lat_mode                 : 3;
09938     uint64_t odt_pd                       : 1;
09939     uint64_t ca_par_pers                  : 1;
09940     uint64_t dm                           : 1;
09941     uint64_t wr_dbi                       : 1;
09942     uint64_t rd_dbi                       : 1;
09943     uint64_t tccd_l                       : 3;
09944     uint64_t lpasr                        : 2;
09945     uint64_t crc                          : 1;
09946     uint64_t gd                           : 1;
09947     uint64_t pda                          : 1;
09948     uint64_t temp_sense                   : 1;
09949     uint64_t fgrm                         : 3;
09950     uint64_t wr_cmd_lat                   : 2;
09951     uint64_t mpr_fmt                      : 2;
09952     uint64_t reserved_33_63               : 31;
09953 #endif
09954     } cn70xx;
09955     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params3_cn70xx cn70xxp1;
09956     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params3_s    cn73xx;
09957     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params3_s    cn78xx;
09958     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params3_s    cn78xxp1;
09959     struct cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params3_s    cnf75xx;
09960 };
09961 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params3 cvmx_lmcx_modereg_params3_t;
09962 
09963 /**
09964  * cvmx_lmc#_mpr_data0
09965  *
09966  * This register provides bits <63:0> of MPR data register.
09967  *
09968  */
09969 union cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data0 {
09970     uint64_t u64;
09971     struct cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data0_s {
09972 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
09973     uint64_t mpr_data                     : 64; /**< MPR data bits<63:0>. Bits<7:0> represent the MPR data for the lowest-order *4 device (*4
09974                                                          device 0); bits<15:8> represent *4 device 1; ..., bits<63:56> are for *4 device 7.
09975                                                          This field is also used to store the results after running the general R/W training
09976                                                          sequence (LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL] = 0xE).
09977                                                          The format of the stored results is controlled by LMC()_DBTRAIN_CTL[RW_TRAIN].
09978                                                          When LMC()_DBTRAIN_CTL[RW_TRAIN] = 1, this field stores the R/W comparison output
09979                                                          from all DQ63 - DQ0.
09980                                                          When LMC()_DBTRAIN_CTL[RW_TRAIN] = 0, this field stores the positive edge read data
09981                                                          on a particular cycle coming from DQ63 - DQ0. */
09982 #else
09983     uint64_t mpr_data                     : 64;
09984 #endif
09985     } s;
09986     struct cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data0_s          cn70xx;
09987     struct cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data0_s          cn70xxp1;
09988     struct cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data0_s          cn73xx;
09989     struct cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data0_s          cn78xx;
09990     struct cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data0_s          cn78xxp1;
09991     struct cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data0_s          cnf75xx;
09992 };
09993 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data0 cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data0_t;
09994 
09995 /**
09996  * cvmx_lmc#_mpr_data1
09997  *
09998  * This register provides bits <127:64> of MPR data register.
09999  *
10000  */
10001 union cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data1 {
10002     uint64_t u64;
10003     struct cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data1_s {
10004 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
10005     uint64_t mpr_data                     : 64; /**< MPR data bits<127:64>. Bits<7:0> represent the MPR data for *4 device 8; bits<15:8>
10006                                                          represent *4 device 9; ...; bits<63:56> are for *4 device 15.
10007                                                          This field is also used to store the results after running the general R/W training
10008                                                          sequence (LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL] = 0xE).
10009                                                          The format of the stored results is controlled by LMC()_DBTRAIN_CTL[RW_TRAIN].
10010                                                          When LMC()_DBTRAIN_CTL[RW_TRAIN] = 1, this field stores the R/W comparison output
10011                                                          from the ECC byte (DQ71 - DQ64).
10012                                                          When LMC()_DBTRAIN_CTL[RW_TRAIN] = 0, MPR_DATA<7:0> stores the positive edge read data
10013                                                          on a particular cycle coming from the ECC byte (DQ71 - DQ64), while
10014                                                          MPR_DATA<64:8> stores the negative edge read data coming from DQ55 - DQ0. */
10015 #else
10016     uint64_t mpr_data                     : 64;
10017 #endif
10018     } s;
10019     struct cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data1_s          cn70xx;
10020     struct cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data1_s          cn70xxp1;
10021     struct cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data1_s          cn73xx;
10022     struct cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data1_s          cn78xx;
10023     struct cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data1_s          cn78xxp1;
10024     struct cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data1_s          cnf75xx;
10025 };
10026 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data1 cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data1_t;
10027 
10028 /**
10029  * cvmx_lmc#_mpr_data2
10030  *
10031  * This register provides bits <143:128> of MPR data register.
10032  *
10033  */
10034 union cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data2 {
10035     uint64_t u64;
10036     struct cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data2_s {
10037 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
10038     uint64_t reserved_16_63               : 48;
10039     uint64_t mpr_data                     : 16; /**< MPR data bits<143:128>. Bits<7:0> represent the MPR data for *4 device 16; bits<15:8>
10040                                                          represent *4 device 17.
10041                                                          This field is also used to store the results after running the general R/W training
10042                                                          sequence (LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL] = 0xE).
10043                                                          The format of the stored results is controlled by LMC()_DBTRAIN_CTL[RW_TRAIN].
10044                                                          When LMC()_DBTRAIN_CTL[RW_TRAIN] = 1, this field is not used.
10045                                                          When LMC()_DBTRAIN_CTL[RW_TRAIN] = 0, MPR_DATA<15:0> stores the negative edge read data
10046                                                          on a particular cycle coming from DQ71 - DQ56. */
10047 #else
10048     uint64_t mpr_data                     : 16;
10049     uint64_t reserved_16_63               : 48;
10050 #endif
10051     } s;
10052     struct cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data2_s          cn70xx;
10053     struct cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data2_s          cn70xxp1;
10054     struct cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data2_s          cn73xx;
10055     struct cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data2_s          cn78xx;
10056     struct cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data2_s          cn78xxp1;
10057     struct cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data2_s          cnf75xx;
10058 };
10059 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data2 cvmx_lmcx_mpr_data2_t;
10060 
10061 /**
10062  * cvmx_lmc#_mr_mpr_ctl
10063  *
10064  * This register provides the control functions when programming the MPR of DDR4 DRAMs.
10065  *
10066  */
10067 union cvmx_lmcx_mr_mpr_ctl {
10068     uint64_t u64;
10069     struct cvmx_lmcx_mr_mpr_ctl_s {
10070 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
10071     uint64_t reserved_61_63               : 3;
10072     uint64_t mr_wr_secure_key_ena         : 1;  /**< When set, this enables the issuing of security key with the
10073                                                          unique address field A[17:0] set by LMC()_MR_MPR_CTL[MR_WR_ADDR]
10074                                                          during the MRW sequence.
10075                                                          Set this to 1 when executing DRAM post package repair manually
10076                                                          by using MRW operation. */
10077     uint64_t pba_func_space               : 3;  /**< Set the function space selector during PBA mode of the MRW
10078                                                          sequence. */
10079     uint64_t mr_wr_bg1                    : 1;  /**< BG1 part of the address select for MRS in DDR4 mode. */
10080     uint64_t mpr_sample_dq_enable         : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10081     uint64_t pda_early_dqx                : 1;  /**< When set, it enables lmc_dqx early for PDA/PBA operation. */
10082     uint64_t mr_wr_pba_enable             : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10083     uint64_t mr_wr_use_default_value      : 1;  /**< When set, write the value to the MR that is computed from the value set in various CSR
10084                                                          fields that would be used during initialization, rather that using the value in the
10085                                                          LMC()_MR_MPR_CTL[MR_WR_ADDR]. Useful to rewrite the same value or to change single
10086                                                          bits without having to compute a whole new value for the MR. */
10087     uint64_t mpr_whole_byte_enable        : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10088     uint64_t mpr_byte_select              : 4;  /**< Reserved. */
10089     uint64_t mpr_bit_select               : 2;  /**< Select which of four bits to read for each nibble of DRAM data. Typically all four bits
10090                                                          from a *4 device, or all eight bits from a *8 device, or all 16 bits from a *16 device
10091                                                          carry the same data, but this field allows selection of which device bit will be used to
10092                                                          read the MPR data. */
10093     uint64_t mpr_wr                       : 1;  /**< MPR sequence will perform a write operation when set. */
10094     uint64_t mpr_loc                      : 2;  /**< MPR location select for MPR sequence. Only makes a difference for DDR4. */
10095     uint64_t mr_wr_pda_enable             : 1;  /**< PDA write enable. When set, MRW operations use PDA, enabled by MR_WR_PDA_MASK per device.
10096                                                          Only available for DDR4 devices. */
10097     uint64_t mr_wr_pda_mask               : 18; /**< PDA mask. If MR_WR_PDA_ENABLE = 1 and there is a 1 in the bit for this mask value, then
10098                                                          the corresponding DRAM device is enabled for the PDA MR write operation.
10099                                                          Bit<23> corresponds to the lowest order, *4 device, and bit<40> corresponds to the highest
10100                                                          order *4 device, for a total of up to 18 devices. */
10101     uint64_t mr_wr_rank                   : 2;  /**< Selects the DRAM rank for either MRW or MPR sequences. */
10102     uint64_t mr_wr_sel                    : 3;  /**< Selects which MR to write with the MR write sequence.
10103                                                          Which pins to drive and how to drive them is automatically controlled through the DDR3/4
10104                                                          mode setting. Bits<19:18> are also used to select the MPR page for an MPR sequence.
10105                                                          A value of 0x7 selects an RCW write for both DDR4 and DDR3 MRW operations. */
10106     uint64_t mr_wr_addr                   : 18; /**< Sets a value for A<17:0> for MR write operations. Note that many of these bits must be 0
10107                                                          for various MRs. Bits<7:0> are also used for write data on an MPR sequence write
10108                                                          operation. */
10109 #else
10110     uint64_t mr_wr_addr                   : 18;
10111     uint64_t mr_wr_sel                    : 3;
10112     uint64_t mr_wr_rank                   : 2;
10113     uint64_t mr_wr_pda_mask               : 18;
10114     uint64_t mr_wr_pda_enable             : 1;
10115     uint64_t mpr_loc                      : 2;
10116     uint64_t mpr_wr                       : 1;
10117     uint64_t mpr_bit_select               : 2;
10118     uint64_t mpr_byte_select              : 4;
10119     uint64_t mpr_whole_byte_enable        : 1;
10120     uint64_t mr_wr_use_default_value      : 1;
10121     uint64_t mr_wr_pba_enable             : 1;
10122     uint64_t pda_early_dqx                : 1;
10123     uint64_t mpr_sample_dq_enable         : 1;
10124     uint64_t mr_wr_bg1                    : 1;
10125     uint64_t pba_func_space               : 3;
10126     uint64_t mr_wr_secure_key_ena         : 1;
10127     uint64_t reserved_61_63               : 3;
10128 #endif
10129     } s;
10130     struct cvmx_lmcx_mr_mpr_ctl_cn70xx {
10131 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
10132     uint64_t reserved_52_63               : 12;
10133     uint64_t mpr_whole_byte_enable        : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10134     uint64_t mpr_byte_select              : 4;  /**< Reserved. */
10135     uint64_t mpr_bit_select               : 2;  /**< Select which of four bits to read for each nibble of DRAM data. Typically all four bits
10136                                                          from a *4 device, or all eight bits from a *8 device, or all 16 bits from a *16 device
10137                                                          carry the same data, but this field allows selection of which device bit will be used to
10138                                                          read the MPR data. */
10139     uint64_t mpr_wr                       : 1;  /**< MPR sequence will perform a write operation when set. */
10140     uint64_t mpr_loc                      : 2;  /**< MPR location select for MPR sequence. Only makes a difference for DDR4. */
10141     uint64_t mr_wr_pda_enable             : 1;  /**< PDA write enable. When set, MRW operations use PDA, enabled by MR_WR_PDA_MASK per device.
10142                                                          Only available for DDR4 devices. */
10143     uint64_t mr_wr_pda_mask               : 18; /**< PDA mask. If MR_WR_PDA_ENABLE = 1 and there is a 1 in the bit for this mask value, then
10144                                                          the corresponding DRAM device is enabled for the PDA MR write operation.
10145                                                          Bit<23> corresponds to the lowest order, *4 device, and bit<40> corresponds to the highest
10146                                                          order *4 device, for a total of up to 18 devices. */
10147     uint64_t mr_wr_rank                   : 2;  /**< Selects the DRAM rank for either MRW or MPR sequences.  For CN70XX/CN71XX, this must be
10148                                                          set
10149                                                          to either 0 or 1. */
10150     uint64_t mr_wr_sel                    : 3;  /**< Selects which MR to write with the MR write sequence.
10151                                                          Which pins to drive and how to drive them is automatically controlled through the DDR3/4
10152                                                          mode setting. Bits<19:18> are also used to select the MPR page for an MPR sequence.
10153                                                          A value of 0x7 selects an RCW write for both DDR4 and DDR3 MRW operations. */
10154     uint64_t mr_wr_addr                   : 18; /**< Sets a value for A<17:0> for MR write operations. Note that many of these bits must be 0
10155                                                          for various MRs. Bits<7:0> are also used for write data on an MPR sequence write
10156                                                          operation. */
10157 #else
10158     uint64_t mr_wr_addr                   : 18;
10159     uint64_t mr_wr_sel                    : 3;
10160     uint64_t mr_wr_rank                   : 2;
10161     uint64_t mr_wr_pda_mask               : 18;
10162     uint64_t mr_wr_pda_enable             : 1;
10163     uint64_t mpr_loc                      : 2;
10164     uint64_t mpr_wr                       : 1;
10165     uint64_t mpr_bit_select               : 2;
10166     uint64_t mpr_byte_select              : 4;
10167     uint64_t mpr_whole_byte_enable        : 1;
10168     uint64_t reserved_52_63               : 12;
10169 #endif
10170     } cn70xx;
10171     struct cvmx_lmcx_mr_mpr_ctl_cn70xx    cn70xxp1;
10172     struct cvmx_lmcx_mr_mpr_ctl_s         cn73xx;
10173     struct cvmx_lmcx_mr_mpr_ctl_s         cn78xx;
10174     struct cvmx_lmcx_mr_mpr_ctl_s         cn78xxp1;
10175     struct cvmx_lmcx_mr_mpr_ctl_s         cnf75xx;
10176 };
10177 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_mr_mpr_ctl cvmx_lmcx_mr_mpr_ctl_t;
10178 
10179 /**
10180  * cvmx_lmc#_ns_ctl
10181  *
10182  * This register contains control parameters for handling nonsecure accesses.
10183  *
10184  */
10185 union cvmx_lmcx_ns_ctl {
10186     uint64_t u64;
10187     struct cvmx_lmcx_ns_ctl_s {
10188 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
10189     uint64_t reserved_26_63               : 38;
10190     uint64_t ns_scramble_dis              : 1;  /**< When set, this field disables data scrambling on nonsecure accesses only.
10191                                                          When data scrambling is enabled by setting CONTROL[SCRAMBLE_ENA] to 1, this
10192                                                          field needs to be cleared to 0 in order to enable data scrambling on
10193                                                          nonsecure mode. */
10194     uint64_t reserved_18_24               : 7;
10195     uint64_t adr_offset                   : 18; /**< Sets the offset to the upper 18 bits of L2C-LMC address when a nonsecure mode
10196                                                          transaction occurs. */
10197 #else
10198     uint64_t adr_offset                   : 18;
10199     uint64_t reserved_18_24               : 7;
10200     uint64_t ns_scramble_dis              : 1;
10201     uint64_t reserved_26_63               : 38;
10202 #endif
10203     } s;
10204     struct cvmx_lmcx_ns_ctl_s             cn73xx;
10205     struct cvmx_lmcx_ns_ctl_s             cn78xx;
10206     struct cvmx_lmcx_ns_ctl_s             cnf75xx;
10207 };
10208 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_ns_ctl cvmx_lmcx_ns_ctl_t;
10209 
10210 /**
10211  * cvmx_lmc#_nxm
10212  *
10213  * Following is the decoding for mem_msb/rank:
10214  * 0x0: mem_msb = mem_adr[25].
10215  * 0x1: mem_msb = mem_adr[26].
10216  * 0x2: mem_msb = mem_adr[27].
10217  * 0x3: mem_msb = mem_adr[28].
10218  * 0x4: mem_msb = mem_adr[29].
10219  * 0x5: mem_msb = mem_adr[30].
10220  * 0x6: mem_msb = mem_adr[31].
10221  * 0x7: mem_msb = mem_adr[32].
10222  * 0x8: mem_msb = mem_adr[33].
10223  * 0x9: mem_msb = mem_adr[34].
10224  * 0xA: mem_msb = mem_adr[35].
10225  * 0xB: mem_msb = mem_adr[36].
10226  * 0xC-0xF = Reserved.
10227  *
10228  * For example, for a DIMM made of Samsung's K4B1G0846C-ZCF7 1Gb (16M * 8 bit * 8 bank)
10229  * parts, the column address width = 10; so with 10b of col, 3b of bus, 3b of bank, row_lsb = 16.
10230  * Therefore, row = mem_adr[29:16] and mem_msb = 4.
10231  *
10232  * Note also that addresses greater than the max defined space (pbank_msb) are also treated as
10233  * NXM accesses.
10234  */
10235 union cvmx_lmcx_nxm {
10236     uint64_t u64;
10237     struct cvmx_lmcx_nxm_s {
10238 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
10239     uint64_t reserved_40_63               : 24;
10240     uint64_t mem_msb_d3_r1                : 4;  /**< Max Row MSB for DIMM3, RANK1/DIMM3 in Single Ranked
10241                                                          *UNUSED IN 6xxx* */
10242     uint64_t mem_msb_d3_r0                : 4;  /**< Max Row MSB for DIMM3, RANK0
10243                                                          *UNUSED IN 6xxx* */
10244     uint64_t mem_msb_d2_r1                : 4;  /**< Max Row MSB for DIMM2, RANK1/DIMM2 in Single Ranked
10245                                                          *UNUSED IN 6xxx* */
10246     uint64_t mem_msb_d2_r0                : 4;  /**< Max Row MSB for DIMM2, RANK0
10247                                                          *UNUSED IN 6xxx* */
10248     uint64_t mem_msb_d1_r1                : 4;  /**< Maximum row MSB for DIMM1, RANK1/DIMM1 in single ranked.
10249                                                          If DIMM1 is dual-sided, this should be set to
10250                                                          NXM[MEM_MSB_D1_R0]. If CONFIG[RANK_ENA] is cleared, this field is ignored. */
10251     uint64_t mem_msb_d1_r0                : 4;  /**< Maximum row MSB for DIMM1, RANK0. */
10252     uint64_t mem_msb_d0_r1                : 4;  /**< Maximum row MSB for DIMM0, RANK1/DIMM0 in single ranked.
10253                                                          If DIMM0 is dual-sided, this should be set to
10254                                                          NXM[MEM_MSB_D0_R0]. If CONFIG[RANK_ENA] is cleared, this field is ignored. */
10255     uint64_t mem_msb_d0_r0                : 4;  /**< Maximum row MSB for DIMM0, RANK0. */
10256     uint64_t cs_mask                      : 8;  /**< Chip select mask. This mask corresponds to the four chip selects for a memory
10257                                                          configuration. If LMC()_CONFIG[RANK_ENA]=0 then this mask must be set in pairs because
10258                                                          each reference address will assert a pair of chip selects. If the chip select(s) have a
10259                                                          corresponding CS_MASK bit set, then the reference is to nonexistent memory (NXM). LMC will
10260                                                          alias a NXM read reference to use the lowest, legal chip select(s) and return zeros. LMC
10261                                                          normally discards NXM write operations, but will also alias them when LMC()_CONTROL
10262                                                          [NXM_WRITE_EN]=1. */
10263 #else
10264     uint64_t cs_mask                      : 8;
10265     uint64_t mem_msb_d0_r0                : 4;
10266     uint64_t mem_msb_d0_r1                : 4;
10267     uint64_t mem_msb_d1_r0                : 4;
10268     uint64_t mem_msb_d1_r1                : 4;
10269     uint64_t mem_msb_d2_r0                : 4;
10270     uint64_t mem_msb_d2_r1                : 4;
10271     uint64_t mem_msb_d3_r0                : 4;
10272     uint64_t mem_msb_d3_r1                : 4;
10273     uint64_t reserved_40_63               : 24;
10274 #endif
10275     } s;
10276     struct cvmx_lmcx_nxm_cn52xx {
10277 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
10278     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
10279     uint64_t cs_mask                      : 8;  /**< Chip select mask.
10280                                                          This mask corresponds to the 8 chip selects for a memory
10281                                                          configuration.  If LMC_MEM_CFG0[BUNK_ENA]==0 then this
10282                                                          mask must be set in pairs because each reference address
10283                                                          will assert a pair of chip selects.  If the chip
10284                                                          select(s) have a corresponding CS_MASK bit set, then the
10285                                                          reference is to non-existent memory.  LMC will alias the
10286                                                          reference to use the lowest, legal chip select(s) in
10287                                                          that case. */
10288 #else
10289     uint64_t cs_mask                      : 8;
10290     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
10291 #endif
10292     } cn52xx;
10293     struct cvmx_lmcx_nxm_cn52xx           cn56xx;
10294     struct cvmx_lmcx_nxm_cn52xx           cn58xx;
10295     struct cvmx_lmcx_nxm_s                cn61xx;
10296     struct cvmx_lmcx_nxm_s                cn63xx;
10297     struct cvmx_lmcx_nxm_s                cn63xxp1;
10298     struct cvmx_lmcx_nxm_s                cn66xx;
10299     struct cvmx_lmcx_nxm_s                cn68xx;
10300     struct cvmx_lmcx_nxm_s                cn68xxp1;
10301     struct cvmx_lmcx_nxm_cn70xx {
10302 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
10303     uint64_t reserved_24_63               : 40;
10304     uint64_t mem_msb_d1_r1                : 4;  /**< Reserved. */
10305     uint64_t mem_msb_d1_r0                : 4;  /**< Reserved. */
10306     uint64_t mem_msb_d0_r1                : 4;  /**< Max row MSB for DIMM0, RANK1/DIMM0 in single ranked. */
10307     uint64_t mem_msb_d0_r0                : 4;  /**< Max row MSB for DIMM0, RANK0. */
10308     uint64_t reserved_4_7                 : 4;
10309     uint64_t cs_mask                      : 4;  /**< Chip select mask. This mask corresponds to the four chip selects for a memory
10310                                                          configuration. If LMC(0..0)_CONFIG[RANK_ENA]=0 then this mask must be set in pairs because
10311                                                          each reference address will assert a pair of chip selects. If the chip select(s) have a
10312                                                          corresponding CS_MASK bit set, then the reference is to nonexistent memory (NXM). LMC will
10313                                                          alias a NXM read reference to use the lowest, legal chip select(s) and return zeros. LMC
10314                                                          normally discards NXM write operations, but will also alias them when LMC(0..0)_CONTROL
10315                                                          [NXM_WRITE_EN]=1. */
10316 #else
10317     uint64_t cs_mask                      : 4;
10318     uint64_t reserved_4_7                 : 4;
10319     uint64_t mem_msb_d0_r0                : 4;
10320     uint64_t mem_msb_d0_r1                : 4;
10321     uint64_t mem_msb_d1_r0                : 4;
10322     uint64_t mem_msb_d1_r1                : 4;
10323     uint64_t reserved_24_63               : 40;
10324 #endif
10325     } cn70xx;
10326     struct cvmx_lmcx_nxm_cn70xx           cn70xxp1;
10327     struct cvmx_lmcx_nxm_cn70xx           cn73xx;
10328     struct cvmx_lmcx_nxm_cn70xx           cn78xx;
10329     struct cvmx_lmcx_nxm_cn70xx           cn78xxp1;
10330     struct cvmx_lmcx_nxm_s                cnf71xx;
10331     struct cvmx_lmcx_nxm_cn70xx           cnf75xx;
10332 };
10333 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_nxm cvmx_lmcx_nxm_t;
10334 
10335 /**
10336  * cvmx_lmc#_nxm_fadr
10337  *
10338  * This register captures only the first transaction with a NXM error while an interrupt is
10339  * pending, and only captures a subsequent event once the interrupt is cleared by writing a 1 to
10340  * LMC()_INT[NXM_ERR]. It captures the actual L2C-LMC address provided to the LMC that caused
10341  * the NXM error. A read or write NXM error is captured only if enabled using the NXM event
10342  * enables.
10343  */
10344 union cvmx_lmcx_nxm_fadr {
10345     uint64_t u64;
10346     struct cvmx_lmcx_nxm_fadr_s {
10347 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
10348     uint64_t reserved_40_63               : 24;
10349     uint64_t nxm_faddr_ext                : 1;  /**< Extended bit for the Failing L2C-LMC address (bit 37). */
10350     uint64_t nxm_src                      : 1;  /**< Indicates the source of the operation that caused a NXM error:
10351                                                          0 = L2C.
10352                                                          1 = Reserved. */
10353     uint64_t nxm_type                     : 1;  /**< Indicates the type of operation that caused NXM error:
10354                                                          0 = Read, 1 = Write. */
10355     uint64_t nxm_faddr                    : 37; /**< Failing L2C-LMC address. Bits<4:0> are
10356                                                          always 0s for an L2C access. Bits<5:4> represent the fill order for an L2C read operation,
10357                                                          and the start point within a cache line for a write operation. */
10358 #else
10359     uint64_t nxm_faddr                    : 37;
10360     uint64_t nxm_type                     : 1;
10361     uint64_t nxm_src                      : 1;
10362     uint64_t nxm_faddr_ext                : 1;
10363     uint64_t reserved_40_63               : 24;
10364 #endif
10365     } s;
10366     struct cvmx_lmcx_nxm_fadr_cn70xx {
10367 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
10368     uint64_t reserved_39_63               : 25;
10369     uint64_t nxm_src                      : 1;  /**< Indicates the source of the operation that caused a NXM error:
10370                                                          0 = L2C, 1 = HFA */
10371     uint64_t nxm_type                     : 1;  /**< Indicates the type of operation that caused NXM error:
10372                                                          0 = Read, 1 = Write */
10373     uint64_t nxm_faddr                    : 37; /**< Failing L2C-LMC address. Bits<3:0> are always 0s for an HFA access, and bits<4:0> are
10374                                                          always 0s for an L2C access. Bits<5:4> represent the fill order for an L2C read operation,
10375                                                          and the start point within a cache line for a write operation. */
10376 #else
10377     uint64_t nxm_faddr                    : 37;
10378     uint64_t nxm_type                     : 1;
10379     uint64_t nxm_src                      : 1;
10380     uint64_t reserved_39_63               : 25;
10381 #endif
10382     } cn70xx;
10383     struct cvmx_lmcx_nxm_fadr_cn70xx      cn70xxp1;
10384     struct cvmx_lmcx_nxm_fadr_s           cn73xx;
10385     struct cvmx_lmcx_nxm_fadr_s           cn78xx;
10386     struct cvmx_lmcx_nxm_fadr_s           cn78xxp1;
10387     struct cvmx_lmcx_nxm_fadr_s           cnf75xx;
10388 };
10389 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_nxm_fadr cvmx_lmcx_nxm_fadr_t;
10390 
10391 /**
10392  * cvmx_lmc#_ops_cnt
10393  *
10394  * LMC_OPS_CNT  = Performance Counters
10395  *
10396  */
10397 union cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt {
10398     uint64_t u64;
10399     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_s {
10400 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
10401     uint64_t opscnt                       : 64; /**< Performance counter. A 64-bit counter that increments when the DDR3 data bus is being
10402                                                          used.
10403                                                          DDR bus utilization = OPSCNT / LMC()_DCLK_CNT. */
10404 #else
10405     uint64_t opscnt                       : 64;
10406 #endif
10407     } s;
10408     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_s            cn61xx;
10409     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_s            cn63xx;
10410     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_s            cn63xxp1;
10411     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_s            cn66xx;
10412     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_s            cn68xx;
10413     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_s            cn68xxp1;
10414     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_s            cn70xx;
10415     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_s            cn70xxp1;
10416     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_s            cn73xx;
10417     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_s            cn78xx;
10418     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_s            cn78xxp1;
10419     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_s            cnf71xx;
10420     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_s            cnf75xx;
10421 };
10422 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_t;
10423 
10424 /**
10425  * cvmx_lmc#_ops_cnt_hi
10426  *
10427  * LMC_OPS_CNT_HI  = Performance Counters
10428  *
10429  */
10430 union cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_hi {
10431     uint64_t u64;
10432     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_hi_s {
10433 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
10434     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
10435     uint64_t opscnt_hi                    : 32; /**< Performance Counter to measure Bus Utilization
10436                                                          Upper 32-bits of 64-bit counter
10437                                                            DRAM bus utilization = LMC_OPS_CNT_* /LMC_DCLK_CNT_* */
10438 #else
10439     uint64_t opscnt_hi                    : 32;
10440     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
10441 #endif
10442     } s;
10443     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_hi_s         cn30xx;
10444     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_hi_s         cn31xx;
10445     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_hi_s         cn38xx;
10446     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_hi_s         cn38xxp2;
10447     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_hi_s         cn50xx;
10448     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_hi_s         cn52xx;
10449     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_hi_s         cn52xxp1;
10450     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_hi_s         cn56xx;
10451     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_hi_s         cn56xxp1;
10452     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_hi_s         cn58xx;
10453     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_hi_s         cn58xxp1;
10454 };
10455 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_hi cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_hi_t;
10456 
10457 /**
10458  * cvmx_lmc#_ops_cnt_lo
10459  *
10460  * LMC_OPS_CNT_LO  = Performance Counters
10461  *
10462  */
10463 union cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_lo {
10464     uint64_t u64;
10465     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_lo_s {
10466 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
10467     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
10468     uint64_t opscnt_lo                    : 32; /**< Performance Counter
10469                                                          Low 32-bits of 64-bit counter
10470                                                            DRAM bus utilization = LMC_OPS_CNT_* /LMC_DCLK_CNT_* */
10471 #else
10472     uint64_t opscnt_lo                    : 32;
10473     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
10474 #endif
10475     } s;
10476     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_lo_s         cn30xx;
10477     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_lo_s         cn31xx;
10478     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_lo_s         cn38xx;
10479     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_lo_s         cn38xxp2;
10480     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_lo_s         cn50xx;
10481     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_lo_s         cn52xx;
10482     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_lo_s         cn52xxp1;
10483     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_lo_s         cn56xx;
10484     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_lo_s         cn56xxp1;
10485     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_lo_s         cn58xx;
10486     struct cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_lo_s         cn58xxp1;
10487 };
10488 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_lo cvmx_lmcx_ops_cnt_lo_t;
10489 
10490 /**
10491  * cvmx_lmc#_phy_ctl
10492  *
10493  * LMC_PHY_CTL = LMC PHY Control
10494  *
10495  */
10496 union cvmx_lmcx_phy_ctl {
10497     uint64_t u64;
10498     struct cvmx_lmcx_phy_ctl_s {
10499 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
10500     uint64_t reserved_61_63               : 3;
10501     uint64_t dsk_dbg_load_dis             : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10502     uint64_t dsk_dbg_overwrt_ena          : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10503     uint64_t dsk_dbg_wr_mode              : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10504     uint64_t data_rate_loopback           : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10505     uint64_t dq_shallow_loopback          : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10506     uint64_t dm_disable                   : 1;  /**< Write to 1 to disable the DRAM data mask feature by having LMC driving a constant value on
10507                                                          the
10508                                                          DDRX_DQS<17:9>_P pins of the chip during write operations. LMC drives a constant 0 in DDR3
10509                                                          and drives a constant 1 in DDR4.
10510                                                          Note that setting this field high is NOT allowed when LMC has the Write DBI feature turned
10511                                                          on
10512                                                          (MODEREG_PARAMS3[WR_DBI]=1). */
10513     uint64_t c1_sel                       : 2;  /**< Reserved. */
10514     uint64_t c0_sel                       : 2;  /**< Reserved. */
10515     uint64_t phy_reset                    : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10516     uint64_t dsk_dbg_rd_complete          : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10517     uint64_t dsk_dbg_rd_data              : 10; /**< Reserved. */
10518     uint64_t dsk_dbg_rd_start             : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10519     uint64_t dsk_dbg_clk_scaler           : 2;  /**< Reserved. */
10520     uint64_t dsk_dbg_offset               : 2;  /**< Reserved. */
10521     uint64_t dsk_dbg_num_bits_sel         : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10522     uint64_t dsk_dbg_byte_sel             : 4;  /**< Reserved. */
10523     uint64_t dsk_dbg_bit_sel              : 4;  /**< Reserved. */
10524     uint64_t dbi_mode_ena                 : 1;  /**< Enable DBI mode for PHY. */
10525     uint64_t ddr_error_n_ena              : 1;  /**< Enable error_alert_n signal for PHY. */
10526     uint64_t ref_pin_on                   : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10527     uint64_t dac_on                       : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10528     uint64_t int_pad_loopback_ena         : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10529     uint64_t int_phy_loopback_ena         : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10530     uint64_t phy_dsk_reset                : 1;  /**< PHY deskew reset. When set, the deskew reset signal goes active if the Vrefint/deskew
10531                                                          training sequence is in the idle state. */
10532     uint64_t phy_dsk_byp                  : 1;  /**< PHY deskew bypass. */
10533     uint64_t phy_pwr_save_disable         : 1;  /**< DDR PHY power save disable. */
10534     uint64_t ten                          : 1;  /**< DDR PHY test enable pin. */
10535     uint64_t rx_always_on                 : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
10536     uint64_t lv_mode                      : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
10537     uint64_t ck_tune1                     : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
10538     uint64_t ck_dlyout1                   : 4;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
10539     uint64_t ck_tune0                     : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
10540     uint64_t ck_dlyout0                   : 4;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
10541     uint64_t loopback                     : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
10542     uint64_t loopback_pos                 : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
10543     uint64_t ts_stagger                   : 1;  /**< TS stagger mode. This mode configures output drivers with two-stage drive strength to
10544                                                          avoid undershoot issues on the bus when strong drivers are suddenly turned on. When this
10545                                                          mode is asserted, CNXXXX will configure output drivers to be weak drivers (60 ohm output
10546                                                          impedance) at the first CK cycle, and change drivers to the designated drive strengths
10547                                                          specified in LMC()_COMP_CTL2[CMD_CTL/CK_CTL/DQX_CTL] starting at the following cycle. */
10548 #else
10549     uint64_t ts_stagger                   : 1;
10550     uint64_t loopback_pos                 : 1;
10551     uint64_t loopback                     : 1;
10552     uint64_t ck_dlyout0                   : 4;
10553     uint64_t ck_tune0                     : 1;
10554     uint64_t ck_dlyout1                   : 4;
10555     uint64_t ck_tune1                     : 1;
10556     uint64_t lv_mode                      : 1;
10557     uint64_t rx_always_on                 : 1;
10558     uint64_t ten                          : 1;
10559     uint64_t phy_pwr_save_disable         : 1;
10560     uint64_t phy_dsk_byp                  : 1;
10561     uint64_t phy_dsk_reset                : 1;
10562     uint64_t int_phy_loopback_ena         : 1;
10563     uint64_t int_pad_loopback_ena         : 1;
10564     uint64_t dac_on                       : 1;
10565     uint64_t ref_pin_on                   : 1;
10566     uint64_t ddr_error_n_ena              : 1;
10567     uint64_t dbi_mode_ena                 : 1;
10568     uint64_t dsk_dbg_bit_sel              : 4;
10569     uint64_t dsk_dbg_byte_sel             : 4;
10570     uint64_t dsk_dbg_num_bits_sel         : 1;
10571     uint64_t dsk_dbg_offset               : 2;
10572     uint64_t dsk_dbg_clk_scaler           : 2;
10573     uint64_t dsk_dbg_rd_start             : 1;
10574     uint64_t dsk_dbg_rd_data              : 10;
10575     uint64_t dsk_dbg_rd_complete          : 1;
10576     uint64_t phy_reset                    : 1;
10577     uint64_t c0_sel                       : 2;
10578     uint64_t c1_sel                       : 2;
10579     uint64_t dm_disable                   : 1;
10580     uint64_t dq_shallow_loopback          : 1;
10581     uint64_t data_rate_loopback           : 1;
10582     uint64_t dsk_dbg_wr_mode              : 1;
10583     uint64_t dsk_dbg_overwrt_ena          : 1;
10584     uint64_t dsk_dbg_load_dis             : 1;
10585     uint64_t reserved_61_63               : 3;
10586 #endif
10587     } s;
10588     struct cvmx_lmcx_phy_ctl_cn61xx {
10589 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
10590     uint64_t reserved_15_63               : 49;
10591     uint64_t rx_always_on                 : 1;  /**< Disable dynamic DDR3 IO Rx power gating */
10592     uint64_t lv_mode                      : 1;  /**< Low Voltage Mode (1.35V) */
10593     uint64_t ck_tune1                     : 1;  /**< Clock Tune */
10594     uint64_t ck_dlyout1                   : 4;  /**< Clock delay out setting */
10595     uint64_t ck_tune0                     : 1;  /**< Clock Tune */
10596     uint64_t ck_dlyout0                   : 4;  /**< Clock delay out setting */
10597     uint64_t loopback                     : 1;  /**< Loopback enable */
10598     uint64_t loopback_pos                 : 1;  /**< Loopback pos mode */
10599     uint64_t ts_stagger                   : 1;  /**< TS Staggermode
10600                                                          This mode configures output drivers with 2-stage drive
10601                                                          strength to avoid undershoot issues on the bus when strong
10602                                                          drivers are suddenly turned on. When this mode is asserted,
10603                                                          Octeon will configure output drivers to be weak drivers
10604                                                          (60 ohm output impedance) at the first CK cycle, and
10605                                                          change drivers to the designated drive strengths specified
10606                                                          in $LMC(0)_COMP_CTL2 [CMD_CTL/CK_CTL/DQX_CTL] starting
10607                                                          at the following cycle */
10608 #else
10609     uint64_t ts_stagger                   : 1;
10610     uint64_t loopback_pos                 : 1;
10611     uint64_t loopback                     : 1;
10612     uint64_t ck_dlyout0                   : 4;
10613     uint64_t ck_tune0                     : 1;
10614     uint64_t ck_dlyout1                   : 4;
10615     uint64_t ck_tune1                     : 1;
10616     uint64_t lv_mode                      : 1;
10617     uint64_t rx_always_on                 : 1;
10618     uint64_t reserved_15_63               : 49;
10619 #endif
10620     } cn61xx;
10621     struct cvmx_lmcx_phy_ctl_cn61xx       cn63xx;
10622     struct cvmx_lmcx_phy_ctl_cn63xxp1 {
10623 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
10624     uint64_t reserved_14_63               : 50;
10625     uint64_t lv_mode                      : 1;  /**< Low Voltage Mode (1.35V) */
10626     uint64_t ck_tune1                     : 1;  /**< Clock Tune */
10627     uint64_t ck_dlyout1                   : 4;  /**< Clock delay out setting */
10628     uint64_t ck_tune0                     : 1;  /**< Clock Tune */
10629     uint64_t ck_dlyout0                   : 4;  /**< Clock delay out setting */
10630     uint64_t loopback                     : 1;  /**< Loopback enable */
10631     uint64_t loopback_pos                 : 1;  /**< Loopback pos mode */
10632     uint64_t ts_stagger                   : 1;  /**< TS Staggermode
10633                                                          This mode configures output drivers with 2-stage drive
10634                                                          strength to avoid undershoot issues on the bus when strong
10635                                                          drivers are suddenly turned on. When this mode is asserted,
10636                                                          Octeon will configure output drivers to be weak drivers
10637                                                          (60 ohm output impedance) at the first CK cycle, and
10638                                                          change drivers to the designated drive strengths specified
10639                                                          in $LMC(0)_COMP_CTL2 [CMD_CTL/CK_CTL/DQX_CTL] starting
10640                                                          at the following cycle */
10641 #else
10642     uint64_t ts_stagger                   : 1;
10643     uint64_t loopback_pos                 : 1;
10644     uint64_t loopback                     : 1;
10645     uint64_t ck_dlyout0                   : 4;
10646     uint64_t ck_tune0                     : 1;
10647     uint64_t ck_dlyout1                   : 4;
10648     uint64_t ck_tune1                     : 1;
10649     uint64_t lv_mode                      : 1;
10650     uint64_t reserved_14_63               : 50;
10651 #endif
10652     } cn63xxp1;
10653     struct cvmx_lmcx_phy_ctl_cn61xx       cn66xx;
10654     struct cvmx_lmcx_phy_ctl_cn61xx       cn68xx;
10655     struct cvmx_lmcx_phy_ctl_cn61xx       cn68xxp1;
10656     struct cvmx_lmcx_phy_ctl_cn70xx {
10657 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
10658     uint64_t reserved_51_63               : 13;
10659     uint64_t phy_reset                    : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10660     uint64_t dsk_dbg_rd_complete          : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10661     uint64_t dsk_dbg_rd_data              : 10; /**< Reserved. */
10662     uint64_t dsk_dbg_rd_start             : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10663     uint64_t dsk_dbg_clk_scaler           : 2;  /**< Reserved. */
10664     uint64_t dsk_dbg_offset               : 2;  /**< Reserved. */
10665     uint64_t dsk_dbg_num_bits_sel         : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10666     uint64_t dsk_dbg_byte_sel             : 4;  /**< Reserved. */
10667     uint64_t dsk_dbg_bit_sel              : 4;  /**< Reserved. */
10668     uint64_t dbi_mode_ena                 : 1;  /**< Enable DBI mode for PHY, must be 0.  DBI mode not supported
10669                                                          in CN70XX. */
10670     uint64_t ddr_error_n_ena              : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10671     uint64_t ref_pin_on                   : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10672     uint64_t dac_on                       : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10673     uint64_t int_pad_loopback_ena         : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10674     uint64_t int_phy_loopback_ena         : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10675     uint64_t phy_dsk_reset                : 1;  /**< PHY deskew reset. When set, the deskew reset signal goes active if the Vrefint/deskew
10676                                                          training sequence is in the idle state. */
10677     uint64_t phy_dsk_byp                  : 1;  /**< PHY deskew bypass. */
10678     uint64_t phy_pwr_save_disable         : 1;  /**< DDR PHY power save disable. */
10679     uint64_t ten                          : 1;  /**< DDR PHY test enable pin. */
10680     uint64_t rx_always_on                 : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
10681     uint64_t lv_mode                      : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
10682     uint64_t ck_tune1                     : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
10683     uint64_t ck_dlyout1                   : 4;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
10684     uint64_t ck_tune0                     : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
10685     uint64_t ck_dlyout0                   : 4;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
10686     uint64_t loopback                     : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
10687     uint64_t loopback_pos                 : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
10688     uint64_t ts_stagger                   : 1;  /**< TS stagger mode. This mode configures output drivers with two-stage drive strength to
10689                                                          avoid undershoot issues on the bus when strong drivers are suddenly turned on. When this
10690                                                          mode is asserted, CN78XX will configure output drivers to be weak drivers (60ohm output
10691                                                          impedance) at the first CK cycle, and change drivers to the designated drive strengths
10692                                                          specified in LMC(0..0)_COMP_CTL2[CMD_CTL/CK_CTL/DQX_CTL] starting at the following cycle. */
10693 #else
10694     uint64_t ts_stagger                   : 1;
10695     uint64_t loopback_pos                 : 1;
10696     uint64_t loopback                     : 1;
10697     uint64_t ck_dlyout0                   : 4;
10698     uint64_t ck_tune0                     : 1;
10699     uint64_t ck_dlyout1                   : 4;
10700     uint64_t ck_tune1                     : 1;
10701     uint64_t lv_mode                      : 1;
10702     uint64_t rx_always_on                 : 1;
10703     uint64_t ten                          : 1;
10704     uint64_t phy_pwr_save_disable         : 1;
10705     uint64_t phy_dsk_byp                  : 1;
10706     uint64_t phy_dsk_reset                : 1;
10707     uint64_t int_phy_loopback_ena         : 1;
10708     uint64_t int_pad_loopback_ena         : 1;
10709     uint64_t dac_on                       : 1;
10710     uint64_t ref_pin_on                   : 1;
10711     uint64_t ddr_error_n_ena              : 1;
10712     uint64_t dbi_mode_ena                 : 1;
10713     uint64_t dsk_dbg_bit_sel              : 4;
10714     uint64_t dsk_dbg_byte_sel             : 4;
10715     uint64_t dsk_dbg_num_bits_sel         : 1;
10716     uint64_t dsk_dbg_offset               : 2;
10717     uint64_t dsk_dbg_clk_scaler           : 2;
10718     uint64_t dsk_dbg_rd_start             : 1;
10719     uint64_t dsk_dbg_rd_data              : 10;
10720     uint64_t dsk_dbg_rd_complete          : 1;
10721     uint64_t phy_reset                    : 1;
10722     uint64_t reserved_51_63               : 13;
10723 #endif
10724     } cn70xx;
10725     struct cvmx_lmcx_phy_ctl_cn70xx       cn70xxp1;
10726     struct cvmx_lmcx_phy_ctl_cn73xx {
10727 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
10728     uint64_t reserved_58_63               : 6;
10729     uint64_t data_rate_loopback           : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10730     uint64_t dq_shallow_loopback          : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10731     uint64_t dm_disable                   : 1;  /**< Write to 1 to disable the DRAM data mask feature by having LMC driving a constant value on
10732                                                          the
10733                                                          DDRX_DQS<17:9>_P pins of the chip during write operations. LMC drives a constant 0 in DDR3
10734                                                          and drives a constant 1 in DDR4.
10735                                                          Note that setting this field high is NOT allowed when LMC has the Write DBI feature turned
10736                                                          on
