10737                                                          (MODEREG_PARAMS3[WR_DBI]=1). */
10738     uint64_t c1_sel                       : 2;  /**< Reserved. */
10739     uint64_t c0_sel                       : 2;  /**< Reserved. */
10740     uint64_t phy_reset                    : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10741     uint64_t dsk_dbg_rd_complete          : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10742     uint64_t dsk_dbg_rd_data              : 10; /**< Reserved. */
10743     uint64_t dsk_dbg_rd_start             : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10744     uint64_t dsk_dbg_clk_scaler           : 2;  /**< Reserved. */
10745     uint64_t dsk_dbg_offset               : 2;  /**< Reserved. */
10746     uint64_t dsk_dbg_num_bits_sel         : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10747     uint64_t dsk_dbg_byte_sel             : 4;  /**< Reserved. */
10748     uint64_t dsk_dbg_bit_sel              : 4;  /**< Reserved. */
10749     uint64_t dbi_mode_ena                 : 1;  /**< Enable DBI mode for PHY. */
10750     uint64_t ddr_error_n_ena              : 1;  /**< Enable error_alert_n signal for PHY. */
10751     uint64_t ref_pin_on                   : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10752     uint64_t dac_on                       : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10753     uint64_t int_pad_loopback_ena         : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10754     uint64_t int_phy_loopback_ena         : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
10755     uint64_t phy_dsk_reset                : 1;  /**< PHY deskew reset. When set, the deskew reset signal goes active if the Vrefint/deskew
10756                                                          training sequence is in the idle state. */
10757     uint64_t phy_dsk_byp                  : 1;  /**< PHY deskew bypass. */
10758     uint64_t phy_pwr_save_disable         : 1;  /**< DDR PHY power save disable. */
10759     uint64_t ten                          : 1;  /**< DDR PHY test enable pin. */
10760     uint64_t rx_always_on                 : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
10761     uint64_t lv_mode                      : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
10762     uint64_t ck_tune1                     : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
10763     uint64_t ck_dlyout1                   : 4;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
10764     uint64_t ck_tune0                     : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
10765     uint64_t ck_dlyout0                   : 4;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
10766     uint64_t loopback                     : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
10767     uint64_t loopback_pos                 : 1;  /**< Reserved; must be zero. */
10768     uint64_t ts_stagger                   : 1;  /**< TS stagger mode. This mode configures output drivers with two-stage drive strength to
10769                                                          avoid undershoot issues on the bus when strong drivers are suddenly turned on. When this
10770                                                          mode is asserted, CNXXXX will configure output drivers to be weak drivers (60 ohm output
10771                                                          impedance) at the first CK cycle, and change drivers to the designated drive strengths
10772                                                          specified in LMC()_COMP_CTL2[CMD_CTL/CK_CTL/DQX_CTL] starting at the following cycle. */
10773 #else
10774     uint64_t ts_stagger                   : 1;
10775     uint64_t loopback_pos                 : 1;
10776     uint64_t loopback                     : 1;
10777     uint64_t ck_dlyout0                   : 4;
10778     uint64_t ck_tune0                     : 1;
10779     uint64_t ck_dlyout1                   : 4;
10780     uint64_t ck_tune1                     : 1;
10781     uint64_t lv_mode                      : 1;
10782     uint64_t rx_always_on                 : 1;
10783     uint64_t ten                          : 1;
10784     uint64_t phy_pwr_save_disable         : 1;
10785     uint64_t phy_dsk_byp                  : 1;
10786     uint64_t phy_dsk_reset                : 1;
10787     uint64_t int_phy_loopback_ena         : 1;
10788     uint64_t int_pad_loopback_ena         : 1;
10789     uint64_t dac_on                       : 1;
10790     uint64_t ref_pin_on                   : 1;
10791     uint64_t ddr_error_n_ena              : 1;
10792     uint64_t dbi_mode_ena                 : 1;
10793     uint64_t dsk_dbg_bit_sel              : 4;
10794     uint64_t dsk_dbg_byte_sel             : 4;
10795     uint64_t dsk_dbg_num_bits_sel         : 1;
10796     uint64_t dsk_dbg_offset               : 2;
10797     uint64_t dsk_dbg_clk_scaler           : 2;
10798     uint64_t dsk_dbg_rd_start             : 1;
10799     uint64_t dsk_dbg_rd_data              : 10;
10800     uint64_t dsk_dbg_rd_complete          : 1;
10801     uint64_t phy_reset                    : 1;
10802     uint64_t c0_sel                       : 2;
10803     uint64_t c1_sel                       : 2;
10804     uint64_t dm_disable                   : 1;
10805     uint64_t dq_shallow_loopback          : 1;
10806     uint64_t data_rate_loopback           : 1;
10807     uint64_t reserved_58_63               : 6;
10808 #endif
10809     } cn73xx;
10810     struct cvmx_lmcx_phy_ctl_s            cn78xx;
10811     struct cvmx_lmcx_phy_ctl_s            cn78xxp1;
10812     struct cvmx_lmcx_phy_ctl_cn61xx       cnf71xx;
10813     struct cvmx_lmcx_phy_ctl_s            cnf75xx;
10814 };
10815 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_phy_ctl cvmx_lmcx_phy_ctl_t;
10816 
10817 /**
10818  * cvmx_lmc#_phy_ctl2
10819  */
10820 union cvmx_lmcx_phy_ctl2 {
10821     uint64_t u64;
10822     struct cvmx_lmcx_phy_ctl2_s {
10823 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
10824     uint64_t reserved_27_63               : 37;
10825     uint64_t dqs8_dsk_adj                 : 3;  /**< Provides adjustable deskew settings for DQS signal of the ECC byte.
10826                                                          The default value should be 0x4. */
10827     uint64_t dqs7_dsk_adj                 : 3;  /**< Provides adjustable deskew settings for DQS signal of Byte 7.
10828                                                          The default value should be 0x4. */
10829     uint64_t dqs6_dsk_adj                 : 3;  /**< Provides adjustable deskew settings for DQS signal of Byte 6.
10830                                                          The default value should be 0x4. */
10831     uint64_t dqs5_dsk_adj                 : 3;  /**< Provides adjustable deskew settings for DQS signal of Byte 5.
10832                                                          The default value should be 0x4. */
10833     uint64_t dqs4_dsk_adj                 : 3;  /**< Provides adjustable deskew settings for DQS signal of Byte 4.
10834                                                          The default value should be 0x4. */
10835     uint64_t dqs3_dsk_adj                 : 3;  /**< Provides adjustable deskew settings for DQS signal of Byte 3.
10836                                                          The default value should be 0x4. */
10837     uint64_t dqs2_dsk_adj                 : 3;  /**< Provides adjustable deskew settings for DQS signal of Byte2.
10838                                                          The default value should be 0x4. */
10839     uint64_t dqs1_dsk_adj                 : 3;  /**< Provides adjustable deskew settings for DQS signal of Byte 1.
10840                                                          The default value should be 0x4. */
10841     uint64_t dqs0_dsk_adj                 : 3;  /**< Provides adjustable deskew settings for DQS signal of Byte 0.
10842                                                          The default value should be 0x4. */
10843 #else
10844     uint64_t dqs0_dsk_adj                 : 3;
10845     uint64_t dqs1_dsk_adj                 : 3;
10846     uint64_t dqs2_dsk_adj                 : 3;
10847     uint64_t dqs3_dsk_adj                 : 3;
10848     uint64_t dqs4_dsk_adj                 : 3;
10849     uint64_t dqs5_dsk_adj                 : 3;
10850     uint64_t dqs6_dsk_adj                 : 3;
10851     uint64_t dqs7_dsk_adj                 : 3;
10852     uint64_t dqs8_dsk_adj                 : 3;
10853     uint64_t reserved_27_63               : 37;
10854 #endif
10855     } s;
10856     struct cvmx_lmcx_phy_ctl2_s           cn78xx;
10857     struct cvmx_lmcx_phy_ctl2_s           cnf75xx;
10858 };
10859 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_phy_ctl2 cvmx_lmcx_phy_ctl2_t;
10860 
10861 /**
10862  * cvmx_lmc#_pll_bwctl
10863  *
10864  * LMC_PLL_BWCTL  = DDR PLL Bandwidth Control Register
10865  *
10866  */
10867 union cvmx_lmcx_pll_bwctl {
10868     uint64_t u64;
10869     struct cvmx_lmcx_pll_bwctl_s {
10870 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
10871     uint64_t reserved_5_63                : 59;
10872     uint64_t bwupd                        : 1;  /**< Load this Bandwidth Register value into the PLL */
10873     uint64_t bwctl                        : 4;  /**< Bandwidth Control Register for DDR PLL */
10874 #else
10875     uint64_t bwctl                        : 4;
10876     uint64_t bwupd                        : 1;
10877     uint64_t reserved_5_63                : 59;
10878 #endif
10879     } s;
10880     struct cvmx_lmcx_pll_bwctl_s          cn30xx;
10881     struct cvmx_lmcx_pll_bwctl_s          cn31xx;
10882     struct cvmx_lmcx_pll_bwctl_s          cn38xx;
10883     struct cvmx_lmcx_pll_bwctl_s          cn38xxp2;
10884 };
10885 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_pll_bwctl cvmx_lmcx_pll_bwctl_t;
10886 
10887 /**
10888  * cvmx_lmc#_pll_ctl
10889  *
10890  * LMC_PLL_CTL = LMC pll control
10891  *
10892  *
10893  * Notes:
10894  * This CSR is only relevant for LMC0. LMC1_PLL_CTL is not used.
10895  *
10896  * Exactly one of EN2, EN4, EN6, EN8, EN12, EN16 must be set.
10897  *
10898  * The resultant DDR_CK frequency is the DDR2_REF_CLK
10899  * frequency multiplied by:
10900  *
10901  *     (CLKF + 1) / ((CLKR + 1) * EN(2,4,6,8,12,16))
10902  *
10903  * The PLL frequency, which is:
10904  *
10905  *     (DDR2_REF_CLK freq) * ((CLKF + 1) / (CLKR + 1))
10906  *
10907  * must reside between 1.2 and 2.5 GHz. A faster PLL frequency is desirable if there is a choice.
10908  */
10909 union cvmx_lmcx_pll_ctl {
10910     uint64_t u64;
10911     struct cvmx_lmcx_pll_ctl_s {
10912 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
10913     uint64_t reserved_30_63               : 34;
10914     uint64_t bypass                       : 1;  /**< PLL Bypass */
10915     uint64_t fasten_n                     : 1;  /**< Should be set, especially when CLKF > ~80 */
10916     uint64_t div_reset                    : 1;  /**< Analog pll divider reset
10917                                                          De-assert at least 500*(CLKR+1) reference clock
10918                                                          cycles following RESET_N de-assertion. */
10919     uint64_t reset_n                      : 1;  /**< Analog pll reset
10920                                                          De-assert at least 5 usec after CLKF, CLKR,
10921                                                          and EN* are set up. */
10922     uint64_t clkf                         : 12; /**< Multiply reference by CLKF + 1
10923                                                          CLKF must be <= 128 */
10924     uint64_t clkr                         : 6;  /**< Divide reference by CLKR + 1 */
10925     uint64_t reserved_6_7                 : 2;
10926     uint64_t en16                         : 1;  /**< Divide output by 16 */
10927     uint64_t en12                         : 1;  /**< Divide output by 12 */
10928     uint64_t en8                          : 1;  /**< Divide output by 8 */
10929     uint64_t en6                          : 1;  /**< Divide output by 6 */
10930     uint64_t en4                          : 1;  /**< Divide output by 4 */
10931     uint64_t en2                          : 1;  /**< Divide output by 2 */
10932 #else
10933     uint64_t en2                          : 1;
10934     uint64_t en4                          : 1;
10935     uint64_t en6                          : 1;
10936     uint64_t en8                          : 1;
10937     uint64_t en12                         : 1;
10938     uint64_t en16                         : 1;
10939     uint64_t reserved_6_7                 : 2;
10940     uint64_t clkr                         : 6;
10941     uint64_t clkf                         : 12;
10942     uint64_t reset_n                      : 1;
10943     uint64_t div_reset                    : 1;
10944     uint64_t fasten_n                     : 1;
10945     uint64_t bypass                       : 1;
10946     uint64_t reserved_30_63               : 34;
10947 #endif
10948     } s;
10949     struct cvmx_lmcx_pll_ctl_cn50xx {
10950 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
10951     uint64_t reserved_29_63               : 35;
10952     uint64_t fasten_n                     : 1;  /**< Should be set, especially when CLKF > ~80 */
10953     uint64_t div_reset                    : 1;  /**< Analog pll divider reset
10954                                                          De-assert at least 500*(CLKR+1) reference clock
10955                                                          cycles following RESET_N de-assertion. */
10956     uint64_t reset_n                      : 1;  /**< Analog pll reset
10957                                                          De-assert at least 5 usec after CLKF, CLKR,
10958                                                          and EN* are set up. */
10959     uint64_t clkf                         : 12; /**< Multiply reference by CLKF + 1
10960                                                          CLKF must be <= 256 */
10961     uint64_t clkr                         : 6;  /**< Divide reference by CLKR + 1 */
10962     uint64_t reserved_6_7                 : 2;
10963     uint64_t en16                         : 1;  /**< Divide output by 16 */
10964     uint64_t en12                         : 1;  /**< Divide output by 12 */
10965     uint64_t en8                          : 1;  /**< Divide output by 8 */
10966     uint64_t en6                          : 1;  /**< Divide output by 6 */
10967     uint64_t en4                          : 1;  /**< Divide output by 4 */
10968     uint64_t en2                          : 1;  /**< Divide output by 2 */
10969 #else
10970     uint64_t en2                          : 1;
10971     uint64_t en4                          : 1;
10972     uint64_t en6                          : 1;
10973     uint64_t en8                          : 1;
10974     uint64_t en12                         : 1;
10975     uint64_t en16                         : 1;
10976     uint64_t reserved_6_7                 : 2;
10977     uint64_t clkr                         : 6;
10978     uint64_t clkf                         : 12;
10979     uint64_t reset_n                      : 1;
10980     uint64_t div_reset                    : 1;
10981     uint64_t fasten_n                     : 1;
10982     uint64_t reserved_29_63               : 35;
10983 #endif
10984     } cn50xx;
10985     struct cvmx_lmcx_pll_ctl_s            cn52xx;
10986     struct cvmx_lmcx_pll_ctl_s            cn52xxp1;
10987     struct cvmx_lmcx_pll_ctl_cn50xx       cn56xx;
10988     struct cvmx_lmcx_pll_ctl_cn56xxp1 {
10989 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
10990     uint64_t reserved_28_63               : 36;
10991     uint64_t div_reset                    : 1;  /**< Analog pll divider reset
10992                                                          De-assert at least 500*(CLKR+1) reference clock
10993                                                          cycles following RESET_N de-assertion. */
10994     uint64_t reset_n                      : 1;  /**< Analog pll reset
10995                                                          De-assert at least 5 usec after CLKF, CLKR,
10996                                                          and EN* are set up. */
10997     uint64_t clkf                         : 12; /**< Multiply reference by CLKF + 1
10998                                                          CLKF must be <= 128 */
10999     uint64_t clkr                         : 6;  /**< Divide reference by CLKR + 1 */
11000     uint64_t reserved_6_7                 : 2;
11001     uint64_t en16                         : 1;  /**< Divide output by 16 */
11002     uint64_t en12                         : 1;  /**< Divide output by 12 */
11003     uint64_t en8                          : 1;  /**< Divide output by 8 */
11004     uint64_t en6                          : 1;  /**< Divide output by 6 */
11005     uint64_t en4                          : 1;  /**< Divide output by 4 */
11006     uint64_t en2                          : 1;  /**< Divide output by 2 */
11007 #else
11008     uint64_t en2                          : 1;
11009     uint64_t en4                          : 1;
11010     uint64_t en6                          : 1;
11011     uint64_t en8                          : 1;
11012     uint64_t en12                         : 1;
11013     uint64_t en16                         : 1;
11014     uint64_t reserved_6_7                 : 2;
11015     uint64_t clkr                         : 6;
11016     uint64_t clkf                         : 12;
11017     uint64_t reset_n                      : 1;
11018     uint64_t div_reset                    : 1;
11019     uint64_t reserved_28_63               : 36;
11020 #endif
11021     } cn56xxp1;
11022     struct cvmx_lmcx_pll_ctl_cn56xxp1     cn58xx;
11023     struct cvmx_lmcx_pll_ctl_cn56xxp1     cn58xxp1;
11024 };
11025 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_pll_ctl cvmx_lmcx_pll_ctl_t;
11026 
11027 /**
11028  * cvmx_lmc#_pll_status
11029  *
11030  * LMC_PLL_STATUS = LMC pll status
11031  *
11032  */
11033 union cvmx_lmcx_pll_status {
11034     uint64_t u64;
11035     struct cvmx_lmcx_pll_status_s {
11036 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
11037     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
11038     uint64_t ddr__nctl                    : 5;  /**< DDR nctl from compensation circuit */
11039     uint64_t ddr__pctl                    : 5;  /**< DDR pctl from compensation circuit */
11040     uint64_t reserved_2_21                : 20;
11041     uint64_t rfslip                       : 1;  /**< Reference clock slip */
11042     uint64_t fbslip                       : 1;  /**< Feedback clock slip */
11043 #else
11044     uint64_t fbslip                       : 1;
11045     uint64_t rfslip                       : 1;
11046     uint64_t reserved_2_21                : 20;
11047     uint64_t ddr__pctl                    : 5;
11048     uint64_t ddr__nctl                    : 5;
11049     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
11050 #endif
11051     } s;
11052     struct cvmx_lmcx_pll_status_s         cn50xx;
11053     struct cvmx_lmcx_pll_status_s         cn52xx;
11054     struct cvmx_lmcx_pll_status_s         cn52xxp1;
11055     struct cvmx_lmcx_pll_status_s         cn56xx;
11056     struct cvmx_lmcx_pll_status_s         cn56xxp1;
11057     struct cvmx_lmcx_pll_status_s         cn58xx;
11058     struct cvmx_lmcx_pll_status_cn58xxp1 {
11059 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
11060     uint64_t reserved_2_63                : 62;
11061     uint64_t rfslip                       : 1;  /**< Reference clock slip */
11062     uint64_t fbslip                       : 1;  /**< Feedback clock slip */
11063 #else
11064     uint64_t fbslip                       : 1;
11065     uint64_t rfslip                       : 1;
11066     uint64_t reserved_2_63                : 62;
11067 #endif
11068     } cn58xxp1;
11069 };
11070 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_pll_status cvmx_lmcx_pll_status_t;
11071 
11072 /**
11073  * cvmx_lmc#_ppr_ctl
11074  *
11075  * This register contains programmable timing and control parameters used
11076  * when running the post package repair sequence. The timing fields
11077  * PPR_CTL[TPGMPST], PPR_CTL[TPGM_EXIT] and PPR_CTL[TPGM] need to be set as
11078  * to satisfy the minimum values mentioned in the JEDEC DDR4 spec before
11079  * running the PPR sequence. See LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL,INIT_START] to run
11080  * the PPR sequence.
11081  *
11082  * Running hard PPR may require LMC to issue security key as four consecutive
11083  * MR0 commands, each with a unique address field A[17:0]. Set the security
11084  * key in the general purpose CSRs as follows:
11085  *
11086  * _ Security key 0 = LMC()_GENERAL_PURPOSE0[DATA]<17:0>.
11087  * _ Security key 1 = LMC()_GENERAL_PURPOSE0[DATA]<35:18>.
11088  * _ Security key 2 = LMC()_GENERAL_PURPOSE1[DATA]<17:0>.
11089  * _ Security key 3 = LMC()_GENERAL_PURPOSE1[DATA]<35:18>.
11090  */
11091 union cvmx_lmcx_ppr_ctl {
11092     uint64_t u64;
11093     struct cvmx_lmcx_ppr_ctl_s {
11094 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
11095     uint64_t reserved_27_63               : 37;
11096     uint64_t lrank_sel                    : 3;  /**< Selects which logical rank to perform the post package repair sequence.
11097                                                          Package ranks are selected by LMC()_MR_MPR_CTL[MR_WR_RANK]. */
11098     uint64_t skip_issue_security          : 1;  /**< Personality bit for the PPR sequence. When set, this field forces the sequence to skip
11099                                                          issuing four consecutive MR0 commands that suppliy the security key. */
11100     uint64_t sppr                         : 1;  /**< Personality bit for the PPR sequence. When set, this field forces the sequence to run
11101                                                          the soft PPR mode. */
11102     uint64_t tpgm                         : 10; /**< Indicates the programming time (tPGM) constraint used when running PPR sequence.
11103                                                          For hard PPR (PPR_CTL[SPPR] = 0), set this field as follows:
11104                                                          RNDUP[TPGM(ns) / (1048576 * TCYC(ns))].
11105                                                          For soft PPR (PPR_CTL[SPPR] = 1), set this field as follows:
11106                                                          RNDUP[TPGM(ns) / TCYC(ns))].
11107                                                          [TPGM] is from the JEDEC DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not data
11108                                                          rate). */
11109     uint64_t tpgm_exit                    : 5;  /**< Indicates PPR exit time (tPGM_Exit) contrainst used when running PPR sequence.
11110                                                          Set this field as follows:
11111                                                          _ RNDUP[TPGM_EXIT(ns) / TCYC(ns)]
11112                                                          where [TPGM_EXIT] is from the JEDEC DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency
11113                                                          (not
11114                                                          data rate). */
11115     uint64_t tpgmpst                      : 7;  /**< Indicates new address setting time (tPGMPST) constraint used when running PPR sequence.
11116                                                          Set this field as follows:
11117                                                          _ RNDUP[TPGMPST(ns) / (1024 * TCYC(ns))]
11118                                                          where [TPGMPST] is from the JEDEC DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not
11119                                                          data rate). */
11120 #else
11121     uint64_t tpgmpst                      : 7;
11122     uint64_t tpgm_exit                    : 5;
11123     uint64_t tpgm                         : 10;
11124     uint64_t sppr                         : 1;
11125     uint64_t skip_issue_security          : 1;
11126     uint64_t lrank_sel                    : 3;
11127     uint64_t reserved_27_63               : 37;
11128 #endif
11129     } s;
11130     struct cvmx_lmcx_ppr_ctl_cn73xx {
11131 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
11132     uint64_t reserved_24_63               : 40;
11133     uint64_t skip_issue_security          : 1;  /**< Personality bit for the PPR sequence. When set, this field forces the sequence to skip
11134                                                          issuing four consecutive MR0 commands that supply the security key. */
11135     uint64_t sppr                         : 1;  /**< Personality bit for the PPR sequence. When set, this field forces the sequence to run
11136                                                          the soft PPR mode. */
11137     uint64_t tpgm                         : 10; /**< Indicates the programming time (tPGM) constraint used when running PPR sequence.
11138                                                          For hard PPR (PPR_CTL[SPPR] = 0), set this field as follows:
11139                                                          RNDUP[TPGM(ns) / (1048576 * TCYC(ns))].
11140                                                          For soft PPR (PPR_CTL[SPPR] = 1), set this field as follows:
11141                                                          RNDUP[TPGM(ns) / TCYC(ns))].
11142                                                          [TPGM] is from the JEDEC DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not data
11143                                                          rate). */
11144     uint64_t tpgm_exit                    : 5;  /**< Indicates PPR exit time (tPGM_Exit) contrainst used when running PPR sequence.
11145                                                          Set this field as follows:
11146                                                          _ RNDUP[TPGM_EXIT(ns) / TCYC(ns)]
11147                                                          where [TPGM_EXIT] is from the JEDEC DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency
11148                                                          (not
11149                                                          data rate). */
11150     uint64_t tpgmpst                      : 7;  /**< Indicates new address setting time (tPGMPST) constraint used when running PPR sequence.
11151                                                          Set this field as follows:
11152                                                          _ RNDUP[TPGMPST(ns) / (1024 * TCYC(ns))]
11153                                                          where [TPGMPST] is from the JEDEC DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not
11154                                                          data rate). */
11155 #else
11156     uint64_t tpgmpst                      : 7;
11157     uint64_t tpgm_exit                    : 5;
11158     uint64_t tpgm                         : 10;
11159     uint64_t sppr                         : 1;
11160     uint64_t skip_issue_security          : 1;
11161     uint64_t reserved_24_63               : 40;
11162 #endif
11163     } cn73xx;
11164     struct cvmx_lmcx_ppr_ctl_s            cn78xx;
11165     struct cvmx_lmcx_ppr_ctl_cn73xx       cnf75xx;
11166 };
11167 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_ppr_ctl cvmx_lmcx_ppr_ctl_t;
11168 
11169 /**
11170  * cvmx_lmc#_read_level_ctl
11171  *
11172  * Notes:
11173  * The HW writes and reads the cache block selected by ROW, COL, BNK and the rank as part of a read-leveling sequence for a rank.
11174  * A cache block write is 16 72-bit words. PATTERN selects the write value. For the first 8
11175  * words, the write value is the bit PATTERN<i> duplicated into a 72-bit vector. The write value of
11176  * the last 8 words is the inverse of the write value of the first 8 words.
11177  * See LMC*_READ_LEVEL_RANK*.
11178  */
11179 union cvmx_lmcx_read_level_ctl {
11180     uint64_t u64;
11181     struct cvmx_lmcx_read_level_ctl_s {
11182 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
11183     uint64_t reserved_44_63               : 20;
11184     uint64_t rankmask                     : 4;  /**< Selects ranks to be leveled
11185                                                          to read-level rank i, set RANKMASK<i> */
11186     uint64_t pattern                      : 8;  /**< All DQ driven to PATTERN[burst], 0 <= burst <= 7
11187                                                          All DQ driven to ~PATTERN[burst-8], 8 <= burst <= 15 */
11188     uint64_t row                          : 16; /**< Row    address used to write/read data pattern */
11189     uint64_t col                          : 12; /**< Column address used to write/read data pattern */
11190     uint64_t reserved_3_3                 : 1;
11191     uint64_t bnk                          : 3;  /**< Bank   address used to write/read data pattern */
11192 #else
11193     uint64_t bnk                          : 3;
11194     uint64_t reserved_3_3                 : 1;
11195     uint64_t col                          : 12;
11196     uint64_t row                          : 16;
11197     uint64_t pattern                      : 8;
11198     uint64_t rankmask                     : 4;
11199     uint64_t reserved_44_63               : 20;
11200 #endif
11201     } s;
11202     struct cvmx_lmcx_read_level_ctl_s     cn52xx;
11203     struct cvmx_lmcx_read_level_ctl_s     cn52xxp1;
11204     struct cvmx_lmcx_read_level_ctl_s     cn56xx;
11205     struct cvmx_lmcx_read_level_ctl_s     cn56xxp1;
11206 };
11207 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_read_level_ctl cvmx_lmcx_read_level_ctl_t;
11208 
11209 /**
11210  * cvmx_lmc#_read_level_dbg
11211  *
11212  * Notes:
11213  * A given read of LMC*_READ_LEVEL_DBG returns the read-leveling pass/fail results for all possible
11214  * delay settings (i.e. the BITMASK) for only one byte in the last rank that the HW read-leveled.
11215  * LMC*_READ_LEVEL_DBG[BYTE] selects the particular byte.
11216  * To get these pass/fail results for another different rank, you must run the hardware read-leveling
11217  * again. For example, it is possible to get the BITMASK results for every byte of every rank
11218  * if you run read-leveling separately for each rank, probing LMC*_READ_LEVEL_DBG between each
11219  * read-leveling.
11220  */
11221 union cvmx_lmcx_read_level_dbg {
11222     uint64_t u64;
11223     struct cvmx_lmcx_read_level_dbg_s {
11224 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
11225     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
11226     uint64_t bitmask                      : 16; /**< Bitmask generated during deskew settings sweep
11227                                                          BITMASK[n]=0 means deskew setting n failed
11228                                                          BITMASK[n]=1 means deskew setting n passed
11229                                                          for 0 <= n <= 15 */
11230     uint64_t reserved_4_15                : 12;
11231     uint64_t byte                         : 4;  /**< 0 <= BYTE <= 8 */
11232 #else
11233     uint64_t byte                         : 4;
11234     uint64_t reserved_4_15                : 12;
11235     uint64_t bitmask                      : 16;
11236     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
11237 #endif
11238     } s;
11239     struct cvmx_lmcx_read_level_dbg_s     cn52xx;
11240     struct cvmx_lmcx_read_level_dbg_s     cn52xxp1;
11241     struct cvmx_lmcx_read_level_dbg_s     cn56xx;
11242     struct cvmx_lmcx_read_level_dbg_s     cn56xxp1;
11243 };
11244 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_read_level_dbg cvmx_lmcx_read_level_dbg_t;
11245 
11246 /**
11247  * cvmx_lmc#_read_level_rank#
11248  *
11249  * Notes:
11250  * This is four CSRs per LMC, one per each rank.
11251  * Each CSR is written by HW during a read-leveling sequence for the rank. (HW sets STATUS==3 after HW read-leveling completes for the rank.)
11252  * Each CSR may also be written by SW, but not while a read-leveling sequence is in progress. (HW sets STATUS==1 after a CSR write.)
11253  * Deskew setting is measured in units of 1/4 DCLK, so the above BYTE* values can range over 4 DCLKs.
11254  * SW initiates a HW read-leveling sequence by programming LMC*_READ_LEVEL_CTL and writing INIT_START=1 with SEQUENCE=1.
11255  * See LMC*_READ_LEVEL_CTL.
11256  */
11257 union cvmx_lmcx_read_level_rankx {
11258     uint64_t u64;
11259     struct cvmx_lmcx_read_level_rankx_s {
11260 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
11261     uint64_t reserved_38_63               : 26;
11262     uint64_t status                       : 2;  /**< Indicates status of the read-levelling and where
11263                                                          the BYTE* programmings in <35:0> came from:
11264                                                          0 = BYTE* values are their reset value
11265                                                          1 = BYTE* values were set via a CSR write to this register
11266                                                          2 = read-leveling sequence currently in progress (BYTE* values are unpredictable)
11267                                                          3 = BYTE* values came from a complete read-leveling sequence */
11268     uint64_t byte8                        : 4;  /**< Deskew setting */
11269     uint64_t byte7                        : 4;  /**< Deskew setting */
11270     uint64_t byte6                        : 4;  /**< Deskew setting */
11271     uint64_t byte5                        : 4;  /**< Deskew setting */
11272     uint64_t byte4                        : 4;  /**< Deskew setting */
11273     uint64_t byte3                        : 4;  /**< Deskew setting */
11274     uint64_t byte2                        : 4;  /**< Deskew setting */
11275     uint64_t byte1                        : 4;  /**< Deskew setting */
11276     uint64_t byte0                        : 4;  /**< Deskew setting */
11277 #else
11278     uint64_t byte0                        : 4;
11279     uint64_t byte1                        : 4;
11280     uint64_t byte2                        : 4;
11281     uint64_t byte3                        : 4;
11282     uint64_t byte4                        : 4;
11283     uint64_t byte5                        : 4;
11284     uint64_t byte6                        : 4;
11285     uint64_t byte7                        : 4;
11286     uint64_t byte8                        : 4;
11287     uint64_t status                       : 2;
11288     uint64_t reserved_38_63               : 26;
11289 #endif
11290     } s;
11291     struct cvmx_lmcx_read_level_rankx_s   cn52xx;
11292     struct cvmx_lmcx_read_level_rankx_s   cn52xxp1;
11293     struct cvmx_lmcx_read_level_rankx_s   cn56xx;
11294     struct cvmx_lmcx_read_level_rankx_s   cn56xxp1;
11295 };
11296 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_read_level_rankx cvmx_lmcx_read_level_rankx_t;
11297 
11298 /**
11299  * cvmx_lmc#_ref_status
11300  *
11301  * This register contains the status of the refresh pending counter.
11302  *
11303  */
11304 union cvmx_lmcx_ref_status {
11305     uint64_t u64;
11306     struct cvmx_lmcx_ref_status_s {
11307 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
11308     uint64_t reserved_4_63                : 60;
11309     uint64_t ref_pend_max_clr             : 1;  /**< Indicates that the number of pending refreshes has reached 7, requiring
11310                                                          software to clear the flag by setting this field to 1. */
11311     uint64_t ref_count                    : 3;  /**< Reads back the number of pending refreshes that LMC has yet to execute. */
11312 #else
11313     uint64_t ref_count                    : 3;
11314     uint64_t ref_pend_max_clr             : 1;
11315     uint64_t reserved_4_63                : 60;
11316 #endif
11317     } s;
11318     struct cvmx_lmcx_ref_status_s         cn73xx;
11319     struct cvmx_lmcx_ref_status_s         cn78xx;
11320     struct cvmx_lmcx_ref_status_s         cnf75xx;
11321 };
11322 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_ref_status cvmx_lmcx_ref_status_t;
11323 
11324 /**
11325  * cvmx_lmc#_reset_ctl
11326  *
11327  * Specify the RSL base addresses for the block.
11328  *
11329  */
11330 union cvmx_lmcx_reset_ctl {
11331     uint64_t u64;
11332     struct cvmx_lmcx_reset_ctl_s {
11333 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
11334     uint64_t reserved_4_63                : 60;
11335     uint64_t ddr3psv                      : 1;  /**< Memory reset. 1 = DDR contents preserved.
11336                                                          May be useful for system software to determine when the DDR3/DDR4 contents have been
11337                                                          preserved.
11338                                                          Cleared by hardware during a cold reset. Never cleared by hardware during a warm/soft
11339                                                          reset. Set by hardware during a warm/soft reset if the hardware automatically put the
11340                                                          DDR3/DDR4
11341                                                          DRAM into self-refresh during the reset sequence.
11342                                                          Can also be written by software (to any value). */
11343     uint64_t ddr3psoft                    : 1;  /**< Memory reset. 1 = Enable preserve mode during soft reset.
11344                                                          Enables preserve mode during a soft reset. When set, the DDR3/DDR4 controller hardware
11345                                                          automatically puts the attached DDR3/DDR4 DRAM parts into self-refresh at the beginning of
11346                                                          a
11347                                                          soft reset sequence (see LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL]), provided that the DDR3/DDR4 controller
11348                                                          is up. When clear, the DDR3/DDR4 controller hardware does not put the attached DDR3/DDR4
11349                                                          DRAM
11350                                                          parts into self-refresh during a soft reset sequence.
11351                                                          DDR3PSOFT is cleared on a cold reset. Warm and soft chip resets do not affect the
11352                                                          DDR3PSOFT value. Outside of cold reset, only software CSR write operations change the
11353                                                          DDR3PSOFT value. */
11354     uint64_t ddr3pwarm                    : 1;  /**< Memory reset. 1 = Enable preserve mode during warm reset.
11355                                                          Enables preserve mode during a warm reset. When set, the DDR3/DDR4 controller hardware
11356                                                          automatically puts the attached DDR3/DDR4 DRAM parts into self-refresh at the beginning of
11357                                                          a
11358                                                          warm reset sequence (see LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL]), provided that the DDR3/DDR4 controller
11359                                                          is up. When clear, the DDR3/DDR4 controller hardware does not put the attached DDR3/DDR4
11360                                                          DRAM
11361                                                          parts into self-refresh during a warm reset sequence.
11362                                                          DDR3PWARM is cleared on a cold reset. Warm and soft chip resets do not affect the
11363                                                          DDR3PWARM value. Outside of cold reset, only software CSR write operations change the
11364                                                          DDR3PWARM value.
11365                                                          Note that if a warm reset follows a soft reset, DDR3PWARM has no effect, as the DDR3/DDR4
11366                                                          controller is no longer up after any cold/warm/soft reset sequence. */
11367     uint64_t ddr3rst                      : 1;  /**< "Memory reset. 0 = Reset asserted; 1 = Reset deasserted.
11368                                                          DDR3/DDR4 DRAM parts have a RESET# pin. The DDR3RST CSR field controls the assertion of
11369                                                          the new CNXXXX pin that attaches to RESET#.
11370                                                          When DDR3RST is set, CNXXXX deasserts RESET#.
11371                                                          When DDR3RST is clear, CNXXXX asserts RESET#.
11372                                                          DDR3RST is cleared on a cold reset. Warm and soft chip resets do not affect the DDR3RST
11373                                                          value.
11374                                                          Outside of cold reset, only software CSR write operations change the DDR3RST value." */
11375 #else
11376     uint64_t ddr3rst                      : 1;
11377     uint64_t ddr3pwarm                    : 1;
11378     uint64_t ddr3psoft                    : 1;
11379     uint64_t ddr3psv                      : 1;
11380     uint64_t reserved_4_63                : 60;
11381 #endif
11382     } s;
11383     struct cvmx_lmcx_reset_ctl_s          cn61xx;
11384     struct cvmx_lmcx_reset_ctl_s          cn63xx;
11385     struct cvmx_lmcx_reset_ctl_s          cn63xxp1;
11386     struct cvmx_lmcx_reset_ctl_s          cn66xx;
11387     struct cvmx_lmcx_reset_ctl_s          cn68xx;
11388     struct cvmx_lmcx_reset_ctl_s          cn68xxp1;
11389     struct cvmx_lmcx_reset_ctl_s          cn70xx;
11390     struct cvmx_lmcx_reset_ctl_s          cn70xxp1;
11391     struct cvmx_lmcx_reset_ctl_s          cn73xx;
11392     struct cvmx_lmcx_reset_ctl_s          cn78xx;
11393     struct cvmx_lmcx_reset_ctl_s          cn78xxp1;
11394     struct cvmx_lmcx_reset_ctl_s          cnf71xx;
11395     struct cvmx_lmcx_reset_ctl_s          cnf75xx;
11396 };
11397 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_reset_ctl cvmx_lmcx_reset_ctl_t;
11398 
11399 /**
11400  * cvmx_lmc#_retry_config
11401  *
11402  * This register configures automatic retry operation.
11403  *
11404  */
11405 union cvmx_lmcx_retry_config {
11406     uint64_t u64;
11407     struct cvmx_lmcx_retry_config_s {
11408 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
11409     uint64_t reserved_56_63               : 8;
11410     uint64_t max_errors                   : 24; /**< Maximum number of errors before errors are ignored. */
11411     uint64_t reserved_13_31               : 19;
11412     uint64_t error_continue               : 1;  /**< If LMC()_RETRY_CONFIG[AUTO_ERROR_CONTINUE] is cleared, LMC will wait
11413                                                          for a 1 to be written to LMC()_RETRY_CONFIG[ERROR_CONTINUE] before
11414                                                          continuing operations after an error. */
11415     uint64_t reserved_9_11                : 3;
11416     uint64_t auto_error_continue          : 1;  /**< When set, LMC will automatically proceed with error handling and normal
11417                                                          operation after an error occurs.  If clear, LMC will cease all operations
11418                                                          except for refresh as soon as possible, and will not continue with error
11419                                                          handling or normal operation until LMC()_RETRY_CONFIG[ERROR_CONTINUE]
11420                                                          is written with a 1. */
11421     uint64_t reserved_5_7                 : 3;
11422     uint64_t pulse_count_auto_clr         : 1;  /**< When set, LMC()_RETRY_STATUS[ERROR_PULSE_COUNT_VALID] will clear
11423                                                          whenever the error interrupt is cleared. */
11424     uint64_t reserved_1_3                 : 3;
11425     uint64_t retry_enable                 : 1;  /**< Enable retry on errors. */
11426 #else
11427     uint64_t retry_enable                 : 1;
11428     uint64_t reserved_1_3                 : 3;
11429     uint64_t pulse_count_auto_clr         : 1;
11430     uint64_t reserved_5_7                 : 3;
11431     uint64_t auto_error_continue          : 1;
11432     uint64_t reserved_9_11                : 3;
11433     uint64_t error_continue               : 1;
11434     uint64_t reserved_13_31               : 19;
11435     uint64_t max_errors                   : 24;
11436     uint64_t reserved_56_63               : 8;
11437 #endif
11438     } s;
11439     struct cvmx_lmcx_retry_config_s       cn73xx;
11440     struct cvmx_lmcx_retry_config_s       cn78xx;
11441     struct cvmx_lmcx_retry_config_s       cnf75xx;
11442 };
11443 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_retry_config cvmx_lmcx_retry_config_t;
11444 
11445 /**
11446  * cvmx_lmc#_retry_status
11447  *
11448  * This register provides status on automatic retry operation.
11449  *
11450  */
11451 union cvmx_lmcx_retry_status {
11452     uint64_t u64;
11453     struct cvmx_lmcx_retry_status_s {
11454 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
11455     uint64_t clear_error_count            : 1;  /**< Clear the error count, one shot operation. */
11456     uint64_t clear_error_pulse_count      : 1;  /**< Clear the error count, one shot operation. */
11457     uint64_t reserved_57_61               : 5;
11458     uint64_t error_pulse_count_valid      : 1;  /**< When set and the count is valid, indicates that the counter has saturated,
11459                                                          which effectively indicates that a command error has occured and not a CRC
11460                                                          error. */
11461     uint64_t error_pulse_count_sat        : 1;  /**< When set and the count is valid, indicates that the counter has saturated,
11462                                                          which effectively indicates that a command error has occured and not a CRC
11463                                                          error. */
11464     uint64_t reserved_52_54               : 3;
11465     uint64_t error_pulse_count            : 4;  /**< Count of cycles in last error pulse since clear.  This count will be cleared
11466                                                          either by clearing the interrupt or writing a 1 to the pulse count clear bit. */
11467     uint64_t reserved_45_47               : 3;
11468     uint64_t error_sequence               : 5;  /**< Sequence number for sequence that was running when error occurred. */
11469     uint64_t reserved_33_39               : 7;
11470     uint64_t error_type                   : 1;  /**< Error type:
11471                                                          0 = Error during a sequence run.
11472                                                          1 = Error during normal operation, which means a read or write operation. Effectively this
11473                                                          means a command error for a read or write operation, or a CRC error for a write data
11474                                                          operation. */
11475     uint64_t reserved_24_31               : 8;
11476     uint64_t error_count                  : 24; /**< Number of errors encountered since last cleared. */
11477 #else
11478     uint64_t error_count                  : 24;
11479     uint64_t reserved_24_31               : 8;
11480     uint64_t error_type                   : 1;
11481     uint64_t reserved_33_39               : 7;
11482     uint64_t error_sequence               : 5;
11483     uint64_t reserved_45_47               : 3;
11484     uint64_t error_pulse_count            : 4;
11485     uint64_t reserved_52_54               : 3;
11486     uint64_t error_pulse_count_sat        : 1;
11487     uint64_t error_pulse_count_valid      : 1;
11488     uint64_t reserved_57_61               : 5;
11489     uint64_t clear_error_pulse_count      : 1;
11490     uint64_t clear_error_count            : 1;
11491 #endif
11492     } s;
11493     struct cvmx_lmcx_retry_status_s       cn73xx;
11494     struct cvmx_lmcx_retry_status_s       cn78xx;
11495     struct cvmx_lmcx_retry_status_s       cnf75xx;
11496 };
11497 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_retry_status cvmx_lmcx_retry_status_t;
11498 
11499 /**
11500  * cvmx_lmc#_rlevel_ctl
11501  */
11502 union cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_ctl {
11503     uint64_t u64;
11504     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_ctl_s {
11505 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
11506     uint64_t reserved_33_63               : 31;
11507     uint64_t tccd_sel                     : 1;  /**< When set, the read leveling sequence uses MODEREG_PARAMS3[TCCD_L] to
11508                                                          space out back-to-back read commands. Otherwise the back-to-back
11509                                                          reads commands are spaced out by a default 4 cycles. */
11510     uint64_t pattern                      : 8;  /**< Sets the data pattern used to match in read-leveling operations. */
11511     uint64_t reserved_22_23               : 2;
11512     uint64_t delay_unload_3               : 1;  /**< Reserved, must be set. */
11513     uint64_t delay_unload_2               : 1;  /**< Reserved, must be set. */
11514     uint64_t delay_unload_1               : 1;  /**< Reserved, must be set. */
11515     uint64_t delay_unload_0               : 1;  /**< Reserved, must be set. */
11516     uint64_t bitmask                      : 8;  /**< Mask to select bit lanes on which read-leveling feedback is returned when [OR_DIS] is set to 1. */
11517     uint64_t or_dis                       : 1;  /**< Disable ORing of bits in a byte lane when computing the read-leveling bitmask. [OR_DIS]
11518                                                          should normally not be set. */
11519     uint64_t offset_en                    : 1;  /**< When set, LMC attempts to select the read-leveling setting that is
11520                                                          LMC()_RLEVEL_CTL[OFFSET] settings earlier than the last passing read-leveling setting
11521                                                          in the largest contiguous sequence of passing settings. When clear, or if the setting
11522                                                          selected by LMC()_RLEVEL_CTL[OFFSET] did not pass, LMC selects the middle setting in
11523                                                          the largest contiguous sequence of passing settings, rounding earlier when necessary. */
11524     uint64_t offset                       : 4;  /**< The offset used when LMC()_RLEVEL_CTL[OFFSET] is set. */
11525     uint64_t byte                         : 4;  /**< 0 <= BYTE <= 8. Byte index for which bitmask results are saved in LMC()_RLEVEL_DBG. */
11526 #else
11527     uint64_t byte                         : 4;
11528     uint64_t offset                       : 4;
11529     uint64_t offset_en                    : 1;
11530     uint64_t or_dis                       : 1;
11531     uint64_t bitmask                      : 8;
11532     uint64_t delay_unload_0               : 1;
11533     uint64_t delay_unload_1               : 1;
11534     uint64_t delay_unload_2               : 1;
11535     uint64_t delay_unload_3               : 1;
11536     uint64_t reserved_22_23               : 2;
11537     uint64_t pattern                      : 8;
11538     uint64_t tccd_sel                     : 1;
11539     uint64_t reserved_33_63               : 31;
11540 #endif
11541     } s;
11542     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_ctl_cn61xx {
11543 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
11544     uint64_t reserved_22_63               : 42;
11545     uint64_t delay_unload_3               : 1;  /**< When set, unload the PHY silo one cycle later
11546                                                          during read-leveling if LMC*_RLEVEL_RANKi[BYTE*<1:0>] = 3
11547                                                          DELAY_UNLOAD_3 should normally be set. */
11548     uint64_t delay_unload_2               : 1;  /**< When set, unload the PHY silo one cycle later
11549                                                          during read-leveling if LMC*_RLEVEL_RANKi[BYTE*<1:0>] = 2
11550                                                          DELAY_UNLOAD_2 should normally be set. */
11551     uint64_t delay_unload_1               : 1;  /**< When set, unload the PHY silo one cycle later
11552                                                          during read-leveling if LMC*_RLEVEL_RANKi[BYTE*<1:0>] = 1
11553                                                          DELAY_UNLOAD_1 should normally be set. */
11554     uint64_t delay_unload_0               : 1;  /**< When set, unload the PHY silo one cycle later
11555                                                          during read-leveling if LMC*_RLEVEL_RANKi[BYTE*<1:0>] = 0
11556                                                          DELAY_UNLOAD_0 should normally be set. */
11557     uint64_t bitmask                      : 8;  /**< Mask to select bit lanes on which read-leveling
11558                                                          feedback is returned when OR_DIS is set to 1 */
11559     uint64_t or_dis                       : 1;  /**< Disable or'ing of bits in a byte lane when computing
11560                                                          the read-leveling bitmask
11561                                                          OR_DIS should normally not be set. */
11562     uint64_t offset_en                    : 1;  /**< When set, LMC attempts to select the read-leveling
11563                                                          setting that is LMC*RLEVEL_CTL[OFFSET] settings earlier than the
11564                                                          last passing read-leveling setting in the largest
11565                                                          contiguous sequence of passing settings.
11566                                                          When clear, or if the setting selected by LMC*RLEVEL_CTL[OFFSET]
11567                                                          did not pass, LMC selects the middle setting in the
11568                                                          largest contiguous sequence of passing settings,
11569                                                          rounding earlier when necessary. */
11570     uint64_t offset                       : 4;  /**< The offset used when LMC*RLEVEL_CTL[OFFSET] is set */
11571     uint64_t byte                         : 4;  /**< 0 <= BYTE <= 8
11572                                                          Byte index for which bitmask results are saved
11573                                                          in LMC*_RLEVEL_DBG */
11574 #else
11575     uint64_t byte                         : 4;
11576     uint64_t offset                       : 4;
11577     uint64_t offset_en                    : 1;
11578     uint64_t or_dis                       : 1;
11579     uint64_t bitmask                      : 8;
11580     uint64_t delay_unload_0               : 1;
11581     uint64_t delay_unload_1               : 1;
11582     uint64_t delay_unload_2               : 1;
11583     uint64_t delay_unload_3               : 1;
11584     uint64_t reserved_22_63               : 42;
11585 #endif
11586     } cn61xx;
11587     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_ctl_cn61xx    cn63xx;
11588     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_ctl_cn63xxp1 {
11589 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
11590     uint64_t reserved_9_63                : 55;
11591     uint64_t offset_en                    : 1;  /**< When set, LMC attempts to select the read-leveling
11592                                                          setting that is LMC*RLEVEL_CTL[OFFSET] settings earlier than the
11593                                                          last passing read-leveling setting in the largest
11594                                                          contiguous sequence of passing settings.
11595                                                          When clear, or if the setting selected by LMC*RLEVEL_CTL[OFFSET]
11596                                                          did not pass, LMC selects the middle setting in the
11597                                                          largest contiguous sequence of passing settings,
11598                                                          rounding earlier when necessary. */
11599     uint64_t offset                       : 4;  /**< The offset used when LMC*RLEVEL_CTL[OFFSET] is set */
11600     uint64_t byte                         : 4;  /**< 0 <= BYTE <= 8
11601                                                          Byte index for which bitmask results are saved
11602                                                          in LMC*_RLEVEL_DBG */
11603 #else
11604     uint64_t byte                         : 4;
11605     uint64_t offset                       : 4;
11606     uint64_t offset_en                    : 1;
11607     uint64_t reserved_9_63                : 55;
11608 #endif
11609     } cn63xxp1;
11610     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_ctl_cn61xx    cn66xx;
11611     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_ctl_cn61xx    cn68xx;
11612     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_ctl_cn61xx    cn68xxp1;
11613     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_ctl_cn70xx {
11614 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
11615     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
11616     uint64_t pattern                      : 8;  /**< Sets the data pattern used to match in read-leveling operations. */
11617     uint64_t reserved_22_23               : 2;
11618     uint64_t delay_unload_3               : 1;  /**< When set, unload the PHY silo one cycle later during read-leveling if
11619                                                          LMC(0..0)_RLEVEL_RANK(0..1)[BYTE*<1:0>] = 3. DELAY_UNLOAD_3 should normally be set. */
11620     uint64_t delay_unload_2               : 1;  /**< When set, unload the PHY silo one cycle later during read-leveling if
11621                                                          LMC(0..0)_RLEVEL_RANK(0..1)[BYTE*<1:0>] = 2. DELAY_UNLOAD_2 should normally be set. */
11622     uint64_t delay_unload_1               : 1;  /**< When set, unload the PHY silo one cycle later during read-leveling if
11623                                                          LMC(0..0)_RLEVEL_RANK(0..1)[BYTE*<1:0>] = 1. DELAY_UNLOAD_1 should normally be set. */
11624     uint64_t delay_unload_0               : 1;  /**< When set, unload the PHY silo one cycle later during read-leveling if
11625                                                          LMC(0..0)_RLEVEL_RANK(0..1)[BYTE*<1:0>] = 0. DELAY_UNLOAD_0 should normally be set. */
11626     uint64_t bitmask                      : 8;  /**< Mask to select bit lanes on which read-leveling feedback is returned when [OR_DIS] is set to 1. */
11627     uint64_t or_dis                       : 1;  /**< Disable ORing of bits in a byte lane when computing the read-leveling bitmask. [OR_DIS]
11628                                                          should normally not be set. */
11629     uint64_t offset_en                    : 1;  /**< When set, LMC attempts to select the read-leveling setting that is
11630                                                          LMC(0..0)_RLEVEL_CTL[OFFSET] settings earlier than the last passing read-leveling setting
11631                                                          in the largest contiguous sequence of passing settings. When clear, or if the setting
11632                                                          selected by LMC(0..0)_RLEVEL_CTL[OFFSET] did not pass, LMC selects the middle setting in
11633                                                          the largest contiguous sequence of passing settings, rounding earlier when necessary. */
11634     uint64_t offset                       : 4;  /**< The offset used when LMC(0..0)_RLEVEL_CTL[OFFSET] is set. */
11635     uint64_t byte                         : 4;  /**< 0 <= BYTE <= 8. Byte index for which bitmask results are saved in LMC(0..0)_RLEVEL_DBG. */
11636 #else
11637     uint64_t byte                         : 4;
11638     uint64_t offset                       : 4;
11639     uint64_t offset_en                    : 1;
11640     uint64_t or_dis                       : 1;
11641     uint64_t bitmask                      : 8;
11642     uint64_t delay_unload_0               : 1;
11643     uint64_t delay_unload_1               : 1;
11644     uint64_t delay_unload_2               : 1;
11645     uint64_t delay_unload_3               : 1;
11646     uint64_t reserved_22_23               : 2;
11647     uint64_t pattern                      : 8;
11648     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
11649 #endif
11650     } cn70xx;
11651     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_ctl_cn70xx    cn70xxp1;
11652     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_ctl_cn70xx    cn73xx;
11653     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_ctl_s         cn78xx;
11654     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_ctl_s         cn78xxp1;
11655     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_ctl_cn61xx    cnf71xx;
11656     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_ctl_s         cnf75xx;
11657 };
11658 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_ctl cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_ctl_t;
11659 
11660 /**
11661  * cvmx_lmc#_rlevel_dbg
11662  *
11663  * A given read of LMC()_RLEVEL_DBG returns the read-leveling pass/fail results for all
11664  * possible delay settings (i.e. the BITMASK) for only one byte in the last rank that
11665  * the hardware ran read-leveling on. LMC()_RLEVEL_CTL[BYTE] selects the particular
11666  * byte. To get these pass/fail results for a different rank, you must run the hardware
11667  * read-leveling again. For example, it is possible to get the [BITMASK] results for
11668  * every byte of every rank if you run read-leveling separately for each rank, probing
11669  * LMC()_RLEVEL_DBG between each read- leveling.
11670  */
11671 union cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_dbg {
11672     uint64_t u64;
11673     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_dbg_s {
11674 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
11675     uint64_t bitmask                      : 64; /**< Bitmask generated during read level settings sweep. BITMASK[n] = 0 means read level
11676                                                          setting n failed; BITMASK[n] = 1 means read level setting n passed for 0 <= n <= 63. */
11677 #else
11678     uint64_t bitmask                      : 64;
11679 #endif
11680     } s;
11681     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_dbg_s         cn61xx;
11682     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_dbg_s         cn63xx;
11683     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_dbg_s         cn63xxp1;
11684     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_dbg_s         cn66xx;
11685     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_dbg_s         cn68xx;
11686     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_dbg_s         cn68xxp1;
11687     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_dbg_s         cn70xx;
11688     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_dbg_s         cn70xxp1;
11689     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_dbg_s         cn73xx;
11690     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_dbg_s         cn78xx;
11691     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_dbg_s         cn78xxp1;
11692     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_dbg_s         cnf71xx;
11693     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_dbg_s         cnf75xx;
11694 };
11695 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_dbg cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_dbg_t;
11696 
11697 /**
11698  * cvmx_lmc#_rlevel_rank#
11699  *
11700  * Four of these CSRs exist per LMC, one for each rank. Read level setting is measured
11701  * in units of 1/4 CK, so the BYTEn values can range over 16 CK cycles. Each CSR is
11702  * written by hardware during a read-leveling sequence for the rank. (Hardware sets
11703  * [STATUS] to 3 after hardware read-leveling completes for the rank.)
11704  *
11705  * If hardware is unable to find a match per LMC()_RLEVEL_CTL[OFFSET_EN] and
11706  * LMC()_RLEVEL_CTL[OFFSET], then hardware sets LMC()_RLEVEL_RANK()[BYTEn<5:0>] to
11707  * 0x0.
11708  *
11709  * Each CSR may also be written by software, but not while a read-leveling sequence is
11710  * in progress. (Hardware sets [STATUS] to 1 after a CSR write.) Software initiates a
11711  * hardware read-leveling sequence by programming LMC()_RLEVEL_CTL and writing
11712  * [INIT_START] = 1 with [SEQ_SEL]=1. See LMC()_RLEVEL_CTL.
11713  *
11714  * LMC()_RLEVEL_RANKi values for ranks i without attached DRAM should be set such that
11715  * they do not increase the range of possible BYTE values for any byte lane. The
11716  * easiest way to do this is to set LMC()_RLEVEL_RANKi = LMC()_RLEVEL_RANKj, where j is
11717  * some rank with attached DRAM whose LMC()_RLEVEL_RANKj is already fully initialized.
11718  */
11719 union cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_rankx {
11720     uint64_t u64;
11721     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_rankx_s {
11722 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
11723     uint64_t reserved_56_63               : 8;
11724     uint64_t status                       : 2;  /**< Indicates status of the read-leveling and where the BYTEn programmings in <53:0> came
11725                                                          from:
11726                                                          0x0 = BYTEn values are their reset value.
11727                                                          0x1 = BYTEn values were set via a CSR write to this register.
11728                                                          0x2 = read-leveling sequence currently in progress (BYTEn values are unpredictable).
11729                                                          0x3 = BYTEn values came from a complete read-leveling sequence. */
11730     uint64_t byte8                        : 6;  /**< "Read level setting.
11731                                                          When ECC DRAM is not present in 64-bit mode (i.e. when DRAM is not attached to chip
11732                                                          signals DDR#_CBS_0_* and DDR#_CB<7:0>), software should write BYTE8 to a value that does
11733                                                          not increase the range of possible BYTE* values. The easiest way to do this is to set
11734                                                          LMC()_RLEVEL_RANK()[BYTE8] = LMC()_RLEVEL_RANK()[BYTE0] when there is no
11735                                                          ECC DRAM, using the final BYTE0 value." */
11736     uint64_t byte7                        : 6;  /**< Read level setting. */
11737     uint64_t byte6                        : 6;  /**< Read level setting. */
11738     uint64_t byte5                        : 6;  /**< Read level setting. */
11739     uint64_t byte4                        : 6;  /**< Read level setting. */
11740     uint64_t byte3                        : 6;  /**< Read level setting. */
11741     uint64_t byte2                        : 6;  /**< Read level setting. */
11742     uint64_t byte1                        : 6;  /**< Read level setting. */
11743     uint64_t byte0                        : 6;  /**< Read level setting. */
11744 #else
11745     uint64_t byte0                        : 6;
11746     uint64_t byte1                        : 6;
11747     uint64_t byte2                        : 6;
11748     uint64_t byte3                        : 6;
11749     uint64_t byte4                        : 6;
11750     uint64_t byte5                        : 6;
11751     uint64_t byte6                        : 6;
11752     uint64_t byte7                        : 6;
11753     uint64_t byte8                        : 6;
11754     uint64_t status                       : 2;
11755     uint64_t reserved_56_63               : 8;
11756 #endif
11757     } s;
11758     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_rankx_s       cn61xx;
11759     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_rankx_s       cn63xx;
11760     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_rankx_s       cn63xxp1;
11761     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_rankx_s       cn66xx;
11762     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_rankx_s       cn68xx;
11763     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_rankx_s       cn68xxp1;
11764     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_rankx_s       cn70xx;
11765     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_rankx_s       cn70xxp1;
11766     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_rankx_s       cn73xx;
11767     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_rankx_s       cn78xx;
11768     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_rankx_s       cn78xxp1;
11769     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_rankx_s       cnf71xx;
11770     struct cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_rankx_s       cnf75xx;
11771 };
11772 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_rankx cvmx_lmcx_rlevel_rankx_t;
11773 
11774 /**
11775  * cvmx_lmc#_rodt_comp_ctl
11776  *
11777  * LMC_RODT_COMP_CTL = LMC Compensation control
11778  *
11779  */
11780 union cvmx_lmcx_rodt_comp_ctl {
11781     uint64_t u64;
11782     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_comp_ctl_s {
11783 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
11784     uint64_t reserved_17_63               : 47;
11785     uint64_t enable                       : 1;  /**< 0=not enabled, 1=enable */
11786     uint64_t reserved_12_15               : 4;
11787     uint64_t nctl                         : 4;  /**< Compensation control bits */
11788     uint64_t reserved_5_7                 : 3;
11789     uint64_t pctl                         : 5;  /**< Compensation control bits */
11790 #else
11791     uint64_t pctl                         : 5;
11792     uint64_t reserved_5_7                 : 3;
11793     uint64_t nctl                         : 4;
11794     uint64_t reserved_12_15               : 4;
11795     uint64_t enable                       : 1;
11796     uint64_t reserved_17_63               : 47;
11797 #endif
11798     } s;
11799     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_comp_ctl_s      cn50xx;
11800     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_comp_ctl_s      cn52xx;
11801     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_comp_ctl_s      cn52xxp1;
11802     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_comp_ctl_s      cn56xx;
11803     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_comp_ctl_s      cn56xxp1;
11804     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_comp_ctl_s      cn58xx;
11805     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_comp_ctl_s      cn58xxp1;
11806 };
11807 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_rodt_comp_ctl cvmx_lmcx_rodt_comp_ctl_t;
11808 
11809 /**
11810  * cvmx_lmc#_rodt_ctl
11811  *
11812  * LMC_RODT_CTL = Obsolete LMC Read OnDieTermination control
11813  * See the description in LMC_WODT_CTL1. On Reads, Octeon only supports turning on ODT's in
11814  * the lower 2 DIMM's with the masks as below.
11815  *
11816  * Notes:
11817  * When a given RANK in position N is selected, the RODT _HI and _LO masks for that position are used.
11818  * Mask[3:0] is used for RODT control of the RANKs in positions 3, 2, 1, and 0, respectively.
11819  * In  64b mode, DIMMs are assumed to be ordered in the following order:
11820  *  position 3: [unused        , DIMM1_RANK1_LO]
11821  *  position 2: [unused        , DIMM1_RANK0_LO]
11822  *  position 1: [unused        , DIMM0_RANK1_LO]
11823  *  position 0: [unused        , DIMM0_RANK0_LO]
11824  * In 128b mode, DIMMs are assumed to be ordered in the following order:
11825  *  position 3: [DIMM3_RANK1_HI, DIMM1_RANK1_LO]
11826  *  position 2: [DIMM3_RANK0_HI, DIMM1_RANK0_LO]
11827  *  position 1: [DIMM2_RANK1_HI, DIMM0_RANK1_LO]
11828  *  position 0: [DIMM2_RANK0_HI, DIMM0_RANK0_LO]
11829  */
11830 union cvmx_lmcx_rodt_ctl {
11831     uint64_t u64;
11832     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_ctl_s {
11833 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
11834     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
11835     uint64_t rodt_hi3                     : 4;  /**< Read ODT mask for position 3, data[127:64] */
11836     uint64_t rodt_hi2                     : 4;  /**< Read ODT mask for position 2, data[127:64] */
11837     uint64_t rodt_hi1                     : 4;  /**< Read ODT mask for position 1, data[127:64] */
11838     uint64_t rodt_hi0                     : 4;  /**< Read ODT mask for position 0, data[127:64] */
11839     uint64_t rodt_lo3                     : 4;  /**< Read ODT mask for position 3, data[ 63: 0] */
11840     uint64_t rodt_lo2                     : 4;  /**< Read ODT mask for position 2, data[ 63: 0] */
11841     uint64_t rodt_lo1                     : 4;  /**< Read ODT mask for position 1, data[ 63: 0] */
11842     uint64_t rodt_lo0                     : 4;  /**< Read ODT mask for position 0, data[ 63: 0] */
11843 #else
11844     uint64_t rodt_lo0                     : 4;
11845     uint64_t rodt_lo1                     : 4;
11846     uint64_t rodt_lo2                     : 4;
11847     uint64_t rodt_lo3                     : 4;
11848     uint64_t rodt_hi0                     : 4;
11849     uint64_t rodt_hi1                     : 4;
11850     uint64_t rodt_hi2                     : 4;
11851     uint64_t rodt_hi3                     : 4;
11852     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
11853 #endif
11854     } s;
11855     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_ctl_s           cn30xx;
11856     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_ctl_s           cn31xx;
11857     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_ctl_s           cn38xx;
11858     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_ctl_s           cn38xxp2;
11859     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_ctl_s           cn50xx;
11860     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_ctl_s           cn52xx;
11861     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_ctl_s           cn52xxp1;
11862     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_ctl_s           cn56xx;
11863     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_ctl_s           cn56xxp1;
11864     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_ctl_s           cn58xx;
11865     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_ctl_s           cn58xxp1;
11866 };
11867 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_rodt_ctl cvmx_lmcx_rodt_ctl_t;
11868 
11869 /**
11870  * cvmx_lmc#_rodt_mask
11871  *
11872  * System designers may desire to terminate DQ/DQS lines for higher frequency DDR operations,
11873  * especially on a multirank system. DDR3 DQ/DQS I/Os have built-in termination resistors that
11874  * can be turned on or off by the controller, after meeting TAOND and TAOF timing requirements.
11875  *
11876  * Each rank has its own ODT pin that fans out to all the memory parts in that DIMM. System
11877  * designers may prefer different combinations of ODT ONs for read operations into different
11878  * ranks. CNXXXX supports full programmability by way of the mask register below. Each rank
11879  * position has its own 4-bit programmable field. When the controller does a read to that rank,
11880  * it sets the 4 ODT pins to the MASK pins below. For example, when doing a read from Rank0, a
11881  * system designer may desire to terminate the lines with the resistor on DIMM0/Rank1. The mask
11882  * [RODT_D0_R0] would then be [0010].
11883  *
11884  * CNXXXX drives the appropriate mask values on the ODT pins by default. If this feature is not
11885  * required, write 0x0 in this register. Note that, as per the JEDEC DDR3 specifications, the ODT
11886  * pin for the rank that is being read should always be 0x0.
11887  * When a given RANK is selected, the RODT mask for that rank is used. The resulting RODT mask is
11888  * driven to the DIMMs in the following manner:
11889  */
11890 union cvmx_lmcx_rodt_mask {
11891     uint64_t u64;
11892     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_mask_s {
11893 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
11894     uint64_t rodt_d3_r1                   : 8;  /**< Read ODT mask DIMM3, RANK1/DIMM3 in SingleRanked
11895                                                          *UNUSED IN 6xxx, and MBZ* */
11896     uint64_t rodt_d3_r0                   : 8;  /**< Read ODT mask DIMM3, RANK0
11897                                                          *UNUSED IN 6xxx, and MBZ* */
11898     uint64_t rodt_d2_r1                   : 8;  /**< Read ODT mask DIMM2, RANK1/DIMM2 in SingleRanked
11899                                                          *UNUSED IN 6xxx, and MBZ* */
11900     uint64_t rodt_d2_r0                   : 8;  /**< Read ODT mask DIMM2, RANK0
11901                                                          *UNUSED IN 6xxx, and MBZ* */
11902     uint64_t rodt_d1_r1                   : 8;  /**< Read ODT mask DIMM1, RANK1/DIMM1 in SingleRanked. If RANK_ENA=1, [RODT_D1_R1]<3> must be
11903                                                          zero. Otherwise [RODT_D1_R1]<3:0> is not used and must be zero. */
11904     uint64_t rodt_d1_r0                   : 8;  /**< Read ODT mask DIMM1, RANK0. If RANK_ENA=1, [RODT_D1_RO]<2> must be zero. Otherwise,
11905                                                          [RODT_D1_RO]<3:2,1> must be zero. */
11906     uint64_t rodt_d0_r1                   : 8;  /**< Read ODT mask DIMM0, RANK1/DIMM0 in SingleRanked. If RANK_ENA=1, [RODT_D0_R1]<1> must be
11907                                                          zero. Otherwise, [RODT_D0_R1]<3:0> is not used and must be zero. */
11908     uint64_t rodt_d0_r0                   : 8;  /**< Read ODT mask DIMM0, RANK0. If RANK_ENA=1, [RODT_D0_R0]<0> must be zero. Otherwise,
11909                                                          [RODT_D0_R0]<1:0,3> must be zero. */
11910 #else
11911     uint64_t rodt_d0_r0                   : 8;
11912     uint64_t rodt_d0_r1                   : 8;
11913     uint64_t rodt_d1_r0                   : 8;
11914     uint64_t rodt_d1_r1                   : 8;
11915     uint64_t rodt_d2_r0                   : 8;
11916     uint64_t rodt_d2_r1                   : 8;
11917     uint64_t rodt_d3_r0                   : 8;
11918     uint64_t rodt_d3_r1                   : 8;
11919 #endif
11920     } s;
11921     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_mask_s          cn61xx;
11922     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_mask_s          cn63xx;
11923     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_mask_s          cn63xxp1;
11924     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_mask_s          cn66xx;
11925     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_mask_s          cn68xx;
11926     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_mask_s          cn68xxp1;
11927     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_mask_cn70xx {
11928 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
11929     uint64_t reserved_28_63               : 36;
11930     uint64_t rodt_d1_r1                   : 4;  /**< Reserved. */
11931     uint64_t reserved_20_23               : 4;
11932     uint64_t rodt_d1_r0                   : 4;  /**< Reserved. */
11933     uint64_t reserved_12_15               : 4;
11934     uint64_t rodt_d0_r1                   : 4;  /**< Read ODT mask DIMM0, RANK1/DIMM0 in SingleRanked. If RANK_ENA=1, [RODT_D0_R1]<1> must be
11935                                                          zero. Otherwise, [RODT_D0_R1]<3:0> is not used and must be zero. */
11936     uint64_t reserved_4_7                 : 4;
11937     uint64_t rodt_d0_r0                   : 4;  /**< Read ODT mask DIMM0, RANK0. If RANK_ENA=1, [RODT_D0_R0]<0> must be zero. Otherwise,
11938                                                          [RODT_D0_R0]<1:0,3> must be zero. */
11939 #else
11940     uint64_t rodt_d0_r0                   : 4;
11941     uint64_t reserved_4_7                 : 4;
11942     uint64_t rodt_d0_r1                   : 4;
11943     uint64_t reserved_12_15               : 4;
11944     uint64_t rodt_d1_r0                   : 4;
11945     uint64_t reserved_20_23               : 4;
11946     uint64_t rodt_d1_r1                   : 4;
11947     uint64_t reserved_28_63               : 36;
11948 #endif
11949     } cn70xx;
11950     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_mask_cn70xx     cn70xxp1;
11951     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_mask_cn70xx     cn73xx;
11952     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_mask_cn70xx     cn78xx;
11953     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_mask_cn70xx     cn78xxp1;
11954     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_mask_s          cnf71xx;
11955     struct cvmx_lmcx_rodt_mask_cn70xx     cnf75xx;
11956 };
11957 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_rodt_mask cvmx_lmcx_rodt_mask_t;
11958 
11959 /**
11960  * cvmx_lmc#_scramble_cfg0
11961  *
11962  * LMC_SCRAMBLE_CFG0 = LMC Scramble Config0
11963  *
11964  */
11965 union cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg0 {
