11967     struct cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg0_s {
11968 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
11969     uint64_t key                          : 64; /**< Scramble key for data. Prior to enabling scrambling this key should be generated from a
11970                                                          cryptographically-secure random number generator such as RNM_RANDOM. */
11971 #else
11972     uint64_t key                          : 64;
11973 #endif
11974     } s;
11975     struct cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg0_s      cn61xx;
11976     struct cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg0_s      cn66xx;
11977     struct cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg0_s      cn70xx;

11979     struct cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg0_s      cn73xx;
11980     struct cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg0_s      cn78xx;
11981     struct cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg0_s      cn78xxp1;
11982     struct cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg0_s      cnf71xx;
11983     struct cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg0_s      cnf75xx;
11984 };
11985 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg0 cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg0_t;
11986 
11987 /**
11988  * cvmx_lmc#_scramble_cfg1
11989  *
11990  * These registers set the aliasing that uses the lowest, legal chip select(s).
11991  *
11992  */
11993 union cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg1 {
11994     uint64_t u64;
11995     struct cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg1_s {
11996 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
11997     uint64_t key                          : 64; /**< Scramble key for addresses. Prior to enabling scrambling this key should be generated from
11998                                                          a cryptographically-secure random number generator such as RNM_RANDOM. */
11999 #else
12000     uint64_t key                          : 64;
12001 #endif
12002     } s;
12003     struct cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg1_s      cn61xx;
12004     struct cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg1_s      cn66xx;
12005     struct cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg1_s      cn70xx;
12006     struct cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg1_s      cn70xxp1;
12007     struct cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg1_s      cn73xx;
12008     struct cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg1_s      cn78xx;
12009     struct cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg1_s      cn78xxp1;
12010     struct cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg1_s      cnf71xx;
12011     struct cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg1_s      cnf75xx;
12012 };
12013 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg1 cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg1_t;
12014 
12015 /**
12016  * cvmx_lmc#_scramble_cfg2
12017  */
12018 union cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg2 {
12019     uint64_t u64;
12020     struct cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg2_s {
12021 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
12022     uint64_t key                          : 64; /**< Scramble key for data. */
12023 #else
12024     uint64_t key                          : 64;
12025 #endif
12026     } s;
12027     struct cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg2_s      cn73xx;
12028     struct cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg2_s      cn78xx;
12029     struct cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg2_s      cnf75xx;
12030 };
12031 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg2 cvmx_lmcx_scramble_cfg2_t;
12032 
12033 /**
12034  * cvmx_lmc#_scrambled_fadr
12035  *
12036  * LMC()_FADR captures the failing pre-scrambled address location (split into DIMM, bunk,
12037  * bank, etc). If scrambling is off, LMC()_FADR also captures the failing physical location
12038  * in the DRAM parts. LMC()_SCRAMBLED_FADR captures the actual failing address location in
12039  * the physical DRAM parts, i.e.:
12040  *
12041  * * If scrambling is on, LMC()_SCRAMBLED_FADR contains the failing physical location in the
12042  * DRAM parts (split into DIMM, bunk, bank, etc).
12043  *
12044  * * If scrambling is off, the pre-scramble and post-scramble addresses are the same, and so the
12045  * contents of LMC()_SCRAMBLED_FADR match the contents of LMC()_FADR.
12046  *
12047  * This register only captures the first transaction with ECC errors. A DED error can over-write
12048  * this register with its failing addresses if the first error was a SEC. If you write
12049  * LMC()_CONFIG -> SEC_ERR/DED_ERR, it clears the error bits and captures the next failing
12050  * address. If [FDIMM] is 1, that means the error is in the higher DIMM.
12051  */
12052 union cvmx_lmcx_scrambled_fadr {
12053     uint64_t u64;
12054     struct cvmx_lmcx_scrambled_fadr_s {
12055 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
12056     uint64_t reserved_43_63               : 21;
12057     uint64_t fcid                         : 3;  /**< Reserved. */
12058     uint64_t fill_order                   : 2;  /**< Fill order for failing transaction. */
12059     uint64_t reserved_14_37               : 24;
12060     uint64_t fcol                         : 14; /**< Failing column address <13:0>. Technically, represents the address of the 128b data that
12061                                                          had an ECC error, i.e., FCOL<0> is always 0. Can be used in conjunction with
12062                                                          LMC()_CONFIG[DED_ERR] to isolate the 64b chunk of data in error. */
12063 #else
12064     uint64_t fcol                         : 14;
12065     uint64_t reserved_14_37               : 24;
12066     uint64_t fill_order                   : 2;
12067     uint64_t fcid                         : 3;
12068     uint64_t reserved_43_63               : 21;
12069 #endif
12070     } s;
12071     struct cvmx_lmcx_scrambled_fadr_cn61xx {
12072 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
12073     uint64_t reserved_36_63               : 28;
12074     uint64_t fdimm                        : 2;  /**< Failing DIMM# */
12075     uint64_t fbunk                        : 1;  /**< Failing Rank */
12076     uint64_t fbank                        : 3;  /**< Failing Bank[2:0] */
12077     uint64_t frow                         : 16; /**< Failing Row Address[15:0] */
12078     uint64_t fcol                         : 14; /**< Failing Column Address[13:0]
12079                                                          Technically, represents the address of the 128b data
12080                                                          that had an ecc error, i.e., fcol[0] is always 0. Can
12081                                                          be used in conjuction with LMC*_CONFIG[DED_ERR] to
12082                                                          isolate the 64b chunk of data in error */
12083 #else
12084     uint64_t fcol                         : 14;
12085     uint64_t frow                         : 16;
12086     uint64_t fbank                        : 3;
12087     uint64_t fbunk                        : 1;
12088     uint64_t fdimm                        : 2;
12089     uint64_t reserved_36_63               : 28;
12090 #endif
12091     } cn61xx;
12092     struct cvmx_lmcx_scrambled_fadr_cn61xx cn66xx;
12093     struct cvmx_lmcx_scrambled_fadr_cn70xx {
12094 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
12095     uint64_t reserved_40_63               : 24;
12096     uint64_t fill_order                   : 2;  /**< Fill order for failing transaction. */
12097     uint64_t fdimm                        : 1;  /**< Failing DIMM number. */
12098     uint64_t fbunk                        : 1;  /**< Failing rank number. */
12099     uint64_t fbank                        : 4;  /**< Failing bank number. Bits <3:0>. */
12100     uint64_t frow                         : 18; /**< Failing row address. Bits <17:0>. */
12101     uint64_t fcol                         : 14; /**< Failing column address <13:0>. Technically, represents the address of the 128b data that
12102                                                          had an ECC error, i.e., FCOL<0> is always 0. Can be used in conjunction with
12103                                                          LMC(0..0)_CONFIG[DED_ERR] to isolate the 64b chunk of data in error. */
12104 #else
12105     uint64_t fcol                         : 14;
12106     uint64_t frow                         : 18;
12107     uint64_t fbank                        : 4;
12108     uint64_t fbunk                        : 1;
12109     uint64_t fdimm                        : 1;
12110     uint64_t fill_order                   : 2;
12111     uint64_t reserved_40_63               : 24;
12112 #endif
12113     } cn70xx;
12114     struct cvmx_lmcx_scrambled_fadr_cn70xx cn70xxp1;
12115     struct cvmx_lmcx_scrambled_fadr_cn73xx {
12116 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
12117     uint64_t reserved_43_63               : 21;
12118     uint64_t fcid                         : 3;  /**< Reserved. */
12119     uint64_t fill_order                   : 2;  /**< Fill order for failing transaction. */
12120     uint64_t fdimm                        : 1;  /**< Failing DIMM number. */
12121     uint64_t fbunk                        : 1;  /**< Failing rank number. */
12122     uint64_t fbank                        : 4;  /**< Failing bank number. Bits <3:0>. */
12123     uint64_t frow                         : 18; /**< Failing row address. Bits <17:0>. */
12124     uint64_t fcol                         : 14; /**< Failing column address <13:0>. Technically, represents the address of the 128b data that
12125                                                          had an ECC error, i.e., FCOL<0> is always 0. Can be used in conjunction with
12126                                                          LMC()_CONFIG[DED_ERR] to isolate the 64b chunk of data in error. */
12127 #else
12128     uint64_t fcol                         : 14;
12129     uint64_t frow                         : 18;
12130     uint64_t fbank                        : 4;
12131     uint64_t fbunk                        : 1;
12132     uint64_t fdimm                        : 1;
12133     uint64_t fill_order                   : 2;
12134     uint64_t fcid                         : 3;
12135     uint64_t reserved_43_63               : 21;
12136 #endif
12137     } cn73xx;
12138     struct cvmx_lmcx_scrambled_fadr_cn73xx cn78xx;
12139     struct cvmx_lmcx_scrambled_fadr_cn73xx cn78xxp1;
12140     struct cvmx_lmcx_scrambled_fadr_cn61xx cnf71xx;
12141     struct cvmx_lmcx_scrambled_fadr_cn73xx cnf75xx;
12142 };
12143 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_scrambled_fadr cvmx_lmcx_scrambled_fadr_t;
12144 
12145 /**
12146  * cvmx_lmc#_seq_ctl
12147  *
12148  * This register is used to initiate the various control sequences in the LMC.
12149  *
12150  */
12151 union cvmx_lmcx_seq_ctl {
12152     uint64_t u64;
12153     struct cvmx_lmcx_seq_ctl_s {
12154 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
12155     uint64_t reserved_6_63                : 58;
12156     uint64_t seq_complete                 : 1;  /**< Sequence complete. This bit is cleared when [INIT_START] is set to a 1 and then is set to
12157                                                          1
12158                                                          when the sequence is completed. */
12159     uint64_t seq_sel                      : 4;  /**< Selects the sequence that LMC runs after a 0->1 transition on [INIT_START], as
12160                                                          enumerated by LMC_SEQ_SEL_E.
12161                                                          LMC writes the LMC()_MODEREG_PARAMS0 and LMC()_MODEREG_PARAMS1 CSR field values
12162                                                          to the Mode registers in the DRAM parts (i.e. MR0-MR6) as part of some of
12163                                                          these sequences.
12164                                                          Refer to the LMC()_MODEREG_PARAMS0 and LMC()_MODEREG_PARAMS1 descriptions for more
12165                                                          details. */
12166     uint64_t init_start                   : 1;  /**< A 0->1 transition starts the DDR memory sequence that is selected by
12167                                                          LMC()_SEQ_CTL[SEQ_SEL].
12168                                                          This register is a one-shot and clears itself each time it is set. */
12169 #else
12170     uint64_t init_start                   : 1;
12171     uint64_t seq_sel                      : 4;
12172     uint64_t seq_complete                 : 1;
12173     uint64_t reserved_6_63                : 58;
12174 #endif
12175     } s;
12176     struct cvmx_lmcx_seq_ctl_s            cn70xx;
12177     struct cvmx_lmcx_seq_ctl_s            cn70xxp1;
12178     struct cvmx_lmcx_seq_ctl_s            cn73xx;
12179     struct cvmx_lmcx_seq_ctl_s            cn78xx;
12180     struct cvmx_lmcx_seq_ctl_s            cn78xxp1;
12181     struct cvmx_lmcx_seq_ctl_s            cnf75xx;
12182 };
12183 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_seq_ctl cvmx_lmcx_seq_ctl_t;
12184 
12185 /**
12186  * cvmx_lmc#_slot_ctl0
12187  *
12188  * This register is an assortment of control fields needed by the memory controller. If software
12189  * has not previously written to this register (since the last DRESET), hardware updates the
12190  * fields in this register to the minimum allowed value when any of LMC()_RLEVEL_RANK(),
12191  * LMC()_WLEVEL_RANK(), LMC()_CONTROL, and LMC()_MODEREG_PARAMS0 registers
12192  * change. Ideally, only read this register after LMC has been initialized and
12193  * LMC()_RLEVEL_RANK(), LMC()_WLEVEL_RANK() have valid data.
12194  *
12195  * The interpretation of the fields in this register depends on LMC(0)_CONFIG[DDR2T]:
12196  *
12197  * * If LMC()_CONFIG[DDR2T]=1, (FieldValue + 4) is the minimum CK cycles between when
12198  * the DRAM part registers CAS commands of the first and second types from different cache
12199  * blocks.
12200  *
12201  * If LMC()_CONFIG[DDR2T]=0, (FieldValue + 3) is the minimum CK cycles between when the DRAM
12202  * part registers CAS commands of the first and second types from different cache blocks.
12203  * FieldValue = 0 is always illegal in this case.
12204  * The hardware-calculated minimums for these fields are shown in LMC(0)_SLOT_CTL0 Hardware-
12205  * Calculated Minimums.
12206  */
12207 union cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl0 {
12208     uint64_t u64;
12209     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl0_s {
12210 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
12211     uint64_t reserved_50_63               : 14;
12212     uint64_t w2r_l_init_ext               : 1;  /**< A 1-bit extenstion to the [W2R_L_INIT] register. */
12213     uint64_t w2r_init_ext                 : 1;  /**< A 1-bit extension to the [W2R_INIT] register. */
12214     uint64_t w2w_l_init                   : 6;  /**< Write-to-write spacing control for back-to-back write followed by write cache block
12215                                                          accesses to the same rank and DIMM, and same BG for DDR4. */
12216     uint64_t w2r_l_init                   : 6;  /**< Write-to-read spacing control for back-to-back write followed by read cache block accesses
12217                                                          to the same rank and DIMM, and same BG for DDR4. */
12218     uint64_t r2w_l_init                   : 6;  /**< Read-to-write spacing control for back-to-back read followed by write cache block accesses
12219                                                          to the same rank and DIMM, and same BG for DDR4. */
12220     uint64_t r2r_l_init                   : 6;  /**< Read-to-read spacing control for back-to-back read followed by read cache block accesses
12221                                                          to the same rank and DIMM, and same BG for DDR4. */
12222     uint64_t w2w_init                     : 6;  /**< Write-to-write spacing control for back-to-back write followed by write cache block
12223                                                          accesses to the same rank and DIMM. */
12224     uint64_t w2r_init                     : 6;  /**< Write-to-read spacing control for back-to-back write followed by read cache block accesses
12225                                                          to the same rank and DIMM. */
12226     uint64_t r2w_init                     : 6;  /**< Read-to-write spacing control for back-to-back read followed by write cache block accesses
12227                                                          to the same rank and DIMM. */
12228     uint64_t r2r_init                     : 6;  /**< Read-to-read spacing control for back-to-back read followed by read cache block accesses
12229                                                          to the same rank and DIMM. */
12230 #else
12231     uint64_t r2r_init                     : 6;
12232     uint64_t r2w_init                     : 6;
12233     uint64_t w2r_init                     : 6;
12234     uint64_t w2w_init                     : 6;
12235     uint64_t r2r_l_init                   : 6;
12236     uint64_t r2w_l_init                   : 6;
12237     uint64_t w2r_l_init                   : 6;
12238     uint64_t w2w_l_init                   : 6;
12239     uint64_t w2r_init_ext                 : 1;
12240     uint64_t w2r_l_init_ext               : 1;
12241     uint64_t reserved_50_63               : 14;
12242 #endif
12243     } s;
12244     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl0_cn61xx {
12245 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
12246     uint64_t reserved_24_63               : 40;
12247     uint64_t w2w_init                     : 6;  /**< Write-to-write spacing control
12248                                                          for back to back write followed by write cache block
12249                                                          accesses to the same rank and DIMM */
12250     uint64_t w2r_init                     : 6;  /**< Write-to-read spacing control
12251                                                          for back to back write followed by read cache block
12252                                                          accesses to the same rank and DIMM */
12253     uint64_t r2w_init                     : 6;  /**< Read-to-write spacing control
12254                                                          for back to back read followed by write cache block
12255                                                          accesses to the same rank and DIMM */
12256     uint64_t r2r_init                     : 6;  /**< Read-to-read spacing control
12257                                                          for back to back read followed by read cache block
12258                                                          accesses to the same rank and DIMM */
12259 #else
12260     uint64_t r2r_init                     : 6;
12261     uint64_t r2w_init                     : 6;
12262     uint64_t w2r_init                     : 6;
12263     uint64_t w2w_init                     : 6;
12264     uint64_t reserved_24_63               : 40;
12265 #endif
12266     } cn61xx;
12267     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl0_cn61xx     cn63xx;
12268     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl0_cn61xx     cn63xxp1;
12269     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl0_cn61xx     cn66xx;
12270     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl0_cn61xx     cn68xx;
12271     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl0_cn61xx     cn68xxp1;
12272     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl0_cn70xx {
12273 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
12274     uint64_t reserved_48_63               : 16;
12275     uint64_t w2w_l_init                   : 6;  /**< Write-to-write spacing control for back-to-back write followed by write cache block
12276                                                          accesses to the same rank and DIMM, and same BG for DDR4. */
12277     uint64_t w2r_l_init                   : 6;  /**< Write-to-read spacing control for back-to-back write followed by read cache block accesses
12278                                                          to the same rank and DIMM, and same BG for DDR4. */
12279     uint64_t r2w_l_init                   : 6;  /**< Read-to-write spacing control for back-to-back read followed by write cache block accesses
12280                                                          to the same rank and DIMM, and same BG for DDR4. */
12281     uint64_t r2r_l_init                   : 6;  /**< Read-to-read spacing control for back-to-back read followed by read cache block accesses
12282                                                          to the same rank and DIMM, and same BG for DDR4. */
12283     uint64_t w2w_init                     : 6;  /**< Write-to-write spacing control for back-to-back write followed by write cache block
12284                                                          accesses to the same rank and DIMM. */
12285     uint64_t w2r_init                     : 6;  /**< Write-to-read spacing control for back-to-back write followed by read cache block accesses
12286                                                          to the same rank and DIMM. */
12287     uint64_t r2w_init                     : 6;  /**< Read-to-write spacing control for back-to-back read followed by write cache block accesses
12288                                                          to the same rank and DIMM. */
12289     uint64_t r2r_init                     : 6;  /**< Read-to-read spacing control for back-to-back read followed by read cache block accesses
12290                                                          to the same rank and DIMM. */
12291 #else
12292     uint64_t r2r_init                     : 6;
12293     uint64_t r2w_init                     : 6;
12294     uint64_t w2r_init                     : 6;
12295     uint64_t w2w_init                     : 6;
12296     uint64_t r2r_l_init                   : 6;
12297     uint64_t r2w_l_init                   : 6;
12298     uint64_t w2r_l_init                   : 6;
12299     uint64_t w2w_l_init                   : 6;
12300     uint64_t reserved_48_63               : 16;
12301 #endif
12302     } cn70xx;
12303     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl0_cn70xx     cn70xxp1;
12304     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl0_s          cn73xx;
12305     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl0_s          cn78xx;
12306     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl0_s          cn78xxp1;
12307     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl0_cn61xx     cnf71xx;
12308     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl0_s          cnf75xx;
12309 };
12310 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl0 cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl0_t;
12311 
12312 /**
12313  * cvmx_lmc#_slot_ctl1
12314  *
12315  * This register is an assortment of control fields needed by the memory controller. If software
12316  * has not previously written to this register (since the last DRESET), hardware updates the
12317  * fields in this register to the minimum allowed value when any of LMC()_RLEVEL_RANK(),
12318  * LMC()_WLEVEL_RANK(), LMC()_CONTROL and LMC()_MODEREG_PARAMS0 change.
12319  * Ideally, only read this register after LMC has been initialized and
12320  * LMC()_RLEVEL_RANK(), LMC()_WLEVEL_RANK() have valid data.
12321  *
12322  * The interpretation of the fields in this CSR depends on LMC(0)_CONFIG[DDR2T]:
12323  *
12324  * * If LMC()_CONFIG[DDR2T]=1, (FieldValue + 4) is the minimum CK cycles between when the
12325  * DRAM part registers CAS commands of the first and second types from different cache blocks.
12326  *
12327  * * If LMC()_CONFIG[DDR2T]=0, (FieldValue + 3) is the minimum CK cycles between when the DRAM
12328  * part registers CAS commands of the first and second types from different cache blocks.
12329  * FieldValue = 0 is always illegal in this case.
12330  *
12331  * The hardware-calculated minimums for these fields are shown in LMC(0)_SLOT_CTL1 Hardware-
12332  * Calculated Minimums.
12333  */
12334 union cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl1 {
12335     uint64_t u64;
12336     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl1_s {
12337 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
12338     uint64_t reserved_24_63               : 40;
12339     uint64_t w2w_xrank_init               : 6;  /**< Write-to-write spacing control for back-to-back write followed by write cache block
12340                                                          accesses across ranks of the same DIMM. */
12341     uint64_t w2r_xrank_init               : 6;  /**< Write-to-read spacing control for back-to-back write followed by read cache block accesses
12342                                                          across ranks of the same DIMM. */
12343     uint64_t r2w_xrank_init               : 6;  /**< Read-to-write spacing control for back-to-back read followed by write cache block accesses
12344                                                          across ranks of the same DIMM. */
12345     uint64_t r2r_xrank_init               : 6;  /**< Read-to-read spacing control for back-to-back read followed by read cache block accesses
12346                                                          across ranks of the same DIMM. */
12347 #else
12348     uint64_t r2r_xrank_init               : 6;
12349     uint64_t r2w_xrank_init               : 6;
12350     uint64_t w2r_xrank_init               : 6;
12351     uint64_t w2w_xrank_init               : 6;
12352     uint64_t reserved_24_63               : 40;
12353 #endif
12354     } s;
12355     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl1_s          cn61xx;
12356     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl1_s          cn63xx;
12357     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl1_s          cn63xxp1;
12358     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl1_s          cn66xx;
12359     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl1_s          cn68xx;
12360     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl1_s          cn68xxp1;
12361     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl1_s          cn70xx;
12362     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl1_s          cn70xxp1;
12363     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl1_s          cn73xx;
12364     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl1_s          cn78xx;
12365     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl1_s          cn78xxp1;
12366     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl1_s          cnf71xx;
12367     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl1_s          cnf75xx;
12368 };
12369 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl1 cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl1_t;
12370 
12371 /**
12372  * cvmx_lmc#_slot_ctl2
12373  *
12374  * This register is an assortment of control fields needed by the memory controller. If software
12375  * has not previously written to this register (since the last DRESET), hardware updates the
12376  * fields in this register to the minimum allowed value when any of LMC()_RLEVEL_RANK(),
12377  * LMC()_WLEVEL_RANK(), LMC()_CONTROL and LMC()_MODEREG_PARAMS0 change.
12378  * Ideally, only read this register after LMC has been initialized and
12379  * LMC()_RLEVEL_RANK(), LMC()_WLEVEL_RANK() have valid data.
12380  *
12381  * The interpretation of the fields in this CSR depends on LMC(0)_CONFIG[DDR2T]:
12382  *
12383  * * If LMC()_CONFIG[DDR2T] = 1, (FieldValue + 4) is the minimum CK cycles between when the
12384  * DRAM part registers CAS commands of the first and second types from different cache blocks.
12385  *
12386  * * If LMC()_CONFIG[DDR2T] = 0, (FieldValue + 3) is the minimum CK cycles between when the
12387  * DRAM part registers CAS commands of the first and second types from different cache blocks.
12388  * FieldValue = 0 is always illegal in this case.
12389  *
12390  * The hardware-calculated minimums for these fields are shown in LMC Registers.
12391  */
12392 union cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl2 {
12393     uint64_t u64;
12394     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl2_s {
12395 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
12396     uint64_t reserved_24_63               : 40;
12397     uint64_t w2w_xdimm_init               : 6;  /**< Write-to-write spacing control for back-to-back write followed by write cache block
12398                                                          accesses across DIMMs. */
12399     uint64_t w2r_xdimm_init               : 6;  /**< Write-to-read spacing control for back-to-back write followed by read cache block accesses
12400                                                          across DIMMs. */
12401     uint64_t r2w_xdimm_init               : 6;  /**< Read-to-write spacing control for back-to-back read followed by write cache block accesses
12402                                                          across DIMMs. */
12403     uint64_t r2r_xdimm_init               : 6;  /**< Read-to-read spacing control for back-to-back read followed by read cache block accesses
12404                                                          across DIMMs. */
12405 #else
12406     uint64_t r2r_xdimm_init               : 6;
12407     uint64_t r2w_xdimm_init               : 6;
12408     uint64_t w2r_xdimm_init               : 6;
12409     uint64_t w2w_xdimm_init               : 6;
12410     uint64_t reserved_24_63               : 40;
12411 #endif
12412     } s;
12413     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl2_s          cn61xx;
12414     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl2_s          cn63xx;
12415     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl2_s          cn63xxp1;
12416     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl2_s          cn66xx;
12417     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl2_s          cn68xx;
12418     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl2_s          cn68xxp1;
12419     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl2_s          cn70xx;
12420     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl2_s          cn70xxp1;
12421     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl2_s          cn73xx;
12422     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl2_s          cn78xx;
12423     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl2_s          cn78xxp1;
12424     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl2_s          cnf71xx;
12425     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl2_s          cnf75xx;
12426 };
12427 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl2 cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl2_t;
12428 
12429 /**
12430  * cvmx_lmc#_slot_ctl3
12431  *
12432  * This register is an assortment of control fields needed by the memory controller. If software
12433  * has not previously written to this register (since the last DRESET), hardware updates the
12434  * fields in this register to the minimum allowed value when any of LMC()_RLEVEL_RANK(),
12435  * LMC()_WLEVEL_RANK(), LMC()_CONTROL and LMC()_MODEREG_PARAMS0 change.
12436  * Ideally, only read this register after LMC has been initialized and
12437  * LMC()_RLEVEL_RANK(), LMC()_WLEVEL_RANK() have valid data.
12438  *
12439  * The interpretation of the fields in this CSR depends on LMC(0)_CONFIG[DDR2T]:
12440  *
12441  * * If LMC()_CONFIG[DDR2T] = 1, (FieldValue + 4) is the minimum CK cycles between when the
12442  * DRAM part registers CAS commands of the first and second types from different cache blocks.
12443  *
12444  * * If LMC()_CONFIG[DDR2T] = 0, (FieldValue + 3) is the minimum CK cycles between when the
12445  * DRAM part registers CAS commands of the first and second types from different cache blocks.
12446  * FieldValue = 0 is always illegal in this case.
12447  *
12448  * The hardware-calculated minimums for these fields are shown in LMC Registers.
12449  */
12450 union cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl3 {
12451     uint64_t u64;
12452     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl3_s {
12453 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
12454     uint64_t reserved_50_63               : 14;
12455     uint64_t w2r_l_xrank_init_ext         : 1;  /**< A 1-bit extension to the [W2R_L_XRANK_INIT] register. */
12456     uint64_t w2r_xrank_init_ext           : 1;  /**< A 1-bit extension to the [W2R_XRANK_INIT] register. */
12457     uint64_t w2w_l_xrank_init             : 6;  /**< Write-to-write spacing control for back-to-back write followed by write cache block
12458                                                          accesses to a different logical rank, and same BG for DDR4. */
12459     uint64_t w2r_l_xrank_init             : 6;  /**< Write-to-read spacing control for back-to-back write followed by read cache block accesses
12460                                                          to a different logical rank, and same BG for DDR4. */
12461     uint64_t r2w_l_xrank_init             : 6;  /**< Read-to-write spacing control for back-to-back read followed by write cache block accesses
12462                                                          to a different logical rank, and same BG for DDR4. */
12463     uint64_t r2r_l_xrank_init             : 6;  /**< Read-to-read spacing control for back-to-back read followed by read cache block accesses
12464                                                          to a different logical rank, and same BG for DDR4. */
12465     uint64_t w2w_xrank_init               : 6;  /**< Write-to-write spacing control for back-to-back write followed by write cache block
12466                                                          accesses to a different logical rank. */
12467     uint64_t w2r_xrank_init               : 6;  /**< Write-to-read spacing control for back-to-back write followed by read cache block accesses
12468                                                          to a different logical rank. */
12469     uint64_t r2w_xrank_init               : 6;  /**< Read-to-write spacing control for back-to-back read followed by write cache block accesses
12470                                                          to a different logical rank. */
12471     uint64_t r2r_xrank_init               : 6;  /**< Read-to-read spacing control for back-to-back read followed by read cache block accesses
12472                                                          to a different logical rank. */
12473 #else
12474     uint64_t r2r_xrank_init               : 6;
12475     uint64_t r2w_xrank_init               : 6;
12476     uint64_t w2r_xrank_init               : 6;
12477     uint64_t w2w_xrank_init               : 6;
12478     uint64_t r2r_l_xrank_init             : 6;
12479     uint64_t r2w_l_xrank_init             : 6;
12480     uint64_t w2r_l_xrank_init             : 6;
12481     uint64_t w2w_l_xrank_init             : 6;
12482     uint64_t w2r_xrank_init_ext           : 1;
12483     uint64_t w2r_l_xrank_init_ext         : 1;
12484     uint64_t reserved_50_63               : 14;
12485 #endif
12486     } s;
12487     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl3_s          cn73xx;
12488     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl3_s          cn78xx;
12489     struct cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl3_s          cnf75xx;
12490 };
12491 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl3 cvmx_lmcx_slot_ctl3_t;
12492 
12493 /**
12494  * cvmx_lmc#_timing_params0
12495  */
12496 union cvmx_lmcx_timing_params0 {
12497     uint64_t u64;
12498     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params0_s {
12499 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
12500     uint64_t reserved_54_63               : 10;
12501     uint64_t tbcw                         : 6;  /**< Indicates tBCW constraints. Set this field as follows:
12502                                                          _ RNDUP[TBCW(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 1
12503                                                          where TBCW is from the JEDEC DDR4DB spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not
12504                                                          data rate).
12505                                                          TYP = 16. */
12506     uint64_t reserved_26_47               : 22;
12507     uint64_t tmrd                         : 4;  /**< Indicates TMRD constraints. Set this field as follows:
12508                                                          _ RNDUP[TMRD(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 1
12509                                                          where TMRD is from the JEDEC DDR3/DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock
12510                                                          frequency (not data rate).
12511                                                          TYP = 8nCK. */
12512     uint64_t reserved_8_21                : 14;
12513     uint64_t tckeon                       : 8;  /**< Reserved. Should be written to zero. */
12514 #else
12515     uint64_t tckeon                       : 8;
12516     uint64_t reserved_8_21                : 14;
12517     uint64_t tmrd                         : 4;
12518     uint64_t reserved_26_47               : 22;
12519     uint64_t tbcw                         : 6;
12520     uint64_t reserved_54_63               : 10;
12521 #endif
12522     } s;
12523     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params0_cn61xx {
12524 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
12525     uint64_t reserved_47_63               : 17;
12526     uint64_t trp_ext                      : 1;  /**< Indicates tRP constraints.
12527                                                          Set [TRP_EXT[0:0], TRP[3:0]] (CSR field) = RNDUP[tRP(ns)/tCYC(ns)]
12528                                                          + (RNDUP[tRTP(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-4)-1,
12529                                                          where tRP, tRTP are from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12530                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12531                                                          TYP tRP=10-15ns
12532                                                          TYP tRTP=max(4nCK, 7.5ns) */
12533     uint64_t tcksre                       : 4;  /**< Indicates tCKSRE constraints.
12534                                                          Set TCKSRE (CSR field) = RNDUP[tCKSRE(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-1,
12535                                                          where tCKSRE is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12536                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12537                                                          TYP=max(5nCK, 10ns) */
12538     uint64_t trp                          : 4;  /**< Indicates tRP constraints.
12539                                                          Set [TRP_EXT[0:0], TRP[3:0]] (CSR field) = RNDUP[tRP(ns)/tCYC(ns)]
12540                                                          + (RNDUP[tRTP(ns)/tCYC(ns)])-4)-1,
12541                                                          where tRP, tRTP are from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12542                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12543                                                          TYP tRP=10-15ns
12544                                                          TYP tRTP=max(4nCK, 7.5ns) */
12545     uint64_t tzqinit                      : 4;  /**< Indicates tZQINIT constraints.
12546                                                          Set TZQINIT (CSR field) = RNDUP[tZQINIT(ns)/(256*tCYC(ns))],
12547                                                          where tZQINIT is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12548                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12549                                                          TYP=2 (equivalent to 512) */
12550     uint64_t tdllk                        : 4;  /**< Indicates tDLLK constraints.
12551                                                          Set TDLLK (CSR field) = RNDUP[tDLLK(ns)/(256*tCYC(ns))],
12552                                                          where tDLLK is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12553                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12554                                                          TYP=2 (equivalent to 512)
12555                                                          This parameter is used in self-refresh exit
12556                                                          and assumed to be greater than tRFC */
12557     uint64_t tmod                         : 4;  /**< Indicates tMOD constraints.
12558                                                          Set TMOD (CSR field) = RNDUP[tMOD(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-1,
12559                                                          where tMOD is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12560                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12561                                                          TYP=max(12nCK, 15ns) */
12562     uint64_t tmrd                         : 4;  /**< Indicates tMRD constraints.
12563                                                          Set TMRD (CSR field) = RNDUP[tMRD(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-1,
12564                                                          where tMRD is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12565                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12566                                                          TYP=4nCK */
12567     uint64_t txpr                         : 4;  /**< Indicates tXPR constraints.
12568                                                          Set TXPR (CSR field) = RNDUP[tXPR(ns)/(16*tCYC(ns))],
12569                                                          where tXPR is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12570                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12571                                                          TYP=max(5nCK, tRFC+10ns) */
12572     uint64_t tcke                         : 4;  /**< Indicates tCKE constraints.
12573                                                          Set TCKE (CSR field) = RNDUP[tCKE(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-1,
12574                                                          where tCKE is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12575                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12576                                                          TYP=max(3nCK, 7.5/5.625/5.625/5ns) */
12577     uint64_t tzqcs                        : 4;  /**< Indicates tZQCS constraints.
12578                                                          Set TZQCS (CSR field) = RNDUP[tZQCS(ns)/(16*tCYC(ns))],
12579                                                          where tZQCS is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12580                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12581                                                          TYP=4 (equivalent to 64) */
12582     uint64_t reserved_0_9                 : 10;
12583 #else
12584     uint64_t reserved_0_9                 : 10;
12585     uint64_t tzqcs                        : 4;
12586     uint64_t tcke                         : 4;
12587     uint64_t txpr                         : 4;
12588     uint64_t tmrd                         : 4;
12589     uint64_t tmod                         : 4;
12590     uint64_t tdllk                        : 4;
12591     uint64_t tzqinit                      : 4;
12592     uint64_t trp                          : 4;
12593     uint64_t tcksre                       : 4;
12594     uint64_t trp_ext                      : 1;
12595     uint64_t reserved_47_63               : 17;
12596 #endif
12597     } cn61xx;
12598     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params0_cn61xx cn63xx;
12599     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params0_cn63xxp1 {
12600 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
12601     uint64_t reserved_46_63               : 18;
12602     uint64_t tcksre                       : 4;  /**< Indicates tCKSRE constraints.
12603                                                          Set TCKSRE (CSR field) = RNDUP[tCKSRE(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-1,
12604                                                          where tCKSRE is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12605                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12606                                                          TYP=max(5nCK, 10ns) */
12607     uint64_t trp                          : 4;  /**< Indicates tRP constraints.
12608                                                          Set TRP (CSR field) = RNDUP[tRP(ns)/tCYC(ns)]
12609                                                          + (RNDUP[tRTP(ns)/tCYC(ns)])-4)-1,
12610                                                          where tRP, tRTP are from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12611                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12612                                                          TYP tRP=10-15ns
12613                                                          TYP tRTP=max(4nCK, 7.5ns) */
12614     uint64_t tzqinit                      : 4;  /**< Indicates tZQINIT constraints.
12615                                                          Set TZQINIT (CSR field) = RNDUP[tZQINIT(ns)/(256*tCYC(ns))],
12616                                                          where tZQINIT is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12617                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12618                                                          TYP=2 (equivalent to 512) */
12619     uint64_t tdllk                        : 4;  /**< Indicates tDLLK constraints.
12620                                                          Set TDLLK (CSR field) = RNDUP[tDLLK(ns)/(256*tCYC(ns))],
12621                                                          where tDLLK is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12622                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12623                                                          TYP=2 (equivalent to 512)
12624                                                          This parameter is used in self-refresh exit
12625                                                          and assumed to be greater than tRFC */
12626     uint64_t tmod                         : 4;  /**< Indicates tMOD constraints.
12627                                                          Set TMOD (CSR field) = RNDUP[tMOD(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-1,
12628                                                          where tMOD is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12629                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12630                                                          TYP=max(12nCK, 15ns) */
12631     uint64_t tmrd                         : 4;  /**< Indicates tMRD constraints.
12632                                                          Set TMRD (CSR field) = RNDUP[tMRD(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-1,
12633                                                          where tMRD is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12634                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12635                                                          TYP=4nCK */
12636     uint64_t txpr                         : 4;  /**< Indicates tXPR constraints.
12637                                                          Set TXPR (CSR field) = RNDUP[tXPR(ns)/(16*tCYC(ns))],
12638                                                          where tXPR is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12639                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12640                                                          TYP=max(5nCK, tRFC+10ns) */
12641     uint64_t tcke                         : 4;  /**< Indicates tCKE constraints.
12642                                                          Set TCKE (CSR field) = RNDUP[tCKE(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-1,
12643                                                          where tCKE is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12644                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12645                                                          TYP=max(3nCK, 7.5/5.625/5.625/5ns) */
12646     uint64_t tzqcs                        : 4;  /**< Indicates tZQCS constraints.
12647                                                          Set TZQCS (CSR field) = RNDUP[tZQCS(ns)/(16*tCYC(ns))],
12648                                                          where tZQCS is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12649                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12650                                                          TYP=4 (equivalent to 64) */
12651     uint64_t tckeon                       : 10; /**< Reserved. Should be written to zero. */
12652 #else
12653     uint64_t tckeon                       : 10;
12654     uint64_t tzqcs                        : 4;
12655     uint64_t tcke                         : 4;

12666     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params0_cn61xx cn66xx;
12667     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params0_cn61xx cn68xx;
12668     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params0_cn61xx cn68xxp1;
12669     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params0_cn70xx {
12670 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
12671     uint64_t reserved_48_63               : 16;
12672     uint64_t tcksre                       : 4;  /**< Indicates TCKSRE constraints. Set this field as follows:
12673                                                          RNDUP[TCKSRE(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 1
12674                                                          where TCKSRE is from the JEDEC DDR3 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not
12675                                                          data rate).
12676                                                          TYP = max(5nCK, 10 ns). */
12677     uint64_t trp                          : 5;  /**< Indicates TRP constraints. Set TRP as follows:
12678                                                          RNDUP[TRP(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 1
12679                                                          where TRP and TRTP are from the JEDEC DDR3 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency
12680                                                          (not data rate).
12681                                                          TYP TRP = 10-15 ns.
12682                                                          TYP TRTP = max(4nCK, 7.5 ns). */
12683     uint64_t tzqinit                      : 4;  /**< Indicates TZQINIT constraints. Set this field as follows:
12684                                                          RNDUP[TZQINIT(ns) / (256 * TCYC(ns))]
12685                                                          where TZQINIT is from the JEDEC DDR3 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not
12686                                                          data rate).
12687                                                          TYP = 2 (equivalent to 512). */
12688     uint64_t tdllk                        : 4;  /**< Indicates TDLLK constraints. Set this field as follows:
12689                                                          RNDUP[TDLLK(ns) / (256 * TCYC(ns))]
12690                                                          where TDLLK is from the JEDEC DDR3 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not data
12691                                                          rate).
12692                                                          TYP = 2 (equivalent to 512).
12693                                                          This parameter is used in self-refresh exit and assumed to be greater than TRFC. */
12694     uint64_t tmod                         : 5;  /**< Indicates tMOD constraints. Set this field as follows:
12695                                                          RNDUP[TMOD(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 1
12696                                                          where TMOD is from the JEDEC DDR3 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not data
12697                                                          rate).
12698                                                          TYP = max(12nCK, 15 ns). */
12699     uint64_t tmrd                         : 4;  /**< Indicates TMRD constraints. Set this field as follows:
12700                                                          RNDUP[TMRD(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 1
12701                                                          where TMRD is from the JEDEC DDR3 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not data
12702                                                          rate).
12703                                                          TYP = 4nCK. */
12704     uint64_t txpr                         : 6;  /**< Indicates TXPR constraints. Set this field as follows:
12705                                                          RNDUP[TXPR(ns) / (16 * TCYC(ns))]
12706                                                          where TXPR is from the JEDEC DDR3 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not data
12707                                                          rate).
12708                                                          TYP = max(5nCK, TRFC+10 ns). */
12709     uint64_t tcke                         : 4;  /**< Indicates TCKE constraints. Set this field as follows:
12710                                                          RNDUP[TCKE(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 1
12711                                                          where TCKE is from the JEDEC DDR3 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not data
12712                                                          rate).
12713                                                          TYP = max(3nCK, 7.5/5.625/5.625/5 ns). */
12714     uint64_t tzqcs                        : 4;  /**< Indicates TZQCS constraints. Set this field as follows:
12715                                                          RNDUP[TZQCS(ns) / (16 * TCYC(ns))]
12716                                                          where TZQCS is from the JEDEC DDR3 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not data
12717                                                          rate).
12718                                                          TYP = 4 (equivalent to 64). */
12719     uint64_t reserved_0_7                 : 8;
12720 #else
12721     uint64_t reserved_0_7                 : 8;
12722     uint64_t tzqcs                        : 4;
12723     uint64_t tcke                         : 4;
12724     uint64_t txpr                         : 6;
12725     uint64_t tmrd                         : 4;
12726     uint64_t tmod                         : 5;
12727     uint64_t tdllk                        : 4;
12728     uint64_t tzqinit                      : 4;
12729     uint64_t trp                          : 5;
12730     uint64_t tcksre                       : 4;
12731     uint64_t reserved_48_63               : 16;
12732 #endif
12733     } cn70xx;
12734     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params0_cn70xx cn70xxp1;
12735     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params0_cn73xx {
12736 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
12737     uint64_t reserved_54_63               : 10;
12738     uint64_t tbcw                         : 6;  /**< Indicates tBCW constraints. Set this field as follows:
12739                                                          _ RNDUP[TBCW(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 1
12740                                                          where TBCW is from the JEDEC DDR4DB spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not
12741                                                          data rate).
12742                                                          TYP = 16. */
12743     uint64_t tcksre                       : 4;  /**< Indicates TCKSRE constraints. Set this field as follows:
12744                                                          _ RNDUP[TCKSRE(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 1
12745                                                          where TCKSRE is from the JEDEC DDR3/DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock
12746                                                          frequency (not data rate).
12747                                                          TYP = max(5nCK, 10 ns). */
12748     uint64_t trp                          : 5;  /**< Indicates TRP constraints. Set TRP as follows:
12749                                                          _ RNDUP[TRP(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 1
12750                                                          where TRP and TRTP are from the JEDEC DDR3/DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock
12751                                                          frequency
12752                                                          (not data rate).
12753                                                          TYP TRP = 10-15 ns.
12754                                                          TYP TRTP = max(4nCK, 7.5 ns). */
12755     uint64_t tzqinit                      : 4;  /**< Indicates TZQINIT constraints. Set this field as follows:
12756                                                          _ RNDUP[TZQINIT(ns) / (256 * TCYC(ns))]
12757                                                          where TZQINIT is from the JEDEC DDR3/DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock
12758                                                          frequency (not data rate).
12759                                                          TYP = 2 (equivalent to 512). */
12760     uint64_t tdllk                        : 4;  /**< Indicates TDLLK constraints. Set this field as follows:
12761                                                          _ RNDUP[TDLLK(ns) / (256 * TCYC(ns))]
12762                                                          where TDLLK is from the JEDEC DDR3/DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock
12763                                                          frequency (not data rate).
12764                                                          TYP = 3 (equivalent to 768).
12765                                                          This parameter is used in self-refresh exit and assumed to be greater than TRFC. */
12766     uint64_t tmod                         : 5;  /**< Indicates tMOD constraints. Set this field as follows:
12767                                                          _ RNDUP[TMOD(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 1
12768                                                          where TMOD is from the JEDEC DDR3/DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock
12769                                                          frequency (not data rate).
12770                                                          TYP = max(24nCK, 15 ns). */
12771     uint64_t tmrd                         : 4;  /**< Indicates TMRD constraints. Set this field as follows:
12772                                                          _ RNDUP[TMRD(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 1
12773                                                          where TMRD is from the JEDEC DDR3/DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock
12774                                                          frequency (not data rate).
12775                                                          TYP = 8nCK. */
12776     uint64_t txpr                         : 6;  /**< Indicates TXPR constraints. Set this field as follows:
12777                                                          _ RNDUP[TXPR(ns) / (16 * TCYC(ns))]
12778                                                          where TXPR is from the JEDEC DDR3/DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock
12779                                                          frequency (not data rate).
12780                                                          TYP = max(5nCK, TRFC+10 ns). */
12781     uint64_t tcke                         : 4;  /**< Indicates TCKE constraints. Set this field as follows:
12782                                                          _ RNDUP[TCKE(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 1
12783                                                          where TCKE is from the JEDEC DDR3/DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock
12784                                                          frequency (not data rate).
12785                                                          TYP = max(3nCK, 7.5/5.625/5.625/5 ns).
12786                                                          Because a DDR4 register can shorten the pulse width of CKE (it delays the falling edge
12787                                                          but does not delay the rising edge), care must be taken to set this parameter larger
12788                                                          to account for this effective reduction in the pulse width. */
12789     uint64_t tzqcs                        : 4;  /**< Indicates TZQCS constraints. This field is set as follows:
12790                                                          _ RNDUP[(2 * TZQCS(ns)) / (16 * TCYC(ns))]
12791                                                          where TZQCS is from the JEDEC DDR3/DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock
12792                                                          frequency (not data rate).
12793                                                          TYP >= 8 (greater-than-or-equal-to 128), to allow for dclk90 calibration. */
12794     uint64_t reserved_0_7                 : 8;
12795 #else
12796     uint64_t reserved_0_7                 : 8;
12797     uint64_t tzqcs                        : 4;
12798     uint64_t tcke                         : 4;
12799     uint64_t txpr                         : 6;
12800     uint64_t tmrd                         : 4;
12801     uint64_t tmod                         : 5;
12802     uint64_t tdllk                        : 4;
12803     uint64_t tzqinit                      : 4;
12804     uint64_t trp                          : 5;
12805     uint64_t tcksre                       : 4;
12806     uint64_t tbcw                         : 6;
12807     uint64_t reserved_54_63               : 10;
12808 #endif
12809     } cn73xx;
12810     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params0_cn73xx cn78xx;
12811     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params0_cn73xx cn78xxp1;
12812     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params0_cn61xx cnf71xx;
12813     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params0_cn73xx cnf75xx;
12814 };
12815 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_timing_params0 cvmx_lmcx_timing_params0_t;
12816 
12817 /**
12818  * cvmx_lmc#_timing_params1
12819  */
12820 union cvmx_lmcx_timing_params1 {
12821     uint64_t u64;
12822     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params1_s {
12823 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
12824     uint64_t reserved_59_63               : 5;
12825     uint64_t txp_ext                      : 1;  /**< A 1-bit extension to the TXP register. */
12826     uint64_t trcd_ext                     : 1;  /**< A 1-bit extension to the TRCD register. */
12827     uint64_t tpdm_full_cycle_ena          : 1;  /**< When set, this field enables the addition of a one cycle delay to the
12828                                                          write/read latency calculation. This is to compensate the case when
12829                                                          tPDM delay in the RCD of an RDIMM is greater than one-cycle.
12830                                                          Only valid in RDIMM  (LMC()_CTL[RDIMM_ENA]=1). */
12831     uint64_t trfc_dlr                     : 7;  /**< Indicates TRFC_DLR constraints. Set this field as follows:
12832                                                          _ RNDUP[TRFC_DLR(ns) / (8 * TCYC(ns))]
12833                                                          where TRFC_DLR is from the JEDEC 3D Stacked SDRAM spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock
12834                                                          frequency (not data rate).
12835                                                          TYP = 90-120 ns.
12836                                                          0x0 = reserved.
12837                                                          0x1 = 8 TCYC.
12838                                                          0x2 = 16 TCYC.
12839                                                          0x3 = 24 TCYC.
12840                                                          0x4 = 32 TCYC.
12841                                                          - ...
12842                                                          0x7E = 1008 TCYC.
12843                                                          0x7F = 1016 TCYC. */
12844     uint64_t reserved_4_48                : 45;
12845     uint64_t tmprr                        : 4;  /**< Indicates TMPRR constraints. Set this field as follows:
12846                                                          _ RNDUP[TMPRR(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 1
12847                                                          where TMPRR is from the JEDEC DDR3/DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock
12848                                                          frequency (not data rate).
12849                                                          TYP = 1 nCK */
12850 #else
12851     uint64_t tmprr                        : 4;
12852     uint64_t reserved_4_48                : 45;
12853     uint64_t trfc_dlr                     : 7;
12854     uint64_t tpdm_full_cycle_ena          : 1;
12855     uint64_t trcd_ext                     : 1;
12856     uint64_t txp_ext                      : 1;
12857     uint64_t reserved_59_63               : 5;
12858 #endif
12859     } s;
12860     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params1_cn61xx {
12861 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
12862     uint64_t reserved_47_63               : 17;
12863     uint64_t tras_ext                     : 1;  /**< Indicates tRAS constraints.
12864                                                          Set [TRAS_EXT[0:0], TRAS[4:0]] (CSR field) = RNDUP[tRAS(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-1,
12865                                                          where tRAS is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12866                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12867                                                          TYP=35ns-9*tREFI
12868                                                              - 000000: RESERVED
12869                                                              - 000001: 2 tCYC
12870                                                              - 000010: 3 tCYC
12871                                                              - ...
12872                                                              - 111111: 64 tCYC */
12873     uint64_t txpdll                       : 5;  /**< Indicates tXPDLL constraints.
12874                                                          Set TXPDLL (CSR field) = RNDUP[tXPDLL(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-1,
12875                                                          where tXPDLL is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12876                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12877                                                          TYP=max(10nCK, 24ns) */
12878     uint64_t tfaw                         : 5;  /**< Indicates tFAW constraints.
12879                                                          Set TFAW (CSR field) = RNDUP[tFAW(ns)/(4*tCYC(ns))],
12880                                                          where tFAW is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12881                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12882                                                          TYP=30-40ns */
12883     uint64_t twldqsen                     : 4;  /**< Indicates tWLDQSEN constraints.
12884                                                          Set TWLDQSEN (CSR field) = RNDUP[tWLDQSEN(ns)/(4*tCYC(ns))],
12885                                                          where tWLDQSEN is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12886                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12887                                                          TYP=max(25nCK) */
12888     uint64_t twlmrd                       : 4;  /**< Indicates tWLMRD constraints.
12889                                                          Set TWLMRD (CSR field) = RNDUP[tWLMRD(ns)/(4*tCYC(ns))],
12890                                                          where tWLMRD is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12891                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12892                                                          TYP=max(40nCK) */
12893     uint64_t txp                          : 3;  /**< Indicates tXP constraints.
12894                                                          Set TXP (CSR field) = RNDUP[tXP(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-1,
12895                                                          where tXP is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12896                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12897                                                          TYP=max(3nCK, 7.5ns) */
12898     uint64_t trrd                         : 3;  /**< Indicates tRRD constraints.
12899                                                          Set TRRD (CSR field) = RNDUP[tRRD(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-2,
12900                                                          where tRRD is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12901                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12902                                                          TYP=max(4nCK, 10ns)
12903                                                             - 000: RESERVED
12904                                                             - 001: 3 tCYC
12905                                                             - ...
12906                                                             - 110: 8 tCYC
12907                                                             - 111: 9 tCYC */
12908     uint64_t trfc                         : 5;  /**< Indicates tRFC constraints.
12909                                                          Set TRFC (CSR field) = RNDUP[tRFC(ns)/(8*tCYC(ns))],
12910                                                          where tRFC is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12911                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12912                                                          TYP=90-350ns
12913                                                               - 00000: RESERVED
12914                                                               - 00001: 8 tCYC
12915                                                               - 00010: 16 tCYC
12916                                                               - 00011: 24 tCYC
12917                                                               - 00100: 32 tCYC
12918                                                               - ...
12919                                                               - 11110: 240 tCYC
12920                                                               - 11111: 248 tCYC */
12921     uint64_t twtr                         : 4;  /**< Indicates tWTR constraints.
12922                                                          Set TWTR (CSR field) = RNDUP[tWTR(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-1,
12923                                                          where tWTR is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12924                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12925                                                          TYP=max(4nCK, 7.5ns)
12926                                                              - 0000: RESERVED
12927                                                              - 0001: 2
12928                                                              - ...
12929                                                              - 0111: 8
12930                                                              - 1000-1111: RESERVED */
12931     uint64_t trcd                         : 4;  /**< Indicates tRCD constraints.
12932                                                          Set TRCD (CSR field) = RNDUP[tRCD(ns)/tCYC(ns)],
12933                                                          where tRCD is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12934                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12935                                                          TYP=10-15ns
12936                                                              - 0000: RESERVED
12937                                                              - 0001: 2 (2 is the smallest value allowed)
12938                                                              - 0002: 2
12939                                                              - ...
12940                                                              - 1110: 14
12941                                                              - 1111: RESERVED
12942                                                          In 2T mode, make this register TRCD-1, not going
12943                                                          below 2. */
12944     uint64_t tras                         : 5;  /**< Indicates tRAS constraints.
12945                                                          Set [TRAS_EXT[0:0], TRAS[4:0]] (CSR field) = RNDUP[tRAS(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-1,
12946                                                          where tRAS is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12947                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12948                                                          TYP=35ns-9*tREFI
12949                                                              - 000000: RESERVED
12950                                                              - 000001: 2 tCYC
12951                                                              - 000010: 3 tCYC
12952                                                              - ...
12953                                                              - 111111: 64 tCYC */
12954     uint64_t tmprr                        : 4;  /**< Indicates tMPRR constraints.
12955                                                          Set TMPRR (CSR field) = RNDUP[tMPRR(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-1,
12956                                                          where tMPRR is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12957                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12958                                                          TYP=1nCK */
12959 #else
12960     uint64_t tmprr                        : 4;
12961     uint64_t tras                         : 5;
12962     uint64_t trcd                         : 4;
12963     uint64_t twtr                         : 4;
12964     uint64_t trfc                         : 5;
12965     uint64_t trrd                         : 3;
12966     uint64_t txp                          : 3;
12967     uint64_t twlmrd                       : 4;
12968     uint64_t twldqsen                     : 4;
12969     uint64_t tfaw                         : 5;
12970     uint64_t txpdll                       : 5;
12971     uint64_t tras_ext                     : 1;
12972     uint64_t reserved_47_63               : 17;
12973 #endif
12974     } cn61xx;
12975     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params1_cn61xx cn63xx;
12976     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params1_cn63xxp1 {
12977 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
12978     uint64_t reserved_46_63               : 18;
12979     uint64_t txpdll                       : 5;  /**< Indicates tXPDLL constraints.
12980                                                          Set TXPDLL (CSR field) = RNDUP[tXPDLL(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-1,
12981                                                          where tXPDLL is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12982                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12983                                                          TYP=max(10nCK, 24ns) */
12984     uint64_t tfaw                         : 5;  /**< Indicates tFAW constraints.
12985                                                          Set TFAW (CSR field) = RNDUP[tFAW(ns)/(4*tCYC(ns))],
12986                                                          where tFAW is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12987                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12988                                                          TYP=30-40ns */
12989     uint64_t twldqsen                     : 4;  /**< Indicates tWLDQSEN constraints.
12990                                                          Set TWLDQSEN (CSR field) = RNDUP[tWLDQSEN(ns)/(4*tCYC(ns))],
12991                                                          where tWLDQSEN is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12992                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12993                                                          TYP=max(25nCK) */
12994     uint64_t twlmrd                       : 4;  /**< Indicates tWLMRD constraints.
12995                                                          Set TWLMRD (CSR field) = RNDUP[tWLMRD(ns)/(4*tCYC(ns))],
12996                                                          where tWLMRD is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
12997                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
12998                                                          TYP=max(40nCK) */
12999     uint64_t txp                          : 3;  /**< Indicates tXP constraints.
13000                                                          Set TXP (CSR field) = RNDUP[tXP(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-1,
13001                                                          where tXP is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
13002                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
13003                                                          TYP=max(3nCK, 7.5ns) */
13004     uint64_t trrd                         : 3;  /**< Indicates tRRD constraints.
13005                                                          Set TRRD (CSR field) = RNDUP[tRRD(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-2,
13006                                                          where tRRD is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
13007                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
13008                                                          TYP=max(4nCK, 10ns)
13009                                                             - 000: RESERVED
13010                                                             - 001: 3 tCYC
13011                                                             - ...
13012                                                             - 110: 8 tCYC
13013                                                             - 111: 9 tCYC */
13014     uint64_t trfc                         : 5;  /**< Indicates tRFC constraints.
13015                                                          Set TRFC (CSR field) = RNDUP[tRFC(ns)/(8*tCYC(ns))],
13016                                                          where tRFC is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
13017                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
13018                                                          TYP=90-350ns
13019                                                               - 00000: RESERVED
13020                                                               - 00001: 8 tCYC
13021                                                               - 00010: 16 tCYC
