13028                                                          Set TWTR (CSR field) = RNDUP[tWTR(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-1,
13029                                                          where tWTR is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
13030                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
13031                                                          TYP=max(4nCK, 7.5ns)
13032                                                              - 0000: RESERVED
13033                                                              - 0001: 2
13034                                                              - ...
13035                                                              - 0111: 8
13036                                                              - 1000-1111: RESERVED */
13037     uint64_t trcd                         : 4;  /**< Indicates tRCD constraints.
13038                                                          Set TRCD (CSR field) = RNDUP[tRCD(ns)/tCYC(ns)],
13039                                                          where tRCD is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
13040                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
13041                                                          TYP=10-15ns
13042                                                              - 0000: RESERVED
13043                                                              - 0001: 2 (2 is the smallest value allowed)
13044                                                              - 0002: 2
13045                                                              - ...
13046                                                              - 1001: 9
13047                                                              - 1010-1111: RESERVED
13048                                                          In 2T mode, make this register TRCD-1, not going
13049                                                          below 2. */
13050     uint64_t tras                         : 5;  /**< Indicates tRAS constraints.
13051                                                          Set TRAS (CSR field) = RNDUP[tRAS(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-1,
13052                                                          where tRAS is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
13053                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
13054                                                          TYP=35ns-9*tREFI
13055                                                              - 00000: RESERVED
13056                                                              - 00001: 2 tCYC

13058                                                              - ...
13059                                                              - 11111: 32 tCYC */
13060     uint64_t tmprr                        : 4;  /**< Indicates tMPRR constraints.
13061                                                          Set TMPRR (CSR field) = RNDUP[tMPRR(ns)/tCYC(ns)]-1,
13062                                                          where tMPRR is from the DDR3 spec, and tCYC(ns)
13063                                                          is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
13064                                                          TYP=1nCK */

13080     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params1_cn61xx cn66xx;
13081     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params1_cn61xx cn68xx;
13082     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params1_cn61xx cn68xxp1;
13083     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params1_cn70xx {
13084 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
13085     uint64_t reserved_49_63               : 15;
13086     uint64_t txpdll                       : 5;  /**< Indicates TXPDLL constraints. Set this field as follows:
13087                                                          RNDUP[TXPDLL(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 1
13088                                                          where TXPDLL is from the JEDEC DDR3 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not
13089                                                          data rate).
13090                                                          TYP=max(10nCK, 24 ns) */
13091     uint64_t tfaw                         : 5;  /**< Indicates TFAW constraints. Set this field as follows:
13092                                                          RNDUP[TFAW(ns) / (4 * TCYC(ns))]
13093                                                          where TFAW is from the JEDEC DDR3 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not data
13094                                                          rate).
13095                                                          TYP = 30-40 ns */
13096     uint64_t twldqsen                     : 4;  /**< Indicates TWLDQSEN constraints. Set this field as follows:
13097                                                          RNDUP[TWLDQSEN(ns) / (4 * TCYC(ns))]
13098                                                          where TWLDQSEN is from the JEDEC DDR3 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not
13099                                                          data rate).
13100                                                          TYP = max(25nCK) */
13101     uint64_t twlmrd                       : 4;  /**< Indicates TWLMRD constraints. Set this field as follows:
13102                                                          RNDUP[TWLMRD(ns) / (4 * TCYC(ns))]
13103                                                          where TWLMRD is from the JEDEC DDR3 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not
13104                                                          data rate).
13105                                                          TYP = max(40nCK) */
13106     uint64_t txp                          : 3;  /**< Indicates TXP constraints. Set this field as follows:
13107                                                          RNDUP[TXP(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 1
13108                                                          where TXP is from the JEDEC DDR3 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not data
13109                                                          rate).
13110                                                          TYP=max(3nCK, 7.5 ns) */
13111     uint64_t trrd                         : 3;  /**< Indicates TRRD constraints. Set this field as follows:
13112                                                          RNDUP[TRRD(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 1,
13113                                                          where TRRD is from the JEDEC DDR3 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not data
13114                                                          rate).
13115                                                          TYP = max(4nCK, 10 ns)
13116                                                          0x0 = reserved
13117                                                          0x1 = 2 TCYC
13118                                                          - ...
13119                                                          0x6 = 7 TCYC
13120                                                          0x7 = 8 TCYC
13121                                                          For DDR4, this is the TRRD_S parameter. */
13122     uint64_t trfc                         : 7;  /**< Indicates TRFC constraints. Set this field as follows:
13123                                                          RNDUP[TRFC(ns) / (8 * TCYC(ns))]
13124                                                          where TRFC is from the JEDEC DDR3 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not data
13125                                                          rate).
13126                                                          TYP = 90-350 ns
13127                                                          0x0 = reserved.
13128                                                          0x1 = 8 TCYC.
13129                                                          0x2 = 16 TCYC.
13130                                                          0x3 = 24 TCYC.
13131                                                          0x4 = 32 TCYC.
13132                                                          - ...
13133                                                          0x7E = 1008 TCYC.
13134                                                          0x7F = 1016 TCYC. */
13135     uint64_t twtr                         : 4;  /**< Indicates TWTR constraints. Set this field as follows:
13136                                                          RNDUP[TWTR(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 1
13137                                                          where TWTR is from the JEDEC DDR3 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not data
13138                                                          rate).
13139                                                          TYP = max(4nCK, 7.5 ns)
13140                                                          For DDR4, this CSR field represents TWTR_S.
13141                                                          0x0 = reserved.
13142                                                          0x1 = 2.
13143                                                          - ...
13144                                                          0x7 = 8.
13145                                                          0x8-0xF = reserved. */
13146     uint64_t trcd                         : 4;  /**< Indicates TRCD constraints. Set this field as follows:
13147                                                          RNDUP[TRCD(ns) / TCYC(ns)]
13148                                                          where TRCD is from the JEDEC DDR3 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not data
13149                                                          rate).
13150                                                          TYP = 10-15 ns
13151                                                          0x0 = reserved.
13152                                                          0x1 = 2 (2 is the smallest value allowed).
13153                                                          0x2 = 2.
13154                                                          - ...
13155                                                          0xE = 14.
13156                                                          0xA-0xF = reserved.
13157                                                          In 2T mode, make this register TRCD - 1, not going below 2. */
13158     uint64_t tras                         : 6;  /**< Indicates TRAS constraints. Set TRAS (CSR field) as follows:
13159                                                          RNDUP[TRAS(ns)/TCYC(ns)] - 1,
13160                                                          where TRAS is from the DDR3 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not data rate).
13161                                                          TYP = 35ns - 9 * TREFI
13162                                                          - 000000: reserved
13163                                                          - 000001: 2 TCYC
13164                                                          - 000010: 3 TCYC
13165                                                          - ...
13166                                                          - 111111: 64 TCYC */
13167     uint64_t tmprr                        : 4;  /**< Indicates TMPRR constraints. Set this field as follows:
13168                                                          RNDUP[TMPRR(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 1
13169                                                          where TMPRR is from the JEDEC DDR3 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not data
13170                                                          rate).
13171                                                          TYP = 1 nCK */
13172 #else
13173     uint64_t tmprr                        : 4;
13174     uint64_t tras                         : 6;
13175     uint64_t trcd                         : 4;
13176     uint64_t twtr                         : 4;
13177     uint64_t trfc                         : 7;
13178     uint64_t trrd                         : 3;
13179     uint64_t txp                          : 3;
13180     uint64_t twlmrd                       : 4;
13181     uint64_t twldqsen                     : 4;
13182     uint64_t tfaw                         : 5;
13183     uint64_t txpdll                       : 5;
13184     uint64_t reserved_49_63               : 15;
13185 #endif
13186     } cn70xx;
13187     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params1_cn70xx cn70xxp1;
13188     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params1_cn73xx {
13189 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
13190     uint64_t reserved_59_63               : 5;
13191     uint64_t txp_ext                      : 1;  /**< A 1-bit extension to the TXP register. */
13192     uint64_t trcd_ext                     : 1;  /**< A 1-bit extension to the TRCD register. */
13193     uint64_t tpdm_full_cycle_ena          : 1;  /**< When set, this field enables the addition of a one cycle delay to the
13194                                                          write/read latency calculation. This is to compensate the case when
13195                                                          tPDM delay in the RCD of an RDIMM is greater than one-cycle.
13196                                                          Only valid in RDIMM  (LMC()_CTL[RDIMM_ENA]=1). */
13197     uint64_t trfc_dlr                     : 7;  /**< Indicates TRFC_DLR constraints. Set this field as follows:
13198                                                          _ RNDUP[TRFC_DLR(ns) / (8 * TCYC(ns))]
13199                                                          where TRFC_DLR is from the JEDEC 3D stacked SDRAM spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock
13200                                                          frequency (not data rate).
13201                                                          TYP = 90-120 ns.
13202                                                          0x0 = reserved.
13203                                                          0x1 = 8 TCYC.
13204                                                          0x2 = 16 TCYC.
13205                                                          0x3 = 24 TCYC.
13206                                                          0x4 = 32 TCYC.
13207                                                          - ...
13208                                                          0x7E = 1008 TCYC.
13209                                                          0x7F = 1016 TCYC. */
13210     uint64_t txpdll                       : 5;  /**< Indicates TXPDLL constraints. Set this field as follows:
13211                                                          _ RNDUP[TXPDLL(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 1
13212                                                          where TXPDLL is from the JEDEC DDR3/DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock
13213                                                          frequency (not data rate).
13214                                                          TYP=max(10nCK, 24 ns) */
13215     uint64_t tfaw                         : 5;  /**< Indicates TFAW constraints. Set this field as follows:
13216                                                          _ RNDUP[TFAW(ns) / (4 * TCYC(ns))]
13217                                                          where TFAW is from the JEDEC DDR3/DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock
13218                                                          frequency (not data rate).
13219                                                          TYP = 30-40 ns */
13220     uint64_t twldqsen                     : 4;  /**< Indicates TWLDQSEN constraints. Set this field as follows:
13221                                                          _ RNDUP[TWLDQSEN(ns) / (4 * TCYC(ns))]
13222                                                          where TWLDQSEN is from the JEDEC DDR3/DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock
13223                                                          frequency (not data rate).
13224                                                          TYP = max(25nCK) */
13225     uint64_t twlmrd                       : 4;  /**< Indicates TWLMRD constraints. Set this field as follows:
13226                                                          _ RNDUP[TWLMRD(ns) / (4 * TCYC(ns))]
13227                                                          where TWLMRD is from the JEDEC DDR3/DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock
13228                                                          frequency (not data rate).
13229                                                          TYP = max(40nCK) */
13230     uint64_t txp                          : 3;  /**< Indicates TXP constraints. Set this field as follows:
13231                                                          _ RNDUP[TXP(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 1
13232                                                          where TXP is from the JEDEC DDR3/DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock
13233                                                          frequency (not data rate).
13234                                                          TYP=max(3nCK, 7.5 ns) */
13235     uint64_t trrd                         : 3;  /**< Indicates TRRD constraints. Set this field as follows:
13236                                                          _ RNDUP[TRRD(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 2,
13237                                                          where TRRD is from the JEDEC DDR3/DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock
13238                                                          frequency (not data rate).
13239                                                          TYP = max(4nCK, 10 ns)
13240                                                          0x0 = Reserved.
13241                                                          0x1 = 3 TCYC.
13242                                                          - ...
13243                                                          0x6 = 8 TCYC.
13244                                                          0x7 = 9 TCYC.
13245                                                          For DDR4, this is the TRRD_S parameter. */
13246     uint64_t trfc                         : 7;  /**< Indicates TRFC constraints. Set this field as follows:
13247                                                          _ RNDUP[TRFC(ns) / (8 * TCYC(ns))]
13248                                                          where TRFC is from the JEDEC DDR3/DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock
13249                                                          frequency (not data rate).
13250                                                          TYP = 90-350 ns
13251                                                          0x0 = reserved.
13252                                                          0x1 = 8 TCYC.
13253                                                          0x2 = 16 TCYC.
13254                                                          0x3 = 24 TCYC.
13255                                                          0x4 = 32 TCYC.
13256                                                          - ...
13257                                                          0x7E = 1008 TCYC.
13258                                                          0x7F = 1016 TCYC. */
13259     uint64_t twtr                         : 4;  /**< Indicates TWTR constraints. Set this field as follows:
13260                                                          _ RNDUP[TWTR(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 1
13261                                                          where TWTR is from the JEDEC DDR3/DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock
13262                                                          frequency (not data rate).
13263                                                          TYP = max(4nCK, 7.5 ns)
13264                                                          For DDR4, this CSR field represents TWTR_S.
13265                                                          0x0 = reserved.
13266                                                          0x1 = 2.
13267                                                          - ...
13268                                                          0x7 = 8.
13269                                                          0x8-0xF = reserved. */
13270     uint64_t trcd                         : 4;  /**< Indicates TRCD constraints. Set this field as follows:
13271                                                          _ RNDUP[TRCD(ns) / TCYC(ns)]
13272                                                          where TRCD is from the JEDEC DDR3/DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock
13273                                                          frequency (not data rate).
13274                                                          TYP = 10-15 ns
13275                                                          0x0 = reserved.
13276                                                          0x1 = 2 (2 is the smallest value allowed).
13277                                                          0x2 = 2.
13278                                                          - ...
13279                                                          0xE = 14.
13280                                                          0xA-0xF = reserved.
13281                                                          In 2T mode, make this register TRCD - 1, not going below 2. */
13282     uint64_t tras                         : 6;  /**< Indicates TRAS constraints. Set TRAS (CSR field) as follows:
13283                                                          _ RNDUP[TRAS(ns)/TCYC(ns)] - 1,
13284                                                          where TRAS is from the DDR3/DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not data
13285                                                          rate).
13286                                                          TYP = 35ns - 9 * TREFI
13287                                                          0x0 = reserved.
13288                                                          0x1 = 2 TCYC.
13289                                                          0x2 = 3 TCYC.
13290                                                          - ...
13291                                                          0x3F = 64 TCYC. */
13292     uint64_t tmprr                        : 4;  /**< Indicates TMPRR constraints. Set this field as follows:
13293                                                          _ RNDUP[TMPRR(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 1
13294                                                          where TMPRR is from the JEDEC DDR3/DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock
13295                                                          frequency (not data rate).
13296                                                          TYP = 1 nCK */
13297 #else
13298     uint64_t tmprr                        : 4;
13299     uint64_t tras                         : 6;
13300     uint64_t trcd                         : 4;
13301     uint64_t twtr                         : 4;
13302     uint64_t trfc                         : 7;
13303     uint64_t trrd                         : 3;
13304     uint64_t txp                          : 3;
13305     uint64_t twlmrd                       : 4;
13306     uint64_t twldqsen                     : 4;
13307     uint64_t tfaw                         : 5;
13308     uint64_t txpdll                       : 5;
13309     uint64_t trfc_dlr                     : 7;
13310     uint64_t tpdm_full_cycle_ena          : 1;
13311     uint64_t trcd_ext                     : 1;
13312     uint64_t txp_ext                      : 1;
13313     uint64_t reserved_59_63               : 5;
13314 #endif
13315     } cn73xx;
13316     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params1_cn73xx cn78xx;
13317     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params1_cn73xx cn78xxp1;
13318     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params1_cn61xx cnf71xx;
13319     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params1_cn73xx cnf75xx;
13320 };
13321 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_timing_params1 cvmx_lmcx_timing_params1_t;
13322 
13323 /**
13324  * cvmx_lmc#_timing_params2
13325  *
13326  * This register sets timing parameters for DDR4.
13327  *
13328  */
13329 union cvmx_lmcx_timing_params2 {
13330     uint64_t u64;
13331     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params2_s {
13332 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
13333     uint64_t reserved_16_63               : 48;
13334     uint64_t trrd_l_ext                   : 1;  /**< MSB of TWTR_L constraints. Set this field
13335                                                          when requiring tRRD_L of more than 9 nCK. Otherwise
13336                                                          this bit must be 0. */
13337     uint64_t trtp                         : 4;  /**< Specifies the TRTP parameter, in cycles. Set this field as follows:
13338                                                          _ RNDUP[TRTP(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 1,
13339                                                          For DDR3, typical = max(4 nCK, 7.5ns).
13340                                                          For DDR4 the TRTP parameter is dictated by the TWR MR bits. */
13341     uint64_t t_rw_op_max                  : 4;  /**< Specifies the maximum delay for a read or write operation to complete, used to set the
13342                                                          timing of MRW and MPR operations. Set this field as follows:
13343                                                          _ RNDUP[Maximum operation delay (cycles) / 8]
13344                                                          Typical = 0x7. */
13345     uint64_t twtr_l                       : 4;  /**< Specifies TWTR_L constraints. Set this field as follows:
13346                                                          _ RNDUP[TWTR_L(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 1
13347                                                          where TWTR_L is from the JEDEC DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not the
13348                                                          data rate).
13349                                                          Typical = MAX(4 nCK, 7.5 ns) */
13350     uint64_t trrd_l                       : 3;  /**< Specifies TRRD_L constraints. Set this field as follows:
13351                                                          _ RNDUP[TRRD_L(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 2,
13352                                                          where TRRD_L is from the JEDEC DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not the
13353                                                          data rate).
13354                                                          Typical = MAX(4 nCK, 7.5 ns).
13355                                                          0x0 = reserved.
13356                                                          0x1 = three TCYC.
13357                                                          0x2 = four TCYC.
13358                                                          0x3 = five TCYC.
13359                                                          0x4 = six TCYC.
13360                                                          0x5 = seven TCYC.
13361                                                          0x6 = eight TCYC.
13362                                                          0x7 = nine TCYC. */
13363 #else
13364     uint64_t trrd_l                       : 3;
13365     uint64_t twtr_l                       : 4;
13366     uint64_t t_rw_op_max                  : 4;
13367     uint64_t trtp                         : 4;
13368     uint64_t trrd_l_ext                   : 1;
13369     uint64_t reserved_16_63               : 48;
13370 #endif
13371     } s;
13372     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params2_cn70xx {
13373 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
13374     uint64_t reserved_15_63               : 49;
13375     uint64_t trtp                         : 4;  /**< Specifies the TRTP parameter, in cycles. Set this field as follows:
13376                                                          RNDUP[TRTP(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 1,
13377                                                          For DDR3, typical = max(4 nCK, 7.5ns).
13378                                                          For DDR4 the TRTP parameter is dictated by the TWR MR bits. */
13379     uint64_t t_rw_op_max                  : 4;  /**< Specifies the maximum delay for a read or write operation to complete, used to set the
13380                                                          timing of MRW and MPR operations. Set this field as follows:
13381                                                          RNDUP[Maximum operation delay (cycles) / 8]
13382                                                          Typical = 0x7. */
13383     uint64_t twtr_l                       : 4;  /**< Specifies TWTR_L constraints. Set this field as follows:
13384                                                          RNDUP[TWTR_L(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 1
13385                                                          where TWTR_L is from the JEDEC DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not the
13386                                                          data rate).
13387                                                          Typical = MAX(4 nCK, 7.5 ns) */
13388     uint64_t trrd_l                       : 3;  /**< Specifies TRRD_L constraints. Set this field as follows:
13389                                                          RNDUP[TRRD_L(ns) / TCYC(ns)] - 1,
13390                                                          where TRRD_L is from the JEDEC DDR4 spec, and TCYC(ns) is the DDR clock frequency (not the
13391                                                          data rate).
13392                                                          Typical = MAX(4 nCK, 7.5 ns)
13393                                                          0x0 = reserved. 0x4 = five TCYC.
13394                                                          0x1 = two TCYC. 0x5 = six TCYC.
13395                                                          0x2 = three TCYC. 0x6 = seven TCYC.
13396                                                          0x3 = four TCYC. 0x7 = eight TCYC. */
13397 #else
13398     uint64_t trrd_l                       : 3;
13399     uint64_t twtr_l                       : 4;
13400     uint64_t t_rw_op_max                  : 4;
13401     uint64_t trtp                         : 4;
13402     uint64_t reserved_15_63               : 49;
13403 #endif
13404     } cn70xx;
13405     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params2_cn70xx cn70xxp1;
13406     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params2_s     cn73xx;
13407     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params2_s     cn78xx;
13408     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params2_s     cn78xxp1;
13409     struct cvmx_lmcx_timing_params2_s     cnf75xx;
13410 };
13411 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_timing_params2 cvmx_lmcx_timing_params2_t;
13412 
13413 /**
13414  * cvmx_lmc#_tro_ctl
13415  *
13416  * LMC_TRO_CTL = LMC Temperature Ring Osc Control
13417  * This register is an assortment of various control fields needed to control the temperature ring oscillator
13418  *
13419  * Notes:
13420  * To bring up the temperature ring oscillator, write TRESET to 0, and follow by initializing RCLK_CNT to desired
13421  * value
13422  */
13423 union cvmx_lmcx_tro_ctl {
13424     uint64_t u64;
13425     struct cvmx_lmcx_tro_ctl_s {
13426 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
13427     uint64_t reserved_33_63               : 31;
13428     uint64_t rclk_cnt                     : 32; /**< rclk counter */
13429     uint64_t treset                       : 1;  /**< Reset ring oscillator */
13430 #else
13431     uint64_t treset                       : 1;
13432     uint64_t rclk_cnt                     : 32;
13433     uint64_t reserved_33_63               : 31;
13434 #endif
13435     } s;
13436     struct cvmx_lmcx_tro_ctl_s            cn61xx;
13437     struct cvmx_lmcx_tro_ctl_s            cn63xx;
13438     struct cvmx_lmcx_tro_ctl_s            cn63xxp1;
13439     struct cvmx_lmcx_tro_ctl_s            cn66xx;
13440     struct cvmx_lmcx_tro_ctl_s            cn68xx;
13441     struct cvmx_lmcx_tro_ctl_s            cn68xxp1;
13442     struct cvmx_lmcx_tro_ctl_s            cnf71xx;
13443 };
13444 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_tro_ctl cvmx_lmcx_tro_ctl_t;
13445 
13446 /**
13447  * cvmx_lmc#_tro_stat
13448  *
13449  * LMC_TRO_STAT = LMC Temperature Ring Osc Status
13450  * This register is an assortment of various control fields needed to control the temperature ring oscillator
13451  */
13452 union cvmx_lmcx_tro_stat {
13453     uint64_t u64;
13454     struct cvmx_lmcx_tro_stat_s {
13455 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
13456     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
13457     uint64_t ring_cnt                     : 32; /**< ring counter */
13458 #else
13459     uint64_t ring_cnt                     : 32;
13460     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
13461 #endif
13462     } s;
13463     struct cvmx_lmcx_tro_stat_s           cn61xx;
13464     struct cvmx_lmcx_tro_stat_s           cn63xx;
13465     struct cvmx_lmcx_tro_stat_s           cn63xxp1;
13466     struct cvmx_lmcx_tro_stat_s           cn66xx;
13467     struct cvmx_lmcx_tro_stat_s           cn68xx;
13468     struct cvmx_lmcx_tro_stat_s           cn68xxp1;
13469     struct cvmx_lmcx_tro_stat_s           cnf71xx;
13470 };
13471 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_tro_stat cvmx_lmcx_tro_stat_t;
13472 
13473 /**
13474  * cvmx_lmc#_wlevel_ctl
13475  */
13476 union cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_ctl {
13477     uint64_t u64;
13478     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_ctl_s {
13479 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
13480     uint64_t reserved_22_63               : 42;
13481     uint64_t rtt_nom                      : 3;  /**< LMC writes a decoded value to MR1[Rtt_Nom] of the rank during write leveling. Per JEDEC
13482                                                          DDR3 specifications, only values MR1[Rtt_Nom] = 1 (RZQ/4), 2 (RZQ/2), or 3 (RZQ/6) are
13483                                                          allowed during write leveling with output buffer enabled.
13484                                                          DDR3 Spec:
13485                                                          0x0 = LMC writes 0x1 (RZQ/4) to MR1[Rtt_Nom].
13486                                                          0x1 = LMC writes 0x2 (RZQ/2) to MR1[Rtt_Nom].
13487                                                          0x2 = LMC writes 0x3 (RZQ/6) to MR1[Rtt_Nom].
13488                                                          0x3 = LMC writes 0x4 (RZQ/12) to MR1[Rtt_Nom].
13489                                                          0x4 = LMC writes 0x5 (RZQ/8) to MR1[Rtt_Nom].
13490                                                          0x5 = LMC writes 0x6 (Rsvd) to MR1[Rtt_Nom].
13491                                                          0x6 = LMC writes 0x7 (Rsvd) to MR1[Rtt_Nom].
13492                                                          0x7 = LMC writes 0x0 (Disabled) to MR1[Rtt_Nom]. */
13493     uint64_t bitmask                      : 8;  /**< Mask to select bit lanes on which write-leveling feedback is returned when OR_DIS is set to 1. */
13494     uint64_t or_dis                       : 1;  /**< Disable ORing of bits in a byte lane when computing the write-leveling bitmask. */
13495     uint64_t sset                         : 1;  /**< Run write-leveling on the current setting only. */
13496     uint64_t lanemask                     : 9;  /**< One-shot mask to select byte lane to be leveled by the write-leveling sequence. Used with
13497                                                          *16 parts where the upper and lower byte lanes need to be leveled independently.
13498                                                          This field is also used for byte lane masking during read-leveling sequence. */
13499 #else
13500     uint64_t lanemask                     : 9;
13501     uint64_t sset                         : 1;
13502     uint64_t or_dis                       : 1;
13503     uint64_t bitmask                      : 8;
13504     uint64_t rtt_nom                      : 3;
13505     uint64_t reserved_22_63               : 42;
13506 #endif
13507     } s;
13508     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_ctl_s         cn61xx;
13509     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_ctl_s         cn63xx;
13510     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_ctl_cn63xxp1 {
13511 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
13512     uint64_t reserved_10_63               : 54;
13513     uint64_t sset                         : 1;  /**< Run write-leveling on the current setting only. */
13514     uint64_t lanemask                     : 9;  /**< One-hot mask to select byte lane to be leveled by
13515                                                          the write-leveling sequence
13516                                                          Used with x16 parts where the upper and lower byte
13517                                                          lanes need to be leveled independently */
13518 #else
13519     uint64_t lanemask                     : 9;
13520     uint64_t sset                         : 1;
13521     uint64_t reserved_10_63               : 54;
13522 #endif
13523     } cn63xxp1;
13524     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_ctl_s         cn66xx;
13525     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_ctl_s         cn68xx;
13526     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_ctl_s         cn68xxp1;
13527     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_ctl_s         cn70xx;
13528     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_ctl_s         cn70xxp1;
13529     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_ctl_s         cn73xx;
13530     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_ctl_s         cn78xx;
13531     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_ctl_s         cn78xxp1;
13532     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_ctl_s         cnf71xx;
13533     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_ctl_s         cnf75xx;
13534 };
13535 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_ctl cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_ctl_t;
13536 
13537 /**
13538  * cvmx_lmc#_wlevel_dbg
13539  *
13540  * A given write of LMC()_WLEVEL_DBG returns the write-leveling pass/fail results for all
13541  * possible delay settings (i.e. the BITMASK) for only one byte in the last rank that the
13542  * hardware write-leveled. LMC()_WLEVEL_DBG[BYTE] selects the particular byte. To get these
13543  * pass/fail results for a different rank, you must run the hardware write-leveling again. For
13544  * example, it is possible to get the [BITMASK] results for every byte of every rank if you run
13545  * write-leveling separately for each rank, probing LMC()_WLEVEL_DBG between each write-
13546  * leveling.
13547  */
13548 union cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_dbg {
13549     uint64_t u64;
13550     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_dbg_s {
13551 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
13552     uint64_t reserved_12_63               : 52;
13553     uint64_t bitmask                      : 8;  /**< Bitmask generated during write level settings sweep. If LMC()_WLEVEL_CTL[SSET]=0,
13554                                                          [BITMASK]<n>=0 means write level setting n failed; [BITMASK]<n>=1 means write level
13555                                                          setting n
13556                                                          passed for
13557                                                          0 <= n <= 7. [BITMASK] contains the first 8 results of the total 16 collected by LMC
13558                                                          during
13559                                                          the write-leveling sequence.
13560                                                          If LMC()_WLEVEL_CTL[SSET]=1, [BITMASK]<0>=0 means curr write level setting failed;
13561                                                          [BITMASK]<0>=1 means curr write level setting passed. */
13562     uint64_t byte                         : 4;  /**< 0 <= BYTE <= 8. */
13563 #else
13564     uint64_t byte                         : 4;
13565     uint64_t bitmask                      : 8;
13566     uint64_t reserved_12_63               : 52;
13567 #endif
13568     } s;
13569     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_dbg_s         cn61xx;
13570     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_dbg_s         cn63xx;
13571     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_dbg_s         cn63xxp1;
13572     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_dbg_s         cn66xx;
13573     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_dbg_s         cn68xx;
13574     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_dbg_s         cn68xxp1;
13575     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_dbg_s         cn70xx;
13576     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_dbg_s         cn70xxp1;
13577     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_dbg_s         cn73xx;
13578     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_dbg_s         cn78xx;
13579     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_dbg_s         cn78xxp1;
13580     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_dbg_s         cnf71xx;
13581     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_dbg_s         cnf75xx;
13582 };
13583 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_dbg cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_dbg_t;
13584 
13585 /**
13586  * cvmx_lmc#_wlevel_rank#
13587  *
13588  * Four of these CSRs exist per LMC, one for each rank. Write level setting is measured in units
13589  * of 1/8 CK, so the below BYTEn values can range over 4 CK cycles. Assuming
13590  * LMC()_WLEVEL_CTL[SSET]=0, the BYTEn<2:0> values are not used during write-leveling, and
13591  * they are overwritten by the hardware as part of the write-leveling sequence. (Hardware sets
13592  * [STATUS] to 3 after hardware write-leveling completes for the rank). Software needs to set
13593  * BYTEn<4:3> bits.
13594  *
13595  * Each CSR may also be written by software, but not while a write-leveling sequence is in
13596  * progress. (Hardware sets [STATUS] to 1 after a CSR write.) Software initiates a hardware
13597  * write-
13598  * leveling sequence by programming LMC()_WLEVEL_CTL and writing RANKMASK and INIT_START=1 with
13599  * SEQ_SEL=6 in LMC*0_CONFIG.
13600  *
13601  * LMC will then step through and accumulate write leveling results for 8 unique delay settings
13602  * (twice), starting at a delay of LMC()_WLEVEL_RANK() [BYTEn<4:3>]* 8 CK increasing by
13603  * 1/8 CK each setting. Hardware will then set LMC()_WLEVEL_RANK()[BYTEn<2:0>] to
13604  * indicate the first write leveling result of '1' that followed a result of '0' during the
13605  * sequence by searching for a '1100' pattern in the generated bitmask, except that LMC will
13606  * always write LMC()_WLEVEL_RANK()[BYTEn<0>]=0. If hardware is unable to find a match
13607  * for a '1100' pattern, then hardware sets LMC()_WLEVEL_RANK() [BYTEn<2:0>] to 0x4. See
13608  * LMC()_WLEVEL_CTL.
13609  *
13610  * LMC()_WLEVEL_RANKi values for ranks i without attached DRAM should be set such that they do
13611  * not
13612  * increase the range of possible BYTE values for any byte lane. The easiest way to do this is to
13613  * set LMC()_WLEVEL_RANKi = LMC()_WLEVEL_RANKj, where j is some rank with attached DRAM whose
13614  * LMC()_WLEVEL_RANKj is already fully initialized.
13615  */
13616 union cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_rankx {
13617     uint64_t u64;
13618     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_rankx_s {
13619 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
13620     uint64_t reserved_47_63               : 17;
13621     uint64_t status                       : 2;  /**< Indicates status of the write-leveling and where the BYTE* programmings in <44:0> came
13622                                                          from:
13623                                                          0x0 = BYTE* values are their reset value.
13624                                                          0x1 = BYTE* values were set via a CSR write to this register.
13625                                                          0x2 = write-leveling sequence currently in progress (BYTE* values are unpredictable).
13626                                                          0x3 = BYTE* values came from a complete write-leveling sequence, irrespective of which
13627                                                          lanes are masked via LMC()_WLEVEL_CTL[LANEMASK]. */
13628     uint64_t byte8                        : 5;  /**< "Write level setting. Bit 0 of BYTE8 must be zero during normal operation. When ECC DRAM
13629                                                          is not present in 64-bit mode (i.e. when DRAM is not attached to chip signals DDR#_CBS_0_*
13630                                                          and DDR#_CB<7:0>), software should write BYTE8 with a value that does not increase the
13631                                                          range of possible BYTE* values. The easiest way to do this is to set
13632                                                          LMC()_WLEVEL_RANK()[BYTE8] = LMC()_WLEVEL_RANK()[BYTE0] when there is no
13633                                                          ECC DRAM, using the final BYTE0 value." */
13634     uint64_t byte7                        : 5;  /**< Write level setting. Bit 0 of [BYTE7] must be zero during normal operation. */
13635     uint64_t byte6                        : 5;  /**< Write level setting. Bit 0 of [BYTE6] must be zero during normal operation. */
13636     uint64_t byte5                        : 5;  /**< Write level setting. Bit 0 of [BYTE5] must be zero during normal operation. */
13637     uint64_t byte4                        : 5;  /**< Write level setting. Bit 0 of [BYTE4] must be zero during normal operation. */
13638     uint64_t byte3                        : 5;  /**< Write level setting. Bit 0 of [BYTE3] must be zero during normal operation. */
13639     uint64_t byte2                        : 5;  /**< Write level setting. Bit 0 of [BYTE2] must be zero during normal operation. */
13640     uint64_t byte1                        : 5;  /**< Write level setting. Bit 0 of [BYTE1] must be zero during normal operation. */
13641     uint64_t byte0                        : 5;  /**< Write level setting. Bit 0 of [BYTE0] must be zero during normal operation. */
13642 #else
13643     uint64_t byte0                        : 5;
13644     uint64_t byte1                        : 5;
13645     uint64_t byte2                        : 5;
13646     uint64_t byte3                        : 5;
13647     uint64_t byte4                        : 5;
13648     uint64_t byte5                        : 5;
13649     uint64_t byte6                        : 5;
13650     uint64_t byte7                        : 5;
13651     uint64_t byte8                        : 5;
13652     uint64_t status                       : 2;
13653     uint64_t reserved_47_63               : 17;
13654 #endif
13655     } s;
13656     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_rankx_s       cn61xx;
13657     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_rankx_s       cn63xx;
13658     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_rankx_s       cn63xxp1;
13659     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_rankx_s       cn66xx;
13660     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_rankx_s       cn68xx;
13661     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_rankx_s       cn68xxp1;
13662     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_rankx_s       cn70xx;
13663     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_rankx_s       cn70xxp1;
13664     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_rankx_s       cn73xx;
13665     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_rankx_s       cn78xx;
13666     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_rankx_s       cn78xxp1;
13667     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_rankx_s       cnf71xx;
13668     struct cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_rankx_s       cnf75xx;
13669 };
13670 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_rankx cvmx_lmcx_wlevel_rankx_t;
13671 
13672 /**
13673  * cvmx_lmc#_wodt_ctl0
13674  *
13675  * LMC_WODT_CTL0 = LMC Write OnDieTermination control
13676  * See the description in LMC_WODT_CTL1.
13677  *
13678  * Notes:
13679  * Together, the LMC_WODT_CTL1 and LMC_WODT_CTL0 CSRs control the write ODT mask.  See LMC_WODT_CTL1.
13680  *
13681  */
13682 union cvmx_lmcx_wodt_ctl0 {
13683     uint64_t u64;
13684     struct cvmx_lmcx_wodt_ctl0_s {
13685 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
13686     uint64_t reserved_0_63                : 64;
13687 #else
13688     uint64_t reserved_0_63                : 64;
13689 #endif
13690     } s;
13691     struct cvmx_lmcx_wodt_ctl0_cn30xx {
13692 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
13693     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
13694     uint64_t wodt_d1_r1                   : 8;  /**< Write ODT mask DIMM1, RANK1 */
13695     uint64_t wodt_d1_r0                   : 8;  /**< Write ODT mask DIMM1, RANK0 */
13696     uint64_t wodt_d0_r1                   : 8;  /**< Write ODT mask DIMM0, RANK1 */
13697     uint64_t wodt_d0_r0                   : 8;  /**< Write ODT mask DIMM0, RANK0 */
13698 #else
13699     uint64_t wodt_d0_r0                   : 8;
13700     uint64_t wodt_d0_r1                   : 8;
13701     uint64_t wodt_d1_r0                   : 8;
13702     uint64_t wodt_d1_r1                   : 8;
13703     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
13704 #endif
13705     } cn30xx;
13706     struct cvmx_lmcx_wodt_ctl0_cn30xx     cn31xx;
13707     struct cvmx_lmcx_wodt_ctl0_cn38xx {
13708 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
13709     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
13710     uint64_t wodt_hi3                     : 4;  /**< Write ODT mask for position 3, data[127:64] */
13711     uint64_t wodt_hi2                     : 4;  /**< Write ODT mask for position 2, data[127:64] */
13712     uint64_t wodt_hi1                     : 4;  /**< Write ODT mask for position 1, data[127:64] */
13713     uint64_t wodt_hi0                     : 4;  /**< Write ODT mask for position 0, data[127:64] */
13714     uint64_t wodt_lo3                     : 4;  /**< Write ODT mask for position 3, data[ 63: 0] */
13715     uint64_t wodt_lo2                     : 4;  /**< Write ODT mask for position 2, data[ 63: 0] */
13716     uint64_t wodt_lo1                     : 4;  /**< Write ODT mask for position 1, data[ 63: 0] */
13717     uint64_t wodt_lo0                     : 4;  /**< Write ODT mask for position 0, data[ 63: 0] */
13718 #else
13719     uint64_t wodt_lo0                     : 4;
13720     uint64_t wodt_lo1                     : 4;
13721     uint64_t wodt_lo2                     : 4;
13722     uint64_t wodt_lo3                     : 4;
13723     uint64_t wodt_hi0                     : 4;
13724     uint64_t wodt_hi1                     : 4;
13725     uint64_t wodt_hi2                     : 4;
13726     uint64_t wodt_hi3                     : 4;

13728 #endif
13729     } cn38xx;
13730     struct cvmx_lmcx_wodt_ctl0_cn38xx     cn38xxp2;

13739 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_wodt_ctl0 cvmx_lmcx_wodt_ctl0_t;
13740 
13741 /**
13742  * cvmx_lmc#_wodt_ctl1
13743  *
13744  * LMC_WODT_CTL1 = LMC Write OnDieTermination control
13745  * System designers may desire to terminate DQ/DQS/DM lines for higher frequency DDR operations
13746  * (667MHz and faster), especially on a multi-rank system. DDR2 DQ/DM/DQS I/O's have built in
13747  * Termination resistor that can be turned on or off by the controller, after meeting tAOND and tAOF
13748  * timing requirements. Each Rank has its own ODT pin that fans out to all the memory parts
13749  * in that DIMM. System designers may prefer different combinations of ODT ON's for read and write
13750  * into different ranks. Octeon supports full programmability by way of the mask register below.
13751  * Each Rank position has its own 8-bit programmable field.
13752  * When the controller does a write to that rank, it sets the 8 ODT pins to the MASK pins below.
13753  * For eg., When doing a write into Rank0, a system designer may desire to terminate the lines
13754  * with the resistor on Dimm0/Rank1. The mask WODT_D0_R0 would then be [00000010].
13755  * If ODT feature is not desired, the DDR parts can be programmed to not look at these pins by
13756  * writing 0 in QS_DIC. Octeon drives the appropriate mask values on the ODT pins by default.
13757  * If this feature is not required, write 0 in this register.
13758  *
13759  * Notes:
13760  * Together, the LMC_WODT_CTL1 and LMC_WODT_CTL0 CSRs control the write ODT mask.
13761  * When a given RANK is selected, the WODT mask for that RANK is used.  The resulting WODT mask is
13762  * driven to the DIMMs in the following manner:
13763  *            BUNK_ENA=1     BUNK_ENA=0
13764  * Mask[7] -> DIMM3, RANK1    DIMM3
13765  * Mask[6] -> DIMM3, RANK0
13766  * Mask[5] -> DIMM2, RANK1    DIMM2
13767  * Mask[4] -> DIMM2, RANK0
13768  * Mask[3] -> DIMM1, RANK1    DIMM1
13769  * Mask[2] -> DIMM1, RANK0
13770  * Mask[1] -> DIMM0, RANK1    DIMM0
13771  * Mask[0] -> DIMM0, RANK0
13772  */
13773 union cvmx_lmcx_wodt_ctl1 {
13774     uint64_t u64;
13775     struct cvmx_lmcx_wodt_ctl1_s {
13776 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
13777     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
13778     uint64_t wodt_d3_r1                   : 8;  /**< Write ODT mask DIMM3, RANK1/DIMM3 in SingleRanked */
13779     uint64_t wodt_d3_r0                   : 8;  /**< Write ODT mask DIMM3, RANK0 */
13780     uint64_t wodt_d2_r1                   : 8;  /**< Write ODT mask DIMM2, RANK1/DIMM2 in SingleRanked */
13781     uint64_t wodt_d2_r0                   : 8;  /**< Write ODT mask DIMM2, RANK0 */
13782 #else
13783     uint64_t wodt_d2_r0                   : 8;
13784     uint64_t wodt_d2_r1                   : 8;
13785     uint64_t wodt_d3_r0                   : 8;
13786     uint64_t wodt_d3_r1                   : 8;
13787     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
13788 #endif
13789     } s;
13790     struct cvmx_lmcx_wodt_ctl1_s          cn30xx;
13791     struct cvmx_lmcx_wodt_ctl1_s          cn31xx;
13792     struct cvmx_lmcx_wodt_ctl1_s          cn52xx;
13793     struct cvmx_lmcx_wodt_ctl1_s          cn52xxp1;
13794     struct cvmx_lmcx_wodt_ctl1_s          cn56xx;
13795     struct cvmx_lmcx_wodt_ctl1_s          cn56xxp1;
13796 };
13797 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_wodt_ctl1 cvmx_lmcx_wodt_ctl1_t;
13798 
13799 /**
13800  * cvmx_lmc#_wodt_mask
13801  *
13802  * System designers may desire to terminate DQ/DQS lines for higher-frequency DDR operations,
13803  * especially on a multirank system. DDR3 DQ/DQS I/Os have built-in termination resistors that
13804  * can be turned on or off by the controller, after meeting TAOND and TAOF timing requirements.
13805  * Each rank has its own ODT pin that fans out to all of the memory parts in that DIMM. System
13806  * designers may prefer different combinations of ODT ONs for write operations into different
13807  * ranks. CNXXXX supports full programmability by way of the mask register below. Each rank
13808  * position has its own 8-bit programmable field. When the controller does a write to that rank,
13809  * it sets the 4 ODT pins to the mask pins below. For example, when doing a write into Rank0, a
13810  * system designer may desire to terminate the lines with the resistor on DIMM0/Rank1. The mask
13811  * [WODT_D0_R0] would then be [00000010].
13812  *
13813  * CNXXXX drives the appropriate mask values on the ODT pins by default. If this feature is not
13814  * required, write 0x0 in this register. When a given RANK is selected, the WODT mask for that
13815  * RANK is used. The resulting WODT mask is driven to the DIMMs in the following manner:
13816  */
13817 union cvmx_lmcx_wodt_mask {
13818     uint64_t u64;
13819     struct cvmx_lmcx_wodt_mask_s {
13820 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
13821     uint64_t wodt_d3_r1                   : 8;  /**< Write ODT mask DIMM3, RANK1/DIMM3 in SingleRanked
13822                                                          *UNUSED IN 6xxx, and MBZ* */
13823     uint64_t wodt_d3_r0                   : 8;  /**< Write ODT mask DIMM3, RANK0
13824                                                          *UNUSED IN 6xxx, and MBZ* */
13825     uint64_t wodt_d2_r1                   : 8;  /**< Write ODT mask DIMM2, RANK1/DIMM2 in SingleRanked
13826                                                          *UNUSED IN 6xxx, and MBZ* */
13827     uint64_t wodt_d2_r0                   : 8;  /**< Write ODT mask DIMM2, RANK0
13828                                                          *UNUSED IN 6xxx, and MBZ* */
13829     uint64_t wodt_d1_r1                   : 8;  /**< Write ODT mask DIMM1, RANK1/DIMM1 in SingleRanked.
13830                                                          If RANK_ENA=0, [WODT_D1_R1]<3:0> must be zero. */
13831     uint64_t wodt_d1_r0                   : 8;  /**< Write ODT mask DIMM1, RANK0. If [RANK_ENA]=0, [WODT_D1_R0]<3,1> must be zero. */
13832     uint64_t wodt_d0_r1                   : 8;  /**< Write ODT mask DIMM0, RANK1/DIMM0 in SingleRanked. If [RANK_ENA]=0, [WODT_D0_R1]<3:0> must
13833                                                          be
13834                                                          zero. */
13835     uint64_t wodt_d0_r0                   : 8;  /**< Write ODT mask DIMM0, RANK0. If [RANK_ENA]=0, [WODT_D0_R0]<3,1> must be zero. */
13836 #else
13837     uint64_t wodt_d0_r0                   : 8;
13838     uint64_t wodt_d0_r1                   : 8;
13839     uint64_t wodt_d1_r0                   : 8;
13840     uint64_t wodt_d1_r1                   : 8;
13841     uint64_t wodt_d2_r0                   : 8;
13842     uint64_t wodt_d2_r1                   : 8;
13843     uint64_t wodt_d3_r0                   : 8;
13844     uint64_t wodt_d3_r1                   : 8;
13845 #endif
13846     } s;
13847     struct cvmx_lmcx_wodt_mask_s          cn61xx;
13848     struct cvmx_lmcx_wodt_mask_s          cn63xx;
13849     struct cvmx_lmcx_wodt_mask_s          cn63xxp1;
13850     struct cvmx_lmcx_wodt_mask_s          cn66xx;
13851     struct cvmx_lmcx_wodt_mask_s          cn68xx;
13852     struct cvmx_lmcx_wodt_mask_s          cn68xxp1;
13853     struct cvmx_lmcx_wodt_mask_cn70xx {
13854 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
13855     uint64_t reserved_28_63               : 36;
13856     uint64_t wodt_d1_r1                   : 4;  /**< Reserved. */
13857     uint64_t reserved_20_23               : 4;
13858     uint64_t wodt_d1_r0                   : 4;  /**< Reserved. */
13859     uint64_t reserved_12_15               : 4;
13860     uint64_t wodt_d0_r1                   : 4;  /**< Write ODT mask DIMM0, RANK1/DIMM0 in SingleRanked. If [RANK_ENA]=0, [WODT_D0_R1]<3:0> must
13861                                                          be
13862                                                          zero. */
13863     uint64_t reserved_4_7                 : 4;
13864     uint64_t wodt_d0_r0                   : 4;  /**< Write ODT mask DIMM0, RANK0. If [RANK_ENA]=0, [WODT_D0_R0]<3,1> must be zero. */
13865 #else
13866     uint64_t wodt_d0_r0                   : 4;
13867     uint64_t reserved_4_7                 : 4;
13868     uint64_t wodt_d0_r1                   : 4;
13869     uint64_t reserved_12_15               : 4;
13870     uint64_t wodt_d1_r0                   : 4;
13871     uint64_t reserved_20_23               : 4;
13872     uint64_t wodt_d1_r1                   : 4;
13873     uint64_t reserved_28_63               : 36;
13874 #endif
13875     } cn70xx;
13876     struct cvmx_lmcx_wodt_mask_cn70xx     cn70xxp1;
13877     struct cvmx_lmcx_wodt_mask_cn70xx     cn73xx;
13878     struct cvmx_lmcx_wodt_mask_cn70xx     cn78xx;
13879     struct cvmx_lmcx_wodt_mask_cn70xx     cn78xxp1;
13880     struct cvmx_lmcx_wodt_mask_s          cnf71xx;
13881     struct cvmx_lmcx_wodt_mask_cn70xx     cnf75xx;
13882 };
13883 typedef union cvmx_lmcx_wodt_mask cvmx_lmcx_wodt_mask_t;
